title: A quick way to get into Bangkok
review: There are two lines operating  the city line which stops at all stations and the express line which has limited stops You can take both from the lowest floor from Suvarnabhumi airport Getting to the concourse is no hassle and straightforward The express line was out of service when I visited but that's no problem as the city line is cheaper and not much slower than the express line It would take about 30 minutes to reach the last stop and there are several stops where you can connect to the BTS and MRT systems Mind you the city line train does not have much space to keep baggage so if you have 5 or 6 huge suitcases a cab maybe a better option The total cost from Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai were the line ends is 45 baht per person so its cheap for solo travellers or possibly groups with upto 4 members Otherwise it maybe cheaper to go by taxi which is more convenient and cheaper as taxi charges will be about 300 baht The only advantage is that the train is faster compared to the traffic ridden streets of Bangkok where even a five hour time advantage can vanish and you find yourself running around the huge hallways of Suvarnabhumi airport trying to find your flight

title: Better than a taxi
review: On previous visits to Bangkok we've always used the airport limousines to travel from the airport to central Bangkok However these are slow due to the traffic and also very expensive This time we decided to try the airport rail link and it was great The station is in the basement of the airport and it was only 45B each to travel to Phaya Thai station at the end of the line From there it was one stop on the skytrain to our accommodation It was a short walk from the rail link to the BTS and there were lifts so we didn't have to carry our suitcases up and down stairs I wouldn't recommend it if you have mobility issues or small children but we will definitely use this rail link again next time we're in Bangkok

title: Best way into the city
review: This is the easiest and best way into the city costing about 2 English pounds it’s so much cheaper than the taxis which i took the first time round in Bangkok it’s direct quick and no traffic and stoped right outside are hotel would recommend taking the time to follow the signs to the rail link

title: Highly efficient transport system

title: Super easy to use
review: We opted for the Airport Rail Link after we returned to Bangkok (the first time we used a taxi)  The total cost for two people from the airport to the last stop (Phaya Thai) was 90 baht total  It took about 25 minutes to go from the airport to Phaya Thai where we used the BTS to get near our hotel  It was a pretty stress free experience and ended up being cheaper than a taxi from the airport for us   We did take a taxi from the airport when we first initially got to Bangkok For perspective a taxi from the airport is 50 baht airport fee + 75 in tolls + whatever the metered fare is as of November 2017 Our metered fare to Sukhumvit Soi 2 (JW Marriott) was ~140 baht so the total for the cab trip we took when we initially got to Bangkok was ~265 baht for the taxi vs ~170 baht (90 for airport rail link and 80 for BTW) to our hotel upon returning to Bangkok (this is for 2 people)    The Rail Link also means you don't have to deal with the taxi cab drivers For the most part we didn't have a problem with them refusing to use the meter but it did happen to us twice (took about 8 cabs in Bangkok total)

title: great alternative to taxi's
review: i have used the airport rail link on two occasions  once on my way home and another time on my way into bangkok after landing  i would recommend it if you have arrived and want to an alternative to using a taxi and aren't familiar with how a taximeter system works also if you don't have a good command of the thai  language  also if you have a good idea where your hotel is based or if you have travelled to thailand on numerous occassions and you know the layout of the city  the language barrier shouldn't be a problem because the staff all speak english  this is the same for the skytrain which you will have to change to when the rail link comes to the terminal  it is easy to get onto the airport rail link you go down to the ground floor in the airport and it is easy enough to find and use  please note there are 2 rail link  lines an express line  with no stops that goes straight to the airport and the other  line which stops at a few different places  please make sure you allow plenty of time if you are going to the airport  i used it once in the past because it was cheap and no bangkok traffic  buying a ticket is easy and there are plenty of polite  helpful staff on hand to help you should you have a problem

review: Very effecient mode of transport  It can get really crowded and crazy during business hours and on weekends Service is prompt and good There is ease In buying cards for travel and very simple The stations are connected to most prominent locations including the Swarnabhoomi airport

title: Unsatisfactory execution of service
review: This service needs to improve it’s one of the first impression of the country Delays  hot train stations packed carriages Escalators are only in one direction if you can find one at all It’s just a huge inconvenience to use this company

title: Public transport from Suvanaphume Airport to the city of Bangkok
review: Airport Rail Link is a cheap transport from Suvanaphume Airport to the city cost between 45 and 90 Baht depends on your station destination  Taxi from the airport will cost you 400500 Baht

title: Easy and convenient
review: Can't say too much more apart from my title Save yourself a lot of money taking the sky train longer distances and motorbike taxi for shorter trips

title: Very Fun and Good Trip
review: Strongly recommended and informative tour And the price is reasonable for me Both Mae Klong train market and floating market are very fun You can wake up early and sleep in car

title: Easy Peasy!
review: Although Bangkok may be a developing city it hosts one of the world's most modern transport systems The BTS couldn't be simpler to use

title: Good ride
review: This train is a quick and economical way to get from the Airport to central Bangkok It connects to the Skytrain system at Phaya Thai station

title: Easy and cheap
review: It was really easy once you got the hang of it Our tour guide gave us a BTS map and a brief intro and we were off Clean air conditioned and every few minutes as well as cheap  you can't get better

title: Thailand Railways.
review: Thai rail travel is good if sometimes slower than the rival Express bus services  However there are serious plans to establish brand new High Speedlinks from Bangkok up North and this work is already in progress alongside major new Super Highways

title: Excellent service
review: The only way to travel  especially peak hours as roads in B can clog up  reliable trains with frigid aircon  easy to navigate  downloading map will put you ahead of the game

title: convenient
review: very convenient to go to main area but not recommend to go in prime time because so so so many people

title: a little long to wait
review: It was so hot in Bangkok and the it took so long for the train to come " It is quite handy to get around with sky train since Bangkok has a pretty bad traffic

title: Board To Shop
review: After reading all the reviews on scams for cabstaxis my wife and I took the BTS  With clear maps and directions everywhere in English and also English speaking staff at the stations getting around was a breeze  and beating the traffic jams  The trains werent too crowded and it brought us to all the shopping centers  By the second day we were zipping around like locals with  the one day pass for B$140  BTS should mean "Board To Shop"

title: Fast+ fun
review: The Skytrain is an efficient and fast way to get to the major Intl airport in Bangkok not the budget 1 Not directly connected with the Skytrain or Metro but there are a few stations that have reasonable linksunfortunately sometimes a nightmare if you are dragging large luggage Once onboard the service is fast and clean dropping you into a very modern and fast moving airport

title: efficient way to get to central Bangkok
review: fast cheap clean and easy to use  I always use it and stay at a hotel nearby so it is a breeze to get to airport

title: Nice & clean
review: Bangkok has one of the nicest sky train in the world and I’ve been to many around the world  It’s still expanding & soon will be going to the old town but as of now it mostly get you to pretty much everywhere else you needed to be

title: Perfect tool to move around the city
review: You can go pretty much to the most popular malls around Bangkok in this tain not useful for temples but yes for malls

title: Easy Convenience
review: With the BTS MRT is the perfect complement to each other When I wanted to get to the Hua Lamphong railway station I took the BTS to Sala Daeng to switch to the Silom MRT station Easy peasy

title: So easy
review: If I return to bangkok I will not be using a racial this is a superb way of getting into the city and so cheap 100 baht

title: Death Railway
review: See my detailed review titled Bridge Over River Kwai and Hellfire Pass This combination tour is offered by Asia Discovery and is an excellent day trip that includes a 2hour ride on the Death Railway train

title: Convenient way of traveling alone
review: I was by myself so no point spending too much a taxi especially traffic jam is crazy in bangkok Nice and easy way of transport

title: Best way to travel from Airport to Bangkok in peak hours
review: One of the best ways to travel from Airport to Bangkok (or other way) in peak hours Costs 35B and takes about 30 mins Trains run every 20 mins during day time Please remember that in the city line seat in the coach is not guaranteed unless your are at the first station However people are kind enough to offer a seat to the needy

title: Convenient and clean
review: The trains are clean and as the announcements are made in both Thai and English we found them very easy to use

title: Easy System
review: The BTS Skytrain is a delightful simple transit system around Bangkok  I've used it on a number of occasions in this most recent visit and previously  It's not hard to work out how to use and if you get stuck I have found the staff at the ticket offices helpful even with language differences  It's airconditioned comfort even if a little crowded at times certainly beats battling the Bangkok roads

title: easiest way to travel
review: Easiest way to get around the city    Careful when passing through tollgate  Bags or parcels carried in front of you can cause the bars to close early You will get hit the hipthigh area this will leave quite sore  Remember carry bag  high over the bars or behind closely you  if in front keep the bag very close to you so you don't break the beam  Note skytrain is the more popular way of people getting to work so it is crowded during peak hours Mind your pockets and bags  The worst thing is Travellers with packbacks take them off and place on the floor in front of you or carry them on your front out of other Travellers way Leaving on your back is not considerate of other passengers especially when the packback keeps hittingnudging the other people when on the BTS

title: Fast and Convenient
review: I felt that the train was very fast and convenient It does make a few stops along the way and I was too tired to check for a direct train but I'm sure there must be one That said there is nothing wrong with the train I took as it offered plenty of baggage space and was yes fast and convenient  Note I took the train in the summer of 2014 Things may have changed since then

title: Very Easy
review: A great way to get into Bangkok Easy to use and cheap Just follow the signs downstairs You can hop off along the way to access other trains and the Subway

title: excellent rail link
review: This is an excellent link to Downtown Bangkok from the airport  We stayed in Pratunam and we were there in no time at all  It was the same on our return  Well done Bangkok  I have previously spent hours in Taxis sitting in endless traffic

title: Great way to get around
review: Very good way to see bangkok and avoid the traffic in the streets but try to avoid peak times as can get very crowded

title: Going around like a local
review: Super easy and cheap to use It takes you to the mains sites in BBK and the trains have air con It can get quite busy at rush hours

title: Easy access
review: Caught the 1A bus from the airport to Mon Chit station and the Sky train from there Easy access to the city and not only do you miss the traffic so it is quicker but it is also about a tenth the price Staff at the bus station and the train stations were very helpful and always pleasant

title: Brilliant experience
review: Brilliant trip the tour guide Boeing ( not sure if the spelling is correct but he said like the plane) was brilliant and very informative friendly and funny  Would definitely recommend both markets were amazing and we also got to ride the local train to the train market which was brilliant 1010

title: the best way to travel in BKK
review: there is no other way to beat the traffic than travelling by the well connected network of BTS skytrain the fare is moderate and the ease of instructions in English makes it a good experience for any international traveller

title: Point A to Point B
review: The skytrain BTS as it's called in Bangkok is such a convenient way to get around Bangkok It's very affordable Just remember to have lots of coins for the ridesthe fares range between 1540 baht per way Riding the rails of the BTS was a great way to move around from districts to districts and also getting to some tourist attractions and sights There's another service called the MRTit functions separate from the BTS so the MRT will not honour the BTS passes   I highly recommend this mode of transport

title: Clean rides.. :)
review: Best way of commuting around BKK  This is perhaps one of the cleanest convenient and friendly services I have used

title: Use it
review: The line is cheap fast easy to use and will drop you off in the downtown If you’re staying in the downtown area you can transfer to another line and quickly arrive at your hotel   Warning If you’re staying in the old part of the city you should avoid this and take a taxi from the airport Unfortunately taxi drivers take advantage of tourists getting off this line and over charge them by 45 times the actual rate This is because there’s to train into the old part city So you’re probably going to pay the taxi driver more to take you from the train station then from the airport

title: How British Rail could learn.
review: Cheap punctual spotlessly cleanairconditioned and frequent Everything that the British train system isn't  Information is currentclear and correct

title: To BKK city centre
review: We took the airport rail link from Suvarnabhumi International Airport to Phaya Thai station for just 45 bahts per person It took us 30mins cutting through major jams which Bangkok is notorious for There's a walkway to BTS Phaya Thai station which make the ease of transfer between airport rail link and BTS a breeze

title: Airport Rail Link Ride
review: Very inexpensive  and comfortable ride into town  Easy transfer at Makkasan into MRT at Petchetburi Station

title: Disabled unfriendly
review: The train is confusing and worse when you get to city link You have to walk updown stairs which is bad for disabled people You will stand on train as Thais know nothing about disabled people

title: Perfect transportation
review: Easy and safe way to explore Bangkok without staying in the traffic jam A wide range of stops makes it possible to step in and out daily ticket recommended

title: Too expensive and too few lines
review: The name Skytrain sounds very enticing but in fact it's quite mundane The train is well maintained and clean and it certainly does the job However train tickets are quite expensive and there only 2 lines (at least when I was there)  It will do a good job taking you from Sukhomvit to Chatuchak though

title: Train
review: Use it if you can when in BKK  Good experience Plenty of options of where to go Cheap and quick Personally I like getting into the centre of town and look around

title: Safe and skmple
review: I hadn't used the train in years Anyone could figure it out And frankly it's mostly up to you because the attendants didn't care Customs control officers have more personality than these people You enter and look on the map and see where you want to go and there is a number corresponding to that location I wanted to go to Jim Thompson House which was at the National Stadium stop #37 Then you take a step over the the ticket vending machine press 37 and drop in coins until the display says 0 Wait a sec and the machine dispenses ticket and change If you don't have coins you must cue up to get from a person in the window then go to the wall machine Warning You use the ticket to both enter now and exit on the other end Good luck

title: The best way to get to large parts of Bangkok
review: Before the skytrain getting around Bangkok was a nightmare of bad traffic  It is said that this mega city simply does not have enough space allocated to streets which created terrible traffic jams  Fortunately the introduction of the sky train then the metro has made getting around this wonderful city much more doable  Learning how to use the sky train is essential as is having lots of change (coins)  Buying single tickets is very very easy  Each station has coin operated machines with a map next to them with numbers next to train stations  So if the train station you are going to has a 22 next toit it means you need 22 Baht in coins  At the machine you first press the station name then put in the coins

title: Easy Travel
review: Avoid taxis and get to your destination easily Buy a 'day pass' for unlimited travel

title: Convenient
review: Very convenient fast clean safe and cheap transportation in this beautiful busy city We prefer to use it whenever possible

title: Exelent
review: Great way to travel in Bangkok Cheap fast clean Very easy to learn how to use this great service Weekly tickets are also on sale

title: Fast easy and cheap
review: Do I need to say more It's a piece of cake even unprepared  easy to find easy to use clean and most important you don't get stuck in traffic In 20 min you are in Bangkok and nice views towards arrival I would add a star here

title: BTS sky train.....can be a litle confusing
review: TRain was greatwe did have a guide with us otherwise since everything is NOT is English it can be a little confusing if not overwhelming very clean and comfortable used by the locals for quick transpotation

title: Super fast and Reliable
review: This is absolutely the very best choice to get in and out of Bangkok if using "swampy" also known as Suvarnabhumi Airport Reliable cheap and comfortable It takes about 15 minutes to complete the journey if using the express service and about 25 minutes if using the normal service

title: Just over 1 Hour from Asoke Sukhumvit to Airport
review: We were staying at Sukhumvit near Asoke station and needed to get back to the airport  Change at Phaya Thai and then get the airport trainThe cost of the airport train from here is 45B   Trains busy but air conditionedSome stairs involved at station change  This seemed a safer option to us than getting a taxi and risk getting stuck in traffic

title: Best Way To Get To and From BKK
review: So convenient so fast and so inexpensive  If you get in before midnight and after 600 AM this is T H E way to get to (or close to) where you need to go

title: This is the way to get from/ to the airport
review: We took skytrain from the airport (BKK) to the end of the line at Phaya Thai station There the security staff call you a taxi to your hotel Way cheaper than taking taxi the entire trip The best part is the view you get from skytrain of Bangkok We took a taxi from our hotel to Phaya Thai station to return to BKK Well worth the cost You get the skytrain at the basement level of BKK and purchase the ticket at the wicket (you don't have to have correct change for the kiosk)

title: BTS
review: The BTS and MRT elevated and underground train network is the only way to get around Bangkok without having to deal with the rip off taxi bandits  it's cheapquick and relatively easy to negotiate

title: ideal for chatachuk flea market visit
review: simple  regular  on time  very convenient and a must for budget and happy go lucky travellers  do try and you maje local friends on the way

title: Get above the traffic and make it easier
review: The BTS system in Bangkok can be much better than hassling with scamming taxi drivers If the taxi will run the meter you're all good if they quote you a price walk away or offer them a third at most if you are desperate   TIPS The BTS ticket machines are mostly coin only where the MRT machines will take notes There are BTS ticket booths to the side which really only give you change not tickets so have coins ready for the wall machines will make your access quicker  The wall ticketing machines touchscreens allow you to change to English and select the destination That gives you the cost and it's generally very cheap 25 to 40 baht for quite a few stations distance  After that make sure you remember the name of the station at the END of the destination you are going to That will help you enter from the correct platform as the platform signs read "To Bearing" or "To National Stadium" as example so this will save you heading in the wrong direction )

title: Too hot and can't sit
review: I come to Thailand every year with my Thai girlfriend and I have now given up on the bts system It's too hot and you can never sit as it is always to packed out Taxi or tuk tuk is more expensive but worth it

title: Convenient
review: Very well run train system Clean air conditioned and easy to follow pricing system Would defiantly recommend using the trains to get around and especially to and from the airport

title: Amazing Train System
review: It is very convenient clean affordable and easy to understand I highly suggest all tourists take the train to save money especially if you are traveling alone TWO THUMBS UP

title: Efficient form of transport
review: The best way to get around Bangkok with no traffic As their economy booms so does the traffic jams The Thai government should be commended for it foresight in public transport and are now also building a subwayThe Skytrain is clean and on time and use it as much as possible it is also cheap If you use this in conjunction with Tuk Tuks and ferry's  you can go anywhere

title: Efficient and clean
review: The cabins are well airconditioned to escape the sweltering Bangkok heat and they are also clean with the no eatingdrinking policy The trains are also relatively fast making traveling around Bangkok much easier  I would highly recommended taking BTS Skytrain to get around Bangkok as it beats the traffic jams on the road and it is also a much cheaper mode of transport

title: A very convenient way of transport
review: BTS skytrain in Bangkok is so convenient to travel from place to place to avoid the traffic jams on the road The fare to travel from one place to another is also affordable with the lowest fare at 15 baht

title: Nice and clean but older stops don’t have elevators.
review: Excellent public transit system that is clean and runs on time  Staff is helpful and friendly  It is expanding so it covers more of the city every year  The only problem is that older stations either don’t have elevators or the elevators don’t work which makes it hard for wheelchairs

title: Easy to travel
review: Easy to use system taking coins or bills 60THB got two of us 4 stations out from the airport then we caught a taxi to our accomodation ( 250 THB)  much cheaper than a taxi straight from the airport and got to see the country side from a different perspective As we went along more people got on and it became a little crowded but not anything ridiculous Definitely will use the Airport Rail Link next time

title: Safe,punctual,economical and hassle-free
review: Very clean safe on time Easy to access from airport to connect with BTS Skytrain cityline recommended number 1 conveyance from airport

title: Funny day with super sara
review: we spent a beautiful day full of laughter We went to train market ad flooting market our guide will have been nice helpful she also helped us for the following days in Bangkok I really recommend this excursion Thanks Sara

title: Absolutely amazing!
review: Right from the getgo Kris was excellent in communicating the details and coordinating the tour itself in spite of the lastminute notice   I was picked up by Aey & Latiff at 7am and off we went to Kanchanaburi The vehicle was very comfortable The stops chosen and the time allotted at each place was just nice as it allowed for a good amount of time to visit but not letting it be too long as well Lunch was a highlight as it was a beautiful traditional Thai restaurant in the middle of Sai Yok   Both Aey & Latiff were extremely professional and I felt like I was out with friends rather than guides in Bangkok Highly recommended

title: Awsome
review: Best way to commute in Bangkok to get away with traffic like any other city It was perfect going around the city From security to ticket guys were very helpful

title: cheap but long wait time
review: we had to wait 30 minutes for the train which I thought was a long long time Train was fine but I think its quicker to take a taxi into town

title: Overview
review: Very efficient train system On the ground  Above ground  Clean and easy to use   Two systems  BTR used a lot  Value for money

title: A cheap and efficient way to get into Bangkok from the airport.
review: Although this airport link has been open for a couple of years this is the first time I've used it I was impressed as the link has interchanges with both the BTS and the MRT This means that for little money you can reach most parts of the city I always stay on Sukhumvit so I just changed to the MRT  and got off at Sukhumvit station then walked the short distance to soy 15 If you are new to Bangkok I suggest checking a map for the station closest your hotel then catching a taxi (they rarely use the advertised meters so negotiate a price first) Walking long distances with luggage in the Bangkok heat is best left to young backpackers I'm not sure but this new link may have made taxi fares more competitive I always get a taxi back to the airport because I'm loaded down with purchases I have paid up to 700BHT in the past but this time it was only 500BHT and I felt I could have bartered lower Getting around Bangkok is now better than ever before thanks to this link If only Melbourne had the same

title: BTS World
review: The BTS is a great way to get to the main sites of Bangkok it is fast and efficient  The air conditioning keeps things on the chilly side but looking around you can see how rich and varied life is in Bangkok

title: Best way to travel
review: Only way to travel in Bangkok Do not take a tuk tuk they rip you off Taxis are OK but why pay 200 baht when you you can get a rabbit card

title: hassles free
review: fast and reliable easy to travelcomfortable convenient seats not too crowdedbeating up the traffic going to airport of Bangkok

title: Efficient and cos5 effective
review: The BTS train system is the ONLY way to get around Bangkokwhich is always grid locked with traffic The staff at stations are helpful and very efficient  The cost is more than reasonable Do as the youth of Bangkok do and travel this wellit will save the planet

title: Where is good to shop
review: I am not in bkk for the first time  however I think other then cheap taxi everywhere Y not use bts instead   Siam siam sq siam sq1 siam paragons Food at basement in siam paragons is fantastic & siam sq have food court open by Singapore company siam sq1 hello kitty cafe n other nice cafe (Can consider to cafe hop around siam)   Asok & nana nana plaza and soi cowboy to experience the night life Terminal 21 is a place to go at asok Plus night market at nana area towards asok   Ekkamai  club at night and live band  Thong lor Japanese food and cafe hopping )

title: Very Convenient
review: It is a very convenient and relatively cheap mean of travelling in Bangkok IT is also very self explanatory and userfriendly Would recommend everyone Though during the rush hour it can be very very busy good luck finding space

title: So easy to get from A to B
review: What a great system and so easy to find your way about I found it extremely easy to navigate and purchase tickets

title: Closest and Friendliest access from airport to tourist destinations
review: This line is one of the inexpensive and easiest access from airport going to the tourist destinations at the heart of Bangkok If you are travelling on a backpack this is the recommended mode of transportation for you going to the city proper  The terminal is conveniently located at the basement of Suvarnabhumi Airport The rail link has two lines the Red and the Blue The difference between the two links is that the Red is the express line where it doesn't have any stops from airport to Makkasan station Fare is higher compared to the other line (around THB 150) The Blue is the regular train with fare ranges from THB 1545  Compared to taxi ride from airport to city proper I highly recommend riding the Airport Link not only for convenience but also to save your Baht for your other travelling needs )

title: Decent elevated train
review: Even bottled water is strictly prohibited Very tight security Closes early but convenient for getting around the major thoroughfares in Bangkok Be prepared to grab a taxi after 11ish if memory serves   On that note let me say two more things about transportation in the city 1) Make for sure you insist the taxi driver meters your ride the second you get int If they don't you could find yourself being on the short end of the stick when they call the police after they claim you refuse to pay your prenegotiated fair (a conversation which never happened) In most cases I have found that they will One of the cases they are less likely is during rush hour or a flash flood I have been asked for as much as 500 bahat to go just a few kilometers  Bangkok lacks an elevated freeway through the city center like other major Asian countries have so surface streets are your best bet   If you don't mind the smell of human waste you can go by boat Bangkok has a privately owned boat company that operates all day along the river Just hop on if you dare and a side rail person will find you to get money   Lastly Tuk Tuks Open air tricycles Nice for sightseeing But I'll tell you a taxi driver once described them as the 'taxi mafia' and he wasn't kidding Those guys will charge a fortune for that experience so use them on short hauls I for one used them to go sightseeing around the area of town on the west side where the elevated metro is limited I had a young kid maybe 16 as my driver He would pull up right to the front door of a lot of places where a automobile is limited   All in all lots of choices in Bangkok But the BTS Skytrain is your best fastest cheapest options

title: Efficient, quick and cheap!
review: We caught the rail link when we arrived in Bangkok  we only had a 10 minute wait  the train was clean and quickly took us to our link with the MRT  impressed It was also very reasonably priced

title: Above the madening crowd.
review: Getting around on the street in Bangkok can be scary smelly car fumes and unrespected traffic laws  This electric tram (train) is air conditioned smooth and fast  It gets you places miles away without the chaos  of the streets

title: Price and Time Efficient commute
review: If you are traveling light and are not very far from Bangkok city then the Airport link is ideal it may not be necessary the cheapest mode but if you have a lot of time to wait and on a very serious low budget then maybe there are a few more options but again the Airport link is the way to go and come out of the airport to reach several regions of the city  Best wishes

title: Interesting and Unique
review: Quite interesting and unique  Although a bit of a ride on motorways to get there most interesting especially when the train comes through The floating market is interesting although the long tail boats are noisy and annoying

title: Simply Fantastic Transport
review: If you want to get around Bangkok easily and quickly above the chokedcongested road transport you cannot beat the Skytrain  Get a map and see exactly where the many stations are being limited to a NorthSouth line and an EastWest line but with both lines being further extended   Cost is reasonable  maximum from one extremity of Bangkok to the other is 52 Baht ($2) but shorter distances much less   Easy system to understand dual language signage throughout really clean and efficient public transport   Great way to get to Weekend Market at the Northern line extremity

title: coconut ice cream 🥥
review: it's a new experience to watch once in the life but nothing to do more there or to buy more than ice cream and some good thai food like fried rice

title: Easy to navigate
review: When we were travelling around Bangkok we found taxis were getting too expensive so tried this Easy to navigate with only two lines

title: Easy and cheap way to travel
review: In central Bangkok this is a great way to get aroundplus it's so cheap It's easy to buy your tickets and is so clean Definitely worth giving it a go

title: Night Train from Bangkok to Surat Thani (Express 85)
review: If you have no time and want to travel fast of course don't take the trainbut compared to a freezing cold squeezy bus ride it is a more comfortable option Sadly they do not use the newest wagons on this track From Nong Khai we had the newer version and were a little disappointed You can order dinner and breakfast right after the start The food is decent Period Yes it is bumpy and yes you may have some delay (we had 13 min after 12 h 😱)as a backpacker who cares

title: Fast and cheap
review: The best way to travel fast within Bangkok An attraction alone )

title: too crowded in the peak hours
review: This airport to city link is a cheaper and easier way to reach central bangkok and connect with the BTS system The trains are cozy with dedicated luggage shelves It also beats the traffic during peak hours and ensures time When we were returning back to suvarnabhumi airport from chaya phrai it was so crowded that i almost suffocated it got worse as more people kept getting into the trainI will recommend it to use it from the airport but not to the airport from the city esp if you have children and large luggages

title: Great Tour!!!
review: Fun times I really enjoyed this  Loved Penny she was fabulous Highly recommend to other travellers

title: Easy skytrain rides to get from one place to another
review: The access to skytrain rides is easy  The route covers many stations and each station provides easy access to shopping centres  We visited Asok station which was next to Terminal 21 shopping centre  Another Siam station we alighted led us to Siam Paragon and Siam Centre  The trains were all nice and clean but do note that it is extremely crowded to travel on the skytrains during peak hours

title: amazing for crazy traffic of Bangkok
review: it's cheap and fast and clean and it almost covers all destinations in Bangkok you gana save lots of time if you use BTS

title: Fast, Comfortable, and Convenient
review: Although it can get crowded it is a very civilized ride The MRT (subway) is in general not as crowded so if you have a choice that would be preferable but the BTS Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok Since it is elevated you do get to view the city through the windows It's also blessedly air conditioned People line up to get into the cars so civilized And it is very economical for tourists I'm used to the NYC subway system so this was a dream for me

title: Great cheap way to travel bangkok
review: This was our favourite method of travelling bangkok no scammy taxi drivers The train arrives regularly and is cheap Clear diagrams of the journey and easy to get tickets if you only speak english

title: Clean and fast MRT
review: We travelled by MRT from Lad Phrao near Mall Bangkapi to Petchburi MRT and found it so clean convenient and quiet Very reasonably priced too  Unfortunately the transport systems in BKK (MRT skytrain bus etc) are not integrated thereby requiring separate ticketscards for each mode of transport The 3 day MRT pass is quite cheap too One can switch over to the Skytrains at few designated MRT stations

title: No more jam
review: fast and schedule but always busy and crowded on the rush hour of weekdays Most of the station already be located in the downtown of Bangkok However it's gonna be perfect if they could build it to cover every area

title: Fastest and cheapest from the airport.
review: A very good mode of transportation from the airport with link to BTS somewhere along the line You can always check at the information counter your destination

title: Practical, convenient with a view.
review: I regularly take the BTS Skytrain from Suvarnabhumi Airport into Town its practical and convenient

title: Quick and User Friendly
review: Found this transportation cheap and quick to get to most places we were going Gets packed quickly so get in fast lol

title: its cheap!!
review: cheapest way to get into the city from the airport but quite fast wont take more than half an hour also the frequency is also quite good

title: Airport Rail link experience was very goood
review: this was one of the best thing happened in bangkok a rain link direct below the terminal stright to the city we saved alot money for that

title: Nice place
review: I visited this place i was very good i enjoyed a lot with my friends & we have experienced very exiting places here here we have enjoyed every thing we like this place place very much & we always this place to enjoy

title: Ride the train to the floating market
review: Great visit to the railway market and joyous rail ride The floating market was another great experienceVictor did a great job explaining to us in detail

title: Sight seeing
review: Quick but crowded Study your map well and you should have no problem connecting from one train to another Reasonably priced Definitely recommend

title: Good Transportation
review: There is only one line so the routenumber of stops is limited  However there are some good stops  The MRT goes through the Sukhumvit area which is where I stayed  If you go in one direction to Hua Lamphong you can get to Chinatown and the Gold Buddha  If you go the other direction you can get to the weekend market (a shopping must visit) at the second or third to the last stop at Mo Chit or Kamphaeng Phet  There is more shopping here than you can imagine and if you only spend a full day here you missed half the shops  Note  Some of the shops are outside = SUN and most are under HOT tin roofs

title: You should experience it once
review: From airport to Boating area From hotel to chao phraya You will need a minimum time to reach anywhere if you have the metro of bangkok And among them BTS Skytrain is best It directly connects the airport with the other metro rails The cost of this is little high bbut as compare to taxitoto it is reasonable and cheap indeed

title: excellent
review: brilliant service to and from the airport cheap safe and reliable I use this every time I visit Bangkok

title: Best way to trawel in Bkk
review: Betst way to trawel in Bkk Cheap and fast Easy to learn the map and not so crouded tip buy ticket for the whole day if you want to explore Bkk

title: Avoid the jam!
review: Best way to move around in Bangkok  For sure the cabin will be packed by people during peak hours yet you dun want to stuck on the road in a taxi

title: Easy
review: Fast and reliable service English translations and cool comfortable carriages makes it easily the best way to and from the airport

title: A good day
review: My daughter and I really enjoyed ourselves Kwan was a really good tour guide Kwan interacted with all of us Kwan took pictures for us She made sure we were safe from beginning to departure Kwan made this experience one for the books My daughter and I will remember this experience for a lifetime

title: BTS Skytrain

title: A good idea, badly executed.
review: In my view the airport rail link has both good and bad features The good are that it's cheap and is not a terribly long journey The bad  it's not particularly comfortable  The nonexpress train just has plastic bench seats and no dedicated luggage area  It's basically a commuter train that also goes to the airport The stations are an absolute joke  They were obviously designed by an architect who had never travelled anywhere  At Phayathai station for example (the end of the line) there is one lift only and hardly any escalators  You have to basically carry your bags up and down  Moronic Makkasan station originally designed to be like the superb Central station in Hong Kong where you check your bags in before you board the Airport link train receive your boarding pass then never have to worry about your bags again  is a total failure and a joke  It is a huge white elephant stuck in the middle of nowhere After a while they extended the Express train to go to Phayathai as well as to Makkasan That made sense  Now however this train has been cancelled for ONE YEAR for maintenance As the Express trains only seemed to run every hour anyway you just had to be lucky to get one  otherwise it's quicker to get the "city line" than to wait for an Express Go online to try to find a timetable and you will find different timetables which aren't the same Today in the Bangkok Post (Aug 20 2014) the SRT Chairman admitted that "some sections of the airport rail link are damaged" and that he has assigned crews to fix them  Have they heard about regular scheduled maintenance  It's not a concept widely understood in Thailand  especially with respect to transport infrastructure There is now a direct physical link to the BTS station at Phayathai and to the MRT at Makkasan  albeit with a long walk It's definitely a cheaper and potentially quicker way to get connected to the BTS  MRT system than a cab  but the whole system is badly designed and if there is a group you certainly need to consider the convenience of a cab

title: Airport Link Rail to Suvannabhumi Airport
review: I had the occasion to use the airport link service again during my recent visit to Bangkok  I boarded at the Rajthewi BTS station to Praya Thai BTS station for a transfer to the airport link rail  The elevator at the Rajthewi BTS station is now functioning properly and appeared quite clean compared to my previous visit when it did not work and I had to lug my bags upstairs in the downpour    Once at the Praya Thai station the guard was very courteous and pointed me to the right direction to connect to the airport link rail  The cost remains nominal at 45 Baht or approximately USD 150  The link rail was clean air conditioned and ran on time getting me to the airport within approximately 20 mins from Praya Thai BTS station  The only thing that they might consider improving is the gap between the train and the platform which is approximately 2  3 inches wide  If there were a small ramp or the gap could somehow be closed or narrowed the ride would have been far safer and requires less efforts in transporting the luggage in and out of the train  Other than that I would still prefer riding on the the airport link to the hotel taxi  Check it out the next time you are in Bangkok

title: Speedy efficient low cost access to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Once you actually board the airport rail link the trip is smooth and fast If you arrive by Taxi or Uber my experience is that the drivers do not know how to get to the auto entrance of the station My Uber driver told me that GPS was finished and that I should walk from the car across a two lane road climb a concrete barricade cross two sets of tracks climb another fence cross yet another road to get to the terminal Even of I were not handicapped at my age of 72 it would be unlikely that I could actually reach my destination via that route On my return i found the directions to a taxi stand ambiguous and was finally told one had to call a taxi This was a challenge to my ability I could and did summon Uber You can opt to take the city line or the express line In my experience timing is everything I have paid the express premium but they leave less often than the city line and with the extra wait it actually took longer to take the express Boarding at the main station Makkasan at rush hour often means squished standing room only for several stops Boarding at Suvarnbhumi gives you a much better chance at getting a seat Thais don't always respect a queue and when the doors open there can be a bit of a stampede The biggest downside is getting to and from the rail link station in Bangkok The airport end is efficient well marked and easy to use
