review: Cheaper than a cab for sure It's fast gets you in city within 20 Minutes or so but i still prefer taking a cab especially after long flight with my backpack but on a serious budget then take the airport train it's very efficient quick and there's even a section to place your luggagegearbackpack )

title: Getting around in Bangkok
review: Now that i have used taxis many times and realise the problems of traffic hams and how they have to drives miles out of the way due to one way streets i can truly say that the train is the best way to get around It is quick  heap and you don't  have to argue with a taxi driver because he wants to charge 4 times higher because you look like a tourist You just need to work out which way the train is going so that you don't get on the wrong one Be warned there are a lot of steps Most stations have lifts and you will find an escalator at various points

title: A bit confusing but convenient
review: System is a bit confusing in terms of which line to use but I definitely made it quicker downtown than had I taken a taxi from airport People are helpful on rail system But just stop and look at where you need to go

title: Excellent
review: Easy to use tickets quite cheap Nice view has connection to the airport Nice and clean lots of information displayed so you never get lost

title: Must Try
review: From Bangkok airport is very convenient to reach the city proper through Sky Train Located at the basement of the airport just 45baht from airport to Phai Thai station It's spacious and cool

title: best way to move around
review: very useful to go around in bangkok for work oo for shopping I've being using it with family and is great

title: Quick travel time to city center
review: During peak travel hours this is a Godsend Although 2 train changes to get to the BTS line the route is clearly marked A definite time saver if traveling with just one carryon bag

title: Clean and efficient
review: Excellent public transit  Clean safe efficient and beautifully airconditioned

title: Better than Taxi
review: Better airconditioning and comfort than a a taxi  I did a race with some workmates where they took a taxi from the office and I took the train and I got to the hotel so quickly that they thought I was lying It is not that much cheaper than a taxi but that's only because taxes are so inexpensive I had only one problem when I tried to go on the train late at midnight The ticket machines and the cashiers that give you tickets close at 11pm so I had to take a taxi   There is also an airport express directly from the airport into downtown which is very comfortable and quick

title: Efficient and reasonable transport
review: The Skytrain is a good way of getting to certain parts of Bangkok Easy to use and reasonably comfortable provided you avoid the rush hour traffic

title: Fast, reliable, affordable transport!
review: In my view the only fast reliable and affordable means of transport from the Bangkok Airport to Bangkok City Centre Avoid the traffic jam during rush hours unless you want to spend a couple of hours in the middle of the highway starring at ugly skyscrapers next to slums

title: Great way to get around!
review: This is the best way to get around Bangkok Very easy convenient and cheap Of course Peak hours it is crowded but still your best option to get around Everyone is polite the trains are clean and airconditioned  so makes getting around this busy city a breeze

title: BTS service
review: The BTS runs frequently so you rarely must wait long between trains  It's clean cool and often quite crowded  Best advice for use is to buy a card with plenty of money on it  You can waste a lot of time waiting in line first to get change then buying single trip tickets from the machines near the entrance

title: Quick and cheap
review: On a budget or not  I still think  this one of the best ways to get into the centre of bangkok Very cheap and very fast The taxis are great but can take an aged to the traffic Easy transfer from Paya Thai into the many stops with BTS sky train I was traveling to and from Silom One note to remember some bts stations don't have escalators or lifts stairs only Heavy case travellers be aware

title: Easy & Quick
review: Nice clean & well maintained trains Quickest way to travel compared to taxis Though crowded Most ticket vending machines accept coins only Separate windows for coin exchange Separate windows for direct ticket sale as well So queues everywhere esp at junctions But still saves a lot of time than taxis

title: Excellent way of travelling in Bangkok, safe, with A/C
review: Try it It is worth the experience Easy to buy tickets and cover a good area of Bangkok True does not cover all the places you want to go but is a very good of connecting some places particularly to avoid some of the traffic in Bangkok

title: Great experience, fast but in no way cheap.
review: We took BTS from Phtom Phrong to BTS Siam and then from BTS Siam to a station to reach Wat Arun It was a great experience everything is systematic and clean and definitely time saving  For the first timers the process goes this way You go to the ticketing counter tell them your destination station they will issue you a card which is required to enter the platform When you get down to your desired station To go out you put the card in the machine and the gate will open NOTE You won't get the card back once you put it in the machine as it will be reused by the BTS This is how it works at BTS Bangkok

title: Easy way to travel
review: It is well air conditioned But for longer trips which are over than 15 minutes you may get cold so get a light jacket on

title: A Good Way To/From Suvarnabhumi Airport (But Can Be Unreliable)
review: The Airport Rail Link is a good way to avoid road traffic when traveling tofrom Suvarnabhumi Airport However the system is not as well managed as Bangkok's BTS and MRT rail transit systems and minor technical problems are frequent causing delays If you decide to use this service allow for ample amount of time (especially if you are catching an outbound flight) There are two types of service the "local" service which is runs about every 15 minutes and takes about 45 minutes to reach Suvarnabhumi Airport and the "express" service which runs about every one hour and takes about 20 minutes to reach Suvarnabhumi Airport   Important Please check the train schedules in advance

title: Excellent and Smooth Ride...
review: Rain or Shine Fastest and Cheapest way to move around in Bangkok and beat the notorious Bangkok Traffic Jam

title: EASY SYSTEM
review: I often used the Skytrain to get from my stay to locations I was visiting You can get to various locations by using the SKytrain I was able to ge to the Mall centers and to the ferry which took me to Chinatown It is about 30 baht per person Price depends on the location which you are departing from to you location of arrival That is something to keep in mind  Huge tip is to carry coins The workers in the windowbooth can give you change for your paper baht (but keep in mind during rush hours it becomes crowded & there is a big line to get change) Great majority of machines only take coins Some stations have touch screen machines which accept bills  Once you pay you get a temporary card which you insert to enter to ride the Skytrain & you insert it in order to exit the station NO FOOD OR DRINKS ARE ALLOWED ON THE SKYTRAIN

title: Fastest way around town but pricey
review: Fastest way around town depending on traffic However the prices can be a bit pricey It is often better to take a taxi or marginal in cost to a taxi

title: Empty Trains
review: I've taken the MRT once and I was surprised at how empty it was Which is great It was weird receiving a black token that you have to hold on to until the end of your ride and then insert it at the turnstile I didn't know that Luckily I kept the token and my ride was quick and easy

title: Way to AIrport
review: That was a great experience travelling to Airport without any traffic congestion Thats really good to have a Direct Rail Link to Airport as it saves time and also provides a perfect journey

title: cheap and easy to use
review: Easy way to get around the city avoiding the traffic We bought a ticket from the kiosk rather than the automatic machine 100 baht (£150) for a journey Good views too

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: This was my second trip to Bangkok Last time we used taxis each time we traveled anywhere This trip we gave the skytrain a go Wish we'd used it last trip It's fantastic So easy to use The instructions are very clear Staff are very friendly And if you don't have correct money they are only too willing to oblige

title: Easy to use
review: Really efficient easy to use and helps in saving some money in taxiuber if you're staying in the center like I did

title: Fast efficient and cheap
review: ll you could want for city travel Frequent services  cheap comfortable cool  Only downside is the steps up to them and they dont go to the historic old town ofgrand palace etc

title: Perfect for avoiding Bangkok traffic
review: If you're in Bangkok and visiting sights that are close to the BTS line this is an absolute must  A day pass (as of this writing) costs 140 Baht (around $4 USD) and will get you onoff the train with no issues  Be aware of the heightened security  there is an officer checking bags at the entrance  If the officer salutes you it is highly likely that they want to review the contents of your bag  They are very professional & respectful  I take the train everywhere I can when I'm in Bangkok  it allows me to avoid the traffic and the (sometimes very high) fares associated with tuktuk travel

title: Easy to navigate
review: The sky train and the MRT are wonderful and easy ways to avoid the traffic of Bangkok  It will really be awesome when Bangkok has a "one pay" card for their transportation like Hong Kong

title: Clean, efficient and AC travel option.
review: Wasn't quite as easy as I'd read Easy enough to purchase tickets but we caught the wrong train and ended up going the opposite way than intended No real issue ended up at the river and caught a ferry for 30 baht to our destination So for 100 baht all up had a much better trip then in a taxi and saved a few hundred baht  Nearly did the same on the return then figured the trains use the same platform to go either way Not how it works at home  Had a laugh when an American guy tried to explain to his local wife how he knew a guy he had just been talking to he was an old navy colleague He asked Siri to translate seaman into Thai

title: Often faster than cabs!
review: Not much cheaper than cabs if you are traveling more than one person   The trains often get packed but their aircon is world class

title: great way to travel in bangkok
review: easy to access easy to work out destination and easy to navigate ongoing destination  we travelled from the National Stadium station after visiting Jim Thompson's house  good value clean trains and helpful staff

title: Took a while but excellent
review: For something so simple it took my wife and I a while to figure out but beats any taxis tuk Turks etc Having been travelling many years ago in Thailand I thought it was a great idea for me to try the Sky Train (Having bottled it all those years ago) Simple straight forward and self explanatory and cheap quicker than taxis and a lot cheaper if you are on a budget

title: Very, very, very convenient
review: One can get around to most of the big and new shopping malls by BTS  It is such a convenient clean and efficient way to travel in Bangkok  Even if you can afford a taxi or limousine the problem is you will get stuck in the traffic jam for hours  So the best way to see places is on BTS  If you only stay in Bangkok for a couple of days simply buy single trips every time  you travel  The vending machines are very easy to operate  Some machines accept notes (in denominations of 20 50 and 100 baht) and offer changes  However some machines require coins you would need to change coins at the counter  Depends on the time of the day the queue can be long  As I stay in Bangkok for a whole week I bought their Rabbit Card (stored value card) which is a much cheaper and more convenient way to travel  The issuance of the Rabbit Card is 100 baht then you can choose how much to top up  I chose the option for 15 trips (to be used in 30 days) at 465 baht which is equivalent to 31 baht per trip  So if you use the card to travel to places that cost more than 31 baht you save in value

title: A must do
review: By far the cheapest and easiest way around Bangkok  Don't be put off it is just like the London underground and easier to use with better views This sky train is super fast cheap easy and air conditioned We found that there are plenty of people to answer your questions if you get into bother (not that I think you can)  Tip  based on some forum reviews saying you can be scammed when dealing with larger notes (1000Baht) we used the BTS to 'break' these up into smaller notes to use

title: Quick and comfortable
review: Really nice experience It is very quick and comfortable journey Discipline observed by People is also worth noticing

title: A Must For Tourist Travel
review: A great safe clean and cheap way to move around It can get a little crowded during peak hour but trains run every couple of minutes  It will cost less than 100 baht to get most places while taxi drivers will try and charge tourists 200300 baht for the same destinations

title: Great tour with Sarah!
review: We had a great tour with Sarah She was very informative accommodating and friendly Would definitely recommend this tour 😀

title: AIRPORT RAIL LINK
review: Forget to pay for a Taxi if your hotel is near a BTS or MRT station the Airport Rail link is easy to get punctual and fast besides that it cost 90% less than a taxi service

title: Quick easy and cheap
review: Faster and cheaper than a tuktuk or taxi Set price so no messing around with haggling over price Nice and clean and easy to use

title: Day Trip to Maeklong Railway and Damnoesaduak
review: Our trip to the railway and floating a market was wonderful and made so entertaining especially with our tour guide Sara Interestingly she also gave us tips to get the best bargains when in these markets

title: Superb tour A++
review: Sarà and driver (sorry forgot the name) were superb Informative and really fun to be around The tour itself was eye opening and was beautiful to see the culture and lifestyle I would recommend to anyone even with kids  Both markets where we stopped were great for price and also for the insta photos haha

title: Cheap efficient travel In Bangkok
review: Super cheap way to avoid the traffic below the trains can get busy at peak times but there is always another one within 5 minutes Highly recommend it also felt well staffed with decent security

title: Good Public Transport
review: The Skytrain was fast clean and cheap took us to most of the things we wanted to see use it on your trip to Bangkok

title: great
review: it can be a little confusing with the routes one has to really look carefully at the maps to locate areas there is not much of a help from the info department

title: Cheap and Enjoyable Journey
review: we prefer to go by skytrain every where in bangkok it is very good and cheap also Have all routes covered Just have to look properly the mentioned stations details at station area

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Using the BTS (and MRT subway train) is the best way to go around in Bangkok especially when there is traffic or you do long distances It's easy cheap and has a good service If you stay a couple days in Bangkok get a 10 or 20 trip card it will save you the lines for buying tickets

title: User friendly system and cheap as chips
review: Much cheaper than taking a taxi or shuttle from the airport and connects up to the Sky Train  It's not hard to work out how to use the system  All in all very handy

title: Quick Cheap and efficient
review: Arrived at Bangkok airport and was easy to follow the signs to the rail link we used it to Ramkhamhaeng and it took around 15 minutes and cost around 30 THB I think  I would use it again

title: Train experience
review: Why i choose train because i want my family to see the city of Bangkok I want them to experience train transport It is cheaper than taxi  If i have choice or next time i would choose taxi because it is more convenient even it makes me spend more money From Airport to Hotel you will use more than 1 type of transport for eg train or BTS or Taxi  Preferable to use taxi if no of passenger more than 3 people  We spent 1 hour plus from aiport to Airport 1st use train then bts then walk to hotel Ratchadamri  I am not sure what the best transport especially during car traffic I ever saw traffic the car transport moved very slow and long I never use taxi during traffic

title: Super
review: Used the Sky Train regularly whilst in the City On time air conditioned and very clean Can be very busy at peak travelling times for going to and from work but if you are unable to get on one train the next is only a few minutes away Very cheap too

title: Long but beautiful train ride
review: As my friend can never sleep in moving vehicles we took the daytime express to Chiang Mai 2nd class with airconditioning is okay the chairs can go flat so you can doze a bit which I did most of the time It is a very long ride though near the end I grew restless a bit The journey is gorgeous Through parks and mountains it was a feast to look out of the window  You will receive some food (cookies sweet bun and some curry  which I threw all over my white dress during the bumpy ride) and some drinks But take care to bring some extra food and water as near the end we really needed it  The price of this train was 616 bhats which roughly translates in 17 euro So for a 10 hour train ride that's really good value  In Bangkok they told us that you can only buy express tickets in Bangkok itself This is NOT true We bought ours in Ayutthaya just half a day in advance

title: Convenient but can get crowded
review: This was a good option for transportation that me and my family used during our stay in bangkok We had a free ferry from our hotel to take us to the nearest stop for rhe sky train It wasnt that expensive to ride and I'd say the best time to travel is between 10 and 3 We got on the skytrain from the mbk center at around 5 o clock and it was rush hour for people getting off of work and school kids getting out of school Horrible time It took almost 2 hours get back to our hotel because the trains were so crowded and didn't come frequently Other than that it's a pretty decent method of transportation

title: Easiest way to commute in bangkok
review: bangkok has traffic at any given time  the sky train is very convenient  cheap and fast to travel around in bangkok

title: Good transport
review: Can be useful in moving around Bangkok To bad it does not reach dmk or bkk airports But for dmk you can reach Mo chit station then take the A1 bus to airport Bus ride only 30 batt

title: Best way get around Bangkok
review: We used the SkyTrain to get around Bangkok Once you get used to it it's quite easy and a cheap way to get around the city You can get a day pass for 130 Bht They have a great system where you just need to now the end destination of you trip and Siam is the main change over station you really can't go far wrong and the Thai People are so helpful The best thing is that they have painted feet on the platform to tell you where to queue but be warned at rush hour it's a free for all and trains get really packed

title: Sky Train
review: Travelling in sukumvit is a nightmare most of the time The traffic is insane The sky train BTS is the only option to travel any distance on the road However if it's a short trip then a motorbike taxi is quick and exciting The BTS is clean fast and frequent It is however crowded so forget getting a seat but you can lap up much needed air con

title: Fast and convenient
review: The fastest and most convinient way to get from the Airport to the city You can choose between two lines The City Line with multiple stops for 45 THB or the Express Line goes direct for 90 THB

title: Shortest way to travel !
review: I have only Kuala Lumpur BTS Skytrain to compare and I find Bangkok Skytrains could use a bit more of maps for proper directions It does become crowdy near Nana

title: Asian standards
review: The BTS is is a modern high quality way to get around Bangkok Public transport has improved greatly in Bangkok since my last visit in 1993

title: Best way to get around....
review: The skytrain (BTS) is one of the three city metro services in Bangkok Others being MRT and Airport link All easy to navigate and cheap clean and airconditioned Usually cheaper and quicker than a taxi  Closes at midnight and opens at 6am I enjoy travelling on the skytrain

title: Really good
review: Really clean efficient and fairly cheap specially from the airport just to get you into the town centre

title: Cheap & convinient
review: Great way to access the Airport rail link depending on where you are staying in downtown Bangkok and very reasonably priced 16 Thai Baht each to connect from Sukhumvit MRT to Makkasan Station for the Airport Rail link

title: Great for avoiding traffic!
review: Beats any form of road transport in terms of comfort speed and safety if you are going anywhere near the train stations

title: Best way into city
review: Given the cost of taxi"s and the very heavy traffic in the city the rail link is the cheapest and fastest way into the cityIt is easy to find in the airport just follow the overhead signs down the escalators in the terminalYou buy a token at a machine before enteringthe machines are easy to use just select which station you want to travel to and it will display the due fareBe aware that the machines only take notes up to a maximum of 100THB so if you only have big notes you can get them changed at an office close byMost people take the link to Phaya Thai which is the last stop and links up to the BTS Skytrain which will take you to most parts of the cityThe fare for this trip is  45THB per personThe trains run every 10 mins in busy periods and about 15 mins the rest of the daythe trip from the airport to Phaya Thai only takes about 20 minutes and is certainly the best way into the city

title: Fast Transport to the city
review: Two main points about the Airport Rail Link  1 it's much cheaper than a taxi and 2 it's twice as fast as and other ground transportation into the city  I don't know how often it runs as I have never had to wait more than about 7 minutes for the next train

title: Best way of running in Bangkok
review: Beacause of a terrible traffic from Bangkok it is a good option to go with skytrainyou can buy tickets from the cashier from the atm with coins or by atm with bancnotes and cardsplease check first in which are you want to go for buying the proper tickets AttentionDON'T LOST YOUR TICKET You will need for exit the train station

title: A most important service for the tourist in Bangkok
review: It's not hard to imagine what life for the tourist in Bangkok would be like without the Skytrain  travel the road traffic arteries beneath it and see how choked they already are The Skytrain will get you to many of the main tourist destinations in the city and for those close to the Chao Phraya river such as the Grand Palace and Wat Pho the station at Saphan Taksin pier is a key starting point For others such as the Vimanmek Teak Mansion and Ananta Samakhom throne hall the Skytrain will get you halfway there say to Phya Thai station from where you can go the rest of the way by taxi at a very reasonable price The intervals between arriving trains are remarkably short Get a Skytrain Rabbit card add value to it and avoid the lines at the ticket machines  just touch the card at the turnstile You also avoid fumbinge with having enough coins at the machines There's a fee and a deposit charged for the card the latter is refundable  The card and its stored value are good for two years or more While the Skytrain cars continue to get more and more crowded especially at rush hour and at Siam station the main junction I'm still pleased to be occasionally offered a seat by a younger person and most riders except for some foreign tourists observe the No EatingDrinking signs helping to keep the cars clean  The main negative feature is the lack of enough escalators to the platforms most access up and down is by long flights of stairs Some stations are said to have elevators but I haven't used them or they're scarce

title: Nice ridthrough the country side
review: We took this ride on the railway which winds you through the country side It was used to transport Japanese soldiers and prisoners of war to conduct work on the Bridge over the River Kwai There is also a cave at the end of the line which is now a temple but was used during the war by the Japanese to store armaments out of sight of the Allied forces

title: Quick cheap reliable
review: Easy to use especially using Google maps tells you what station gets you where it's a bit like London tubes but above ground and as busy

title: Efficient and modern transportation system
review: Bangkok sky train is clean modern and efficient mode of transport for getting around the city including to key malls The fares are also very reasonable City center can be gridlocked with traffic during the daytime and using sky trains makes getting around a breeze

title: Flying train
review: It serves the town transfer and it is very high from the ground level You need to have the exact amount to buy the tickets from the machines Really it is difficult for foreigners to use it without any helping info

title: Alternative BTS
review: While the name is airport link it also served like BTS We took this train from Ratchaprarop to last destination which linked to BTS However we can't use rabbit card so need to buy single trip ticket everytime

title: Magic
review: Magic wished we had this in our country as well Just a shame it stops operating at midnight Great and modern almost NYC instead of Thailand Could spend Days on this system

title: Very efficient
review: BTS is a great way to get through the city if you don’t mind it being very busy sometimes Trains every 5 mins and very efficient and the fastest way to travel across town

title: Good Journey with Great Views
review: This train trip was part of a tour I was on I enjoyed this as it gave great views of the countryside and was good to get out of the city for a few hours I would say bring plenty of water as its a hotdusty day But just sit back and enjoy the ride

title: Experiences that last a lifetime
review: Riding in a third class train chugging along and meeting the locals Meeting friendly German policemen on their Asian holiday Seeing the indefatigable hawkers walk up and down trains selling their wares (including coffee which is most welcome) on inter city trains Being assisted by friendly staff on the first class sleepers and at the Bangkok MRT and helped by security guards and train staff to lift up heavy luggage on and off trains without having to ask All are wonderful experiences which I will treasure The trains might not run on time but the experiences last far longer than the delays I can assure you

title: Top marks
review: Fast reliable ever running it seems clean and safe  and based on the horrendous traffic below the best cheapest way to get around Bangkok The staff at the kiosks are most helpful  get an all day ticket or just a return and during busy times line up like gentlemen  wow it's not like that in London or New York lol

title: A fantastic way to get around the city.
review: Fast cheap & efficient the BTS is a great way to get around the city It also runs to the airport

title: What a  Treat and great transportation
review: This was an adventure in it own self  great view from up there while your traveling above the city great transport ssystem a bit confusing at first but you get on and figure it all our after a while

title: Great service
review: Clean frequent service    These trains which are nearly always very full are a must for transport around this city   Service is regular and frequent fully air conditioned for movement around busy Bangkok

title: Skytrain - blooming excellent
review: Cheap efficient very helpful and friendly staff easy to use magnificent air con to help break up the heat of bangkok touristing Cannot say a bad word about it

title: Great Transpotation!
review: Easy to get around and efficient Costs were fair I wish they had a 2 or 3 day pass but I guess they don't or I was not understood when asking Either way it got to where we needed to go

title: BTS Skytrain
review: We took the skytrain hoping to see more of the city but it is very busy although well run and easy to use

title: Simple, fast, clean
review: Probably the cleanest public transportation I've ever been on  Easy to use especially in Bangkok traffic Maybe not the cheapest but quite likely the fastest

title: Excellent choice during traffic
review: Can’t imagine life in Bangkok without BTS  Easy to navigate and relatively inexpensive if you do not travel too far  Irreplaceable mode of transportation during the pick hours  If you travel as a family sometimes the taxi could be a better option since the price for the long distance off pick hours became comparable with BTS

title: BTS to chilom
review: Amazing walk and coolness with breezes even during summer times with hottest weather in April  Perfect for tourists who love efficiency speed good value for money and walking to explore

title: Efficient and inexpensive
review: This mass transit system operates very smoothly and is dirt cheap  Once you learn how to read the maps and negotiate the ticket purchase process it's a piece of cake  Safe at night too  Expansions are underway to connect to the second major Bangkok airport

title: BTS skytrain - avoid Bangkok traffic
review: A modern air condition train system Immaculately clean  no food or drink allowed If lost ask locals they are only to happy to help

title: Convenient Airport City Transfer
review: Upon exiting from the Suvarnabhumi Arrival hall proceed to the basement for this transfer to the city Token can be purchased at the machine Just select the station and pay accordingly There are stations to alight for transfers to the BTS Skytrain or MRT An easy connection transfer to the BTS Skytrain is at Phya Thai

title: Use it it really is good.
review: We used this so often  so much quicker than cabs and so clean and efficient   Seats at all times brilliant

title: great for getting around bangkok
review: easy to use and great value with most rides under 150us Many stops located at shopping malls or markets And always a good place to escape the heat   They have a day pass for 475us and 1 week or 30 days Not quite as useful for tourists as the BTS (skytrain) but still very useful

title: Efficient & convenient
review: Avoid traffic with this ease and convenience Traffic solutions in Bangkok saved by both the MRT and Skytrain

title: Confidently located to Everything
review: We have used the BTS sky train to go to most of the sites It makes more sense to jump on this train because the cabs crawl at a snails pace in the heavy traffic

title: Excellent modern train system. Foreigners Have No Fear!  You can't miss!
review: Well designed and thought out foreigners will have no trouble taking this train  Intuitive logical maps mark out the station you're at in Roman letters how many stops to the next station what the price is and if you don't have change the ticket booth will accommodate you  Buy your eticket slip it through the turnstile and off you go  Inside the cars it's airconditioned and an electronic map shows you which way you're headed and what the next stop is  Announcements in Thai and English tell you what the next stop is  It's a very very easy cheap airconditioned way to get around Bangkok  or at least cover vast distances relatively quickly and easily  BTS is well done  As good as Tokyo

title: Simply the best way to get around downtown
review: Avoid the Bangkok roads and glide in airconditioned comfort Perfect for me to get between various destinations in the downtown area It does get VERY busy during peak hour so keep that in mind

title: Most efficient mode of transport from airport to city
review: I have taken ths transport a few times and can say when you are to travel during peak hours nothing can beat airport rail link Though reaching till that point in BKK traffic can be an issue at times

title: Zombie Train
review: Great for getting around but with everyone glued to their smartphones it looks like a scene from a George A Romero movie

title: easiest and quickest
review: after being hassled to use yuk tusk its great to climb aboard an air conditioned sky train and get to your destination in minutes

title: Most convenient
review: Most convenient to ravel from one place to another place if you wants to avoid traffcIt's easy to useCleanliness and neatness along with maintenance is very good

title: Best
review: We take skytrain BKK airport to go to our hotel Radisson Suite Bangkok and this quick service Better use this service to go out in city

title: Fast and efficient
review: A convenient way to get to the city centre Took about 25 mins to get to Pratunam The trains are clean but do avoid peak periods as it is quite hard to get in or out of the train

title: Just what a traveller needs
review: Great system that takes you into the heart of Bangkok quickly efficiently and at low cost ( THB45 ) Also connects to other railways at different stops We took the link to Phaya Thai station Could have hopped onto the BTS there if we needed to transit somewhere else but out hotel was a short (12 km) walk around the corner The carriages allow plenty of space for travelers with luggage and are easy to get in an out of The trains run very regularly Would recommend for anyone whose hotel is close to a rail line

title: Get a taxi instead
review: It was easy to get the train from the airport to the city but as soon as you arrive at the last station the taxi drivers are waiting for you and charge you 10 times more than normal as they know that you just arrived to Bangkok an do not know the prices For the same price you can take a taxi direct from the airport to your hotel for the same money The train is crowded and is very very cold

title: Easy way to travel, easy to figure out
review: Most stations have people who are able to speak some level of English which is helpful but even despite this if you do even a small level of research via Google maps before your journey this system is very easy to use and the locals use a good system for letting people off before boarding the train at each stop which is a nice change from the free for all I have been used to in Europe

title: Economy one
review: It is cheaper than BTS A lot comfortable than the public transportation like buses It linked with someone famous places

title: SO easy to use - try it!
review: Bangkok traffic is now notoriously logjammed Why bother sitting in a cab or a fumey tuktuk when you can take the Skytrain Google for routes in advance so you know what ticket to buy Announcements in Thai and English on the train and signage in English means you wont miss your stop Very easy very cheap and efficient Try it

title: Best way to go thru town
review: We western world have to learn a lot from the users of the BTSwe wait the people to get out before entering easy for Asian but in our so called modern society no respect Anyway  it's the best beau to discover or run to meetings around town

title: Quick, easy, reliable service from the main airport to the city area
review: A cheap fast and reliable way to get to the airport Especially useful in peak hour and rainy weather to beat the traffic It is clean the only problem can be getting to a station

title: Vacation
review: It is a cheap and fast way to get in and out of downtown Bangkok during the day They don't have an express line so the train stops at every station It took us about 35 mins from the airport to Phaya Thai station to connect with BTS (sky train) They don't offer any ramps so you have to carry your luggage up and down the stairs They do have an elevator for you Not sure of the efficiency nor the speed of the service If you travel light give it a try

title: Get there fast

title: The fast and cheap way to get to the airport
review: The road between Bangkok and BKK airport can become very congested You need most of the recommended 3 hours at the airport before departure and travelling by road can add a couple of hours and be very stressful in this situation  The rail city airport rail link is very modern fast and although stops at six stations is still cheap air conditioned and the best way to make this journey (The express link is not running at the moment apparently due to a lack of carriages () but this line  does very well) We got on at the Makkasan terminal an enormous mostly empty building in town using a taxi to get there All was easy albeit you have to walk round a bit to find the actual rail link but people will guide you if you get a bit perplexed We would use it again as our first choice of travel to and from the airport in Bangkok

title: The Preferred Method of Travel to the Airport
review: Clean efficient convenient affordable fast and centrally located There are lifts for people with heavy luggage There are also escalators There are eateries at the station if you want a snack and the trains run regularly

title: Unforgettable

title: Express Airport Link
review: Bangkok’s Airport Link is the most convenient mode of transportation to and from the Suvarnabhumi International Airportit brings you from the airport direct to the city center HASSLEFREE connecting to BTS Sky train it might get congested in some hours but stillits the easiest and stress free way for your next departure or arrival in Thailand

title: train travel with a view

title: ok
review: It was clean fast efficient spaciousbut really not sure why it ranks so highly in the list of attractionsI mean it's a train

title: World-class commuting experience!
review: The best and fastest way to go around Bangkok at most affordable prices If you're planning on taking any more than 3 or 4 rides in a day better to go for a full day pass costing 140 Baht  which is excellent value for money You can easily find change of money at the station counters and its very easy to find your way around the station and buying the tickets is indeed very easy The trains are worldclass in every way  punctual spotlessly clean and very comfortable Please help keep it that way please don't litter and please be polite to the amazing people of Thailand

title: Better to explore on your own
review: The Railway Market is very exciting to see  a little touristy but still fairly authentic The second market is unfortunately a big tourist show and has nothing in common with an original floating market as you know it from other countries You are put in a boat and steered from one souvenir boat to the next You are also repeatedly presented with a snake or a small lemur to take a photo with It is not an authentic experience at all What a pity  Our tour guide Kiwi was very friendly and always cheerful and explained everything very precisely ) I would do the tour a second time on my own  drive to the Railway Market with a driver and have enough time there to look at everything in peace and skip the second market

title: Only way to go
review: Look this and the subway are the way to get around Bangkok particularly around peak time The cost is great value and you can get to most attractions Some station only take coins not notes so a bit of a pain but you can usually change notes close by

title: Predictable timing, but calculate the overall trip time
review: Went in early Dec but for some reason the "Express" train (skips stations) wasn't working so between walking to station buying ticket waiting for a train stopping at all stations the time didn't feel much different than going for a taxi into the city I honestly wouldn't mind paying 350thb for cab vs 50 thb for the airport link although the time would be much more predictable during rush hour

title: Regular and reliable.
review: My husband and I used this service and were really glad we did It is not expensive to use and it is reliable clean and cool and it has regular trains to take you from the airport

title: Travel around using public transport
review: If you know roughly how many trips you're gonna take during the trip it's advisable to get a rabbit card It will save time as you won't have to queue up for the ticket everytime you want to use the BTS Take note that the card is chargeable but it can be kept for your next trip to bangkok   The downside is that you have to use the stairs as there are very limited escalators at the station Good for slimming down if you're gonna eat alot at bangkok 😂

title: Easy access, fast and efficient train services

title: Great Concept, Questionable Execution

title: Easy to travel...

title: Improved and easy to use from the airport
review: Before it was changed to a single line it used to be two types of lines (yellow and red the more direct one quite expensive and not worth the expense if you were more than 2) It has now become easy and inexpensive (50 THB for the longest commute) It is designed for both travelers and commuters working outside BKK so yes it can be busy at times and seemingly crowded if you are carrying pieces of luggage but it is quicker than any other ground transportation Easy access airconditioned helping staff all around it is highly recommended for a troublefree ride from the airport I tend to take a taxi when I go from city to airport but it mostly depends on the time of the day the state of the traffic and your location within the city in relation to the train stations andor the highways) I guess that accessing the carriages at peak hour with luggage when you are not starting from the first station (when the train is empty) can be very challenging and frustrating both for yourself and the locals My recommendation when you arrive by plane in BKK train then taxi

title: Good option for skipping traffic

review: I used this regularly and it was great BUT I am disabled and struggled with all the stairs There are escalators at specify stations but overall you need to grin and bear the stairs I couldn't find elevators and if there were some they were very well hidden It seems the message here is if you have a disability you have to put up with this or stay home Plus users never give up the disabled assigned seats for anyone

title: Fun, secure and efficient. Overnight trains BKK-CM and Surat Thani-BKK through 12goasia
review: Booked our two train journeys (BKKChiang Mai and Surat ThaniBKK) for August online in advance with 12goasia Efficient service they emailed me the ticket voucher with explicit details (and photos) of when and where to pick the tickets up over the road from Hualampong train station I picked up tickets for both journeys at the same time  Journey to CM on the 1930 aircon sleeper was a lot of fun (the kids loved it) Although once seats are converted to beds they weren't all that comfortable (but manageable) and the lights were left on the whole journey which made it difficult to sleep too much as the curtain around your bed is not that thick We left and arrived on time though and had a great rice porridge with pork breakfast on board before arriving  Journey from Surat Thani to BKK on the 1830 aircon sleeper was excellent More comfortable beds this time and helpful friendly service from the staff on board and at Surat Thani station to make sure we boarded the right train Again it departed and arrived on time  In our experience the security on the train is fine Keep your valuables in your bunk with you and tie your larger bag to the bunk ladder or store it under your seatbed This is a more expensive journey up to CM than going in 3rd class so it tends to attract foreigners and more wealthy locals We certainly felt perfectly safe at all times  If you are new to Thailand I would very much recommend taking the overnight aircon sleeper train up to CM than fly The journey is part of the experience and it is easy to grab a taxi (c400B) from the airport to the train station and then plenty of signs in English and helpful people about at the station to get you on the right train You see and experience so much more doing it this way

title: Train #9 Bangkok to Chiang Mai - 1st class sleeper
review: Our family of 2 adults 2 children had an excellent experience on the night train to Chiang Mai    We booked our tickets through 12Go (highly recommend)  We picked the tickets up about 330pm and had a snack and a couple of beers in their cafe (no alcohol allowed on the train)  We then went to the 7eleven and stocked up on food and snacks for the kids but decided we would also try the food on the train  We boarded early at about 5pm to get settled in (and because the kids were so excited to get on the train)    We were in the last last carriage (13) and were in seats 0912 meaning we had two interconnecting rooms  There were two toilets one urinal and one shower for the carriage  They were kept clean throughout the journey (including one person overflowing the shower which was quickly mopped up)  Not long after we departed (on time) a lady came around and showed us menus for dinner  We decided to try two of the set menu options for 210B (I think)  they came with a soup a curry a stirfry rice fruit and a juice  She asked what time we wanted it and I said whenever it was ready (ie sooner rather than setting a later time)  At about 7pm the food arrived  It was surprisingly nice  the kids loved the chicken and cashew stirfry with rice and the curries were tasty   At about 830pm the man came around to make up the rooms  The kids were asleep by 9pm and we woke them at 630am  The train moves a lot in a side to side motion but we had a fairly decent sleep  The flow of the air con is adjustable and we turned it off not long after leaving Bangkok  It was still cool in our rooms but none of us were cold  The first class rooms don't have the same issue with light as second class as you can turn the lights off (and lock the door)  There is also a screen (which you can turn off) showing the upcoming stations and a map etc   Just before 7am the man came back around to unmake the beds and we arrived in Chiang Mai about 10 minutes late  It was a great experience  Would we do it again  yes

title: BTS skytrain is a necessity if you need to get somewhere on time.
review: The BTS skytrain is a very useful public transportation tool particularly when Bangkok’s roads are jammed with traffic  The line I normally use is the Suhkumvit line as I am most often staying at a hotel along this strip  It is easy to get up to the BTS system by either manual stairs or escalator depending on the stop you are at  Once up in the departure area it is fairly easy to navigate the maps if you have at least a rudimentary understanding of where you are and where you want to go  The maps will clearly tell you the cost and you can buy your ride pass for literally change  It seems the average fare I will pay is between half a us dollar to just over a dollar  Considering how bad traffic can get in Bangkok these days along the main thoroughfares this is a really good deal as it will end up being cheaper and much faster than the taxis stuck below in traffic  There are plenty of ticket machines all over to get your tickets from  Some will even take the Thai baht bills and give change back  For the areas that do not have these particular machines there is always a change window nearby  If you want to avoid wasting time in a change line make sure you keep the change given by your numerous purchases  When you are ready to go up to the trains you will need to pass through the “gates” which are guarded  You will insert your ticket horizontally and it will be spit back out vertically and the gates will open allowing you to pass  Get your ticket back  You will need your ticket until you are done or you can be fined Make your way to the proper line and board  The trains do have seating but most of my stops are not too far in distance so I will usually stand  The mornings and late afternoons will have jam packed trains  If you must travel during these peak times make sure your valuables such as your wallet or purse are secured  It is known that pickpockets and thieves will ply their trade on the carriages  Also realize that during these busy times you will share a carriage with people of different cultures who do not always bathe regularly let alone using soaps  It can get interesting from an olfactory perspective  Some people will bring menthol tubes or perfumed scarves or such to aid in dampening some of these more pungent visitors from exotic parts of the world  After you reach your destination disembark quickly and make your way back down to the “departure” gates  Insert your ticket in the same way but this time you won’t get it back  Sorry no souvenir

title: How Public Transit Should be.

title: Nightmare Night Train to Chiang Mai
review: I planned the night train to Chiang Mai boarding at Ayutthaya for what I thought would be a good experience during my trip to Thailand  I'm an older woman who has traveled all over the world for 40 years and have many times traveled alone as I am during this trip as husband and others were unable to go this time  Trying to board I was herded to the front by the platform worker twice despite telling him that I was in Car 11 which seemed like it might be at the back of the train  I almost missed getting on the train because he kept telling me to get on with the others in the front  No one was helping people find their designated berths in the back of the train and no one asked for tickets on boarding either one of which would have helped  I asked the first staff where Car 11 was and she said "next car"  The next car was the dining car so I asked the staff in the dining car where Car 11 was and she said "next car"  I then asked a staff in the "next car" where Car 11 was (none of the cars are marked on the inside or the outside) and she pointed back toward the DINING CAR  Having asked 3 people I found that in this car most curtains were closed for people to sleep already but that Berth 7 was unused and the curtains were open so I assumed that this was my berth having gotten absolutely no help from anyone finding my berth after asking 3 staff  About an hour later two British ladies came back from the dining car and said I was in their berth which was an unpleasant surprise for all of us  The same young staff who had given me wrong information before arrived and then called another young female with a walkie talkie who seemed to be in charge  By this time I was getting out of the berth assuming that there was a mistake (after all these kinds of seating mistakes happen quite frequently on trains and planes) This next staff member took a demanding rigid and officious tone with me which was offensive as I am invariably a quiet respectful person  I showed her the ticket I thought was the right one but it was mistakenly my ticket from the earlier ride between Bangkok and Ayutthaya that morning  This would not have been hard to understand and I told them it was the wrong ticket but this young woman jumped to the conclusion that I was a VAGRANT WHO DIDN'T BELONG ON THE TRAIN  She said to me "Madame you will have to get off the train at the next stop Lopburi"  Lopburi is widely known for it's seediness and for having no places to stay without bars on the windows and over 1* rating  I was shocked  I told her I needed a minute to look for my ticket in my purse for between Ayutthaya and Chiang Mai  she waited for no more thatn 30 seconds as I frantically searched and then said again "Madame you will have to get off the train in Lopburi the next stop"   Panicked I eventually found the ticket (this was in front of an entire car of people)  She looked at it and said "sorry" and turned and left  To make matters worse I STILL didn't know where car 11 was and looked beyond in the next car  A staffmember in THAT car told me then that Car 11 was "BACK" and  pointed me back toward Car 10 and the dining car  Unbelievable    I made a complaint at the railroad office when I got to Chiang Mai but expect no reply  So beware of the  potential AS A TICKETED PASSENGER (hopefully not a woman traveling alone as I am) for being treated like a vagrant and booted from the train in the night at a very seedy stop in a country halfway around the planet from home

title: Convenient.
review: This is a great way to get around Bangkok It covers most of the main areas of the city that a tourist will need to travel including the Weekend Markets (Chutachuk Markets) on the Mo Chit line The main shopping complexes (Paragon and other) at Siam station The Bang Wa line will take you to the river and the Saphan Taksin Station connects with the river ferries The SkyTrain links in with both the Sky Train to the Airport and also the underground system The ticket purchasing system is fairly simple to use and small change can be obtained at all stations  All stations are clean and very safe I always enjoy travelling on the SkyTrain although sometime it can be very busy

title: Efficient way of travelling

title: Connect Us from Suwarnabhumi Int Airport to the Center of Bangkok
review: This is the best airport connect transport system in Bangkok The train is so clean and it's better for Us to go to our hotel by using  ARL than Taxi The price is so cheap

title: Best way to get around Bangkok!
review: It is clean easy to use AIR CONDITIONED inexpensive The US could take some lessions from them  Highly recommend getting around on BTS  You can buy a a Rabbit card for $50 baht (non refundable) plus $50 baht refundable and load it with $100 baht  You can keep reloading the card with 100 increments or more if you want  The card will be good for 3 years if you want to keep it when you leave Bangkok for next trip  You can also use the Rabbit card in some places for food  In the food place in the lower level of Siam Paragon and other places as well  Pretty handy   All the stops are announced in English as well as Thai their app is not so great but you can get maps at the stations  They are very helpful at stations  Some have escalators some do not  SUPER easy to get to hotels from Airport using the sky link  just ask for help LOTS OF STAIRS  not wheel chair friendly

review: I like the creativity of Thailand The sky train running through the city "skies" and easing access to many parts is a class Bangkok is a big city where one can easily spend a lot on transport but the sky train is cheap

title: Clean and super easy to use
review: I was pleasantly surprised with how easy it was to buy tickets for this Airport Rail link Station is located in the basement of the Airport  Buy ticketsdisc from booth and hold disc over yellow spot to enter station One way ticket cost 45 baht Ensure to walk along the platform rather than stopping at the bottom of the escalator as guards will blow the whistle at you Hop on the train at platform 1 or 2 both head into the city I missed the first train as I was waitinb on the wrong side Trains come every 15 minutes or so Luggage carriers in train I couldnt find an escalator so I had to  lug my case down the stairs this is thd the only pitfall

title: My, it really made us think!
review: The whole experience was very moving We didn't mind that it was 34 degrees as it helped understand what these guys went through Such a momentous task in very short space of time in horrendous circumstances The information centre and museum were very informative Make sure you listen to the poem entitled 'Mates'  golly so moving Well worth a visit expect to be captured by the emotion of it all

title: Convenient!
review: Convenient Can get to almost anywhere around Bangkok from this station Buying tickets is easy all the names of the stations etc are mentioned in Thai and English as well

title: Wonderful
review: This is really cheap way to get into town and it avoids Bangkok's notorious traffic jams It cost 40 Bahtto Makasan and a taxi is 500 If you have mountains of luggage you might struggle

title: BTS
review: Great facility and transportation system easy yo use and understand and helpful staff Worth using when in and around Bangkok center

title: Easiest way to get around
review: Try to avoid the peak time then you will have the chance to see the city view on your train ride You will always see tourists and locals on the train

title: Easy to use
review: It was our first time using ARL  and thanks to fellow TripAdvisors  our trip to Sukhumvit was easy  Purchased tokens on ground floor (45 THB) to last station (Praya Thai) then take BTS to city center  Recommend only if you don’t have many luggage

title: quick and rapid during peak time
review: If you want to avoid traffic It is the best way to get around Bangkok especially tourist attraction area  Clean quick and cheap

title: Convenient
review: A great way to travel from the airport (BKK) to the city  We took the express train and it only took about 17 minutes to get from BKK to Phaya Thai  On our way back we took the City Line train which took about 30 minutes  It was also good

title: Super!
review: do not be afraid to ask people about how it works with to buy tickets then it works really well with the skytrain taking you both quick and easy everywhere to several shopping centers

title: The link that no Bkk taxi driver would want you to know about
review: The first time I was in Bangkok I've fallen for the tourist trap of taking a Taxi to the center for the mafiacartelrate of 400thb This was before I knew about the airport link which is fast cheap and convenient (45thb for city line that makes several stops along the way 90thb for direct link) The final destination is always phaya thai station From there you can catch the metro or the BTS to get to your destination If you go to Khaosan road like most travelers do then find a taxiboat station

title: Easy, cheap and clean
review: Easy to use clean & efficient and cheap as chips  44baht seems to get you anywhere  Just wish it went further into old Bangkok

title: Excellent transport system to access Bangkok
review: Used the sky train for my recent visit to Bangkok I purchased the 140 THB day saver ticket which was excellent valueit is a shame it does not cover the metro The trains were prompt and very clean

title: Easy way to get around
review: The BTS or metro trains are an quick easy and cheap way to get around Bangkok and avoid the traffic There are stops at major shopping centres and by the Chao Phraya river where you can catch tourist boats The trains are very clean and air conditioned

title: Best WaybTo travel In Bangkok
review: Using the BTS is the best way to get around in Bangkok  It is fast clean and reliable  The only thing is their are not enough cars during rush and busy time

title: Comfortable ride
review: It's the best to take airport rail link to City centre Airport link connects to the Bangkok Transport system (BTS) if you disembark at Phayathai station Airport rail link cost 45 Bhats per person

title: NO BARGAIN
review: Thank God This is the only transportation in BKK that does not need bargaining and it's clean It's not fast nor frequent so please take plenty of time prior travelling

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: The stations are in ideal locations and run very frequently  They also connect with the BTR buses and subway trains  The tickets are extremely cheap (around 5THB) but it is a good idea to purchase a Rabbit card so you just have to tag on and tag off which is more convenient than having to purchase a single journey ticket each time

title: Best way to go around!
review: I definitely love Skytrain in Bangkok It is the easiest way to get to places Skytrain is fast modern clean and easy to understand how to buy tickets and how to find your line

title: Good Alternative to/from the airport
review: This is a great alternative to using a taxi or limo into the city especially during peak traffic times in BKK  Only downside is that it can get crowded during peak traffic times and you may have to stand and had you luggage  There are a number of stops along the way so it isn't fast  If you have a lot of heavy luggage and plan to switch over to the BTS when you arrive at Phaya Thai you may want to consider a taxi or limo  There are no escalators between the stations and there is a lot of ups and downs by stairs    Otherwise this is a great alternative

title: Belongs to the top transportation over the world
review: Sky train is very clean and very safe  Your way is easy to find and you can find a lot of staff to help you if you are lost or in trouble  The best way to go from a place to another in BKK

title: convenient for travelers
review: one of the best ways to reach the center from the airport Affordable (45 baht from airport to phaya thai) and hassle free highly recommended for tourists travelling to bangkok

title: Cheap and easy
review: We purchased a 15 trip rabbit card which we used over our week in Bangkok The BTS is extremely efficient and spotlessly clean

title: Bridge on the River Kwai
review: Visited the Death Railway museum and adjoining cemetery  sobering reminder of the past  walked over the iron bridge   Museum had very good display of the tragic history of the area

title: skytrain
review: used  it to get from our hotel mode sathorn down to the water taxis It was easy to use and understand but must get change from the kiosk for the machines

title: You Must Do This
review: We have been to Kanchanaburi several times but we have never taken the railway up to Hellfire Pass  It always seemed too hard to figure out  other than very expensive 'tourist' trips  The key is to visit it as a 'local'  First go to the Kanchanaburi Train Station (NOT the station near the bridge) about 30 minutes before the outbound train (607 1035 1626) and pay THB100 per person at the ticket counter  You will get an assigned seat  Ask for midcar lefthand seats (although the ticket agent will probably give you those seats anyways if it's not too crowded)  We did not bother with the VIP 'tourist' tickets  The seats were the same the only difference was that the VIP cars were in the front and served 'free' drinks  Sit with the locals and take your own drinks  There is plenty written about the trip itself which is great in every way so I'll not include that  We decided to go to the end of the line and then have lunch before taking a car back to town (THB1000)

title: Quick, cheap, clean and easy!
review: Using the train to reach the city from the airport was so easy  the map was clear and the cost to travel was very small The carriage was very clean and the ride very comfortable Is definitely recommend this option

title: Must see for history buffs.
review: Take the train from the bridge to Nam Tok and back along the river Kwai It will be an unforgettable experience

title: Easy access
review: Provided easy access in central Bangkok I would love to see more variety of little shops around Some stations have exciting kiosks such as dried fruit shops money changer fruit juices   Some tocket machines accept small notes and change was nice On the day machine was broken just go to ticket counter and they will break your notes with coins

title: Straight into town and cheap
review: This train is Fast and takes you straight into town As it starts at the airport you will always get space and most likely a seat this might be different though when you need to connect for example with the sky rail Good alternative to a taxi

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The MRT is the perfect way to travel around Bangkok You can  buy a token for your journey at the entrance to each metro station and they are very inexpensive The trains are clean and spacious for underground trains   There is even data

title: Excellent network, very comfortable, quite economical
review: We had a very good experience with the Bangkok metro lines…  Don't travel with luggage as they are no escalatorslifts

title: Most reliable transport
review: This is the fastest and cheapest mode of transport to connect to Bangkok city It takes less than 30 minutes to reach Central Bangkok from airport by Airport Rail Link First train starts at 6 in the morning

title: Airport rail link
review: Excellent means of getting to  from the city from the airport You have the choice of an express service (more expensive) or a stopping all stations service shared with the general public It is only 7 stations to the city and does not take long A short 50 metre or so walk to then link up with the BTS Skytrain The Airport Rail link is a "private" service for which you purchase a token for the trip The BTS Skytrain is totally separate and require you to either purchase a reloadable travel card  refundable 50 baht deposit plus an initial 150 baht load  or pay for each trip as it occurs Choose depending on the circumstances of your stay

title: Good Not Great
review: This is good I took it from Bangkok to Ayutthaya It was very cheap and decently clean However it was extremely overcroweded

title: Most comfortable way to travel in Bangkok
review: Best way to beat the traffic and get from one place to another fast The air conditioned sky trains are easy to navigate and quite comfortable After travelling in many places with trains including London underground and Berlin   trains and more id say BTS skytrain is so far my favourite  Id reccomend to buy a day pass at 140baht if you will travel a lot to save time and money

title: Good
review: The best way to get to cityc center from airport Cheap and fast Sth It's crowded but better than paying too much for taxi

title: Clean, air conditioned, easy to find!
review: Very good system It's clean it's air conditioned (very important given how hottttt it is) The stops are easy to find just need a bit more coverage

title: Good
review: A good way to beat the Bangkok's notorious traffic Good air con system a very important aspect of heatBangkok weather But not all stations with note accepting machine and multiple tickets purchase at once Machines mainly using coins which gotta purchase separately if more than one ticket and need to change coins at the counter a small inconvenience

title: Fast cheap way to get downtown
review: The airport rail link is the best way to get downtown From the airport to Bts station right downtown costs 90 baht or roughly 3 dollars It takes about 25 minutes and you can go wherever you want from there Don't take the taxi out of airport as it costs 1500 baht to go downtown and is a scam The train is downstairs in the airport and is easy to use

title: Easy to follow
review: I love the BTS It was the easiest less congested way to the travel However during rush hour you may have to wait for a metro with space It is tourist friendly

title: Training
review: Convenient even though crowded during peak hours And connects you to key places in BKK And stations near shopping malls

title: Easy to use, but soooo crowded!
review: Made one journey on the sky train spanning 3 stops Extremely easy process to read the maps and buy the token tickets  Good value for money too The only problem is the crowd  At peak hours you’d likely have to let a few trains go before you can even squeeze in   I’d still use it again though  for the price and convenience and the ability to bypass the horrible jams on the streets below

title: Easy, Efficient
review: The title says it all really the Airport Rail Link provides a connection from Suvarnabhumi Airport via Makkasan Station to Phaya Thai station in central Bangkok  We were staying in the Sukhumvit area so changed onto the MRT (blue line) to Sukhumvit (which also links to the BTS Asok station)   Just buy a token at the machines or the helpful ticket counter and you’re off

title: clean, cheap and efficient
review: Used a lot on a recent trip Was on time quick and convenient with air con Also very cheap Will def use again

title: Convenient way of travelling
review: Cheap and most easy convenient way of travelling around in bangkok Bangkok is notorious for its traffic  so what better way to beat it than the MRT Clean and lovely cool AC air The tickets are very easy to purchase from the vending machines or the teller

title: Strap hanger
review: IT IS ALWAYS CROWDED Please increase the frequency of trains or add more cars Rarely are we able to get a seat But I suppose it is value for money

title: Easy way to move around BKK
review: Grab a map & whiz around BKK high above the congested streets Air conditioned and comfy ( avoid the peaks at 900 and 500)

title: Bangkok to Chiang Mai overnight - 2nd class
review: This train actually wasn't too bad even though it was pretty old The seats were comfortable and fine and when they were turned into beds they were also fine each with a little curtain for privacy There was enough luggage space too The negatives are as always on old trains the toilet facilities on board (why can't they just clean them properly and fill the handsoap containers and provide paper towels The steward does nothing all night the least he can do is keep the loo clean) and the fact that we left Bangkok 90 minutes late with no explanation and the food we had ordered just after boarding took until 1030 to arrive so we couldn't have our beds made and sleep before we'd eaten  Much better to take your own food on board

title: first time user
review: we had to get about a fair bit on the MRT I found it very easy to use very clean and very prompt Signage is also in English so easy to understand where you are going to

title: Easy to travel!

title: Fantastic
review: I cannot believe that more people do not use this  It's so much quicker and cheaper than any other way into Bangkok

title: Efficient

title: Beat the traffic!
review: Although the trains can get very crowded with standing room only this is the quickest way to get around

review: Very efficient fastest and economical way to get from and to airportdowntown All stations has escalators even with heavy luggage it's easy to handle The train goes straight under the airport

title: Great stuff
review: Very secure and security on station Staffs are friendly and given map direction  I used a lot of Nana station Some stations they provide the escalators and lift for handicap

title: Efficient
