title: Efficient and Effective
review: The BTS Skytrain can bring tourists straight to the main shopping districts and it is wellconnected to the MRT systems too

title: Excellent system
review: We used the skytrain for shopping to MBk and Siam paragon The trains are cheap really clean and run to schedule

title: Not the sky train but equally as good
review: See sky train review There are also 2 types of train one which stops at each station and one that is an express service yet doesn't run as further as the other

title: A great day out and amazing history and scenery.
review: The trip was well worth the 3 hours to get there We were well looked after by both driver and guide  Our guide made sure we did everything the best way and at the best time possible 👍😁

title: Take it, it’s cheaper
review: I highly recommend everyone to take the train everywhere It’s easier and faster than a tuk tuk (always over priced) or taxi (unless you get a metered one) because it’s cheaper and faster especially when there’s peak hour jams

title: Convenient but expensive
review: This is an extremely useful and convenient way to get to and from the airport  It is a little bit pricey though

title: Awesome way to get around the city
review: We have been in Bangkok for 14 days and have extensively used the BTS This has proved convenient clean and a great service When confused the ticket officers have been helpful Can be crowded during rush hour but everyone very polite and no problems  We purchased all day ticket for 140 bht and found this the most economic

title: Travel on BTS to avoid traffic Jams
review: If you visit Bangkok the BTS is the best way to move around At times the traffic congestion is very bad and it can take an hour just to travel a distance of 56 km Best alternative is to take BTS It is modern air conditioned but generally jam packed during any time of the day Use BTS during monsoon season to avoid long traffic jams   Note  the tourists can also take one day pass for unlimited travel on BTS

title: Easy travel
review: Look at the map and it will tell you the price go to the ticket office and they will either issue a ticket or give you the change so that you can buy the ticket from the machine They give you change as the machines do not take cards or notes

title: only way to travel
review: I bought a day pass every day I was in town  It's the only way to go  Difficult to walk with all the traffic  I wish it went to the historic part of town

title: Really easy to use with Google maps
review: Have change ready to get rid of it air conditioned comfort well sign posted kept you informed through the journey  give it a go instead of a taxi or Tuk Tuk

title: A must if you visit Kanchanaburi!
review: A "living" part of our recent history For the young ones WWII may belog to "ancient" history but I think that this is something they can learn a lot from

title: Best way to get to the city
review: If you try taking a taxi from Suvarnabhumi into the city it will easily cost you in the range of ฿400฿500  However when you land at the airport you can get right in the train station located inside the airport pay ฿45 and get into the city a little while later  The Airport Rail Link connects to the SkyTrain at the Phayathai station and the SkyTrain can get you around to a lot of Bangkok  It's an incredibly easy system and far cheaper than a taxi  I'd definitely recommend the train to anyone arriving at BKK  Do be careful though the night's last Airport Rail Link leaving the airport gets you to Phayathai after the SkyTrain has stopped running for the night  This means you get deposited at the Phayathai station with no onward train travel and there are throngs of taxi drivers there ready to take advantage of your travelwearied state  As anywhere in Bangkok always demand that a taxi driver uses the meter if the driver tells you the meter is broken or tries to negotiate a rate beforehand it means he's a shady person  Your best bet is to talk away from the station to Phayathai Road and flag down one of the taxis driving by rather than dealing with any of the taxis waiting to prey on people

title: Fast
review: Easy to work out how to use Carriages are clean and cooling Can get full very quickly and seats are hard to come by but there's plenty of standing room and hand rails to hold onto

title: Good train
review: We took this train from Bangkok Airport to Ratchsprop Station for reaching Pratunam It was fascinating jouney throuhout the time after watching huge tall builings on the way It is also cheapest one and less time consuming

title: Better than some in Europe
review: Not so overcrowded Clean carriages and people do not eat on the train Felt safe All in all a good experience

title: Fast, clean, safe, and cool.
review: This is a dream of mass transportation You should plan your touring to avoid rush hour esp if you are carrying bags

title: I studied in 2000 for half a year in Bangkok at Asia Institute of Technology .....
review: I had the luck to study for about half a year at the AIT  Asia Institute of Technology  in Bangkok and I travelled all over Thailand and all around South East Asia  Of course I took the BTS Skytrain to visit the city of Bangkok I strongly recommend you to travel in the less hot and less humid season to Bangkok The climate in Bangkok can be terribly hot and extremely humid   Bangkok in the hot and humid months is really not a fun it's very exhausting and you'll be sick of this humid climate very quickly   The PROs of the BTS Skytrain cheap easily accessible and fast Bangkok's BTS is better than taking taxis Don't be afraid of feeling lost the station names are not only in Thai but in English as well

title: beat the traffic n Fast
review: Fastest way to the city centre as it arrives two stops away from central SIAM Journey is less than 30 min n u can choose to get off at makkasan which is a stone or two throw from terminal21 If u have not been to bkk the traffic is a nightmare worst than Freddy

title: USE THE SKYTRAIN
review: Use the skytrain when youre in Bangkok It's really really cheap and you can get almost everywhere for under 50Bath And It's much easier and faster than taxi

title: train service
review: Fast trip into city yes go by train Only about 8 stops from airport to city stop   Yes i do it again Peter J

title: Great service
review: Helpful for my travel while the traffic jam Sometime I can not travel from place to place in time because of the traffic in Bangkok too jam But no problem with skytrain

title: Avoid the traffic - go by train
review: The airport link is a great way to avoid the traffic and the stress of going by car  I use it often to get in and out for meetings or to meet people also for my own travel Service cost effective clean fast and on time

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: I would highly recommend using the BTS Sky Train I was a little apprehensive not being so good with directions and large crowds but things are really setup so well There is always a booth to get your change and the ticket machines are easy to figure out Just look online and figure what your destinations station name is and your going to have an easy time At first I did not even know which direction my train ran so I would always just say the name of the station to one of the security people and they point which side to take Now I have it figured pretty good and it really is a great way to beat the Bangkok traffic

title: Love the floating market
review: Our tour was amazing Ms Kiwi our tour guide was a very enthusiastic lady she loves her job We went as a family of five and my elderly mother We were picked up from our hotel and then proceeded to the railway station Ban Kalong we went to see the salt farm in here We then had the experience of riding a train to Maeklong station market we enjoyed the view from the train We then had to stay for few minutes at the market and had some coconut 🥥 juice or mango juice before departing to the floating market Damnoen Saduak Enjoy the floating market with their fresh produce we had some coconut ice cream and the coconut pancakes was the highlight of our lunch

title: Travel
review: Great way to get around Recommend getting map to help what direction to go Clean and airconditioned Also cost of day pass 140thb which we felt was well worth tge cost

title: Fast and efficient
review: I took it to get to my apartment at Sanam Pao I dropped of at Phaya Thai and changed to BTS The tickets can be easily bought from the airport station itself Just get from the vending machine There are also signs showing train to city at the airport to direct you to the airport rail link Easy to find and rather fast transportation

title: Great way to go around Bangkok
review: As far as possible I use sky trains in Bangkok to visit places They are clean and wonderfully cool A great respite from the heat of the city Prices are extremely reasonable service is good and coaches are spotlessly clean

title: Criminal Frozen Airco
review: I had made a comment here  aboit the BTS of Bangkok saying that the absurd cold inside of the wagons was really crazy  but the underground (MRT) is even more frozen as air conditioned temperature   the stupidity of those responsible would be criminal denunciation (as they make people sick)

title: Convenient/ inexpensive
review: Very easy if only hand carry when landed at Suvannabumi airport just get escalators to ground floor buy tickets 30 bath hop on if hotel on  Sukumvit change one station  Or change for MRT

title: Grand railway
review: One of the most grand views over the river is from this railway You're able to walk a shorter amount on it to see the cave and to get on the other side is no problem Not for the person who is afraid of heights

title: A Great and a Cheap Way to Get to Bangkok
review: Since Bangkok has tons of traffic during all hours of the day it is a great idea to use the Airport Rail to get into the city It is easy to find as the entrance to the Rail Link is inside the Airport level B The ticket machines have English instructions Most of the time the Airport Rail Link is quite crowded though as there are many travelers who use it to go to or from the city so I wouldn't suggest choosing this option of travel if carrying several large and heavy bags Other than that I think it is a great option to get into the city

title: BTS sky train
review: Best thriftiest way of getting round the city Clean and air conditioned punctual and user friendly

title: Convenient!
review: BTS is very easy to navigate and cheap for users (cheaper than most countries) but high quality trains and very safe

title: Similar to BTS Sky Train, very cost efficient
review: Just as with the BTS the MRT also offers a very low cost transport medium for travelers esp those travelling individually or in very small groups Some MRT stations drop of directly in attraction areas and some have links for transfer to BTS

title: Fast airport rail Link
review: This is a rapid efficient and clean ride between Airport and downtown Bangkok Reasonably priced Local train travel within Bamgkok is efficient and reasonably priced MetroMRT also offers Seniors discount

title: The fastest path across Bangkok
review: Beat the crawling traffic and congested roads with the Skytrain BTS  Easy to get around frequent services that start early in the day and run late into the night clean wellmanaged and provided with excellent signage and announcements in English  Unfortunately it does not cover entire Bangkok

title: Efficient anf fast, but limited reach
review: Best way to get around in Bangkok since roads are usually too much congested Use the trains or water transport if you don't want to waste your holiday on the road BTS is very efficient good frequency neat and fast Only problem is that the line does not reach attractions on the West so you have to change to a bus or cab or boat or walk if you are coming from the Sukhumvit side and want to go to Wat Arun area

title: My way of transport
review: Staying around Sukhumvit the easiest way to go around is walking to the skytrain and hop on it Of course after buying a ticket  For me it is the best way of transport  When I am travelling alone I am tempted to take a moto in order to avoid walking but be careful because the traffic can be "killing"

title: Easy to use
review: Cheap and efficient was crowded but heythere's a lot of people to move  City line cheaper but slower than express line

title: Excellent way to come to Central Bangkok from the Airport
review: First impression is the very helpful staff at the information desk with good English skillsThe Airport Rail Link is quick and comfortable giving access to other underground lines so you can reach destination in whole Bangkok network

title: Handy but avoid peak hours
review: Looking for the quickest and cheapest way into town connect with the MRT (underground) or BTS (skytrain) Then take the Airport Rail Link  Avoid it however with big or many suitcases during rush hour heading towards the airport You won’t find space to get in and there are only 4 trainshour and 5 during rush hour Clearly not enough

title: Give it a pass!
review: If you are looking for some transportation that is slower more inconvenient and more expensive than a taxi just use it especially if you are not traveling alone  Seriously now give it a miss and Grab a cab

title: Must do!
review: Tour was well organised with unique experience of local train ride The guide was attentive and able to tend to various requests Highly recommended

title: Best mode to travel from airport to hotel
review: Strongly recommended to commute from airport to hotel From Airport to Makkasan station it took 25 min and cost 175 bhatt per person  Best mode of travel from airport as bangkok has bad traffic and if u want to catch you flight on time i strongly recommend airport link

title: Train ride on the Death Railway.
review: Known more as the Death Railway in Thailand and more as the ThaiBurma railway to us Aussies it really should be both The part of the line I rode was between Wang Pho and Thakilen Stations travelling over some on the original track layout for the Japanese Army's railway project Both spectacular views and sombre thoughts remembering the barbarism with which the Japanese treated their PoWs

title: Great airport rail link
review: The train brings you right to the middle of the city with only 49baht in 20mins this was so great And I even got free ticket back to the airport on May 5th 2019  Just one word GREAT

title: Quick and cheap
review: Skytrain is frequent  quick and easy to navigate Boarding and exiting is well managed and the cars are clean with limited seating  as standing is the standard Tickets are priced around £1 and are obtained from ticket machines where English instructions can be selected Having baht in coin is essential for use Bizarrely the manned ticket point did not issue tickets but changed notes to coin to facilitate use of the machines Regrettably the concrete structure upon which the Skytrain operates is a real eyesore

title: Great tour
review: Great tour and our guides were excellent I was travelling with elderly relatives (80+ years old) and the guides were extremely helpful

title: Sky Train
review: A quick and painless way of travelling around Bangkok plus inexpensive Air conditioned clean and comfortable  Mike  UK

title: Fast, inexpensive and clean.
review: I recommend travelers to buy a prepay "rabbit card" Makes it easy to enter stations without the need to order tickets at the machines Card can also be used at food courts and Mc Donalds

title: Good Service - had a great experience as foreigner
review: The service is very good on time and very clean I visited in November and explored the city One of the best medium for trousim and travelling in and around the city

title: EASY RIDING
review: The BTS Skytrain is a brilliant way to get around It is safe clean and airconditioned In the Bangkok heat a big plus It's stations are generally in an easily accessible area close to most major attractions and frequently attached to or very close to some of the major shopping malls It is a fast way to get places as you are able to avoid the traffic and runs till quite late at night Tickets are easy to obtain and use Depending on your length of stay you can get a day pass about BHT140 which gives you unlimited travel up till midnight of the day of purchase You could also get a stored value card called a Rabbit card Ideal if you are there for an extended period and intend using the service quite often The day pass works quite well if you are needing to travel quite often and far on a single day  However most fares start at BHT15 per single journey and increase the further away from your starting point that you need to go to So it makes sense if you are going to be doing a few long trips in that day But 2 short trips will cost you less by just buying a ticket  Tickets are available from automated machines at all stations Pick your destination feed in coins and out comes your ticket NOTE there are staff at ticket offices for day passes and rabbit cards and top up but if you need a single ticket you will queue and then all they will do is give coins for the machine So make sure that you have coins for the machine It is a great way to travel around and although it can get crowded it is still an efficient service that will make your visits easier Great way to stay out of the heat and the rain and avoid the city traffic

title: Very comfortable way to get around the city
review: An inexpensive way to get around the city Air con plenty of seats and generally not too busy The only very busy station in my experience is Siam but that is to expected as it is where the main shopping centre is and also is the only station you can change directly on the other bts line By nature of being a sky rail there are a lot of steps to get to and from the stations and platforms There are lifts but not at all stations and not to all platforms however mostly there are My only tip is to make sure you have plenty of change for ticket machines However if you don't there are change offices at all stations too

title: Good transport
review: Fast efficient and cheap way to get into Bangkok from the airport Links up with the rest of the BTS network to get you to where you want to go

title: Beat the heat & get there on time
review: This fantastic commuter system runs like Swiss clockwork & Swiss trains On time Frequent intervals Do yourself a big favor get out of the famously chaotic BKK traffic Beautifully comfortable air con system Mostly elevated providing stunning views Get a day pass for about A$800 & relax for 12 a day taking in the scenery

title: Bts sky train
review: By far the best way to travel anywhere in bangkok super efficientGreat airconditioning great value for money and just so punctual  u never have to wait more than 57 mins for a train changing lines is no problem at all  wud choose it over a taxi or a tuktuk any day

title: Good
review: The BTS sky train met and exceeded my expectations It was very easy to follow and extremely affordable

title: no travel jam and comfortable ride in summer
review: It is June   pretty hot in Bangkok normally  I like to travel by BTS from place to place cos the trains are clean with good airconditioning  You will feel very comfortable once you step inside a train It's also a good way to avoid traffic jam especially if you know your way in Bangkok  Local people are basically very polite to queue on the platform for a train  so it makes a nice experience to take this public transportation just like in Tokyo or Taipei  Whenever in Bangkok I make use of the BTS very often  except going to the airport with lots of luggage and sourvenir

title: Train with Aircon, not an attraction
review: Want to get around Bangkok you have many options I'll list the top five  1 Metered Taxi  if it's busy you pay more   2 Tuk Tuk  more expensive than a taxi Mainly a tourist experience   3 MTS  The underground train It stops it starts it moves Excellent price   4 BTS (Skytrain)  not sure why listed as an attraction as its public transport It goes overground and you get to see the parts of Bangkok it passes which is nice It has aircon (needed that in May) and nonstop running adverts on TV screens The price is very reasonable During peak hours it can be packed with people going to work and then you'll appreciate the aircon even more   5 Motorbike Taxi  having a bad day want to appreciate life again Well catch a motorbike taxi In a short space of time you will appreciate being alive as you experience near death experiences on the back of the bike

title: This is public transportation.
review: Excellent occasionally crowded  Prices are reasonable and the lines are constantly expanding  This is the best way to skip Bangkok traffic jams

title: Very convenient and affordable transportation
review: The train stations are conveniently linked to  major tourist spots and shopping malls  air conditioned and with high frequency I recommend one to get a rabbit card that with stored value if you are going to travel with  the train services everyday  it saves you time to buy the tickets everytime and may save the costs too if you are traveling for long distance from one end to another

title: Lifeline to commute in Bangkok
review: In a city like Bangkok where traffic jams are common BTS sky train is quite helpfulIt is very easy to commute in BTS  neat and clean and most of its stations are at points of interest like shopojng mall etcIt saves a lot of commuting time

title: Take the train!
review: Easy and cheap to take the train to and from the airport Even after my very long journey to get to Thailand from the USA I managed to figure out how to get myself onto the train and into Bangkok

title: Cheap transport to town

title: Easy, clean & cheap
review: My husband & I had just 5 hours in Bangkok as an excursion of free time from our cruise ship Once we’d walked the sky walk from Central World shopping mall and taken a few minutes to study the map we found it easy to get a ticket and find our way around  If you’re in doubt just ask The locals are used to travellers finding their way around and often looking puzzled and are more than happy to help  The Skytrain is clean and cool and we easily got a seat

title: Memorable experience not to be missed!
review: Amazing experience The train ride to the market is very beautiful The experience of being next to the train as it passes is phenomenal The floating market is something that cannot be missed The day was incredible A very special thank you to the guide ALEX GUY he was spectacular in everything professionalism good disposition and contagious energy

title: Very handy

title: Great train
review: Best method of transport to the airport if you are staying near a BTS station 45 baht each way  half an hour to or from airport to BTS station link at Phaya Thai station Cheaper and quicker than taxi and it isn't complicated Just make sure you have cash go to basement floor ay airport Buy a token and go through turnstiles

title: Easy travel
review: When we were doing our research on Bangkok we came across the ARL and after reading enough about it we decided that we can definitely use the ARL as opposed to the taxi service  Yes it is way cheaper than booking a private taxi and that really works especially if you are traveling on a budget It also gave us a first hand experience of Bangkok it's infrastructure systems and people on day one itself  We traveled between the Suvarnabhumi Airport and Makkasan If you know where you want to get off then all you need to do is check the maps which are marked very clearly and in detail  There is no confusion when getting the tokens from the self service machine or looking for which platform you need to be at to board the train in your direction Everything is well laid out  Getting on and off the train is also very convenient as people are more relaxed and follow a proper queue system Most of the passengers were busy with their own thing conversations cell phones etc   It is a great way to look at the city from above and the sights are very attractive I particularly found this entire stretch (sorry do not know the name) that had beautiful homes with red roofs and interspersed with trees Just made me want to get off and stay there So if you can then definitely do this train journey standing and not sitting  The announcements are clear and so there is no chance that you will miss your station People were polite and didn't really catch anybody staring  If you have too much luggage or too many children (who are already getting tired and cranky) then maybe you can skip this and do it another time  The coaches were very clean and well maintained You can look up the detailed information on their website httpwwwsrtetcothen or read more about them at httpsenwikipediaorgwikiAirport_Rail_Link_(Bangkok)

review: It  runs on time and the ticket machines are bilingual which is a great help The announcements in the train are supported by a graphic display so there is little chance of skipping ones station

title: Clean and Efficient but not Extensive Enough
review: I am surprised that this counts as one of the "attractionsthings to do" in Bangkok and even more surprised that it ranks as No 2 (as of June 2017) Since there are so many things to see and do in Bangkok its BTS Skytrain system should not be even in Top 10 I consider it merely as a tool to get around to see the real "sights"  Yes it is clean and efficient However because the cars are narrowbodied (similar to skytrains in Vancouver and several other cities) it can get very crowded in rich hours In addition for a city this populous the two BTS lines are not sufficient Several areas of interest to tourists like Kao San Road Royal Palace and Wat Po cannot be accessed by skytrains or underground metro  Also you can not connect BTS Skytrain directly to underground metro system Even they are next to each other in several locations (such as SilomSala Daeng) people using one cannot transfer to the other seamlessly You need to get out of the station use a new ticket and get into the other one This does cause some inconvenience

title: Would recommend

title: Will definitely be back in thailand and take Ms Sara to be our tour guide again. (Ms. Philippines 😂)

title: Clean service great air conditioning
review: An absolute must use to escape the traffic congestion  The trains are clean and the commuters are disciplined  The platforms are very well kept However washroom facilities in the platforms do not exist Very few of the stations have escalators and sometimes that is a tiring and steep climb especially if one is laden with the ubiquitous shopping bags Not very friendly for wheelchairs  Expect to wait for trains in queues during peak hours particularly in the evenings The frequency is of course excellent during the rush hours so the wait is not really trying You will still do better taking the BTS instead of a taxi if you are not averse to a little walking to your destination Every station has great signage  As one exits the taxis and motortaxis (scootermobike taxis) await you Expect a language barrier though and be prepared to bargain  about 20%  The air conditioning is excellent inside the trains The stations are not airconditioned The Enquiry counters at each station are adept at dispensing the requisite change  A dayticket is 140THBapprox 4USD at the current exchange rate It is valid till the close of their services every night  The train services operate till midnight every night

title: Easy cheap and best way to navigate the city
review: Easy cheap and best way to navigate the city  All staff and other passengers are very helpful  Pleasure to use even for amateurs haha

title: Convenient

review: The BTS Skytrain is the fastest way to move around Bangkok as it connects all most all major parts of the city A route map is very useful before boarding as it will guide you to your destination smoothly It’s safe nice and modern but very crowded most of the time It’s frequently available and reached destinations on time therefore you will not face any problem

title: Easy access
review: access from airport easy to find cheap and direct to main city transport links Ideal if staying in city No drama with luggage as most other passengers same issue

title: The ONLY way to get around Town
review: Bangkok traffic is the worst in the world  What would normally be a quick jaunt takes a ridiculous chunk out of your day because you sit in horrendous traffic conditions  On top of that there is construction going on everywhere so you are constantly being diverted and rerouted  Don't even think about driving on your own here  Of course  there are the tuktuks  But you use them the obligatory few times for the "experience" and then it gets old  Besides the tuktuk drivers charge extortion prices and cost way more than a taxi  and you get a mouthful of carbon dioxide and risk life and limb every few seconds on top of that  The ONLY civilized way to travel about town is using the BTS  It is also the fastest way and normally connects you right to the doorstepentry of where you want to go  The stops are very convenient and so are the connections  They come every few minutes so you are never waiting a long time  The buzz kill is when it gets overly crowded  but just grin and bear it as the stops are frequent the crowd diffuses and then you can get your breathing room back    The best part of the BTS is that it is airconditioned  That in itself is worth the baht for the ride

title: Amazing experience
review: A great day enhanced by our lovely Guide Or and our skillful driver Too  Lots of information shared and we had choices regarding boat ride and either short or long train ride  Nothing was too much trouble for them both to make it a very special day for us  A close friend worked on the Railway and Hellfire Pass was then transported to Japan and thankfully made it back to his family

title: Good safe transport system

title: Bangkok train sleeper to Koh Samui

title: Cheap, Convenient & Efficient
review: Took the airport rail link into the city this time round Reached my hotel destination in under an hour especially during the busy NYE period Trip costed me a mere 100baht to Phaya Thai while BTS to my hotel costed me about 30baht  Was caught in a very nasty BKK grid lock jam in the city which lasted for 6hours the last time I visited Learnt my lesson and took the Rail Link instead   On my return trip I took the cab though as traffic seemed to clear up on the day I was returning Cab ride took me 45mins and costed me 500baht

title: Easy, fast, fixed fare price!!
review: I definitely agree that Airport rail link is the most convenient transportation you can use to get in and out of Suvarnabhumi Airport which is like 20 plus kilometers from Bangkok center Airport rail link Suvarnabhumi station located just inside the terminal super easy to find     Instead of hours traveling in crazy Bangkok traffic Airport rail link allow you to travel back and forth in  less than half an hour Also the fare is fixed depending on the distance travelled          Although Airport rail link doesn't open 247 The operating hour is from early morning 6 am to midnight

title: Great Transit

title: Easy

title: Modern. Clean. Great

title: Fast and cool way of commuting around Bangkok

title: Bangkok's 'Central' Line
review: I am not sure why I am reviewing this but it gives me points and points make prizes Oh no they don't  The SkyTrain used in conjunction with the Metro and the Airport Link is a good cheap service and efficient way of moving around Bangkok Single journeys typically cost 3040 baht (~£070) If you are making more than 4 journeys per day consider getting a day pass (140 baht £3)   If your hotel is near the SkyTrain it is also very easy to get from and to the airport for 45baht (~£090) plus the cost of getting fromto the Phaya Thai stop

title: So easy to get around!

title: Hassle Free
review: Cheap fare ticket going to the airport cool trains and efficient Hassle free that's why I recommend this to tourists

title: Fast link to Airport

title: travel light its good
review: nice and cheap way to the airport if your travel light with one change i often use this for all the shopping malls also

title: Best way to travel
review: Best was to get to chaktuchak market as you get right into it The MRT IS clean efficient fast n smooth and among the smarter ways to get around Bangkok

title: Cheaper and Faster For Lone travellers
review: I have used this several times when travelling by myself If you happen to arrive during peak rush hours this is a good alternative to get to the City You can get off at major points like Sukhumvit and Sathorn if your hotel is located in those areas   At 90 baht per person to Makkasan or Phaya Thai it is cheaper than a taxi of around 300 baht if you are by yourself and only have a small luggage THe only downside is it is still NOT physically connected to the BTS in Makkasan you need to get out of the building cross the railroad tracks I have seen too many tourists get confused as to how to get to the BTS as the Makkasan station is huge and not enough signage

title: East way to mitigate the traffic
review: The ideal way to get around Bangkok is to use the Skytrain or Subway as the trains are regular quick and inexpensive but study the maps first and figure out the most convenient way to reach each destination

title: Great way to see Bangkok
review: The skytrain is cheap and very convenient  Everyone is really helpful and all maps are clear It is very easy to go around most places in Bangkok centre using this train   They are clean safe and very realiable Bangkok in general is not an easy city for wheelchairs or prams only a couple of station have lifts so if you have a baby pram (stroller) be prepare to carry both the kid and the pram up and down the stairs

title: An amazing, historcal site to visit!
review: We visited the Death Railway as part of a day tour in October 2017  The first stop on our tour was the Death Railway Museum and the nighbouring cemetary where hundreds possibly thousands of soldiers POWs who died during the construction of the railway are buried I believe visiting here is a must before going on the train ride or visiting the Bridge Over the River Kwai as then you will know all about the history of the railway before visiting  The train ride itself is breathtaking but also sad and nostalgic The scenery is stunning and you get an appreciation for the unbelieveable environment in which the POWs and workers were forced to to work in to construct the railway  This was a great day tour well worth the price we payed (approximately $85AUD) for the whole day tour

title: Standards Slipping But Convenient

title: An opportunity to reflect

title: Interesting way to travel
review: We booked first class sleeper compartments (for a party of five) for the 13 hour rail journey between Bangkok and Chiang Mai Whilst not like any first class that I had experienced previously all of our party enjoyed the trip After booking the journey in the UK and then looking at YouTube clips I did wonder what I had let my travelling party in for However having prepared for the worst the old fashioned charm was a pleasant surprise The carriages were old but everything worked (the toilets being the main concern) and the staff were helpful  making up our beds and bringing food and refreshments Most importantly we all got some sleep Traveling over night means that you don't see too much but the sights coming out of Bangkok were fascinating and seeing the sun rise just before Chiang Mai was great Glad we did it but also glad to come back on the considerably shorter but less interesting plane journey

title: Moving,Heartbreaking,Inspirational

title: Fast and Decent
review: The BTS is a fast and inexpensive (well expensive by HK standards but cheap for everyone else) way to travel It basically transports you to most of the places you would want to go to and at some stations you can get off and interchange to the MRT It is air conditioned and there are seats available like every other modern train It's a simple way to get around nothing scenic whatsoever  Only downside which can be a major problem is the lack of elevators Most of the time the elevator doors are locked and they cannot be accessed The elevator is also pretty small and can only fit in a baby pram plus five thin people This is a major inconvenience to those with disabilities I was travelling with two toddlers and we ended up carrying the prams up and down the stairs which was very exhausting

title: A Cinch!
review: Riding the BTS was so incredibly cheap and easy Most of the workers speak a decent amount of English and can assist you if you have questions  The ticket machines require coins only which can be obtained from the service window close by The machines do give change so no need to worry about exact  There are plenty of maps to help direct you some even offer helpful hints and tips about each stop (specific sites to visit)  The train itself comes frequently and is very clean English is spoken after the Thai announcements and if you still didn't understand the stop name just look at the TV the next stop will be written at the bottom of the screen  Definitely recommend over tuktuks and taxis Most of the time you'll get to your destination faster on the skytrain even with the stops since traffic is so crazy

review: Living on sukhumvit this really is the only way to get around fast As I been on the skytrain almost daily for the past 3 years now there has been delays no more than twice Can be super crowded at peak hours Just wait for the next train they come within minutes Never have to wait more than 5 10 min even if you don't get on the first train I would recommend everyone to get a "Rabbit" card Pre paid tickets and also work as payment in many shops Will save you time at the station even if you are just here for a few days  Some stations are of course more busy than others Asoke is really crowded at peak hours as it connects to the underground Mrt train But I can't imagine how it used to be too travel the city before it was built Unfortunately the two lines only cover so much of the city Mrt does extend the reach but menu places still require you to take taxi or bus to get to

title: Iconic Bangkok 3/4 Day Trip - Great for Families
review: Well organised not too fastpaced trip visiting 2 of Thailand's iconic attractions  the floating market and the Maeklong Railway market  Minibus pickup from hotel is easy and convenient our guide Victor was helpful and courteous and we headed out to board the train to ride the last few stops to the market itself  Kids can see the Thail countryside rural housing the salt flats and fish farms etc along the way  Coming into the market we see many tourists capturing the scene from the side of the tracks and then we disembark and walk back along the tracks our train has just come in along only now it is barely recognisable as the market has reencroached on the tracks and is in full swing    Plenty of sights sounds and smells to arouse the senses  Grad an ice cold drink and wait for the train to depart the station which is "the show" as all those market stall owners pull back their awnings and goods to allow the disembarking train to pass just inches from our faces  After the train leaves we get the minibus again headed to the floating market  We have a tasty lunch at an outdoor restaurant first then onto the longboats for a paddle around the market area  Buying some fruit or a souvenir from the vendors on other boats is a thrill for the kids too     After a lap of the canals its minibus transfer back to Bangkok and for a few extra Baht the driver can sometimes do drop off back to your hotel   Overall a great relaxed day out covering 3 forms of transport and 2 different market types

title: A sight for the visually impaired - Bangkok BTS Skytrain
review: This experience was over 2 years old Everytime I visit Bangkok use the BTS Skytrain when a less than able person is also a passenger I get a reminder of how excellent the service is  I was with a blind friend and his wife and a few friends about 2 years ago when I first experienced this service  When a less than able person is spotted by BTS staff especially the guards they will take over looking after the welfare of the person despite the presence of a careperson  The help starts with assistance of ticket purchase The guard will help the person up the platform & wait with the person for the train Usually the 1st carriage  The person will be asked final destination When the train arrives the driver will converse with the guard before the guard helps the person to board and where possible find the person a seatBy this time the driver will know which destination the person is going to  The tran driver will wait for the guard to confirm all is well before further progress The guard assures the person all is well & disembarks  At the final destination a guard will be waiting at the same carriage The train driver will wait for confirmation from the guard before closing doors & departing  Help starts as soon as the doors open and ends at the station exit & maybe beyond depending on circumstances  The automatic gates are bypassed This is VVIP treatment  I was recently in Bangkok using the BTS during rush hour and the procedure is unchanged  This must be the most eye opening public service I have had the pleasure to observe  Even Singapore ignores this  Top marks to Thailand  Hope this helps  The train driver will wait for OK from

review: I suggest u to go airport rail link to goes to hotel in sukumvit makkasan and also phaya thai thank you

title: Avoid traffic
review: Go anywhere within minute on a cost effective solution for yourself or entire family without beeing stock in traffice for hours

title: Easy Travel
review: Great and iexpensive way to see the cityclear maps and easy to use

title: Very well-organized, great experience!
review: The tour was very wellorganized Our guide was really helpful professional and nice However it ran so quickly We didn't have time to look around the Railway market at all we just ran through it The Floating market was a much better experience We had time to have lunch look around and do some shopping

title: The 2nd best way to travel through BKK
review: Along with the notorious TukTuk the BTS SkyTrain is the ideal way to travel through Bangkok especially around the Sukhamvit area and its Soi's

title: Clean, fast and reliable
review: A very nice experience Super fast and modern trains that flows over the traffic jammed streets of Bangkok We were impressed by the organised thais that lined up neatly to embark on the train Super smooth

title: A great way to travel
review: We like visiting in Bangkok very mush One thing that make's our holiday a more plesent and comfortable is the airport rail link We tack the train from the airport usualy to the Pratunam area where we usualy like to book the hotels for our holiday The price is very risnable (40 bath for each one from the airport to the Pratunam) and we don' t have to start looking for a taxi driver that will accept tacking us from the airport to the Pratunam erea for a risnable price Once we wanted to try tacking a taxi to our hotel and the taxi driver asked us for 1500 bath and didn't want to make the ride for less than 1000 bath With the Airport rail line train we got to our hotel at a train drive of 25 minuts at the price of 120 bath for 3 pepole and less than 5 minuts wallk We have no traffic lines and we get to the hotel in a very comfretable and easy way Sometimes the train is a bit crowded since many local tai pepol use the Airport Rail linc to get to work and to go back home but it's not so bad and it is still a much nicer suitable and shiper way The Airport Rail linc train start's at 600 o'clock in the morning untill 2300 o' clock It has 8 stops during wich you can see some of Bankok city view sometime we use the Airport Rail linc to go to other places during our stay in Bangkok and we don't use it only to go to the airport

title: Amazing trip
review: What an Amazing day  Both places exceptional in their own way Our tour guide was a legend  Full of info The Railway market was very cool and the train gets very close so listen when they tell you to get behind the red line lol Floating market was nothing I was expecting much betterIt was so big mind blowing how people live there so much to look at and buy its a bit like dodgem cars only on waterheheh  Highly recommend

title: Quick, cheap and easy, love it
review: Look at the title it says it all I can recommend it to everyone Not difficult to figure out how it works

title: Perfect!
review: I love how easy this rail is to access at the airport  What’s worse than trying to grab a taxi or “grab” at an airport especially one you aren’t familiar with  Jumping on this rail alleviated all the stress associated with that  Just blew in the basement of the airport you can access this amazing train and take it right on in to the city  I lucked up and had a hotel just off the line so it was a super easy transition for me

title: Easy
review: Quite liked that it was raised from ground and the station pulled up straight to pedestrian walkways to popular sites such as the big shopping mall  Great that you can buy a one time ticket on the spot for the exact amount that gets you to your location  Not the quickest ride unsure if there are express services but in the heat you don't even care

title: Ease of travel
review: The Airport Rail link is really cheap and good It takes approximately 30 minutes to Phaya Thai station where you can connect to BTS or if you want to connect to MRT  it is linked via Makkasan station Highly recommend

title: Bangkok's Airport Rail Link
review: If you are travelling 'light' the Airport Rail Link is a quick and convenient way of getting to Suvarnabhumi Airport Easiest way is if you are close to the BTS get the Skytrain to Phyathai Stn and change there onto the Airport Link line The fare ONE WAY is 45 Baht There are 6 stops before the Airport You can also catch an EXPRESS service from Makkasan Stn(Fare 35 Baht) The Airport station platform is underground you just take the lift or walkway up to the level you want

title: Wonderful way to get around the city!
review: Fast comfortable and above the traffic What's not to like  Easy to follow signs Much cheaper than taxis

title: Great Metro System!
review: If you neeed to get around Bangkok this is best and most efficient way to do so It is very clean and highly reliable If you are there for more than a day make sure to get the Rabbit care you can purchase at the counters You can just scan in and out with this card and then at the end have them refund if there is any money left on the card

title: Railway experience
review: A real experience travelling on a Thai overnight sleeper train The bed was comfortable and made with fresh sheets food was sold from the restaurant car ( watch out for the unofficial vendors before you leave) We ordered dinner and then breakfast Also offered a wake up cup of tea or coffee Arriving in Chiang Mai just after dawn was lovely Train was 20 years old but clean and personnel were very friendly Booked through 12go and picked up tickets opposite the railway station Easy

title: Useful way to get around
review: Very fast efficient way to get around BK Easy to navigate and a definite improvement on taxi times  Don’t forget the rule to let others off before you board The locals are very polite and will stand for old folk  It’s cheap the machines are in English and take notes

title: It works
review: Got me to and from the airport on a budget ran on schedule and was clean What more can you ask for

title: It's a train...
review: The tickets sound more exciting than they are  rabbitsand the real problem is the lines don't go anywhere near where tourists want to be Other than that it offers pretty much what you want from a train  wheels doors and seats although these are often occupied They are very clean  eating and drinking are prohibited and queuing is very orderly Signs are good too

title: Fastest way to hit the city centre
review: The best way to reach the city if you are travelling solo or with a small group (not too many luggages)

title: Unbelievable
review: Clean airconditioning fast regular cheap easy to navigate What else can you ask for Maps provided in the carriage People are polite entering and exiting This is an amazing system Wish ours was as efficient

title: Cheap, fast, cool
review: It is really cheap compared to other transportation options (around 15 baht for short distance) Also perfect way to avoid the terrible Bangkok traffic jam It comes every 10 minutes (and I think even more in traffic hours) Air conditioned and clean

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: Whether you travel from Suvarnabhumi airport to the city of if you want to travel within the city please use the airport rail link it is much cheaper than taxis More reliable No traffick problems

title: good service, always on time
review: post competitive rival to bts for public transport only it is underground type compare to the latter which is a raise public transport fare wise is almost same like bts whilst the routes is pending on the destination as sometimes it might take longer or shorter

title: Very convenient
review: The BTS was fast & simple to undertake Journeys  Friendly staff & the ever courteous Thai community  They stop at most malls & best to beat the crazy traffic

title: just take half day riding back and forth and watching live
review: it is worth just to take half day riding back and forth and watching live in the trains and on the ground  traffic jams countless people and lot of surprising buildings  life from its best view

title: Easy to use
review: Clean and easy to navigate  Staff working inside the ticket booths and security were quite helpful  Stations are marked in Thai & English  EatingDrinking are not permitted

title: Efficient and Cheap
review: Trains operate every few minutes on the two lines Although they can be crowded its a cheap fast way of getting around Train announcements and signs are in English as well as Thai If you are in Bangkok for more than a day or two it is worth buying a 'rabbit' card to preload with as much as you like rather than having to find coins and queue to buy tickets before each journey

title: Transport from airport to city
review: airport link the speed so slow long waiting time they should increse more trian  for taxi the car very dirty and old

title: Good alternate for Expensive  and cheating TUK TUK
review: It is a very economic and a faster option available in the city we travelled from Nana to Chatuchak market which is very comfortable and faster

title: Quick, on time, easy and affordable
review: Taking the train was quick on time easy and affordable Trains were nice and cool compared to outside and were clean

title: Great to get around
review: This is by far the best way to get around Bangkok Fast and stations all around near touristic areasObviously gets crowded in the morning with people going to work same in the evening Can use machines to get tickets or counters Better than taxis

title: Cheap and quick
review: Better than a taxi Avoids all the traffic congestion on the motorway Might take a couple of changes but its worth it

title: Good to go...
review: but train like train Not really good sights because its a lot of people all the time  Fast way to go somewhere but nothing special and smells not really well there

title: Excellent Museum
review: Worth every one of the 140 baht entrance fee A very moving experience Perhaps from time to time we all need  a  reminder of what our parents grand parents and great grand parents went through on our behalf and this certainly does the trick An absolute must visit if you are in the area

title: Avoid Traffic Jam
review: If you are travelling light eg with only a cabin luggage bag taking the airport rail link into Bangkok city is not only economical but fast especially during peak hours Try to stay in hotels near any BTS station along the Sukhumvit line for easier connection from Phaya Thai station interchange from Airport Rail Link to BTS line The cost from Svarnabhumi Airport to Phaya Thai (last station) is only 40Baht and for another 2530Baht you can reach your hotel along Sukhumvit Road Taking a taxi from the airport would cost anywhere from 300  400 Baht including Highway Tolls and the frustration of getting stuck in traffic along the way

title: very uncomfortable seats, crowded
review: I think the only advantage of this rail link is that you know when you will arrive at the airport which given Bangkok's traffic conditions is great But the walking to and waiting at the stations without airconditioning but with luggage can be very tiresome And the seats in the train are very narrow and super uncomfortable

title: Nice trip, even better when you are in a hurry
review: Sky train is a good solution for cities like Bangkok The journey about the train is good modern staff from the security personnel til those who help tourist are well predisposed

title: Best Way to Get in Town
review: As a resident in Bangkok for the last thirteen (13) years we find the BTS the most convenient way to get around the city We moved to different apartments and condos (5 times) for the last 10 years and proximity to a BTS station is always the first thing to consider No need a car for you to live here provided there is BTS it connects to the MRT (subway) and to the airport link This transport system has been undergoing expansion in different directions some of which are soon to be operational in the next few months Whether it is for shopping or cultural exposure BTS is the fastest way to get to your destination

title: Highly recommend
review: Definitely worth your money if you want to explore the railway market and the floating market Our guide Sarah was incredibly sweet funny and helpful Highly recommend

title: Good reliable public transport
review: Relatively easy to use Travellers can either purchase a single ticket for 34 bht or a daily pass for 140bht Please be aware that most vending machines did not take paper money as they only accepted coins It was however easy to change notes into coins as stations used did have a cashier available to exchange the notes trains are modern and clean and seemed safe Best to avoid peak hours as they become extremely crowded

title: Great way into town
review: Cheap easy and fast way into BK  Definitely quicker and cheaper than a taxi  Easy to pay and a great start to the holiday rather than hours stuck in traffic

title: Fast transport
review: Once you know which side of the track to be on it's so easy to catch  They have a counter there to change your notes into coins    Then you can use their machine to go get your tickets  They have a map of the stations next to ticket machines so you know exactly how much to pay  Click on the price you need insert coins and then grab your ticket  If only going tow next station cost 15 baht two stations 22 baht three stations 28 baht etc  Trains come about every five minutes you don't have to wait long  Its air conditioned and clean   No food or drinks to be consumed on there  So much quicker than a taxi

title: Clean and simple to use
review: The Skytrain is the easiest way to get around Bangkok As the stations are raised over the road the entranceexit is via a stairs from road level Tickets are obtained from ticket machines or ticket offices The machines seem to be the quickest way to pay for fares Some machines take notes and coins but there are usually longer queues for these You can exchange notes for 10 Baht coins at various service windows The cost of the fare is displayed next to the name of your destination station Simply press the corresponding button showing the amount of the fare (25 42 50 etc) feed in the coins and the machine will issue a plastic ticket and any change Bahts coins come in 10 5(definitely) and 1s (I think) The trains are air conditioned but get crowded during morning and evening rush hours I would recommend using the Skytrain around Bangkok where you can If coming from the airport and have minimal luggage then use the Airport Link and change where required Traffic in Bangkok is easily the worst I've experienced  Use the Skytrain to Central Mall (get off at Chit Lom) and follow the signs The Mall covers seven floors with lots of retail banks and food outlets Be warned the prices are high for named brands but you can find every brand under the sun

title: Easy, fast and cheap
review: It is easy to buy tickets from a machine It is cheap and I really prefer to go with sky train because you don't have to fight over prices as you do with taxi and there is no chance of fraud Also you won't get stuck in traffic

title: Quick and easy transportation
review: Between the Skytrain and the river taxi system virtually everything you want to see or do in Bangkok is easily accessible  Fares are reasonable

title: JUST TAKE THE TRAIN......
review: If you want to go to Bangkok downtown areas such as Shukumvit just take the train It is extremly convinient located at the lower level of Suvarnabhumi Airport (BKK) and cost just 35 TBH to the Makasan station from where you can take a 5 min taxi ride to Sukhumvit It take you about 20 min which you will never get by taxi  Just get some TBH exchanged at the arrival level  and by the way its a good idea also to buy yourself a tourist SIM card At the airport they know how to setup your account and internet connection Later on it might be a hassle because the shop will hardly someone speaking English

title: Beats the traffic jams of Bangkok
review: We travelled on the sky rail a number of times and found it to be very clean and easy to get to where you wanted to go  The traffic jams in Bangkok can sometimes have you waiting for hours in a vehicle so sky rail stopped the waiting around  The carts can get quite full at times but I found everyone was polite and always offered elderlypregnant women seats (so nice to see good manners in such a large city)  We were a little aprehensive at first but found the system easy to use We would often catch sky rail to where we were going but if we were returning late at night we usually returned by taxi Toilets at the station were very clean

title: Efficient and Clean Transport
review: pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and efficiency of the metro and trains as well as the well behaved people waiting for passenger to get out before getting in themselves the single tickets is by carrying a coin and gets swallowed on the way out then reused afterwards which avoids any paper consumption  And great addition (and necessary) option which is the very well appreciated Air Conditioning  )

title: Cheap and fast
review: A very cheap fast and convenient way of getting across Bangkok  Worth using you get to see some views of the city whilst you travel  It can tend to be very busy at peak times though as you would expect

title: sky train - the  best way to avoid traffic
review: The sky train was so efficient and cleanquick and easy to use its the best way to get somewhere on time  especially in peak time when you can just sit in traffic and go nowhere

title: Fast and clean
review: We traveled as a family with two young kids on the BTS and found it easy and fast to use  Oddly kids are prioritized on public transport in Thailand so they got offered seats while we had to stand )

title: Take the train
review: The train is the best way to see the town and is the least expensive way to travel  Over head and no traffic or pedestrians to contend with

title: Clean and safe
review: Connects with metro lines You can take sky train from airport to city center  In either line will take you to khan San Road Great for getting around the Siam center Silom and other areas

title: a great way to get around Bangkok
review: its much cheaper than Tuk Tuks and there are lots of stations all over the city  the service is fast and frequent

title: Fast
review: Best way to see all shopping malls Cheaper and faster Very easy to use map presents with station prices Better to buy a card minimum 180 Thai Bht

title: Performance
review: It is very convenient and price is very cheap In view of the heavy traffic in Bangkok this is the most effective and efficient way of transportation However it does not cover some of the places of interest and very congest during the peak hour If you are a tourist or traveling not in a huge group it is strongly recommended to use the BTS

title: Great
review: The skytrain is a great way to get around and also a nice to SEE the city as it is raised up above street level

title: Just the best way to get around Bangkok - get a reloadable card
review: Worth getting a reloadable card and using the skytrain  so convenient and cheap  stops at a number of good shopping malls  sheltered walkways accessed from stations  best avoided at peak times if not used to metro a bit sardineish them

title: 快速方便的快線
review: 從素灣納普機場直接可以坐到市區很快，這次去曼谷搭機場快線乘客不少是通勤上班上課的市民，所以比較容易擁擠，行李太多去機場可能會不方便Write a Review You're almost finished Please update the areas marked in red before submitting – Reviews must be at least 200 charactersWrite a Review You're almost finished Please update the areas marked in red before submitting – Reviews must be at least 200 charactersWrite a Review You're almost finished Please update the areas marked in red before submitting – Reviews must be at least 200 characters

title: Sky train
review: Once you figured out what to pay and where to go (when in doubt just ask the person selling the tickets) it's a very easy to get around Bangkok

title: Airport Link
review: This is very convenient for travelers who don't have much luggage But you need to go to Pratunam to get too  But if this link is extended to more places its very easy

title: Fast cleaning
review: When the train arrives at the airport it is cleaned by gassing out the train The person who is doing this is fully covered with protected clothes and mask Funny enough some other cleaners walk next to that person without protection

title: Excellan transport system
review: We used the sky train on several occasions during our 7 night stay in Bangkok and found it exceptional It is very clean no graffiti well air conditioned and very easy to identify train stops from clear pre warned massaging and signage on the walls some which light up so you know which station is next If only Australia had a system like this if they did I have no doubt more people would use it

title: The best way to get around
review: When coming to Bangkok we always make sure we stay at a hotel close to a BTS station so we can get around easily Traffic is so bad that the BTS is the best way to travel in the city Plus it is cheap and very efficient clean and wonderfully airconditioned always welcome after being in the heat of the city

title: i wonder indonesia have bts too
review: for a big city like Bangkok BTS is the best way to traffic jam  clean very informative  near from all the big shopping mall in Bangkok

title: One of the most transport in Bangkok.
review: MRT in here is very good It is very clean cheap and convenient You can come to everywhere in Bangkok by it

title: Clean efficient but staff can improve
review: Quite efficient traveling with bts in Thailand With heavy tourism in Bangkok They should consider training staff to speak some basic english to help  Very similar to Hong Kongs transit system   Was easy enough to navigate but with luggage Many of the stations elevators are under construction I had to carry two huge luggage down several flights of stairs  Notably Ekkami station has no escalator or elevator at the moment due to construction

title: easy and cheap way around Bangkok
review: This is the best way to get around cheaply in BangkokClean carriagesno food drink allowed reliable announcements in good English easy to read maps You can buy a day ticket like a London travelcard It interconnects with the older underground servicerecommended I have used taxis and I really like the motorbike taxis for the adventure I have used the tuk tuk service too but traffic is heavy all the time so Skytrain is the answer staff are polite and helpful doesnt take long to suss out the rules most stations have a variety of fooddrink places to use good simple cheap travel

title: Amazing Day - Bucket List with great Guide and Company
review: Fantastic tour A real highlight of the trip  The guide and driver were excellent As was the booking process and the app Highly recommend this company and this tour  The Hotel pickup option is a must if you can High quality vehicle and so much easier than trying to get across to the Meeting Point yourself  My only criticism was the trip back where the Driver did not use Google or a live traffic app He kept on making poor decisions for roads and it added 20 minutes to the journey and caused us to be late for checkout

title: Travel
review: Airport Rail Link is very convenient transport or self travelers As for us we took ARL then changed to subway (MRT) then moved to sky train (BTS) There is always traffic jam in Bangkok everyday so it was comfortable and convenient to use train in Bangkok

title: Airport Rail Link
review: A fast and easy transport to leave the airport to town area Everyday at 6pm at the waiting area to board the train Station will play Thailand Nation Song the thai really respect Every thai will stand at attention Normally i will travel from Airport to Pratunam area via this cheap and under 30 min Avoid peak hrs if you are taking non express train

title: Crowded - but easy to use
review: Lines to get ticket and exchange money  Get coins before going to the station allows you to skip one line Often very crowded in the trains  Easy to use and gets you around fast

title: Easy to use!
review: Very easy to understand  We always got a day pass  Sometimes they would fail and they would just get us another or have you go thru a pass thru but no problems

title: A must to get around Bangkok
review: These trains are great to get around Bangkok on  Try and stay at a hotel within 5 minutes walk of a station  Trains are very frequent and airconditioned  If you are staying for a week or more in Bangkok and will be using the BTS skytrain regularly each day then buy a rabbit card  it will save you from lining up to buy tickets each time (costs 450 baht and that includes 100 baht of discounted rides) It has about 15 rides on it to start with you can top it up and it will be valid for 5 years if you are a return visitor  It is only usable on the two BTS lines not the MRT  I think you can also use it on the BRT (rapid transit bus system) but we didn't use this bus

title: Way to beat the horrendous Bangkok traffic
review: Traffic in Bangkok is horrendous like in any major city around the world We decided to use the skytrain to avoid some of it Unfortunately the train does not travel all around the city but you can spare yourself some queuing if you want to visit the Siam ParagonDiscoveryCentral shopping area   Also handy to visit Jim Thompson house and the station Saphan Taksin is next to the pier where you can board a boat for a trip upriver to visit the temples Even if you do not speak any Thai the system is relatively easy to use Maps are visible all over the stations and for each stop you can find written the amount of Thai Bath you must pay to get there You need coins and you can change your banknotes at the cashier (always present next to the entrance) Once you get your ticket do not lose it as you will need it on the way out )  BTW nowadays with taxi meter compulsory travelling by taxi is also good value for money although the train is obviously cheaper

title: Bangkok on foot
review: The most convenient transportation in Bangkok is BTS You can easily access central Bangkok and can link to other interesting sites For tourists day pass will be most practical because you don't have to find coins to buy tickets from vending machine Air con on train can be part of your refreshment during the day

title: Well organised
review: I was impressed with how clean organised and efficient the service was (used it during the weekend) There are clearly marked areas for people to queue to enter the sky train No durian is allowed

title: Best Way to get from the airport into Bangkok
review: Beat the traffic and pay a fraction of what a taxi would cost to get into Bangkok The most you pay is 45Baht less depending on what stop your getting off at compared to 450+ on a taxi To get from the airport to the end of the line it takes 25 minutes which is much faster than a taxi or bus The train can get very busy though along the way so if your getting off before the end make sure your near the doors otherwise you will never get off in time with your suitcases They need to expand the network of the metro and also put on more frequent trains to make it more accessible and a better travelling experience

title: Easy to use
review: Very easy to use to get into Bangkok Roads are so busy its quickest way into the city and the cheapest

title: First time taking train from the airport to the coty
review: 1 The airport rail link is Super convenient The station located on the ground level at the airport 2 It cost us 40bath to the city & about 7 stop from the airport Announcements done in English & THAI 3 While at the train stations at the airport saw they did security swoop & basic cleaning done

title: commute to MBK and Emquartier
review: Nice ride very convinient well maintained trains and reasonably priced fareIt make travelling around easier for foreigners

title: Not senior friendly
review: Great way to avoid the traffic jams but try to make use of the off peak times as the crowds are heavy during office hours Conveniently located in most suberbers

title: days pass...to avoid congested traffic
review: We use the complementary 1 day pass to get around Bangkok is convenient save money and to avoid the queue (the pass is come with Bangkok skytrain route guide map) NB trains always packed not only during peak hours also on weekend

title: Clean and fast
review: It's fast safe and saved to travel by airport Rail link You can buy the ticket automatically at the machine then wait in line for getting into the train The staff was very friendly for all passengers I was impressive by the professional service

title: 1st class,  no hassle
review: If your flying into Bangkok and staying in a hotel on Sukhumvit or Silom area and not to far from a BTS then this is a no brainier fast quick clean very efficient and costs pennies

title: Excellent to get thorough Bangkok
review: Excellent to get through town at high speed and low cost and enjoining the view from above  The shrine of Evran with department stores surrounding it it and the the direct connection to Shangri la a definit plus

title: Public transport at its best
review: Cheap fast safe clean and easy to use  Bangkok can be proud of having such a prime example of airport city center transit facilities   If you are staying somewhere near a train station downtown this is definitely the way to go  It is easy to find hotels near a train station for example there are lots of good hotels (Amari Novotel)  within 10 min walking distance to Ratcha Prarop station Even during the times of road blockades in early 2014I found it safe and reliable to use the airport link

title: Very convenient and well connected
review: Definitely the only way to travel in bangkok at least on weekdays unless you actually LIKE sitting in a traffic jam for hours

title: On time, efficient, straightforward signages in English and Thai
review: Very  good option to consider if you're travelling to a part of town served by the Airport Rail Link Otherwise there are a few interchanges available  at the 3rd last stop and the last stop   The fact that the ARL had specific departure and arrival timings meant that scheduling of trips to and from the airport were very accurate

title: Simple and very efficient travel system.
review: This was a really good value and efficient system for getting around the main tourist attractions in Bangkok

title: Cheap and easy
review: The most convenient and cheap way to go to town from and to the airport and avoid the crazy traffic  Clean train   air conditioned  since it is in service I never used another transportation and never had any trouble with it

title: The easiest way to get around
review: A great way to see lots whilst avoiding the notorious Bangkok traffic  A bit fiddly with having to pay fares in coins at machines and unable to buy day or return travel tickets but not the end of the world

title: An economic way of getting into the city from the airport
review: And it's quiet  It's devoid of loud speakers and televisions unlike all the rest of the trains in Bangkok  Fast and reliable I hope they suss out their escalator situation in Phaya Thai though  Getting down the steps in those crowds with a suitcase is a bit treacherous

title: Bts Skytrain - JJ MARKET
review: Really good Very cheap and easy to get tickets  It is also very helpful if you want to go to JJ market When u get in the station you put coins in the machine and quickly get ur ticket I saw a lot of security as well

title: Bets way to travel through Bangkok
review: Connects almost all the shopping malls in Bangkok Easy to travel They have weekly train cards available for foreign tourists

title: Superb
review: An excellent way to get around Bangkok links all the major centres and shopping plazas no good for disabled to many steps up and down

title: Jump aboard just don't try it during rush hours.
review: If your visit to Bangkok includes mobilizing besides walking you'll need to learn how to ride the BTS  It's simple it's fast and convenient and did I mention over crowded during rush hours  Do you very best to take the train that will get you almost everywhere you want to go  (MRT transfers may be required)

title: The best way travel in BKK
review: I use it often to avoid traffic jam especially rush hour just look for your end route it also connect to MRT(subway) so if you travel around downtown of bangkok this is the best way

title: BTs better than NYC transit!
review: Amazing public transportationbetter than NYC transit Clean reliable and organize for travelers of all ages

title: Efficient
review: Get a train card that use like a touch n goso you don't have to queue up for train ticket every time using trainthe remained money can be refund the train comes very fastbut its usually very pack

title: Efficient way to get from airport to your location
review: Stayed in Pratunam area so had to drop at Ratchaprarop station It is the second last station on the route Journey takes about 2535 minutes Costeffective and timesaving method of transportation

title: Another example of how to do an Underground railway.
review: Here is another example of how to do Mass Transit Systems The whole system is spotlessly clean estate and trains Typical journeys cost 28 THB (£075) short journeys 18 THB (£055) Compare this to the dirty and unreliable London Underground where the minimum charge is £620 Sadiq Khan should visit the Far East and learn how a Underground system should be run

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: Sky train in Bangkok is the best mode of transport Generally there is a traffic jam on main roads and it takes more time but skytrain helps to reach the destination in time and also at afforadable price

title: Makes getting around extremely cheap and easy
review: When in Bangkok use the BTS and MRT whenever you can Traffic is crazy and after 8am it will take you ages to get anywhere using the roads The train system is very easy to navigate your way around   Public transport is so cheap in Bangkok as it is still government subsidised Make the most of it

title: Quick and convenient
review: Skytrain is the best way to travel in Bangkok as it is quick and easy to useThe trains are spotlessly clean airconditioned and run at short intervalsI used Skytrain every day I was in Bangkok and would recommend themEven late at night I felt very safe

title: easy to town
review: i like when i come Bangkok to take the Airport Rail Link for going to hotel i choose my hotel near airport rail link og the BTS if stay at hotel near BTS it is just to change at Phaya Thai price is about 45 bath pr person and more fast than taxa if you stay in centre

title: Clean Cool and Quick
review: Best Transpo besides a River boat in Bangkok You want to steer clear of the traffic jammed streets Do not fear the Sky Train because it works well And it's a Big Bargain when Time = Money And when doesn't it

title: Great guide Toomtoom!
review: ToomToom was an awesome guide She was lots of fun We had some good laughs and she took great care of us  I visited the floating market in 1998 and it was much better back then as the sellers only sold from actual boats Now they have shops along the canal we stop at Not nearly as authentic  The Railway market is a site to experience Loved it Thank you ToomToom

title: Great value
review: This train is a great reliable and fast way to get out of the airport trains run about every 12 min so one is never far away Although limited stops it does connect with both mrt and bts (underground and skytrain networks) so u can get most places easily 1 negative is need different tickets for each rail system and at some stations the lines can be long but if going to be regular user can get prepaid cards that save a lot of time Like all trains in Thailand it is cheap to use and really saves a lot of time compared to taxisbi have put a pic on too of the 3 prepaid cards for the different train systems in Bangkok

title: Quick and Cheap
review: This is the best way into Bangkok Leave the other travellers waiting for a taxi at the airport take the train to Phaya Thai  which is the last stop Easy swap here to many train stops  Either then catch a taxi from Phaya  Thai or the closest station to where you are going Faster  cheaper and more interesting

title: Escaping from trafic jam
review: BTS train is very comfortable because we can escape from the trafic jam The fee is reasonable especially one day pass is useful if you take the train some times Inside the cabin it is realy cool and we must be careful if we are wet

title: Reliable, cheap, clean and easy to understand
review: Best public transport I have ever used  any place in the world Realiable clean very friendly staff security high and very effecient We travelled for 4 days 4 persons a lot of times and the average rate was 150 baths per way

title: Super clean and super easy to use
review: BTS is the best mode of transport to commute in Bangkok Just go to the little office just outside of the gates to get change or buy your ticket  Staff at the BTS stations is very helpful if you have any questions

title: Excellent service
review: Impressed with Airport rail link to Phaya Thai from Airport Runs regularly and air conditioned moving lots of people with good space Trip 45 baht takes about 30 minutes

title: Convenient city transport
review: Accessible and clean I stayed near the chong nonsi bts station I do wish the payment system for bts and the mrt were aligned

title: Easy traveling in Bangkok
