review: The easy and cheap way for fast traveling in Bangkok Very crowded during rush hour but still faster and most comfortable way of traveling Cheaper and easier than Taxi

title: Fastest and Cheapest way to go
review: Unless you're coming in or departing after hours (11pm I think) this is the way to go You avoid the crazy BKK traffic and the cost is a fraction of what a taxi costs It is very easy to locate at the airport It gets you to a BTS station so you can transfer to BTS or take a taxi from there to your final destination

title: Great connection from airport
review: Tried to use less taxis this year and go native so arrived and got this link from BKK to downtown No issues at all with service and all clearly marked and announced stations so hard to go wrong I did get a taxi to Don Muang for some internal flights and it looks like the link is being extended to cover both airports so this will be a great improvement on waiting on a taxi at DM

title: Convenient
review: Cheap Easy to navigate to famous tourism place in bangkok Smart and efficieny system Suitable for low budget traveller

title: Fast and easy
review: The best way to get around Negative  is that we were unable to read the station names or know where we were Luckily we had a friend with us who lived there and without him we would have tried it

title: Great veiws
review: We took a trip out to the end of the line and back on the Sky train and then changed lines and did the same again a great way to see the city from an elevated position

title: Great trip
review: This trip is a must do if you have a free day in Thailand The day was well organised and the tour leader was very knowledgeable

title: Traveling Swiftly Above the Bangkok’s Traffic.
review: BTS has to be for a tourist as well as hundreds of thousands of daily local commuters best friend cause it makes different spotslocation more accesible and fast Make sure to stay near one the next time and familiarize yourself with the system and you will know that Bangkok wouldn’t be the same without it I always make sure that I’m near one each time I’m in the city of Angels

title: Best way to travel
review: The traffic in Bangkok is insane and so if the Skytrain is headed in your direction take it  It is cheap and clean and fast  Can be extremely crowded at times (like sardines) but people are polite and not pushy  As a matter of fact they actually line up to get on and wait until everyone that wants to gets off

title: Bangkok to Padang Besar
review: Great journey on the night train from BKK to Padang Besar where we crossed the border We bought the tickets directy at the train station the same day got 1 lower and upper berth which was 1800 THB for the 2 of us Boarded the17 hour long train which departed on time and almost arrived on time at the thaimalay border We had ordered dinner from the steward that came shortly after boarding ( curry rice set menus for about 120 THB each) but at nearly every stops you have locals getting on board with snacks and food for way cheaper We were served dinnet at the time requested ( 7pm or 8pm)  then got our beds made by the same steward We could fit 2 people on the lower berth and it was very quiet all night Great trip and way cheaper than flying

title: Easiest and fastest
review: To get around the outside of downtown it's the cheapestfastest and easiest  there is so much traffic in bangkok  glad we took this to and from airport

title: Convenient.
review: Caught the Skytrain around Bangkok  Very convenient and quick  We never had more than a few minutes wait  Best to get the the rail map and a few tips from information before embarking  Be sure to make a note of your station name and also the station at the end of your line  We used the ticket counter to purchase tickets but I'm sure once you've unlocked the mysteries of the machines they would be a quicker option

title: Convinced
review: Bangkok traffic is so bad to take taxi  Best to take skytrain  First and easy to get where you want to go Highly recommend

title: The best way to get around Bangkok!
review: This is a brilliant way to get to most of the major sites in Bangkok It connects with the train which travels perpendicular to it so you can easily cover the city  It is spotlessly clean and comfortable with the best aircon to keep you refreshed for you next temple visit

title: Terrific system: inexpensive and easy to use, basically idiot proof
review: I enjoyed using the BTS  It is clean smooth fast and easy to use  There are attendants who speak comprehensible  English (as oppose to my incomprehensible Thai) but additionally there are kiosk w easy to follow menus that allow one to select a destination station and purchase the ticket  Keep a quick step when exiting the gates however they close quickly and pack a bit of a punch if you get caught in one

title: fast airport - city connection
review: Best thing with that is it's fast so you avoid the city traffic It does not bring you right into the city centre though you'll need to connect to another line But it's easy and straightforward to make a transfer It's absolutely the optimum way to get to the city from airport It's not the cheapest though there are some public buses but they'll take ages to get to the city And of course a taxi may be more comfortable it'll also cost you much more and also you may get stuck in traffic

title: Easy and cheap!
review: My experience of the sky train was great It was simple to use and to follow air conditioned and cheap   I went to the weekend markets early in the morning (Sat) and it was very rammed May have been peak time work etc on the way back it wasn't as bad

title: Convenient
review: Absolute convenient and easy to manage travels for first time Bangkok travellers The downside is that most of the exits and entrance to BTS are stairs instead of escalators so if you are taking BTS with your luggage it could cost you a lot of energy

title: Something different and something expected
review: The railway market tour part of the day was a unique  enjoyable and authentic experience Our guide was knowledgeable and helpful throughout The floating market element of the tour was more  like  a performance put on for the tourists with no signs of local Thai people doing their shopping there However overall it is a tour worth doing just for the railway market element and would recommend if you are looking for something a little bit different

title: Reasonable transport
review: A good system for getting around Bangkok A fast and efficient service A Day ticket only costs 140 Baht per person  Good value

title: Conveneint to get around Bangkok
review: Its very convenient and relatively affordable connects to most shopping area Once exit and you are ready to shop and sight seeing

title: Easy to use transportation mode
review: Good connection to many interesting places for a low price Don't get stressed by too many people joining you in one waggon Go to the weekend market with this train

title: Quick transportation in busy Bangkok
review: The skytrain provides the type of transportation that can be expected from cities of this size It is quick easy to buy tickets and airconditioned

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS is clean efficient economical and beautifully airconditioned  Traffic is a nightmare making the much maligned Bangkok taxi impractical for many journeys in the centre (people who criticise then should try Phuket to experience the extortionate "service" provided there)  Tuk tuks are usually a total rip off for tourists and should be boycotted  If you are there for more than a couple of days I would recommend getting a Rabbit Card  It makes life so much easier A word of caution Check the time of the last train for your journey if you are enjoying the nightlife They stop running earlier than you might expect

title: Easy to navigate and use
review: Used the BTS Skytrain to go to the weekend markets Easy to use Can get an all day pass for 140 baht Hope on and off anywhere Train says what the stations are also in English Some trains have the map and the lights showing where you are and what stop you are at Not allowed food or drinks on the train Security will stop you from entering if you do Also random bag checks at entry points Clean no issue with safety at all I was impressed by the glass barrier that you stand behind and opens once safe to get on the train   Very easy and what I thought was safe way to get around the city

title: Convenient
review: We took a train to the airport which was very convenient and cheap as well We enjoyed our last ride to the airport

title: Very efficient, clean, cheap and convenient.
review: Very efficient clean cheap airconditioned regular and convenient Along with the river ferries it is a great way to beat the Bangkok traffic

title: Best way to save money in Bangkok
review: We used Sky train all the time for local travel only in 30 Bhat (local currency you can travel + 40 KM its amazing

title: Fast and save
review: Definitely the fastest and most reliable way to get from the airport to the city center and vice versa It is not cheap but cheaper than a taxi and way more reliable concerning timing

title: Easiest way to get around in BKK
review: BTS Skytrain is very easy to use and also very reliable The cost is very reasonable as well Traffic in Bangkok is very bad and the BTS is the fastest way to get anywhere

title: Very fast
review: The Airport Rail Link is very fast takes less than 20 min from the BKK airport to downtown Bangkok Very cheap way to travel much cheaper than a taxi

title: Robin Tinto loves BTS sky train !
review: On my trip in November I started using the BTS sky train instead of a taxi It’s so easy and with the horrendous traffic in Bangkok it’s so much easier to get from place to place in Bangkok instead of sitting in traffic Really recommend it  Robin Tinto

title: Makes life so much easier
review: This underground system is extremely good clean and efficient Once the new lines are completed then it will be the preferred way of navigating the city (in conjunction with the Skytrain) and have a longer range too

title: Metro at its best
review: While this serves as a good linear city transport connectivity with different areas in the city is not there But with a well planned map metro can be very handy

title: Cheap efficient way of getting around Bangkok
review: We've used the BTS quite a bit to get around Bangkok In comparison to our public transport system at home we've found it to be extremely clean cheap and efficient The sky train is also a good way to see parts of the city

title: Life Saver from Bangkok's Terrible traffic
review: using the mrt to travel could be a life saver for you as bangkok has one of the terrible traffic of the world even though all the drivers are disciplined and it's economical too

title: Easy
review: Used the skytrain a few times and found it very easy and pretty cheap  staff are very friendly and helpful

title: Outstanding
review: Very easy to use we were able to maneuver throughout the city and this was our first time in Bangkok Just a warning you can not eat or drink on the train they will make you place it in a bag The trains are cool and clean

title: Train nAccess to everything
review: The BTS is the only way  to get to Bankoks most marvellous markets  For people staying outside of Siam the MRT can be the easiest way of getting to Chatuchak Market So how does the MRT work The MRT (Metropolitan Rapid Transit) is an underground train service that stretches through 20 km of central Bangkok The service only has one central line but there are also links to the airport The most central and most common of all 18 stops is Silom which is located next to Lumpini Park There are also stops at Petchaburi and Sukhumvit which is next to Asok BTS (Skytrain) station

title: Easy to travel
review: This  BTS transportation in Bangkok is very user friendly clean and not congested The routes to around Bangkok was very easy to located at a fingertip

title: Good for longdistance
review: Use it for long distance trips Best night train in a sleeper It is so much more save than all these unsafe night busses Service facilities is all out of age but much better than night busses

title: excellent to use without having luggage to roll
review: I tried it last year and always look for the map and ask where are you going the bad thing is that they don't have a sliding wall for rolling the bags or a wheelchairthey don't have electric stairs

title: Good option to get around
review: We took the train couple of times to go around but found it to be expensive for short travel However it was still much cheaper than tuktuks

title: Quick Way to get around
review: A very fast and cheap way to get around especially if you arrive during rush hour The train is only 20 minutes from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Payathai Station

title: Need a Common Ticket with the BTS
review: The MRT and BTS are the best ways to get around Bangkok  It is annoying that you can't buy a day pass or ticket good on both  Every time you switch from one to the other to get where you are going you have to stop and get another ticket  Other than that it is excellent

title: Quik and easy
review: Rabbit card so helpfulyou get around we use bts a lot  Thanks is best way to avoid traffic jamand gets you to jjmarket in no time

title: Fastest route ever in Bangkok city
review: You can see how traffic jam is serious in city of Bangkok No reason to not get on BTS rather than taxi when you visit here  Don't forget to bring your coins

title: Very convenient
review: Riding on BTS sky train is a good experience In Bangkok where traffic jam is a norm riding on BTS is one of the good options to go around   It is clean fast and reasonable   All the signs are clear

title: Travel in air conditioned style
review: The Sky Train is often crowded but always cool and clean with highly effective air conditioning There are few lines but brilliant connections from downtown Bangkok to the river for example where you can hop on an express boat to the old city to within a five minute walk of Jim Thompson's house or  or right out to the weekend market A day pass costs about £3 per person The network is well signposted in the Roman Alphabet and easy to navigate

title: Useful
review: It's very useful and near my hotel (just 100m walk from my hotel) Clean I can use it to visit the new airport From Airport RaiLink i can go anywhere i want with BTS and MRT (interchange station)

title: Such A Convenient Way To Get Around The City
review: We found the Skytrain to be so convenient and the staff to be extremely helpful  It is clean and very well marked making it easy to use

title: Skytrain transport in Bangkok
review: You certainly need to pick your times when travelling by skytrain in Bangkok but everybody takes an orderly turn in exiting and entering the train  Very crowded we went to the National Stadium to see The Jim Thompson House and were accosted by the Tuk man who spun us the story that it was closed obviously this is common in Bangkok and of course the driver then takes you to all different establishments trying to sell their wares but we were happy to purchase some hand tailored clothes from a supplier along the way we finally made it to our destination after a few stops along the way but the experience was a good one and a very cheap entertainment

title: Most convenient way to travel
review: It’s the most convenient way to travel around within the city & specially the Airport link rail If you are staying in the centre of the city Do not try and book a taxi from the airport as they are quite expensive & over charged Take the rail link and move to the closest station as the trains are empty and safe too

title: An easy and affordable transport option from the Airport
review: Comfortable fast efficient frequent and very inexpensive Easy to take luggage on and off A great alternative to being stuck in the infamous BKK traffic jams

title: Easy and quick
review: Very easy and quick transport to city from the airport or the viceversa Can connect to BTS Skytrain so it serves good Only downside could be that some of the stations BTS ones do not have the lifts so have to carry luggage yourself

title: Great way to get around the city
review: We would be lost without the sky train Easy to get around and has AIR CONDITIONING  Would buy a day pass as it will be a lot cheaper if you plan to travel around

title: Visit Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is user friendly and reasonably priced  Signage is very good (Thai and English)     It is safe and the cleanest of its kind that I've seen in any city

title: Riding the bts
review: Great way to get around bangkokhowever it is so popular now and they keep extending the stations so when the train gets near to the city it’s already full They need to put on longer trains and run more frequent outside peak hours is best time to use)

title: Artery of bangkok
review: This is the saving grace if you want to travel in bangkok Bangkok is known for its traffic jams and this provides a big relief Very efficient and clean Can get very crowded during office hours

title: Easy to use and affordable.
review: Fastest way to the city for the airport Trains run on schedule Plan your route before you travel and make sure to observe the stops Example Blue Line 21 connects with the airport link But you have to exit the station and go around the corner and then up to the airport link paying a separate fare Also when you buy your token keep it handy at your destination

title: Simple to use
review: It’s just like most of the other subway systems but cheaper Only $15 to travel across Bangkok It’s A better way to get around than the taxis not having to deal with the horrendous traffic jams  I understand there are 3 separate tram systems in Bangkok and for some ridiculous reason they are all separate

title: They urgently need to add at least 2 carriages to the train!
review: Some years ago as it has started it usually was empty or evenings only half full Meanwile despite the cutting the gap between the trains to 15 minutes they are fairly full even on weekends or at the day time In rush hours the trains are really overcrowded There is enough place on the platfrom ov every station to let the train be at least double so long as it now is The railway company urgently needs to increase the amount of carriages in every train to at least 5 better even to 6

title: Great
review: Really easy to use and very cheap You can get around Bangkok  so cheap and easy using this transport system  I recommend it

title: very fast and comfortable
review: it is very comfortable to go around downtown by sky train the train are clean and there are places to sit for elderly and kid

title: Great way to get to and fro
review: The Airport Rail Link is a highly convenient and economical mode of transport  if you are travelling light At Phya Thai BTS when you change from the Airport Rail Link to the Skytrain make sure you use the entry point that gives access to the escalator otherwise you will have to climb with your luggage Ask the BTS staff to guide you to the escalator A lot cheaper and quicker  and more enjoyable  than cabs to get to the city from the airport

title: Great Learning trip
review: I have always been intrigued by the story Despite the numerous times i visited Bangkok i finally decided to visit this place  There is a lot of history meaning and significance to this The story of how PrisonersofWar (POW) World War 2 were taken from Singapore to this place by the Japanese so that weapons and war supplies can be effectively delivered and not destroyed Focus were on POW from America England Holland   Taking the train was a great experience for people who have lived in the modern cities Especially at the most famous station where the train runs beside the mountain out towards the river  There are different sections for the train each costing differently

title: Safe and a good alternative to go to your destination fast.
review: First time to take the BTS train alone and it was a breeze I went to the machine counter to get my token I pressed the English button and instructions were very simple As I passed through the barrier friendly staff were quick to assist Dropped the token by the barrier as I exited Train and station were clean What would normally take me 2030 minutes to same destination riding a car took me 10 minutes Great way to save time and to explore as there were shops I would have not seen otherwise

title: Convenient and very affordable
review: Convenient and very affordable I will definitely use again and again if you go to center of Bangkok you can take this Airport Rail Link first and call taxi later faster and also cheaper

title: Safe, easy, essential
review: If you have ever battled the traffic in Bangkok you know public transport is a must  We used it every day  Saved hours of sitting in traffic and found it clean pleasant and most importantly safe

title: Fast and easy way to see Bangkok.
review: Great way to avoid the traffic and gridlock Trains run regularly but do get busy at rush hour Fares depend on your destination If you're going to be hoping on and off all day then a day pass is probably good value @ 140 baht

title: Easy to use
review: This is a great way to get around the city it is cheap easy to use and quick  The staff are very friendly and helpful  There are maps around the public areas and in the trains also an ap you can download which I thought was really helpful

title: Stress and traffic free way of travelling to and from the airport
review: Highly recommended if you are travelling alone or as a couple preferably with small luggage Tickets can be bought from ticket machines or the ticket office before entering the barrier  If you have heavy luggage you would have to look for a lift I have used it to travel to and from Phayathai Station and change to BTS There are 6 stops on the way and total journey time is about 30 minutes Cost is 45 Baht The carriage can get quite crowded midway because of the stops in between Getting on at the airport or Phayathai means that you are most likely going to get a seat For transfer to BTS you have to go one level down from rail to BTS and it is well signposted it is about a 5 minute walk with luggage from platform to platform

title: Easy to use!
review: Used this heaps during out stay So simple and straightforward Wishing our public transport was that simple

title: Just trains
review: Well we didn't go so far but it is just like a train in any city But it is always fun to see how their train system works

title: Good Rail link and cheap!
review: The rail link from airport to Hotel is very efficient and cheap compare to riding a taxi The only problem is during hot weather connection to mrt is a 5 minutes walk you will experience a few sweat

title: Nice and clean
review: Nice and clean sky train easy to get in and out fast  Busy at normal peak time 😀😀 information in Thai and English

title: Useful link but very busy during peak hours
review: Without this link travelling around the downtown would be unbearable the BTS is frequent and extremely clean but massively busy during working rush hour with long queues to pass through the ticket gates An important thing to remember is that you have all of your 10 Baht coins before going to the station (huge queues for change) or better still buy a Rabbit card and skip the change and ticket machine queues

title: What would Bangkok do without it?
review: It's not fun but it is convenient cheap and brilliantIt synchs well with the water taxi If you knew Bangkok before it was built you would know it plays a huge role in making the city livable

title: Excellent connection between Bangkok and Suvarnabhumi Airport..
review: The Rail link is really good with regular trains and stops along the way arriving at Phaya Thai taking about 20 minutes Trains leave ever 15 minutes so never a long wait

title: Best way to get to malls and neighboring cities
review: The sky train is the best way to get to malls and neighboring cities You avoid the traffic as well there are timings for each train and directions that are self explanatory Stops are announced and is also a safe way to get about Avoid rush hour and crowds

title: good way to travel to airport
review: This ttrain takes very short time Very clean Fast way to get to the airport Ticket also very cheap

title: Day train Bangkok to Chiangmai
review: We wanted to go during the day so we could see the country side  You have to book tickets with seat in advance as no standing allowed  0830 am to 1930 pm  A long old day  We took water and sinks with us and loo paper  However the train did have western as well as Thai style Food and drink was give free on the service it was a bit different but edible   I have to say the staff on the train were fantastic  friendly and helpful  Because after 6 hours are coach lost power and aircon  That wasn’t much fun but we kept going  after 2 hours they managed to fix it  We only arrived 1 hour late in Chiangmai Great views on the way and a nice way to spend the day   Would I do this again in Thailand   Yes for sure

title: The best way to get to and from BKK/Suvarnabhumi airport
review: The Airport Rail Link itself is very good but know that the Express line is closed (or at least it was when we traveled) Also all the Thai Air International passengers who had the option of checking in their luggage at Makassan should know that this facility is not available anymore  The Airport link itself is fantastic and for a solo traveler or even a couple the best way to get to and from BKKSuvarnabhumi airport

title: Cheaper and faster than a cab
review: In cities like Bangkok mass transit systems are the only way to get around If you like sitting in endless traffic jams watching taxi meters ticking up then get a cab If you're like most other people get on the fastairconditioned rail link Oh and did I mention it's $1 each way

title: Cheap and easy to get around in Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is an excellent way of getting around in Bangkok You avoid the traffic and it is easy to use Cheap fast and comfortable Just get a map of all the stations and you are good to go

title: Way to go!!!!
review: This is by far the best way to travel in Bangkok none of the ridiculous traffic jams very clean and fast trains and very frequent

title: Nice experience - clean train running on time
review: The BTS trains are excellent clean trains They do not allow food or drink on board Trains can be congested at peak hours but nicely air conditioned and running on time  For foreigners they can be bit confusing at some places as same track is used for travel in both directions but they have good safety track record  Ticketing and directions are clear and easy Better to use if you do not have luggage or you are travelling off peak time with luggage

title: Mrt cheap and easy to use
review: The MRT is a cheap and easy transport option Easy to use Their are manned ticket booths so you dont have to use machines which we found much easier

title: fantastic quick economical service
review: easily accessed via station next to hotel river ferry drop point Ensure you ask your hotel consierge for train stops and directions of where you want to get off or change platforms for other lines Simple to negotiate once you get the hang of finding the name sign of the LAST stop on the line in each direction you want to go

title: Screw the tuktuks
review: BKK train and tube system is quite good in some parts of town I recommend using the train to get from downtown to the airport because sometimes it is hard to get a metered taxi

title: Robbiebad
review: Quick cheap but way to crowded even with aircon it still gets hot & sweaty because of the volume of people but for reliability quick & cheap to get round Bkk I can't fault it

title: Cheap and quick way to get to and from the hotel!
review: Super cheap and easy way to travel to and from the International Airport Clean air conditioned and convenient

title: Spotless
review: Winding it's way under the busy Bangkok streets this is certainly the 'way to go' if your journey happens to coincide with the location of the stations It's cleanliness is unsurpassed in this city and the journey costs are very reasonable

title: EASY CLEAN AND CHEAP
review: We live in Australia and our transport sucks The BTS Skytrain is so easy and takes you the places you want with no troubles and its cheap And its bloody clean The australian government should learn from these blokes

title: Efficient
review: Cheap and easy way to get around if your destination is near the BTS  Lack of English in some areas and station name announcements are a little difficult to make out but workable if you are on your toes It can fill up pretty fast depending on time of day and where you are so be prepared to stand

title: Best way to get around city
review: \Fastest cheapest coolest (airconditioned) way to get around BKK city  and from mall to mall  much faster than sitting in traffic in taxis

title: Great city transport
review: BTS sky train is convenient clean and well priced  Get coins from teller and use machine to get tickets Fairly simple  If you need assistance just ask any local If they can understand you they will help  Costs about 50 bath to go from one end of city to the other  Highly recommend

title: Fast Inexpensive Link to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Frequent service Relatively fast  No traffic jams here  Inexpensive price  45 Thai Baht from the end of the line at Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi  Links to Other Transport  BTS Station at Phaya Thai and MRT at Makkasan  Fairly good operating hours  6AM to Midnight  Drawback  Seats not as comfortable as the BTS

title: Very efficient
review: The sky train is amazing  It's fully air conditioned and runs completely on time and regular  It's by far the easiest way of getting around at most times of day due to the traffic congestion in Bangkok  All the main bars restaurants and malls etc are near a sky train station with the exception of the old town where the river taxi is king The only down side is the sky train is a coin only system so if you don't have change you can queue for ages to get change for the machine  They won't actually sell you a ticket

title: Limited
review: Usefull but a bit overpriced as you don't have a proper connection throughout the city We prevered to grab a cab especially when with more

title: AC freezing
review: Clean and fast Minus is AC I think +13 so freezing and blowing strong Of course will use again as it's the fastest way to get to destination

title: It WORKS!
review: It is clean safe and on time Basically a transport option that works Just wish that you could buy return tickets from the machines and the ticket system was integrated with Rabbit Card Not complaining just a suggestion )

title: Must do day trip from Bangkok :)
review: We had an absolutely awesome day with Sara and a small group We loved both the stops and Sara was a joyous guide to have with us Thank you so much would highly recommend

title: super easy, super cheap
review: Myself and my fiance used the airport link to get to makkasan station to link up with the MRT line to get us to hua lamphong station where our hotel was located and we were very impressed with how easy cheap and stress free it was At the airport you head all the way to the ground floorbasement use the ticketing machine to purchase a little plastic token and off you go The machines are in english and easy to use its clean and safe the staff are really helpful (opening the disabled access gates for us as i was lugging 2 cases of luggage weighing 20kg each with mewhich i wouldnt advise unless you are fairly fit as its mostly escalators and only the odd lift and its alot of 'upping and downing') its nice and cool which was a great relief to escape the thai heat for a while and you also get a great view of the city (including the traffic you have missed tee hee) as you whizz along It was that easy we also used it to return to the airport after our stay was over

title: Best way to move around
review: With traffic congestion on road a major issue SkyTrain is the best option to move around in Bangkok The clean and airconditioned trains are very comfortable to travel in with the hot and humid weather  in Bangkok

title: Great tour and awesome guide Jum
review: This was an awesome and budget friendly half day excursion to view the Railway and Floating market  Our guide Jum was knowledgeable humorous and kind and made this a truly great experience She had great recommendations all around and if you get her as a guide you will be most fortunate too ) Kudos to her and the operator for this tour ❤️

title: Best way to reach the city
review: Take the Airport Rail Link instead of a taxi It's easy to book cheap and fast and you have perfect connection to the Skytrain for further destinations in the city

title: Great way to move around Bangkok
review: I was surprised at how easy it was to use the BTS Skytrain They have signs in English and is not too pricey I really recommend it if you are going to stay in the city and need to travel around it

title: Very rude and bad customer service
review: I went to their office in front of Bangkok Train station asking for information about travelling towards south Thailand or Malaysia and the employee was very rude and ineffective She proposed to travel by air and when I said I wished to travel by land she looked bored and annoyed I left without getting any support I didn't get her name but it is the one with glasses

title: Easiest and cheapest way to move around Bangkok
review: You cannot travel to all the parts of Bangkok in sky train But atleas the shopping centres and malls in main areas you can cover by travelling in Sky Train to avoid heavy traffics in Bagkok Tickets are quite cheap 25 Baht average

title: Really good transportation system
review: Getting a ticket isn't tough at all You can get to all the big hotels and malls with this in the blink of an eye It's cheap too so it beats going by taxis any day

title: Easy access to get around Bangkok
review: BTS provides easy access to all attractions  Clean and good AC provide a smooth and comfy ride  I took MRT & BTS to get to all the attractions during my visit  System is easy to use

title: Poor Speed..
review: As a business person we like to have fast mode of transport First of all roads are fully blocked with cars And second this skytrain have so many stations Go to slow If they reduce stations and keep only long distance station I beat speed of train can increase and traveling to places like Chatuchak market or Silom from sukhmvit will be easier   Hope in future they make long distance trains which will not stop on small small every station

title: A Great Way To Get Around Bangkok!
review: It's very decent convenient and fast for tourists to get around Bangkok It has easy access to certain places like Erawan Shrine Sheraton Grande Sukhumvit and many many more Though the train has been used for quite some time it is still clean because they strictly prohibit food drinks and littering

title: Great service from the airport to downtown
review: It will conect you with the bts service around bkk good service and accesible You would start from the underground tunnel in the airport bts station would conect around the trip  Anonucer will speak in thai and english

title: Easy, accessible and affordable.
review: Nothing to tell really just and accessible and affordable way to get around specially from the airport and to it

title: worst train service
review: from the airport to town is still OK but from town to airport or anywhere it is a nightmare  too many people and too little trains when they arrive at makkasam they are normally full and cant trust this service to get to the airport

title: Sky Train
review: Very easy to use clean and efficient The machines for tickets only take coins Highly recommend  much better than a taxi or tuktuk during the day

title: Value
review: So convenient they are clean regular and always on time At certain times of the day they are very crowded but being airconditioned I didn't find this a problem

title: Good experience
review: Hassle free travel cleanalbeit a little crowded at timeseasy to follow station announcementsoverall an enjoyable experience

title: Best transportation through Bangkok
review: Exploring a city that you don't know  and a big one like Bangkok  always brings the transportation problem In Bangkok the traffic jam is a big problem and should be taken into account even if you're not traveling on a budget So even though riding a fancy car or taking a cab might not be a financial problem to you sky train is still an important option First of all you have all kind of information in English  so you can help yourself Even the most modest guys in security or other functions can say two of three words of information in English The ticket machine is perfectly understandable and you can find your line and fare easily It will only take coins  but this is not a problem If you don't have coins in the ticket box people will give you change  and you'll buy the ticket in the machine by yourself You should keep the ticket  you'll need it to exit the Skytrain at your final destination In some stations curios only there is only one track foir different trains and they wait one for another It is a simple way to cross the city without traffic The Skytrain only have two lines  and it do not go till the historical part of the city  but evento this is not a problem You can also comute in the Taksin station to the tourists cruise lines in the river and this will take you to all the Wats and attractions in the river bank I'm not sure absoluto elevators  if you have any kind of mobility limitationsyou should check it out first

title: Good Travel
review: Expensive but good  Best part I never knew that there is a station inside chatuchak market The Booking clerk told us )

title: Fast and cheap
review: Compared to taking a taxi into the city the Bangkok Airport rail link is definitely the best option    It's cheap It's fast  It's clean It's convenient  I've taken a taxi before from the airport into the city and was faced with the dreadful Bangkok rush hour traffic    This airport Rail also connects easily to the BTS stations to take us closer to our hotel

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: For all people in general from tourists expats or locals the BTS is pretty much the best way to get around if you need to get anywhere in "central Bangkok"  For practical purposes I'm just defining "central Bangkok" as any area of Bangkok that is subject to gridlocked traffic

title: Easy commuting
review: This was really easy to get tickets and get on and off  Its a shame there are only two lines covering central Bangkok as it would be great if it covered more of the city

title: Works well
review: You can see it’s brand new because everything is clean and working fast Only a few lines so far but they cover quite a lot of Bangkok it’s is however more expensive than the good old MRT Train is air conditioned of course but always check the name on the train since some stations only have one platform but different directions Main transfer station is Siam where you can join the Skywalk and reach most shopping destinations

title: Brilliant to get around
review: The Skytrain is a fast and efficient way to get around the traffic choked city of Bangkok It's super cool air conditioning makes the journey a welcome break from the hot air outside even when the carriages are jam packed For ease and to save queues make sure you buy on of their Rabbit cards

title: Fast, cheap, easy
review: I never had to take a taxi or tuk tuk whole time in Bangkok Between the Skytrain walking and the ferries my husband and I could see everything that we wanted Skytrain was easy to purchase one way fares if you're not sure what to do there is usually someone working behind a window close by and could answer questions if needed When riding the Skytrain make sure you're paying attention to the announcements of which station you are at We almost missed a stop because we got busy talking and the stations are not clearly labeled when you are looking out of the train for a station name

title: Best place to exchange currency
review: Ground floor of Bangkok international airport only 45 baht into central bangkok takes about 40 minutes to BTS station  Only standard train runs there was an express train for 90 baht but it doesn't seem to run anymore  In airport the exchange rate was 488 baht per pound on ground floor opposite the ticket machines there are currency booths best was 5165 baht per pound

title: Generally easy but...
review: This is a good system but check stations carefully to alight and ask for directions if unsure We got off one stop early and it was difficult to get back on the line

title: Great tour with a great guide
review: This is a great tour to take It starts early AM and you don't get back till evening depending on the traffic so be prepared to be gone all day However it's well worth the time spent Start in an Air Conditioned bus then take the train to the rail market and see how the market converts when a train arrivesdeparts  Then go to the floating market Have lunch then head back in the vanbus  Our tour guide "Kiwi" was a great and energetic tour guide and made the tour 3 times better Book this tour you won't regret it

title: Great way into the city without the hassle of expensive taxis
review: Suvarnabumhi airport is crowded have to wait in line to get a taxi  Can be hellish on a hot day  The Airport Rail Link is a great way to get to the BTS Skytrain  Not expensive and very comfortable  Highly recommend

title: Pure pleasure
review: Coming from London it's an absolute pleasure to use this service It's organised has air conditioning and is run professionally and reliably

title: Avoid traffic Jam with this
review: The Airport Rail Link is a good way to avoid Traffic Jam If you are travelling 2 or less it is cheaper to travel via Rail and it is faster without having to get jam

title: Should have travelled by day
review: We took the 2nd class sleeper from Chiang Mai to Bangkok  Ticket booking and collection through 12 Go Asia faultless  Train clean food very good and scenery for 3 hours out of Chiang Mai (until it got dark) was worth seeing  However the sleeper was very uncomfortable  The steward converted the seats to beds at 630pm and we were then confined to bunks until 5am  Curtains around bunks were thin lights on and tracks bumpy so almost impossible to sleep  Wish we had got 850am train from Chiang Mai which would have got us into Bangkok in time for dinner and a good nights sleep

title: Private tour " Death Railway " Heartbreaking History .. a must experience !!
review: We enjoyed the day immensely  Lots of heartbreaking history combined with beauty  the day was wellbalanced with museums sightseeing and  lotsa photo opportunities Our guide was great  good English and very knowledgeable  Well done Tripadvisor

title: Ease and value
review: Great way of travelling around Bangkok with roads getting so busy now Super ac Efficient First rate

title: Perfect
review: BTS Skytrain is an easy affordable and quick way to navigate the city of Bangkok Traffic is awfully congested in this city so Skytrain is the fastest way to get around

title: Fast and on time
review: It took me 20 minutes from Sukhumvit to Suwanaphoom AirportWorked half day but still on time for the flight at 300pm Great

title: its a best in bangkok
review: It is best to transport in Bangkok you will be safe from the traffic jam and you will reach any destination you want to go in Bangkok at a very convenient price

title: So convenient
review: We were staying at the Hyatt Regency hotel so the stop for the sky train was virtually right outside our hotel We used it many times during our seven days in Bangkok We used it both daytime and nighttime and it was never to packed It was lovely and cool as it has air conditioning so that was a bonus It is a really convenient and cheap way to travel Bangkok

title: Convenient, efficient and fun
review: Clean and convenient Such a great way to get around Bangkok  The ride was comfortable and very easy to navigate You should get a week pass if you plan on wandering around thee city  From the city to Chatuchak and beyond

title: quickest and safest way to the city
review: Its very convenient because the station is just below the airport and it will connect you to Phaya Thai (in 30 mins) where it interchanges with Skytrain Express Line i think has trains stopping only at Makkasan and others only Phaya Thai   Regular train or the City line will have 6 stops before reaching Phaya Thai We took the city line because we're getting off at Ratchaprarop We paid THB40 pretty much cheap compared to cabs  The stations are clean and huge you can play hide and seek if you want

title: Great way to get around
review: Our location was by the riverside in Bangkok used this transport to get us downtown and also to the weekend market on the outskirts of the city easy to navigate make sure you get the cards if your travelling a few days rather than the pay per ride clean easy and cheap

title: Cheap but packed
review: It was nice to take the link to Makkasan and then a taxi to our Hotel near Nana BTS station And Luckily we were the beginning of the stops so we got the seats However as we were getting closer to Makkasan we realized people will keep flooding in and barely exit It was hard to shuffle through to get off of Makkasan It is not elderly or handicap friendly and can be tiresome with flights of stairs at the end of stations   Again good to have change When you shop save change

title: Take the train
review: After traveling in India and Sri Lanka this train trip was BLISS We were fortunate that the guy who does the beds etc in our section of train was such a legend His lovely energy contributed to a wonderful experience We packed ourselves a picnic made sure we had a movie to watch and cruised easy on all the twelve hours long Word of caution though I had the top bunk and nearly froze to death The air vent up there is evil I borrowed a minus ten degree down sleeping bag and then managed to sleep It's also bright up there as they do not turn the lights off so it shines in above the curtain SO book bottom bunks if this sounds too much We are traveling as two so prefer to book up and down beds so that we face one another whilst still in chair mode before the bed transformation Just make sure you have your woollies handy and banish the more warm blooded person to the freezer All in all I'm looking forward to the return journey   Ps The station in Bangkok has loads of space to hang around before your train There are plenty of seats and a large floor area where people set out blankets and kind of camp out with all their luggage Very comfy so if you have a lot of time before your train don't worry also a mini shop and food vendors on location Very handy

title: Easy peasy
review: Nothing bad to say about this system Peak hours can be very busy Some of the stations don't have escalators so tricky for people with disabilities

title: The BTS SkyTrain
review: The BTS SkyTrain was the first electric mass transit railway system to commence operations in Thailand  Tourist Information Centers operate daily from 08002000 hrs Passengers can call at 0 2617 7341   or via Help Line phones at the Information Board on the Concourse Level (ticket selling floor) of BTS stations

title: very clean and cheap
review: easy to use faster way to get around Bangkok without sitting in a taxi or tuk tuk in the fumes  if it is busy the queues are long to buy tickets from the vending machines especially when you can only use coins or cash and not a card

title: So easy
review: So easy to use I would recommend a day pass at 140bht if you are going to a lot of different places But the individual trips are well worth the money as well

title: Very convenient way to get around
review: BTS is certainly one of the best way to get around quickly amongst the busy traffic of Bangkok  It was however not so convenient when you have large luggages as only have escalator going up the platform but not for going down  Although the train interval is relatively regular it is however always packed with many people as well

title: Clean and practical
review: I was impressed with the cleanliness of the BTS in Bangkok Just make sure you have an idea of were you need to go because this a big system with many routes There were tons of workers and locals willing to help

title: Trust the Skytrain
review: Armed with a map and determination and some YouTube research we ventured on to the Skytrain There is some written information in English but it was help from fellow passengers that assisted us on our way Australia could learn something from the Skytrain system in terms of elevating above the city traffic and ease of navigation There are simple systems in place to allow for queuing and getting on and off quickly and safely The trains are clean passengers are quiet and courteous  making space for others and giving up seats for others Avoid tuktuks and trust the train

title: Best way to move around
review: The BTS is a great way to move around in Bangkok and to keep cool in the heat The service is very efficient and the trains are extremely clean

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: Buy a day pass and it will allow you to travel on the BTS as much as you like for the day and it is very cheap

title: Easy to use, cheap, and clean
review: Easy system to use not too expensive clean and stations tend to have food Also most stations have bathrooms just need to ask

title: Long que
review: Very crowded during rush hour  Also long que if you don't have prepaid ticket  the service is nice and stations are clean

title: Surprisingly efficient
review: If you wanna avoid traffic jams  taxi touting  This is really a good way to commute in Bangkok   Being not really organized in transportation  This BTS system is surprisingly efficient and fast Spacious and stops at strategic locations  One day pass is highly recommended for tourist who expect to get to many stations  As one way ticket is not really cheap and you need to queue long for coins changing as vending machine do not accept bank notes

title: Limited Destinations
review: Caught the Sky trains to Chatuchak Weekend Market and on the way back from restaurants Videos advertising a plethora of items plays on screens in each carriage Relatively speedy and a good way to avoid Bangkok's inhibitive levels of traffic It is cheaper than a taxi or tuk tuk especially if travelling alone   Tip Catch it if both you and destination are near a BTS station don't go out of your way

title: clean easy fast
review: skytrain is good if the station is ok for where you want to go seems safe and certainly faster than taxis sometimes difficult to get a taxi from the stops

title: Beat the traffic.
review: Excellent speedy and cheap way of getting around Bangkok and missing the traffic jams Trains run regular and are clean well maintained and air conditioned Very busy and crowded at peak times so be prepred to stand and get jostled by tourists with backpacks One big downside is that none of the stationsor trains have toilet facilities

title: Day Train to Chiang Mai
review: Most people elect to take the overnight sleeper to Chiang Mai so my wife and I decided to take the Day train so we could see the countryside  The trip takes 9 or so hours but it is very interesting and allow you to interact with Thai's if you want The train all second class with recliner seats similar but more comfortable that airplane seats  The train stops at numerous stationstowns along the way and they feed and water the passangers as you go alone  Seats are all reserved and I suggest you order on the internet long ahead of time  Our train was full all the way The scenery constantly changes goes through the mountain ranges as well Well worth the trip

title: Great clean, fast, cheap service
review: Super efficenct Easy to use felt very safe was clean & a cheap way of getting tofrom airport First time using it was a doddle If you have any queries there are attendants there to explain how to use ticket machines Get your token go through the gate down to platform & get on next train Switching to other train lines is easy too but if you have lots if luggage this could prove hard as not all have lifts it was a work out with just a small suitcase but if you're not in a rush & can take a breather when needed it's cool

title: Great train system
review: We took the railway just to one end of the system & back its cheap clean & airconditioneduse the detailed maps to help you find your way

title: You can't beat the Airport Rail Link
review: For speed and ease skip the taxi stand and take the rail link  The fare is really reasonably  so inexpensive I have even forgotten what it was  Runs directly from BKK to Phaya Thai where you can connect with the rest of Bangkok

title: Perfect Transport to travel through bangkok
review: It is a very convenient public to take It covers most of the popular district where have big shopping malls good eating places The key point why you have to choose to take it because the road traffic maybe jam usually in Bangkok  So it is a time guarantee you to reach the destination

title: Makes getting around Bangkok easy and affordable
review: Bangkok is a massive city with capital 'M' Traveling across the city in a taxi or tuktuk as a tourist can quickly cost more than it necessarily should therefore the BTS Skytrain is a welcome alternative with departures every few minutes and air conditioned coaches all at relatively low cost Ask at ticket offices (located at every station) if you need any help the friendly staff will help you with change and to operate the machines If you carry a backpack you'll be asked to present it for quick metal detectorinspection so you can feel more easy in big crowds that safety is constantly observed

title: excellent mode of transportation
review: Use the sky train when in Bangkok as the street can be jammed packed for hours on endexcellent value of the money

title: Fun trip from Chiang Mai to Bangkok
review: We took an overnight train from Chiang Mai  Make sure you book your own first class compartment you will be glad you did  No frills with first class but you have your own space bed and privacy  Our train was 3 hours late arriving onto Bangkok

title: Efficiency and speed
review: This is the best way of getting around Bangkok if you need to be somewhere on time By foot is more fun this is most efficient

title: Easy, air-conditioned way to get around
review: A modern clean cool way to get around certain areas of Bangkok and avoid the traffic It's also easily connected to lots of malls (Central Embassy Central Chidlom Amarin Erawan Central World Siam Paragon MBK Siam Centre among many others) so you may not need to go to street level at all Siphon Taksin is a great stop for getting boat trips and Klong tours   All in all it's easy  though as in any city quite crowded at peak hours You can expect people to give you a seat if pregnant elderly or with small children I normally have no problem getting the stroller on but sometimes do need to encourage people to move further down into the carriage

title: Clean, quick and enjoyable!
review: Great way to travel in Bangkok Fast and easy Convenient to get to most of the major malls and tourist attractions

title: Clean, fast & convenient
review: Thank goodness for the SkytrainI can't imagine life in Bangkok wo it  It's clean fast convenient for getting around the central parts of town It does get very crowded during rush hours and it's also usually over airconditioned (it's a good idea to bring a scarf or cardigan)

title: Good transportation for BKK
review: Surprisingly  clean and punctual transportation in such a huge city People are nice and helpful if you ask for advice on how to reach someplace

title: Fast and cheap way to get to airport
review: I definitely recommend taking the airport rail link instead of taxi It’s easy and fast to get to Siam and city center 40 baht per person was a pretty fair price

title: An excellent way of getting around
review: Wow this didnt exist last time l was in bangkok Its very easy to use and cheap Avoid rush hour and check out the day ticket options if you re using it to zip around the city

title: Traveling on the MRT
review: The system is very easy for the tourist to use Signs are clear and it is easy to obtain a card to ride the MRT Personnel are polite and helpful

title: Good and speedy option
review: The bts service is a good and speedy option available for travellers in bangkok but the ticket is on the costlier sideif some has dont time and is in a urry then its the best way to go otherwise i will bus as a mode of transportationits cheap and upto the pointplease everyone get a thai sim in thailand bcoz the wifi wont work without a thai simbettr to buy itAIS is the cheaper onei got this for only 200 baht for 7 days unlimited data at 1 Mbps which has network coverage all over Thailand

title: Perfect way to go to the mall when not using Uber, Tuk, Tuk or taxi.
review: Fast orderly and efficient Straight shot from the W hotel to the SIAM mall This BTS runs along the corridor very conveniently Used this to travel to the Chatuchak Saturday market as well

title: fast clean and easy
review: Comfortable Inexpensive Safe Frequent English marked signed and announced  A view of BKK worth  exploring in it's own right

title: Easy way to get into BKK
review: I have used the Airport link many times  very good service  clean safe and reliable I prefer to use train into bkk rather than bus or taxi because of traffic issues in BKK  having said that if u have a few heavy bags u might find it easier to take a taxi from airport direct to your hotel

title: Clean, resanably priced and efficient
review: Excellent way to travel around Bangkok avoiding the slow moving traffic Two main lines running roughly east to west and north to south Unfortunately BTS doesn’t extend to China quarter and the old town but the river hop on off boats are also very efficient and very cheap

title: best way to explore downtown..
review: Good  1 timely (most of the time) 2 relatively cheap if compared to the other mode of transport (tuktuk taxi) vs the assurance of the travel time (and you don't need to haggle or scammed 3 covers most of the attractions in the downtown or at least left  you to travel short distance to the final destination eg chatuchak market (mor chit station) asiatique (saphan thaksin station) siam shopping area (siam paragon siam square MBK central world central chitlom gaysorn) and many more 4 always have the customer service personnel that ready to assist you 5 a lot of new lines is ongoing construction to provide better coverage all around Bangkok 6 several travel card options available to save your budget eg unlimited day pass  Not so good 1 not all station has the escalatorlift something of a concern for disabled  people with lots of luggage family with small kids 2 current service only covered by 2 lines another 1 new line to nonthaburi is expected to start its service within this year  3 parking space may not available at all station the biggest parking space is at mor chit station  4 if traveling in the evening the air conditioning is very cold

title: Above all the traffic
review: Fast clean and easy to travel around A good network to get to where you want to  The price was reasonable and with the security presence at the stations if fely very safe

title: Always full packed. Bangkok is always crowded.
review: BTS is better to take than car or taxi Its faster though many people especially rush hours It's fun to see place with train You could stop in different station and explore different things

title: clean and easy to follow
review: Tip dont buy a drink and then gp onto platform Its clean and easy to use and very cheap The nearest station to capehouse apartment was Chit Lom

title: Fast, easy and pretty cheap
review: With the BTS Skytrain you can go to certain places very quick It is easy to buy a ticket or a daypass It is not that expensive It can be really crowded in the trains but hey it's Bangkok  Too bad you have seperate daypasses for the BTS and MRTskytrains A combination would be more touristfriendly and even more attractive Also the BTSskytrains don't go to all the places The MRTskytrains also don't go to all the places So in some cases you will probably still need a taxi or tuktuk

title: Quick & easy way to get around
review: We found the BTS great Easy to navigate with signs and instructions in English and pretty cheap  we bought a day pass for 140B each Trains come every couple of minutes and it saves the time and hassle sitting in traffic

title: Fast and easy
review: Fastest and easiest way to get around in Bangkok So easy to use and gets you near the sights in town Buy a dayticket

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is the best way to get around for both locals and tourists  You can cut your travel time to more than half using the skytrain system without fighting with the infamous Bangkok traffic  The skytrain is safe clean and economical without dealing with dishonest cabbies

title: Great service and Clean.
review: It can get very crowded but its a great service to use and very easy to understand the money exchange and the different locations The employee are very helpful

title: Great trip to experience
review: It was a fun trip to try recommend They take you to the market and railway which overall takes a few hours to do and then there’s a lot of travelling to get there

title: Worthy , cheap and better option during pick hours
review: Skytrain in Bangkok are better options when traffic rules on streets Its quickest cheap and good option for travelling The travel routes are explained nicely for tourist in stations as well

title: Fast and efficient transport to the city
review: Traffic jams can be a nightmare in Bangkok hence if there just 23 pax with minimal luggage would recommend using the airport rail link which connects easily with the BTS system Cost for 34 pax combined would be similar to taking the taxi if you need to take a combination of airport rail and BTS Eg we paid 45bath for airport rail ticket to Phaya Thai station and transfer to 22 Baht ticket to Siam BTS station The main advantage would be the time saved

title: Fast transport
review: I've used BTS Skytrain several time when I was in bangkok It's easy to buy the tickets easy timetable to read Everything is also written in English Inside the train all the stops are named in Thai and English Travelling with BTS was very easy

title: safe time and on time on your plan
review: BTS is the best way to travel in Bangkok But you should wait long time if you buy the ticket machine We recommend you to buy the one day  trip card for safe time and don't confuse to use the ticket machine

title: cheap yet will carry you conveniently
review: very cheap i cant believe it well maybe because everything in singapore where im from is expensive spacious sitting arrangement and got big spaces for your luggages too and mostly can bring you to you r destination fast and away from bangkok's super heavy traffic

title: easiest way to travel
review: The Airport Rail Link provides an easy and cheap way to get to and from the BKK airport It connects to the Skytrain which I managed fine despite having a large bag during rush hour

title: So easy to use
review: So easy to use  You go to the sign it shows you where you are where you want to go and the price is listed right next to the stop you want to get off on  Only takes change but you can get it from the info booth really easy Super easy and quick and much better than sitting in traffic

title: Brilliant way to get around Bangkok!
review: Hardly used cabs when we got the hang of the trains etc Easy to use and cost effective Very clean and quick way of getting around BKK

title: Efficient and cheap
review: Like the Sky Train the travel is cheap and runs efficiently with a nice polite queuing system in place We used the Sky Train more than the Metro but single journey tickets were cheap and great to take us to the places not quite reached by the Sky Train  Don’t bother with taxis unless you absolutely have to

title: Not bad online booking but overnight sleeper trains are freezing cold!
review: Generally quite clean Online booking system is functional Train people sell food it's not good Either bring your own or private people will get on the train to sell food it's better Biggest problem overnight AC sleeper trains are FREEZING I had been warned about this and actually brought winter clothing And it wasn't enough Apparently the newer trains are not as cold but be warned (It was also 3 hours late)

title: Only way to to and from airport
review: This is a faster service to and from airport No need to take a taxi and sit in traffic  Very good service from airport to downtown 6 stops takes 30mins 6am to midnight  Very clean

title: It's a bit slow
review: It's a cheap and convenient way to travel to and from airport  But it is quite slow so if you have a plane to catch don't leave your hotel too late  No place to sit during peak hours

title: An efficient and affordable way to get around
review: We were staying close to the Victory Monument so a 10 minute walk and we could go lots of places on this train system Siam was a place we went several times for the shopping but also handy to get to the river for a cruise up to the Royal Palace Obviously popular with locals and tourist alike We learned to avoid peak periods

title: Fast and smooth ride
review: Economic price to reach the city Fast and comfortable ride only 7 stations to reach the city in about 30 mins at 45bhat most importantly avoid the traffic jam

title: Convenient way to/from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Depending on the purpose of your trip to Bangkok finding a hotel near the Airport Rail Link may prove to be one of your better choices On my last visit I stayed at a hotel within 100 yards of the MRT One stop later I was on the ARL to Suvarnabhumi and I didn't have to deal with taxi drivers or the horrendous Bangkok traffic Quick easy efficient

title: Easy to use a real must in clogged Bangkok
review: Very cheap and efficient way to get around It covers most of the "central" areas and does So a lot quicker than the roads Easy English signing and very clean

title: Super handy and fast travel
review: Using the Skytrain is almost mandatory in Bangkok fast and efficiënt way to get around town Really really busy sometimes

title: Best way to travel within Bangkok as traffic got worse
review: Had a tour that started at another sky train station so took the train in rush hour Train very busy but well air conditioning etc so was a please journey for about 25 baht one way

title: Great service with A/C
review: BTS works well Not expensive frequent and has AC in this hot and humid city Drawback  not enough lines yet

title: Speedy method of transport
review: Easy to use if you refer to the map before you travel There are few maps on the stations Easy to buy tickets Great for visiting Sky Walk  Use Chon Nonsi station

title: Great experience
review: It was a Great Tour And Sara was the perfect Guide She is very knowledgable and funny We really enjoyed the trip We not only visited the both markets but also a temple at the way to the trainstation and a sea salt production  We Can really recommend the trip

title: Way to go!
review: We had to have a bit of help on the first trip but then it was no problem at all and we used it everyday Everyone using it was very polite and respectful and it made our stay in Bangkok a pleasure

title: Best mode of transport
review: This is the best mode of transport around town if all the places you want to visit are near the BTS stations Forget the traffic jams with a ride on the BTS

title: Cheap and fast
review: Don't get crazy with taxi  sky train is a fast opportunity to visit the city super clean super safe   EnjoyBangkok

title: convenient way to travel in BKK
review: The BTS trains are relatively new and always clean The same can be said for the stations they are strategically located and some have direct paths connecting to malls (eg Asok Stn to Terminal 21) Ticket machines were easy to use just remember that they don’t accept THB2 coins

title: Train and floating market
review: The trip was great The train ride was 30 minutes and it was an experience to see the vendors and all the people We had time to browse the markets The floating market was so busy A lot of boats It was nice to go down less busy canals I would recommend the experience

title: Good, with exceptions
review: We opted to try the sleeper train to get from Bangkok to Chiangmai rather than flying We booked a firstclass cabin on the #13 train Honestly we were so exhausted that we did not explore the restaurant car or anything else so this review is just based on car #1 that we were on   The bunk beds were not that uncomfortable however be advised that the cabin gets VERY cold even if you turn the AC off Bring warm clothes or be prepared to cuddle My partner and I ended up sleeping the majority of the night together squished onto the bottom bunk because it was so cold   The cabin was equipped with a sink and mirror a little folddown table 2 nightlights and 1 outlet for charging It provided everything we needed to spend the night comfortably They do provide blankets and pillows as well   Although our cabin was nice (and I would definitely recommend the privacy) our trip wasn’t the best as we were right beside the toilets We heard every little sound as well as the sliding door (that sounds airpressured and made a sucking sound) that opened every single time someone needed to use the washroom   At one point I also got up in the middle of the night to use the washroom and the whole ceiling was leaking water as it was raining outside It was quite unpleasant   Not the friendliest staff either but you get the bad with the good I guess anywhere you go   All in all I would recommend this option if you’re not into flying as the accommodations were actually quite comfortable just try not to get stuck in the cabin beside the toilets if you are a light sleeper

title: Best way to travel around the city

title: Nice and Fast

title: Very clean and efficient
review: I must say that I did not see anything gross on the train yay It does get very busy in the afternoonevening We had to wait to trains at 630 at night until we could get on one And they push in like sardines Be prepared to move with the crowds  It took us about 2 trips until we understood how the system works The BTS also has an app or at least a website where you can put in your origin and destination and it will tell you time and costs It was very handy because I didnt know how long it would take to get from point A to B  Also the trains are always moving It will close the doors no matter what so be quick coming in or out So generally this is how it works if you need change during work hours there is usually a person in a booth that will cash bills for you After you get you change go to the vending machine (at least that is what they look like) and see the stop you want to go to  it will have an amount next to the stop and this is the baht that you will be paying and click that number onto the vending machine Once you put the money in a ticket will come out  hold onto the ticket You will now use that ticket and insert it into the revolving door thing The ticket will pop back up  take it Then you will see a sign that has the name of the ending platforms (the end of the tracks) and you will need to go to the appropriate one When you leave you will need that same ticket for the exit revolving door this time the machine keeps the ticket The only difference in this is if you have to use the middle exchange then you will need to get off at the Siam stop and follow the signs for the ending platform for your destination

title: The historic railway remains an important mode of transportation to great places.
review: The Death Railway is an excellent way to get to the Hellfire Pass Memorial Museum (Thai ช่องเขาขาดพิพิธภัณฑ์สถานแห่งความทรงจำ) GPS 14353261 N 98958557 E (14°21'117"N 98°57'308"E) Tambon Tha Sao Amphoe Sai Yok Chang Wat Kanchanaburi 71150 0900  1600 Public transit access Nam Tok Sai Yok Noi Railway Station Saturday and Sunday only 18 kilometres (11 miles) away The special train from Hua Lamphong only stops at Sai Yok for three hours to allow tourists to get to Hellfire Pass to see the Konyu Cutting so taking other trains to Nam Tok to hitch a ride would allow for more time  Another historic place to visit on a day rail trip from Kanchanaburi is Prasat Mueang Sing (Thai เมืองสิงห์ (Pronunciation)) is a historical park in Sai Yok District Kanchanaburi Province Thailand It protects the remains of two Angkor Kingdom temples dating to the 13th and 14th centuries Prasat Mueang Sing กจ4032 Wang Sing Kanchanaburi Province Thailand Location 1403927 N 9924304 E  The Wampo Viaduct (Tham Krasae Bridge) near Wang Po is a trestle bridge that begins at 14°06'038"N 99°10'082"E and continues to 14°06'178"N 99°09'597"E at the Tham Krasae Cave Tham Krasae Bridge and Tham Krasae stations are the two stops on either end of the Wampo Viaduct near Lum Sum Sai Yok District Kanchanaburi  Come on over for the Kanchanaburi Light and Sound Festival State Railways of Thailand takes two Class C56 is a type of 260 steam locomotives to the show These were built by the Japanese Government Railways (JGR) from 1935 to 1939 and later operated by Japanese National Railways (JNR) A total of 164 Class C56 locomotives were built between 1935 and 1939 Locomotives C56 1 to 90 and 161 to 164 were sent to Asian countries occupied by Japan during World War II C 56 17 and C 56 19 are brought up for the show These both have functioning boilers after lengthy renovations They are two of the four remaining operational C56 locomotives in existence C56 44 (SRT 735) is preserved in operating condition and is used daily for excursions on the Ōigawa Railway Japan C56 160 is preserved in operating condition by JR West at Kyoto Railway Museum
