title: Beat the massive trafiic jam!
review: Given the crazy traffic at times in Bangkok especially during peak hours taking the airport rail link is almost a good option For those who would like to use this transport try to opt for your accommodation to be near Asoke BTS Terminal 21 The station is located at this area no need to change train lines as you will be getting on at Sukumvit station which is next to Asoke BTS

title: BTS skytrain is the time saver during anytime of the day
review: BTS connects to most of the markets and areas It is easy to use this and saves lot of time especially if you want to go to busy areas like sukhumvit paladium mall MBK or Terminal 21 etc BTS station are connected directly with these malls so you dont need to cross the road outside

title: Sara was the best. Amazing experience
review: Had an amazing day and Sara was an incredible guide with lots of local knowledge Would definitely recommend Thanks Sara

title: Used once
review: I tried this to try to avoid the traffic  I found the train was very slow to leave  it was over priced and left me in awkward part of the city I needed two more separate MRT plus Skytrain trips to get me to my hotel Also the walk to the MRT was huge  Suggest you take a metered taxi from the departure area  about 200b plus tolls  as it costs the same takes the same time but drops you outside your hotel

title: Great experience
review: This is the best way to get around most places in Bangkok Very cheap and efficient way to travel Highly recommend

title: Comfortable and NO Jams
review: Took the train the first time must say was very comfortable an the intervals have certainly improved It avoids the jams and the hassle of constantly getting ripped off by Taxi Drivers in Bangkok Seems these days thats the norm for the driver to ask for a much higher flat fee and or take you round the mulberry bush to bump up the meter fare Will definitely recommend it The rail link connects to the Sukhumvit BTS line very convenient

title: How it's done
review: Airports are always removed from city centers Bangkok shows how it's done by providing a convenient rail line directly into the city Forget taxis which are going to be slow in Bangkok traffic just hop on the train and ride it to playathai

title: quick and eazy to get to weekend markets
review: we stayed in the pratanum area in bangkok and caught the BTS at Petchburi 18 station and travelled 6 stops to Mo chit where the weekend markets are oposite straight forward and easy Be aware that when buying your ticket at the station as we did twice ( Sat and Sun) that the rules seem to change depending on who mans the ticket office The first time we asked for 2 return tickets from Petchbouri to Mochit return which we were sold and it worked perfect the next day went to the station ticket box asked for the same and were told cant buy return ticket and were given change to go to vending machine on patform to buy tickets which we did but be aware of putting right stations in etc overall very fast way to get around Bangkok train can be crowdedStation stop announcments on train are done in Thai and english

title: Awesome travel!
review: Bangkok is a very busy city with a lot of traffic So some places you want to visit maybe just 10min away by car but because of the traffic can take 40min ( So the sky train is the alternative that is fast  cheap and very accessible  The stations are clearly marked if you know your destination area It is also in air con so its a refreshing ride out of the heat

title: Great way to get in Airport if you have moderate or less luggage.
review: i feel this is the best economical way to reach airport that to without hassle of traffic love the infrastructure

title: Clean, cheap, fast.
review: Clean train clean station frequent easy to find and easy to navigate  I highly recommend buying tokens directly from the agent(s) behind the windows unless you speak Thai though because the machines made no sense they were good at understanding my butchering of the station names too  A ride from the airport to the center of town was ~60 baht but seating is very limited so be prepared to standand it gets full fast so there is no such thing as personal space if you need that you'll need a cab   They have an easy system of scanning your token to go through the turnstile to enter and dropping your token into the slot when leaving through the turnstile

title: BTS
review: The BTS is the prefect choice for getting around in Bangkok It is easy and safe I am lucky that a station is a two minute walk from my hotel   I am mapping out my routes the day before i go because i find myself transferring to other skytrains I also go from the BTS' Nana Line to the River Taxis at  the Saphan Taksan stop on the BTS' Silom Line I transfer from Nana to Silom Line by transferring at the Siam stop It is very easy and the rides are not long   Very reasonable in price I am sure your hotel will have maps available   Enjoy

title: The best way to get to town
review: the rail link is easy to find fast and good connection to other transport price is reasonable and clean I will use it again

title: Wonderful and inexpensive way to have two amazing experiences!
review: Although we missed the 9am sharp departure because our taxi driver took us to the entirely wrong place the company was able to get us a taxi to meet up with the group It was a 1000 Baht ride but another couple shared the cost Tammy our guide was amazing We rode the train through the train market disembarked and were able to also experience the market from the ground We were transported to the floating market where we had lunch and were able to ride in the paddle longboats through the market Just a warning the toilet is 5 Baht to use but toilet paper will cost you an additional 10 Baht We learned to always carry wipes or tissue throughout Thailand because some places didn't provide any options at all They took everyone back to the MBK Center  It's a nice way to spend 6 hours and get two amazing experiences for a great value Highly recommended

title: Not to be trusted to get you there on time!
review: We just visited Bangkok and found out that the train often malfunctions Especially the link to the airport Be aware

title: Easy to use
review: It's quite easy to use and reach a lot of areas Make sure you have change because if you don't you have to line up at the station agents to get change I wish they just issue the ticket rather than giving out change

title: Not during rush hours
review: Early morning 4 congested trains can go pass in front of you no one able to get on the landform of any Absolutely the best otherwise transport in Bangkok to few only stops acrossEach Station attract high skyscrapers condominium at high premiums

title: Efficient system
review: Used it for the second time in five years and highly recommend it since it is often faster than using a taxi in Bangkok's notorious traffic  Signs and announcements are in English and Thai so tourists do not feel confused  Tips for travelers 1 If you are buying daily tickets then the machines require coins (1 5 and 10 baht only) they do not accept currency notes nor credit cards There is a counter at each station where you can exchange notes for 10baht coins 2 I think that tourists have an option of buying a multiuse pass as well but this is not advertised very well at the stations 3 Trains get very crowded during rush hour but this being Thailand people are extremely courteous about waiting for people to exit the train before getting on  4 No problems with odors very clean 5 there are trains that go from the airport to downtown which may be faster than taking a taxi during rush hour 6 Did not see any restrooms in the stations

title: Reliable transport around Bangkok
review: Taxi in Bangkok Forget it They don't want to use meter even they write taxi meter Only from airports and MBK mall they use it So skytrain or MRT is the best choice It is connected to water transport

title: EFFICIENT. CLEAN AND COMFORTABLE
review: Bangkok has public transportation figured out  The subway system is a great way to get around The stations all seem to have escalators up and down unlike the Sky Train The cost is very inexpensive and the trains run at a great frequency

title: Interesting Experience with BTS
review: I enjoyed riding BTS very convenient fast and helpful to go around the city It is easy to get to BTS the instruction to use the BTS also easy I just hope there are lift in each BTS station

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok!
review: Bangkok being what it is you never know if a journey of 3 kms will take 5 minutes or 2 hours the skytrain solved that problem fast clean and efficient only way to travel

title: Donot use this tour. Poorly organized transport only
review: The train part of the tour was ok but the floating market is not really part of the tour but just a minibus to get there Once at the market we paid an extra 150 to get on a boat Our tour guide May  told us this was the only place in the world to buy food directly from the boat and that it was the best option if not interested in shopping So we had our boat organised by our tour guide but the boat only visited a few canalside souvenir stalls and did not go close to even a single food boat vendor So we not only missed out on the floating market experience but also the opportunity to ear lunch and were cornered to visit souvenir stalls instead This was very unpleasant after missing a beautiful hotel buffet breakfast due to early morning departure and not getting back until 200 We complained to the tour guide but she said it was out of their control as the boats are operated by a private company The boat trip was precisely all the scams we were told to avoid picture with little monkeys overpriced souvenirs and no opportunity to buy from the boat vendors  If you want to go to a floating market in Bangkok go to a less touristy one or a company includes a boat not to the market but in the market Otherwise better to just go to a recreated floating market on the ground floor of Icon Siam

title: One of the best
review: This is one of the best public transport systems in the world clean efficient comfortable However it has 2 drawbacks One its spread is very limited and two its pricing is very strange If you are a group of 2 or more a taxi ride will always be far less expensive Of course depending on the time of day and your journey the taxi ride may take for ever But generally speaking taxis are very cheap in Bangkok though of course also very polluting

title: Excellent Option to Commute with Bangkok
review: The MRT is great to get around Bangkok This is mostly underground and has two lines  The only issue is MRT Pass cannot be used on other public transports If a single Pass could be usable across BTS MRT BRT RailLink and Ferries it would be great  You needs bank notes to buy machines from Vending machines or you can get it from counter I would suggest to go for the Pass which you can get for 180 THB 30 THB is the issuing fee and will not be refunded and 50 THB is the deposit If you are going to travel extensively ON MRT (remember MRT does not cover all the major attractions and the pass is not usable on other transports so this may be costly) for 3 days you could go for the 3 day pass which would be cheaper

title: Never Lived Up To Expectations
review: This service has never really lived up to expectations When planned there were two routes The express direct from midtown Bangkok to Suwanabhum Airport and a commuter route stopping 6 or 7 times on the way to the international airport It opened that way but within a year the express service had been curtailed and the rolling stock of the commuter line has not been kept up at all It is still running but is slow and there is not sufficient room for luggage   The stations are elevated and its very very difficult to get a large suitcase up to the train platforms  Sadly this is a service that failed to meet the needs of the Thai citizens or the tourists who travel to Bangkok  You are better off in a taxi even with the horrible traffic in Bangkok But the BTS and underground MRT are both efficient and easy to use

title: Skytrain is fastest way to navigate Bangkok.. sometimes in combination with river boat or taxi
review: Skytrain station was near our hotel & it did help save a lot of travel time in the overcrowded Bangkok Taxi is very cheap but traffic is formidable Skytrain is bit expensive but certainly worth it

title: Easy to use but a rabbit card
review: Easiest way to get around Bangkok my tip buy a rabbit card for frequent use but FYI you will need your passport or drivers license at the cashier window to buy this card Offers multiple use a lot quicker in busier times

title: Very good transport to the most important places of the city.
review: Easy to use it to the main points of the city in the very busy traffic of Bangkok and very reasonable price

title: Best Way to Get to downtown Bangkok
review: Quick efficient only 8 stops to Sukhumvit and inexpensive  Why spend so much for a cab  Take the train  Very comfortable as well

title: Hard to find but worth the effort
review: We arrived at the Airport and wanted to leave our bags at the left luggage area at Hua Lamphong Railway station for the day ( 70 baht each bag and pretty secure for non valuables )  We figured there must be a rail link It is poorly signposted and even with the minimal help from the helpdesk we found it  Take the lift to the second floor it looks like it only goes to a hotel Follow this across the covered walkway to the station Train takes approx 1 hour about the same as a car Private car 1000 baht for 4 persons  Train 5 baht each it takes the same time is incredibly cheap and you meet some real Thai people The breeze through the open windows locals selling food We've arrived in Bangkok

title: Very easy
review: Easy clean safe used it all the time while in Bangkok Never crowded people very nice Very simple to navigate and follow drections

title: Best way to get around BKK. Period.
review: Not much to say that hasn't already been said in these reviews  On a recent trip to BKK I made sure that every Air BNB I booked was strategically located within a 35 min walk to the nearest BTS station If you want to explore BKK I can't recommend this enough as it's easily the quickest cheapest way to do so  The main thing to factor in for travelers that aren't familiar with Bangkok traffic  BKK is notorious for it's daily hourly traffic jams This is why BTS is so convenient so please do not underestimate it The worst thing is planning a vacation like this only to spend hours a day stuck in traffic I learned the first time I came to BKK and suffered through this never again Not with the BTS  Again  explore BKK the right way and use the BTS as much as possible You won't regret it

title: Great Rail System
review: This is a cheap and quick transfer from airport to our hotel near Platinum Fashion Mall  About 40 Baht one way

title: Vacation
review: Easy bring change Long lines but they go quick Faster when there is a lot of traffic You pay the fee associated with the number of your stop

title: EXPERIENCE ON BTS SKYTRAIN
review: Very convenient and to avoid traffic jam Each stop has its own attraction and the signs are easy to follow  You won't go wrong on a BTS Skytrain Highly recommend this transportation to the tourist

title: Skytrain
review: Once  figured out how it works its easy efficient and cost effective but remember you will need LOTS of small change most stations do not use notes only coins in their machines

title: Not disable/ elderly friendly
review: The steps to climb to the station The lift to use is you must summon the guard to activate the lift

title: Easy to get around
review: Although language can be a barrier with Thai people the bangkok BTS system is super easy to understand and use especially for a first time tourist Every sign has english translation written underneath and the ticket system is simple too Also a great mode of transportation to beat the horrible Bangkok traffic

title: if you enjoy full blast advertising that is the place to be
review: even if is the fastest way to move around the city is definitely not much of a pleasure starting with the non existent disability friendly futures and the continous harassment by stupid advertising that you will otherwise happily skip always very crowded

title: Excellent city transport link
review: This is a great city transport link for getting around and seeing the city I would def recommend this over tuk tuks and taxis simple and easy to use and on time

title: Best form of transport
review: Easiest way to travel around the central part of Bangkok  So easy to use and navigate  The biggest plus though is how cheap it is to use

title: Good, but might involve climbing 3-4 stories
review: Good system fast cheap clean and no long waits BUT at some stops you have to climb 34 stories so it's not great for seniors It pays to look for an escalator even though not all stops have them The taxis are so cheap that I've taken to using them in Bkk largely because of the climbing

title: Average trip Bangkok to Chiang May
review: The day train from BKK to CM is a relatively long journey (11+ hours) in a small train (4 wagons and u can’t move between them you are trapped in your wagon) that is pretty uncomfortable and not too clean It was a mediocre experience and I can’t help thinking of the qualities the Ho Chi Minh  Hanoi trip offered in a similar old train set  Next time it will be the night train that is supposed to be of another standard

title: Great day with Sarah!
review: Sarah is the best tour guide always smiling and entertaining us with curious things about Thailand and the markets we visited during the trip

title: Clean, Convenient, and Air Conditioned
review: When Bangkok traffic can be daunting the BTS is a great way to get around Besides high traffic times when commuters pack the trains full the BTS is the very best way to get around the city The trains are always clean as food is not allowed and travelers respect that no food or trash is allowed on the train Trains are also air conditioned so they provide a nice break from the city heat

title: Quick and conveniant
review: Tickets are issued only by automatic machines but there is always a counter close by to change your paper money to coins

title: Caught from the airport to the city
review: Great train service Cheap good and air conditioned Not much more to ask for really  Much better than fighting through city traffic in a car

title: Informative and fun!
review: This tour was an excellent way to observe another way of living It was fun and informative Our tour guide Mr Tee offered lots of information and was attentive to our needs Be prepared for the crowd and the heat That’s just the way of the city Include this experience in your travels

title: Great safe, clean and easy to connect to most places in Thailand!
review: It was absolutely fantastic no need of taxis anymore just use the cheap convenient transportation

title: Excellent Public Transportation
review: They MRT was a great way to move around BKK  The traffic in BKK is terrible and the MRT is easy to navigate and very cheap  Once you learn your way around it is a great system to use

title: Great choice from airport-city
review: I think this is the best way to go to the airport (Suvanabhumi) because you don't have to be stuck in the traffic or meet a bad taxi drivers and you know it's pretty far from city center to suvarnabhumi airport so I would recommend travellers to take a train from phyathai bts (it's connected to airport rail link) and go to the airport but one thing I don't really like is the train is quite slow if compare to the bts or mrt but it's the only train to airport anyway

title: Impressive
review: I've been to many metroplotis using MRTBTS system but I was still fascinated by the one operated in Bangkok very easy to use clean puntual and inexpensive If you're tourist and plan to travel to many places I suggest buying oneday ticket (140 baht) I will help you save lots of money

title: super convenient!
review: we used the BTS wherever we go during our stay in Bangkok very fast and clean but they don't have many escalators so be aware of lots of steps climbing

title: Easy and trustable
review: MRT stations are beautifully decorated especially new stations  from MRT Hualumphong to MRT Thapra It passes chinatown at Watmangkorn temple station MRT is the new choice to access central of Bangkok  Grand palace and Tha chang pier It's trustable and stricted transportation price Now it hasn't fully operated just opened between 10am to 4pm only After it has grand opening on September 2019 don't worried with cheated taxi fare anymore

title: Efficient but need to be more age friendly!
review: I couldn't deny this is among the best LRT I have traveled But I didn't see many old commuters using Me and my wife were over 60s and we were among the oldest commuters each time we boarded the train I think the main problem was the stairs It will be an added convenience to all if there can be more escalators or lifts just like the MRT

title: Fun to ride
review: Easy access to airport  However some station don't have elevator  Beware  Express train takes every 20 minutes from one place to BKK airport Check map first

title: In Bangkok Can't live without it
review: Quick efficient cheap aircon travel to most parts of business and holiday places and save hours sitting in smelly slow taxis stuck in massive traffic jams especially when it rains Essential to have a transit card to avoid long queues for tickets during rush hours

title: A fast, clean & air conditioned way to travel
review: This is by far the fastest way to travel It is clean & air conditioned (a BIG plus in tropical Bangkok) During rush hour it is often FULL  but the next train will be along in 10 minutes (but it also be full)

title: Easy and cheap to use
review: We had a guide the first day we got to Bangkok so she showed us how to use the Bangkok train system Easy to use once you know how to Just keep lots of coins so you avoid the long wait in lines to get change at times especially around peak times

title: 20 mins from plane to city centre
review: best way to get from plane to city another fantastic part of Bangkoks great transport network 80BHT one way if only it went into siam instead of changing trains

title: Victim of their own success
review: The skytrain is the most convenient mean of transport to move quickly in Bangkok and escape the nightmarish traffic jams But during the last years the skytrain gets overcrowded as well during busy hours and you will feel like a sardine in a can

title: Fast And Efficient
review: The Airport Rail Link connects  Suvarnabhumi Airport  with downtown Bangkok terminating at Payathai station where it connects with the BTS skytrain Previous station connects with the Bangkok Metro  Trains run in each direction about every 20 minutes and the journey takes less than one hour Trains are spacious and fares are extremely low

title: I wish Manila had this.
review: Bangkok has a super efficient city rail system It is fast and economical I wish manila's rail system was more like this

title: Brilliant service. Fast & frequent
review: It's the best way to get around the roads are heavily congested BTS cheap & efficient Highly recommended

title: Great!
review: it was great very fun experience Sara was amazing She was super sweet and funny 10 out of 10

title: Good service
review: We got very very good service from my birthday date by KTong KTae and KNut And great with very fresh food and good taste  Perfect

title: Really good transport system
review: We used a lot the Skytrain and it is really good with air conditioner and clean Also the workers in the skytrain helped us a lot with the stations and to buy the tickets The only problem is that the Skytrain is just in a part of the city the other area close to the palaces doesn't has so you have to go by a taxi bus or walking

title: Easy and cheap
review: So easy to get around You can buy an all day pass that lasts til midnight for 120 Great if your gettting on and off a number of times Saves all the hassle

title: easy ride
review: the map is always on each station direction is easy to follow with reasonable price instead you wasting time bargain for tuktuk Its an easy ride to go one to another place around Bangkok

title: Very convinient if you want to go quikly in town
review: I have used the airport rail Link a few times & must say It is easy fast & sheap transport to go in town with easy connections to the skytrain & métro I will useit again next time The only small problem do not carry a big luggage

title: Small part is great the rest not so much
review: We rode the train from Nam Tok to Kanchanaburi you see some interesting Countryside as you go by and going over the viaduct is cool with some beautiful scenery Cossing over the bridge over the River Kwai is not that big a deal more of a been there done that sort of thing Saying all that it is still a good way to return from Nam Took

title: Clean & Cool
review: The Skytrain is only about 12 yrs old and still very clean The floors and seats are very clean and new looking It is hard to believe the skytrain is already 12 yrs old They pump the air conditioning so it is very cool very refreshing coming from the heat Easy to use and navigate around town I would highly recommend using itespecially with Bangkok traffic

title: Sky Train is amazing
review: Great cheap and efficient way to get to and from the airport Very impressed  You can use connecting lines to get to a lot of other locations in Bangkok

title: Great transport
review: The BTS skytrain is a great form of transport for getting around Bangkok It's clean and modern and runs very smoothly  Even at busy times when it's full it's not uncomfortable and as with the MTR (metro) it's very well organised  Perhaps if anything it could do with being expanded to cover more parts of the city

title: Easy to navigate
review: Sky train is very easy to navigate Staff at the counter will help and assist you with purchasing the correct ticket for your travel needs

title: Great way to travel
review: Great way to get around the city as the traffic is hectic to say the least Clear regular service with clear directions Worth it

title: Deteriorating service
review: One of obvious choices for moving around central Bangkok but unfortunately service is deteriorating Trains are late many delays recently (up to hours when system went bust recently) capacity is not adjusted to continuous increase in demand Prepare yourself for a long journey often squeezed like a sardine in a can

title: Easy, reliable and reasonably priced
review: If your hotel is close to a Skytrain station it could be the best way to get around  It links with the river ferry terminals if you're heading to the Grand Palace Chinatown or Khao San Road areas  If there is a group of you a taxi might be a cheaper option as BKK taxis are reliable airconditioned and cheap  Although the Skytrain links with the airport link think twice if you have a lot of of bags as the "connections" at Makkasan and Phaya Thai involve walking quite far  If it's raining forget getting off at Makkasan as you'll get soaked walking to the Skytrain and finding a taxi at Makkasan is often very difficult and involves a long long wait

title: Handy
review: Cheap fast and most importantly air conditioned Booths to buy tickets are easy to use and manned counters are also available if the booths have a queue Signs are clear and easy to read pedestrian traffic seems to flow well stops are all over the city I mainly used the skytrain to get the the chatuchak weekend market

title: Easy to use and very cost efficient!
review: The trains are great They come very frequently and are a fraction of the cost of a taxi plus get you where you want to go much faster than driving

title: Every 15-30 minutes
review: I've been on the Makasan train a few times now and they come every 1530 minutes If you misstime you are stuck waiting for some time And may as well get a taxi direct to the airport So only use this service if your timings align well It's nicely air conditioned (on the chilly side) and never busy so very leisurely and no stress about getting stuck in traffic

title: Cheap
review: 1* iT is fine and cheap  2* You can't buy a ticket with credit  debiut Card  3 Pity that's that IT didn't continuo to center

title: Easy way to travel!
review: Great to use the BTS to avoid the heavy traffic in bangkok You will need your passport to get a rabbit card which i dont really like because i hate carrying my passport around but luckily you only need to show the passport to get the card and not to fill it later

title: Good
review: A Good timetable and clean Helpful staff and easy to get THE tickets

title: Great way to travel
review: The airport link is both a great way to get from downtown Bangkok to the airport it is also an ideal way to travel to the outer areas of Bangkok such as Latkrabang  Big thumbs up Comfortable easy affordable

title: Not sure why the skytrain is written as an attraction.
review: Skytrain is always a nice way to get around in any city you are in but it doesnt really get you to the old townKhao San easily

title: Easy Way to get around
review: Easy way to get around low cost And now there is skywalk so it's easy and with direct access to shopping malls and hotels  Save the taxi and skip the long waiting in street level

title: Huge Time Saver
review: The BRS is fastefficient and easy to use With the very heavy traffic in Bangkok (especially Friday afternoons and evenings) it can save one a lot of time It is much more pleasant then sitting in traffic for two hours without going anyplace

title: Convenient and fast.
review: I usually use MRT service for transportation It is fast and convenient There will be crowded during rush hours though However MRT is still my first choice   Bangkok MRT is very clean and wellmaintained If you have an MRT card it will be much easier

title: Fast and efficient
review: Fast and efficient Not like Singapore's joke they call MRT  Great strong air con Clean and very comfortable Great way to move around Bangkok

title: The only way to travel around Bangkok
review: We used this every single day to whizz around Bangkok We did try out the taxi's and tuk yuk which were fun but we found the Skytrain to be Cheap Quick easy clean with AIRCON YAAAAY

title: Easy!
review: You have to see on the board how much it is costing to the station where you want to go Then you put your coins to the machine If you don´t have coins you can change them on a counter You can´t by ticket from the counter

title: Affordable ride but where is express train?
review: The ride from downtown Bangkok (mukkasan station) to the airport only take about 30 minutes and only cost about $1 However if you are looking for express train you will be very disappointed as it only has 1 express train every hour now I believe

title: Skytrain
review: We stayed at the Sofitel Bangkok Sukhumvit and used the skytrain a couple of times to get to the shopping centres and found it very reasonably priced and convenient  Beats catching the tuktuk andor the taxis as the traffic can get atrociously bad at times

title: Fastest way to get anywhere in Bangkok
review: Great price comfortable and frequent  Wish the system was longer  there are very few subway lines in Bangkok  Bring your walking shoes

title: Convenient but certain stops/stations can been quite crowded
review: The BTS is a convenient transportation to move around One could either purchase a rabbit card which you could top up once credit is low or just get single ticket to your preferred destination  My husband and I experienced using the BTS and stations that we hop in and out were namely Ploenchit Childom and Siam Siam station was the busiest among the three stations as it is the crossplatform interchange station for the BTS Skytrain in Pathum Wan District Ie the Suhkumvit line and Silom line  an interchangeable station to the

title: Excellent public transportation
review: I used to use BTS every day I lived in Bangkok for the better part of eight years BTS was the quickest and cheapest way to get around town and avoid rush hour traffic Getting a seat can sometimes be a problem but you have to persevere and keep your eyes open and you will get a place at least for part of your trip As an older man however I found young people most often unwilling to give their seats to an elderly passenger especially if they are Caucasian

title: Efficient MRT
review: Excellent service always another train coming along without a long wait at allcould ask for better service

title: Wonderful mode of transportation
review: Traffic in the city was avoided The trains are air conditioned Well behaved passengers  Hope to have the same in Manila

title: Impressed!!!
review: "Easy to understand" train line & we used BTS throughout our trip in Bangkok to reach our destination Train reached punctually so we were confident that we would reach our destination within our planning time If one thing to improve would be the costumer service at the counter Please be more friendly to foreigners

title: Great way to travel around but not during busy hour!
review: Pros BTS Skytrain is a great way to travel Bangkok hotel (intercontinental holiday inn and more) shopping destination (chatucak market siam paragon platinum and more) and tourist spot (aquarium at siam paragon and more) It's cheap fast and clean  Cons However it's not recommend to travel during busy hour since there are so many people there while the station is pretty small You can purchase the ticket at automatic ticket machine but you need to have coin (you can't pay with paper money change at automatic ticket machine) You can pay with big change or with paper money only at ticket counter Beware most place only have 2 counters open so you need to prepare a Long queue during traffic hour  Using BTS Skytrain can be a problem for people using wheels chair or small kids with baby stroller since some of the station not providing any lifts and escalators They only give access by stairs at those station

title: So easy
review: The BTS system was so easy to figure out for a foreigner traveling alone Really well organized and labeled stops Only two trainstracks and they intersect at just one spot so it's super simple to navigate And blissfully air conditioned

title: Convineant was to Travel
review: An excellent way to travel around the city Easy cheap and very very clean There is a BTS station where you need Surprised to get free rides on Christmas day

title: Easy to get around
review: Easy and cheap to get around Bangkok Felt safe to use Can get real crowded during rush hours We had BTS station right next to our hotel so used it pretty much everyday

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The Bangkok Skytrain is clean easy to use and inexpensive  It will take you to within walking distance of almost all Bangkok attractions

title: Timming is key.
review: BTS has been a great way to travel around Greater Bangkok It is very well priced and much more convenient than private car The only down side can be peak hour  Clean friendly and safe

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: Brilliant for getting around Bangkok quickly cheaply and cool Easy to work out and takes you to a number of attractions

title: BTS is the only way to travel in BKK.
review: BKK traffic is a bummer and extremely unpredictable The place maybe a 10mins walk but will take you 45mins by car My friend took 315hrs from her hotel to airport and missed her flight  ONLY WAY TO TRAVEL IN BKK IS BT BTS We were two families with 3 young children but the BTS convenient and fastest way round Access to most big malls

title: Quick simple and easy to use

title: Beware of hidden costs for food
review: We took the night train first class from Bangkok to Chiang Mai  We had booked our ticket in advance and waited for a while in the very hot station There was a food court and some vendor stands and we availed ourselves of sticky rice and ice cream We should have eaten our dinner there as the food looked good and was a good price We got on our car and the porter immediately brought us 2 orange drinks and a plate of fruit and set them down We thought it was part of the package  WRONG We found out at the end of our journey it was an extra 400 baht The toilet smelled awful at the beginning of the trip and by the next morning was really bad  The dinner we ordered was bland and the the next morning breakfast was equally poor They give you a tiny cup of coffee or tea and if  you want a refill it is another charge People around us were quite noisy and the sounds carry through the vent system The compartment was extremely cold and we needed to sleep in jackets We left at 615 and arrived an hour late at 815  Would not do this again

title: The Sky Train......It's the only way around
review: I must admit I remember Sukhumvit when there wasn't a BTS system or even the MRT  But having gone through the years of build the Sky Train is s God send  Unfortunately it's popularity has grown so the morning and  early evening trains are so packed with workers you sometimes can't get on and have to wait for the next one  However the trains are coming every 7 minutes so it's not too bad They are air conditioned and if your lucky to get a seat not too bad comfort wise  Travel time is quick and heading to  from the airport isn't too bad although you do need to change trains in most cases  Chatuchak market is also now easy to get to as are most other tourist areas in inner Bangkok  The current Government is expanding the system which is great but if only they can add another carriage to ease congestion in the morning and evening peak times  Anyhow you'll soon discover it's the best way to move around

title: Good mode of public transportation
review: I always take the MRT or bangkok metro to Chinatown (Hua Lamphong station) Terminal 21 (Sukhumvit station) Chatuchak or JJ market (Kampheng Phet station) whenever I visit Bangkok as it is fast reliable and convenient No more tuk tuk or meteredtaxi bringing you to Diamond Factory before reaching your destination or overcharging you when the shopping mall is near closing time   However during my visit last week I was disappointed with MRT unlike BTS as it is no longer protourism by stopping to sell the day pass So be prepared to buy the top  up MRT card for THB18000 with THB10000 value THB5000 refundable deposit and THB3000 nonrefundable card fee The validity of the card is two years No rebate or discount for using the card at all if you are an adult For school children also same price but enjoy a 10% discount on the fare

title: Efficient and convenient
review: A welcome addition to the system and very attractive if you plan a hotel along the stops do some homework on the website on timings location etc It was possible to take a late night 2250 flight into BKK catch the last train (2337 on the city multistop line not the express) and check into our hotel just after midnight A direct escalator or lift would have been better than having to walk round to get to street level but is a minor peeve For Dec 2012 this month promotional 20 Baht train ticket to any station so outbound to the airport was ridiculously cheap We did not try the City terminal airport checkin (at Makkassan) which would have allowed more shopping time The ride itself is like what we expect from most modern transit (but just a notch less luxurious than say Hong Kong or the Maglev in Shanghai) with local young people out and about to and from the airport for the ride

title: Really great fast train

title: Better by far than a taxi ride
review: I regularly use this link when travelling in and out of Bangkok   It's reasonably frequent and quick the price is cheap and it's airconditioned Beats kamikaze taxi drivers in cabs with the seat belts tied down so that they cannot be used  I normally change trains at Phaya Thai station It's a little inconvenient that you have to drag bags quite a distance but apart from that the transfer works OK   The only time I have tried leaving the Airport rail link at Makkasan station was also the last This place might work for some but I found it very difficult to understand and to get around   With these few provisos it's a good service

title: Excellent

title: Way easier than I expected!
review: I was skeptical about getting a train ticket on a Friday (as I read so many ppl describing issues with that) I got to the station at the same day around 1130am and there was no queue whatsoever The lady at the counter explained me the differences among the options I got the lower sleeper (air con leaving 1935) I was lucky to get the ticket not having to pay extra for an agency The trip itself was way easier than I thought (as a solo traveller) and it actually was quite comfy There was a 30min delay but chatting with the the other travellers meanwhile did not bother me The food offered seemed good but I did not try them   I had no issues with pickpockets as none of the ppl in my car did Of course I had to make sure I locked my backpack before sleeping (just in case) The train is old but not terrible at all I only had an issue during the night instead of freezing (as many ppl described here) I felt it got too warm in the middle of the trip I woke up and felt like they turned off the aircon I had a bad time to fall asleep again with my curtains closed which was weird I had to sleep with them open for a while They turned the aircon on again by 7am I slept well though (once I got used to the heat) but only a few ppl noticed it during the night There was a guy selling orange juice in the mornng that pieced everyone off Nobody was interested that early and he woke up everyone   I read so many bad reviews about this trip that I was being careful I was afraid as a girl to do this trip alone but afterall I totally recommend it There was absolutely no problem The guards are always around as well I felt safe

title: Best Transport to reach Suvarnabhumi International Airport from Bangkok
review: If you have less baggage Airport Rail Link is the best transport to use to reach Suvarnabhumi International Airpot from Bangkok City  I used this Train through Phyathai Station when I came from Nana From Nana to Phyathai you have to use BTS From Phyathai to Airport you have change over by using a separate link All you have to do to get down and change over to Airport Link and to buy a separate ticket as both BTS and Airlinks are reported operated by different service provider  In general Airport Link is over crowded hence people with less baggage can find it easy to use this transport which is fast and convenient

title: Sky train pluses and minuses
review: I’ve spent time in Thailand since 1974 so only too well recall the pre BTS days Traffic jams like no one should ever experience Grid lock which meant an intersection could be closed for hours  The advent of the BTS a skytrain system which has no traffic interaction at all means smooth travelling for commuters It’s been so planned that it serves many major places for both local and tourist The seating has been designed recognizing the majority of travelers will be standing because of numbers At peak hours the time between trains is a matter of a few minutes and even in off peak the gap between arrivals is not lengthy  Peak travel can see times when passengers like myself may have to wait for three or four arrivals before there is room to board  It has a major interchange station at SIAM a major shopping entertainment center  It also has interchange stations for the underground MRT A downside is that the two systems are independent of each other so ticketing is separate  However it does mean that access to main centres has been increased Route Maps are available at all stations It also serves for transport to Suvanaphum airport Meaning if you’re travelling light you can make your flight on time  The downside is that baggage creates a further problem for boarding because there’s no real space allocated for it Security checks may also delay you because you’ll need to open cases for checking before you can board Also as travelers note that they are serious about not allowing food or drink to be consumed on the train

review: It is a fantastic transportation system  If it rains no problem  you can walk from the train to most malls without getting wet  It is a lot faster than taxis   The Rabbit Card (prepaid) saves you a lot of time buying tickets  We love Skytrain

title: You don't need taxis in bangkok
review: BTS is the only way I commute in Bangkok unless it's a late night out and operating hours are over I dislike taking taxis here because the taxi drivers like to tout and ask for higher fare from foreigners BTS is practically linked to all the famous attractions and malls so there is really no need to take taxis I would recommend BTS for all travelers

title: Fast and handy
review: Very useful for getting around bangkok Feels clean modern and efficient which is nice in a hole like bangkok

title: Love It!!!
review: Having lived in Bangkok in the '70s prior to the Sky Train I cannot stress how it has revolutionized travel around the city It is so convenient to get to most of the main areas and then you can connect if needed It is always clean cool and you get wonderful views over the city Great value and the best way to travel in the city I wish Toronto had one

title: Clean, comfortable, and safe.
review: A great way to get around Bangkok if you get tired of the tuktuks It is mostly an elevated train and hits most of the major areas of the city It can get crowded like all cities but the Thai people are unfailingly polite

title: Cheaper and quicker than taxis
review: Fairly quick and easy to catch the BTS to almost anywhere in Bangkok Just make sure you know where you are going before you get onto the train It is normally fairly busy so standing on the train can be a thing

title: Sky Train-Best way to travel in and around Bangkok
review: The Sky Train is easy to learn to use for visitors  It is cheap clean air conditioned fast and gets you there when everything else is at a standstill in Bangkok  Walking and the Sky Train are the two best ways to get around in Bangkokthen opt for Tuk Tuks Mototaxis or taxis

title: Sky train
review: On the plus side Easy to usetrack side maps are simple cost is cheap and run regular on the down side always seem to be overcrowded

title: Best way to get around the innercity area.
review: buy a travelcard to avoid queues at ticket machines the bts is the best way to travel between key shopping area hotels and entertainment zones also allows you to avoid being ripped off by terrible Bangkok taxi drivers

title: Quick, cheap, and convenient way to get to the city from the airport
review: For sheer convenience of getting away from the airport quickly without having to deal with traffic you can't beat the Rail Link  A somewhat quirky ticket in the form of a black plastic disk that you buy at one station and deposit at the destination that's confusing for first timers but is more than made up for by the sheer convenience of the link itself

title: Very comfortable and cheap option
review: Starts from the airport itself and takes you to the heart of the city Comfortable mode of journey bypassing the city heavy traffic and high taxi costs

title: fast and easy
review: Loved my first experience on the express train to the airport The ticket from Praya Thani only costs 90THB per person and the trip takes only 15 minutes The waiting area has comfy chairs as well If you are leaving in the daytime the view leaving the city is great as well The trains are first class re standardI'd highly recommend this option for getting to the main airport in Bangkok

title: Avoid the insane traffic!
review: Bangkok is a great place to visit but traffic can be absolutely insane BTS Skytrain is a clean efficient safe way to get around  recommend using it whenever possible

title: Fast efficient and on time
review: Other than the ticket this was a very easy way to get around Ticketing machines have exact change or you'll have to wait in line to get it

title: Excellent travel partner
review: easy access and it is air conditioned plus goes to the airport and city centre It can get very crowded in rush hours Buy tokens or a value added card

title: The BTS is a great & quick way to go around Bangkok.
review: If you visit Bangkok and you do not have a ride on the BTS you have missed out on a great experience is the quickest way to get around runs regular spotlessly clean and air conditioned for your comfort when in Bangkok have a ride on the BTS you won't be sorry you did

title: Still Great
review: We have used it for years and as long as you don't have large or many bags the best most reasonable way to and from airport to town Of course you must know how close or far away a station is to your destination to see if it's practical for you

title: Easy ride to the city
review: Because my son arrived a day ahead he had researched the train to downtown It was no trouble to find our way late night to downtown the train is clean and quick Good directions as long as you know your stop comfortable and safe and inexpensive

title: Great way to get around all the shopping
review: It can get hectic especially  if you get caught  up in peak hour when the locals are going to work or school  but it's a good transport to get around in genral especially  all the major shopping  complexes but  not recommended if you have a pram or not so active  pensioners as there are quite a few stairs to get to the platform

title: very convenient!
review: easy and cheap the best way to go to the city center it takes only 3045 mins depending on where you are going

title: Very easy way to get around the bustling city of Bangkok.
review: We found that the train system in Bangkok is very well run It is very affordable trains run very frequently and are very well presented and kept clean The ticketing system was very easy to use We travelled into Hua Lamphong from the Pratunam area and found it (as foreigners) very easy to use Compared to home the system runs extremely well and is very cheap to travel on We had to change from the BTS to the MRT system and it was easily done with a great walkway linking the two  It's the best way to get around Bangkok without having to battle with all the traffic

title: Convenient but can be crowded
review: The BTS covers some major sights and malls but the overall coverage of the city is quite limited and there are only 2 lines There isn't a long wait between trains and transport is quick Can get very crowded at peak Be aware that you need to buy tickets in coins only

title: Bangkok BTS - keep on traveling!
review: The best way to travel and explore the city and you can get good views 😎 It covers most of the "go to" places and linked to other transportation options such as the MRT and the river taxi And it's cheap

title: Good during Peak Travel Times
review: If your hotel is close to the BTS Line or the Airport Link Line itself this might be a good option for you to skip the peak hour traffic jam

title: Solo
review: It's very easy to use this airport rail Its fast cheap and easy which I really like You use this instead of uber or taxi You will save time as well

title: Life-saver in Bangkok's Heat
review: Excellent way of getting around especially if you want to go to connect to trains travelling to international destinations This service is quick ceheap and airconditioned

title: The Only Way to GO !!!!!
review: Stay in Sukhumvit 50 bht taxi ride to sky train None stop 15 20 min service from Phetchaburi station to airport for 80 bht No worries about being late no crashes no motorway night mares The station is world class security staff and easy to understand instructions For me it is the only way to det to the airport

title: Amazing sight and great photo opportunity
review: We took the railway while visiting kanchanaburi and it is as amazing as the pictures you see Beautiful views of the river Lovely old train takes you back in time when all trains had old wooden seats and drop down windows

title: Great
review: Sarah was a wonderful tour guide We really enjoyed our tour She even taught us some key Thai words I can't recommend her enough

title: Quickest Way to get to the Airport!!!
review: Economicalefficientwell connectedcrowded depending on the hour of the daybut definitely the best way to commute

title: Best public transport to get around Bangkok
review: BTS Skytrain probably is the best public transport to get around bustling metropolis of Bangkok where traffic congestion happens everyday In my opinion however BTS can still improve in some ways  1 The ticketing machine could be upgraded to accept notes instead of only coins It is a pain in the neck to queue up twice just to exchange for coins and buy ticket at the machine if one does not have prepaid card or one day pass 2 Some BTS have limited access to escalator (either one side of the road) especially at stations with more crowds and nearby major landmarks 3 The service line could be extended to more major attractions and landmarks in Bangkok  Other than that I am very satisfied in overall Less waiting time clean and convenient

title: Best Value To and From the Airport
review: Convenient if you don't have large luggage Some station elevators were out of service so some passengers had to carry their bags updown the stairs

title: It's so easy!!!
review: Punctual prompt perfectly clean The Sky Train astounded me because it was so cheap to travel on & the service was so great Do not he daunted by it as a method of transport it is definitely the easiest way to travel

title: Economical and best way to reach suvarnabhumi airport
review: I stayed in ramkhamhaeng and for those who want to go to suvarnbhumi airport this is the best and economical way than taxi to reach airport

title: Great idea, but poor access and taxi availability from the Makkasan terminus
review: This is not a bad value and a great idea The signage is poor The Makkasan station offers poor taxi access (taxis do not wish to serve passengers from this station so you must walk across the road  albeit with a quite new flyover it has become more safe) and the staff have poor English skills and are unresponsive It is much better than a taxi at least you are not cheated nor taken for a ride"

title: Clean, fast, quiet and comfortable
review: I used the BTS Skytrain for the first time and did not need any assistance This was easy to use  The cars were extremely clean the ride was comfortable and quick What more could you ask of a public transport system Perfect in every sense

title: Very well organized
review: We opted for the hotel pick up option They emailed us the evening before to confirm pick up time at the hotel and they were on time in the morning The tour was well organized We stopped for gas and snacks along the way before reaching the train station to take the train to the market At the market we had 30 minutes to explore and shop and watch the next train leave Then we went to the floating market where our tour guide Vicky gave us great bargaining tips We had about 15 hours to explore and we opted to pay extra to ride the small boat through the market After they dropped us back off at our hotel around 130pm It was a great day and felt very organized Our tour group had a total of 12 people

title: great connectivity
review: Traveled in this link the great connectivity and the punctuality is tremendous people are frendly and helpful in guiding

title: The cheapest to get to the aiport
review: Hassle free and take the blue line instead of airport line you will end up spending 15 mins extra from Makassan station to reach the arport however the amount of money you will save is a lot by avioiding airport link train

title: Very easy to use
review: We found the BTS Skytrain very straightforward cheap and easy to use  The ticketing system very simple but often there are no machines for change so make sure you carry coins20 5 and 1's Does not accept 2's  You can go to a window and get change but there is often a big line up The stations are announced on 1 of the lines and inside the carriages there are lights that show what station you are at and what side to exit  You can purchase single journey's or day trips You don't have to wait long for trainsa few minutes at most

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok without being stuck in traffic
review: The BTS is a great way to travel within the city and gets you point to point especially if you’re travelling as a family unit with more than 45 people If you opt for taxis you would need more than one and probably risk the likelihood of being stuck in traffic even during the supposed mid morning low peak period   It’s a very clean and comfortable ridenothing like the older subway systems that some tourists are probably accustomed to

title: Fast - clean - cheap
review: Love the skytrain here Although bkk is too crowded traffic jam every where you can enjoy the fastest way to move by bts I really enjoy this Can go from siam to chatuchak weekend market for 15 mins

title: Changes the outlook of the City
review: BTS skytrains are very convenient to use and touches the major points of the cities we went to Chatuchak Weekend market from Ploenchit in just 17 minutes or so while a taxi may take more than 40 minutes and far more when traffic is bad I felt the train as safe and clean as any other major city metros like New York or Sydney

title: slow but a good day
review: the train was on time leaving but construction made my trip slow the ride was a good experience traveling around Thailand slow but sure I suppose

title: Nice experience
review: Clean fast especial in the heavy traffic jam of Bangkok The price is little bit higher than MRT Connect to the city centre with can go to any shopping mall here by walk

title: wonderful transport system
review: Buy a day travel card (150 baht as of February 2015) Rapid air conditioned travel to most places of interest in the city Easy to read travel maps and announcements in English

title: Very convenient
review: First of all it is clean and safe I recommend taking it from the airport to get to the city center fast and cheap The daily pass is very convenient and rather cheap I strongly recommend using the BTS

title: Smooth and pleasant journey
review: Took ARL because the taxi queue was ridiculously long when I arrived  Turned out to be a smooth and pleasant journey About 3045 minutes to reach city area Connect to some BTS ad MRT stations but separate ticketing  Okay  if you don't have bulky luggages

title: Excellent and cheap
review: A great quick cheap way to get from Ato B and not stuck in Bangkok traffic  The carriages are clean Can be busy during rush hour

title: Great transport system!
review: Nice clean and convenient Seems like it's always pretty full most times of the day Could be more trains but then again that may just be me getting spoiled by HK mtr with super tight schedules

title: Excellent transportation
review: Excellent way for travellers to get to and from the airport to the city Busy at times but clean and comfortable

title: Many years - many more people
review: When the BTS first started years back all of bangkok was not able to accept it due to the wages vs the cost of travel for the tourist this was HEAVEN easy to get AWAY from the mad traffic below as the city became more affluent this has gradually been accepted by the masses and today during peak hours is jammed pack to the brim enjoy the locals and sounds

title: City Line!
review: Really good mode of transport from Airport My hotel was in Sukhumvit Soi 4 Nana Station on BTS Line So went to Airport CITY LINE Station below SuvarnaBhumi to PhayaThai Station From PhayaThai there is BTS to Nana Loved it and would highly recommend it Paid 50Baht to Phayathai (NonExpressFare I Think) and another 2030 Baht to Nana on BTS

title: Convenience to into the city
review: Airport Rail Link is convenience for all traveler When you arrive Suvanabhum Int Airport go to the underground floor (there is sign for direction) You can buy ticket at office box or buy from machine The cost is 45 baht person (around 11 Euro or 12 USD) You can enter to the city within 4045 mins The final station is link to BTS  (Pha Ya Thai station) It's good choice because it's saver and quicker than taxi

title: Skytrain experience
review: Its easy to use cheap and convenient The train are pretty punctual and its locations are easy to get to Most of the major hotels are within walking distance to the sky train

title: The most convenient transportation for me in Bangkok
review: The biggest reason I prefer MRT is to avoid the hot temperature It runs faster than BTS and somehow cheaper

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Even with only speaking English we were able to quickly learn how the BTS works and travel freely throughout Bangkok We were shocked at how clean the stations and trains were You also have a ton of choices of food and drink while you're waiting You cannot eat on the train though Also  if you're a woman and a monk gets on the BTS he is not able to sit by you If you have the option to get up and he can sit where you are without sitting next to another woman please be respectful and do so

title: Ok
review: After visiting Japan and coming to BKK and getting the train to my hotel the grand eastin I was not very happy but I can't complain it took me to my destination and different countries have different systems either way I had a guy yapping away  just drove me nutsjust wouldn't shut up after listening to all that and frustrated I got it in Siam to connect with local BTS to surasak it was so full so thank god I had only a 7 kg I wouldn't advise with big luggage if you hit peak hours in the trainI made it to the hotel  just be mindful if you have kids But BTS is the way to go around   walking in the heat makes it unbearable good luck and safe tripoh by the way I took a taxi back to the hotel get a local taxi and tell him you want express lane  500 baht I tipped him so 600 baht driver was nicebrought me on time 🎈and I saw a guy with all his jaw sawn up I said to my partner looks like he had a terrible accident  then I saw a lady with bandage nose oops then I realized nip and tuck wondered should I 😀😀😀😀😀

title: Efficient and easy to use
review: We used the Sky Train whenever we could during our stay in Bangkok It was super easy and convenient if you're familiar with other tube lines We took the Airport Rail Link to the airport from our hotel We left from the National Stadium at 9am and were at the airport after about an hour There is an express line but it wasn't running so we just took the regular one

title: Efficient
review: A good way of travelling to & fro airport into the city of Bangkok From airport to Phaya Thai only 45 Baht No traffic jam cheap convenient Only set back is have to stand from the airport to the destination as many tourists with luggage pack the train unless you are first few in queue Easy to buy tickets too The ticket comes in a coin form

title: Convenient way to see Bangkok
review: Don't underrate the train service in Bangkok its clean safe and great the only minus is that you either buy a daily pass or a monthly pass they just dont offer a weekly pass what a shame I hope in future they do I also hope that one day the train service will go beyond MoChit all the way to Impact convention centre

title: Easy and accessible transport
review: Great way to get around lots of friendly staff who are happy to help if you need   Don’t be afraid to ask for directions   Cheap quick and accessible

title: excellent but costly
review: To travel by sky train was a good experience Trains are neatclean and travel in time Ya you have to wait for coins and then you can travel Further cost from one station to other one nearby is very high People are also very very friendly and helpful While travelling one person helped me lot to reach to Marriott hotel which gate to use which train to go and which exit to take Signboards are not clear and one who does not know Thai language faces difficulties Overall it was a great experience I could not find where I can have full day ticket Bravo  keep the  services up Nowadays people are so busy in their mobiles in sky trains

title: The best public service from town to Suvarnabhumi airport
review: With a ridiculous tkt you will arrive inside the airport avoiding the harassment of the taxi surcharging just because you are not Thai  Consider it does not run 24 hours per day check the updated schedule on their website to plan your trip

title: ok
review: when you need to go somewhere the skytrain doesn't the MRT might get you there Only needed it a couple of times but very handy

title: Cheap and easy to use
review: Best way to get around Bangkok gets a little crowded sometimes  There is pretty intimidating secutiry at the stations sniffdogs and regular bagchecks and the cards can get packedcrowded at peak times and places but it's a nice modern system  Just hope they keep expanding north to Don Mueang airport so you can get to both airports by rail

title: only way to travel
review: aircon no traffic a bit busy a rush hour thais dont like to speak loud in public places clean thais even stand up to let elderly sit cheap quick safe organized no "meterontaxiproblems" the only way to travel trough bkk get to the subsoi's by taking mototaxi

title: Nice public transport
review: Really nice very clean and fast however the lines are a bit limited as they don't go very far but it looks like they are building more

title: Takes you from point A to point B
review: I used the morning train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai and back The reason for it was to see the landscapes and do some computerwork Overall the trains are getting old but it was okay considering that the air conditioning worked well No shiny hankypanky just a train The food was also okay  nothing special but like an airplane food (rice egg curry) For those that are complaining about the food what do you expect from that kind of transportation anyway An a la carte restaurant )   The thing that bothered me was that the train left departure delayed over an hour from BangkokChiang May (and was also late in the destination) and over 20 minutes late from Chiang Mai  Bangkok (and was also late in the destination for over 15 hours) Like how You can't blame traffiv right Does it depend on how long smokebreaks the traindriver needs   Otherwise a good and comfy way for such a long ride But as 12go asia online booking tells you  do not believe the arrival times and consider for at least 3 hour later arrival time

title: Fastest way to the City
review: The Airport Rail Way is the Fastest way to the City  Locatio  Airport Main Building  Level  Level 1  Operation Time  6am  Midnight  Transfer time to City  around 30 min  6 Stops  Price  15  45 Bath

title: Great way to get around Bangkok!
review: We bought a 1day roverticket and it enabled us to travel around the city for a day and then get to the station to get a train to our next destination The trains and stations are modern and spotlessly clean You receive a swipe card which gets you through the barriers Very impressed It is not expensive

title: Easy to use.
review: We used the sky train to return to our hotel from the reclining Buddha Access from the river was direct When I lined up to buy (4)tickets for the family I got change and was sent to the ticket machine In the end it was not too hard but I've still got the excess change in my pocket Looks like a day passing the sky train would be manageable and inexpensive

title: Bangkok's Got Everything!
review: When you approach Thailand overhead in your aeroplane you're reminded of Thailand's tropical roots ponds of water and coconut trees lace the city  Then when within Bangkok you're just overcome wTuktuks zig zagging thru the exhaust of buses and the aroma of sliced papaya  Need to regroup  To find shelter  Go Underground  Laid back Thais  They just have everything

title: Easy and smart
review: Such a big help when you would to get around in Bangkok Cheap AC and fast The only thing is that it only has 2 lines

title: Easy trasnportation option
review: it' s a nice and easy way to move around the city  Beating the city traffic and saving a lot of time as Bangkok roads are very busy during business hours

title: Best mean of transport airport to the city
review: Very fast way from the airport to the city and also is it really cheap many people are on board but it is the best easy and the fast way

title: Really helpful
review: Really helpful on getting around the city signs are clearly marked in english although on certain times it can get crowded

title: If You're Not Near The BTS You're Nowhere (sort of)
review: The title may be a bit of a stretch since the whole of Bangkok is a wonderful and fascinating city But if you're in BKK for business or tourism and you're a Farang (foreigner with no ability to read write or speak the Thai language) then you want to be near a BTS stop The signage is all in English (as well as Thai) and is clearly marked If you're from the US you'll have to get used to the "on the left" concept regarding direction of travel but if you survived your walk TO the BTS through traffic then chances are you're okay Goes anywhere the tourist wants to go and most places the diplomat sans auto or Westerner conducting business needs to go Yes that includes Nana and all it's distractions   As of March 2016 the cost for a 1Day Pass which you ask for by requesting a "oneday pass at the kiosk costs 140 THB equal to roughly $4 American A real bargain for unlimited rides in the calendar day NOT a 24hour period from time of purchase as in New York for example Although NYC has done away with the socalled oneday "Fun Pass"

title: Not much of an attraction but good transport!
review: An easy convenient and cheap way to get into the city Certainly much better than taking the taxi or a bus Gets you till Phayathai station from where you can take the BTS and go anywhere in Bangkok

title: Fast, comfy and inexpensive
review: Instead of rotting in a car stuck in Bangkok traffic and spend Baht 500 commuting the airport rail link costs Baht 45 takes me to town in 30 min  The train is comfortable and definitely beats the traffic jam It is well connected to BTS at Phraya Thai and MRT as well  Very very convenient

title: Historical between the Thais and Burma
review: It's a place where you can know more about the history of these 2 countries where the Burmese try to invade There is a museum

title: Best way to get from the airport to the city
review: Best way to get from the airport to the city It's clean nice fast very easy to use and you get a nice view over the city

title: Girl friends holiday
review: Bangkok is a wonderful city to visit  The food is good with lots of variety  Most important part is the food handlers care about hygiene  Shopping is also fun as Thai are friendly and they try their best to help even though they don't speak good English

title: A useful way to see Bangkok
review: Extremely cheap for 4445Bht Absolutely no liquids allowed An apparent yet subtle safe and reassuring presence of security  Clean modern upto date if not technologically advanced system Well worth doing for a cheap way of seeing just a small part of the city  There are currently 2 lines which interconnect and the whole journey takes approximately 45mins to 1hr 15 to complete Faultless efficient and convenient depending where you are travelling tofrom and includes a purposeful link with the equally efficient and affordable river boattaxi service

title: Cheap and cool way to Central Bangkok
review: We used the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnabhumi to Phaya Thai and it was fantastic Such a great way to get to Central Bangkok for 45 baht for a single ticket (the equivalent to 90p) It is a safe fast and efficient way to get around and would fully recommend it I just wish they would reinstate the express service and this would dramatically cut service times

title: The best!
review: This is the best way to get to Bangkok These is no traffic easy transfers to wherever you are going The rate is fair but don't loose your ticket because you will have to pay again The employees have no sympathy at all Clean and easy

title: Ton-nes of fun
review: a brilliant experience Ton our tour guide made the trip so much fun  very informative and helpful would recommend

title: Efficiency
review: As in ANY country DO NOT travel during peak hours It can be a nightmare Other than that I enjoyed the experience

title: Super fast and easy
review: Used multiple times on multiple trips to Bangkok when exploring the area that the BTS covers it is fantastic little bit of a journey to access from some areas but that doesn't detract from the ease of use it provides

title: Not fast, but definitely the cheapest and convenient
review: One of the cheapest airport railway I've used Much more cheaper than the KLIA express 3545 baht only Easy access to downtown and switch to BTS or MRT The train isn't a high speed train though may take sometimes to reach downtown

title: Best way to travel BKK
review: Easiest way to get around is on the skytrain and metro Take both whenever you can Plus you feel like a local and no scam from Tuk Tuk drivers

title: Super convenient access across the city!
review: Don't waste time sitting in Bangkok traffictake the Skytrain  With stops across the city and connections to the MRT (Subway) it is cheap and convenient  Your best bet is to buy the reloadable pass  This avoids the need to wait in line to buy tickets each time (my one big complaint is that the ticket machines usually only take coinsthe bill feeders never work)  The pass is SUPER convenient and the fare is the same  You pay something like 50 baht (US$14) for the card itself  Traffic is notoriously bad in bangkokthe train system is the way to go if you can

title: Great Transport system
review: Want a quick and easy way around Bangkok this is it  Fast  efficient and very clean  With very helpful staff  all the ticket ladies spoke English

title: Easy way to escape Bangkok Traffic
review: When in Bangkok BTS skytrain is definitely the best choice for travelling around the city if you wanna escape Bangkok road traffic

title: Crowded but the fastest means of transportation
review: As traffic jams are usual in Bangkok motorcycles and BTS are the fastest choices BTS is a bit crowded but air conditioned Price is reasonable but you should know exact station as the price will change and makes headaches

title: Fun and different
review: It was very fun Boom was a great guide She took care of us explained the story of the markets and the salt fields (whyle you waited for the train) and how things worked and made sure we were all safe and if you need help translate She was there She also took pictures of us The pickups and drop offs worked great also I do think if you come to bangkok you should do this tour Recommended

title: Convenient and Cheap
review: Most of the shopping area are linked by the mrt and sky train The fare is much more cheap than else where Like other train service no food and drink allowed in the train

title: Awesome adventure
review: The trip with Sara was amazing seeing the locals and exploring the towns on the way to the floating markets was an awesome experience Has so much fun and I would definitely recommend this trip if you want to do the floating markets Sara shows you the best way to do it the best and the worst stuff to buy and how to navigate around the markets with no problems Would absolutely recommend and would definitely do it again )

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Great to travel around Easy to reach local attractions Relatively cheap and can avoid traffic in city area

title: Clean, cheap and convenient
review: The BTS Skytrain system is a clean cheap and convenient way of getting around Bangkok  You can buy a day travelcard costing 140 Bahts (equivalent to just over GBP 3  May 2017) and travel anywhere on the BTS system There is also a subway (MRT system)  but you need to buy separate tickets to travel on this system  and the BTS travelcard cannot be used for the MRT  The BTS has two main lines  Sukhumvit and the Silom You need coins to buy your tickets from the ticket machines If you do not have change you can get change from the ticket offices They will not sell you tickets   The BTs skytrain system is very good All trains are air conditioned There are safety barriers on the platforms There are security checks before you can go to the platforms Trains are fast and frequent Prices for single journeys are very much on the cheap side   I would recommend this form of public transport in Bangkok

title: Efficient and clean skytrain
review: Easy to go from A to B and access shops river boats or accommodation Used it to come back to hotel from Embassy when trying to sort out my visa for Vietnam

title: Easy to use
review: The sky train is a great way to get around bangkok  They do have travel cards you can buy instead of single use as they do not sell returns We used a one day premotion ticket which cost 140 bhat and was well worth it  It also means you don’t have to stand in line to Buy tickets every time  You want to use it  They have ticket machines but you need change or most don’t work Trains come every few minutes  Clean and fast  Best way to get around it they can get very busy

title: Cheap and quick way to get to city from airport even with small children
review: Good choice to travel from airport to city center Children and us enjoyed the trip and it is much more cheaper than taxi ) Nice city views quick

title: So clean and comfortable train system
review: In general Thailand train system is convenient for tourists who are not familiar with the place  This is the best alternative to taking a bus or taxi where traffic can be very horrible in one of the busiest cities in Southeast Asia

title: Great ride
review: The Skytrain is the most efficient way to travel around Bangkok It is fast clean and very frequent An all day pass gives great flexibility and value It is air conditioned and comfortable It can get a bit crowded during the rush hour

title: lil difficult to navigate
review: since not many people know english there it gets a little difficult to navigateto top it up there are different levels to take different routes

title: Best way to reach Downtown
review: The rail link station is located at level B1 in suvarnabhumi airport We had to reach Phaya Thai station as it was the nearest to our hotel We took the 820 am train to Phaya Thai The train was already full with people at the airport even though that was the 1st station And it only started getting more crowded We were 3 of us with 6 bags so we stood in the end of the carriage where there were no seats (it was also the only place left when we entered the carriage) That is the best place to stand if you have luggage like ours so that you dont come in the way of people getting in and out Most of the people got off at makassan station We reached phaya thai station in 30 mins which is the scheduled travel time At the train station there were taxis available The ticket cost us 45 baht per person and is the best mode of transport during the rush hours and also the cheapest if you are travelling to downtown
