title: Transportation
review: Very clean efficient and cheap Most staff speak good English and it’s far far cheaper than tuk tuk’s or taxis Only way to visit the sights of Bangkok

title: Fast Options to Travel
review: BTS is above surface metro rail system in Bangkok It is not very expensive But compare to India it is expensive Good to beat traffic and save time & money But you will not find wast rail network in Bangkok

title: great quick and cheap
review: great quick and cheap  signs in english too and free maps

title: Experience the Train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai
review: The overnight train to Chiang Mai is a must Go either first or second class you'll have a berth to sleep in They are comfortable and clean First class is less than $30 second less than $20 It's a 12 hour ride that is super with amazing views and its air conditioned Get up at least an hour and a half before you arrive you don't want to miss the mountains Food and drinks are available and reasonable and taste good The shower and bathrooms are well functionalbut not pretty They are clean though NOTE the trap door opens on the toilet after leaving the situation great track sounds SMOKING is not allowed unless you have to Use the bathroom open the window flush the butt down the toilet By the way there are two toilets one pot and one Thai style It's safe but BEWARE OF SCAM ARTISTS

title: Fast & Easy
review: We found this mode of transportation fast and cheap People there were happy to help you figure out where to go It does not cover all of Bangkok so after you get off you may need to take a taxi to your exact location

title: A bit tricky for English speakers, but there's lots of help
review: We gave this a try to get around Bangkok and it took us a while to figure it out but we had fun in the process  When we gave up and asked for help we were always able to find someone who could get us pointed in the right direction

title: Nice
review: We took the ARL to the airport and found it clean inexpensive and very efficientjust like BTS but uses a token instead of a plastic card Way to go

title: Fast and convenient ride from the airport
review: Take the ARL to Bangkok if you want to avoid traffic and have an airconditioned experience Otherwise you can take a taxi or a tuk tuk

title: Fantastic!
review: Takes youlinks you anywhere you want to go  Just so easy but you have to get used to consulting the rail map and the names of the entrance ramps so you don't take the wrong train

title: City Heights
review: This form of transportation is the most comfortable easy and fast way to get around the city of Bangkok  Smooth efficient clean and totally climate controlled  Suggestion Don't go in the early evening as it is like rush hour on the platforms and difficult to get in and out  During the day it is the best

title: The only way to travel in Bangkok
review: The traffic is unbelievable in yet he city The metro is easy for foreigners to navigate It is reasonable and there are signs in English

title: Good way to travel in BKK traffic...
review: Good way to travel in BKK traffic Traffic in Bangkok can be quite annoying But if you travel by skytrain you would have that problem It's quite easy to use

title: Cheap Reliable with a view
review: Since being here we’ve tried all forms of transportation from catching a regular 🚕 ⛴ 🚊 Uber and tuktukby far the BTS is a gorgeous way to have a different view of the cityit’s reliable cheap and aircon is welcoming in all the humidity of Thailand Catch it if you get a chance at least once like we did during peak hour (after work) even we just wished the train had more cars Otherwise it’s safe clean and easy to use

title: best to go around in bangkok
review: because of the traffic the best way to go around bangkok and fast its bts if you will take it often try to get a card with an amount on it not because its cheaper but some station you will have to wait to get coins (the ticket machine take only coins) and then queue again for the ticket

title: Clean and efficient.
review: If you ride a train or subway in the United States you will find same ticketing and turnstile methods Safe and clean but you can't eat or drink in the cars

title: Amazing Job
review: While the Sky trains do a beautiful job outside over the congested streets of Bangkok the MRT which was built with amazing silence and efficiency connects long distances underground and heralded Bangkok's transition as a world class city Another cheap and quick public transport option for residents and tourists Very swish and easy to do it yourself with adequate signages and maps everywhere You can  figure out how to go anywhere without asking anyone Which for me is a very good indicator of a Visitor Friendly Destination

title: Efficient and Affordable
review: BTS is an efficient transportation system particularly for tourists as it conveniently connects all the attractions including malls and are easily accessible unlike Dubai where one has to cover large distances to reach the platform However escalators both for going up and down on all entry and exits would be a welcome addition Acquiring a ticket is easy and MBT Staff are very helpful and availability of various shops on the station adds colour to the platforms and are of convenience to commuters particularly tourists

title: Sky Train Bangkok
review: Great ride to shopping we got on & off at varies stations after buying a all day pass good experience riding on this train

title: Clean, safe way to avoid the Bangkok traffic
review: We stayed near the train station by Chinatown and enjoyed taking the train to many sites and locations  Very affordable clean safe and convenient

title: Efficient way to travel
review: The Airport Rail Link is an efficient form of transport from the airport Situated on the lower level of the airport access is easy The trip is reasonably fast and the last stop is in the centre of Bangkok From there you have the option of either catching a cab to your hotel or connecting with other forms of transport My only warning is to be aware when catching cabs from the last stop as we were caught out My cab trip included expressway fees and a fee that was equivalent to my cab fare back to the airport

title: Easy train service
review: Simple effective Not too dissimilar from the London tube Simply buy a token from the ticket machine touch it to the pad at the turn style and head for the train We’ll sign posted and easy to read maps with attendants at each station From the airport to Hua Lampong in around an our costing 30 baht per person

title: Easy to use
review: An efficient way to get around parts of Bangkok as it does not go everywhere  Easy to get tickets and easy hop on and hop off  It was clean and it was easy to use

title: Cheap and effective
review: Does what it says on the tin Why anyone would ever wanna sit in a taxi likely stuck in traffic for x100 bht I'll never comprehend  It's cheap and easy Connects to mrt (and I think bts)

title: nice ride
review: nice trip here every the time   cold ac and a quick trip to and from the city   rush hour can be a bit like a sardine can but what can you expect in a city of millions of smiling people

title: An efficient and easy to use system
review: A good way to get around the city including to and from the airport The views can be interesting for tourists and tickets are easy to buy either from the machines or kiosks often attended by Englishspeaking staff

title: MRT to Ratchada
review: Hi folks I've used the BTS in Bangkok each time I've visited mostly because of the convenience of the Rabbit card tag on  tag off system I found the MRT a little different The MRT doesn't use Rabbit  So of the two card based systems are yet to be integrated (They aren't as of the the time of writing this report) I use the MRT from time to time Mostly to get down to Ratchada for the massage services available down there  I take the Sukhumvit MRT and take it to Huay Kwang MRT station  From there it's a short walk to any one of the neon palaces

title: Clean and very good transportation in Bangkok
review: You can go anywhere in Bangkok using BTS Skytrain because it connected also to Subway  MR Clean facilities and good for senior citizen disable and mother with young childrenThai people very kind and respect for it I travelled with my parents and young children and always gets seats even in rush hours Thanks Bangkok

title: Excellent way to go to and from airport
review: At the first time it was a little problem for us buying a ticket and receiveg token for because we were not used to such a system Also it was a strange that they changed tariffs in week when we were in Bangkok

title: Easy to use and air conditioned
review: This is a very easy way to get around Bangkok and air conditioned There's so much traffic in this city it's far more reliable to use this to and from the airport as well People will help you understand how to buy tickets but you must find your final destination on the ticket machine the number next to it is how much you need to pay You can only use coins if you don't have them you can get them from the staff at the ticket booths (but oddly enough you can't always buy your tickets from them)

title: The only way to travel in BKK
review: Cheap quiet and fasteverything that Thai taxi's aren't I've been riding it daily for years with no complaints

title: Good transporation option
review: No problems taking the sky train Taxi is probably cheaper but nice to have tried it  People in Asia are good to que up and let old people sit Can't say the same for norway

title: the best and easiest way to explore bangkok
review: bts sky train is the best possibility for tourists to explore the center of the city for expamle the night market siam and his shopping malls nana and the night life over there

title: Easy mode of travel
review: Takes you close to downtown area all you have you have to do is walk north from there to the big round a bout and catch the right bus too khao san road Ask for some help everyone is very helpful and friendly When you get to the street below on the corner is toursit info Theyll direct you to the bus stop Saved a lot lot of money using this transport

title: Saved our butts.
review: We booked a tour and jumped in a cab The cab driver told us we wouldn't make it due to busy traffic and suggested we take the skytrain  We told his advise and found it quite simple to use  Cheap clean and efficient   Will certainly use it again

title: Great service to/from BKK-City
review: Fast and efficient way to get into the core city 45baht for adults Get off at certain stations to Transfer to different lines along the route Station located at bottom floor of BKK

title: Unique train experience
review: You have to try the train It looks dangerous with a lot of crowds yet it's thrilling Passengers are surprisingly organised and behave themselves thanks to Thais It is the tourists that cut in line  Cabins are really cold though so wear a jacket

title: Fab experience minus artic temperatures and smelly toilet
review: This was a really cool experience and would definitely recommend trying it  We net some nice people on the train which we have remained in contact with throughout our trip  WARNING it is so cold at night time (we went in the aircon train in august time) there are only so many pairs of shorts and tops you can put on Take a towel or blanket to cover yourself as well at least two pairs of socks trousets top abd thick jumper We felt like ice cubes by morning The air con was on for the entire journey and when other passengers asked staff to turn it down or off they said no I would recommend the fan train around august time as it would probably be cool enough without air con  Also the toilet was so smelly make sure you wear shoes and hold your breath   Apart from these two issues it was a really good experience and well worth the money  Ps if you can take your own breakfast instead of buying it on the train

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: BTS Skytrain is great way to get around the city  Very easy to use with good instruction in english  Very regular clean carriages and so cheap  Travel with the locals to see this great city

title: Clean, Fast, Convenient, Reliable
review: Bangkok's skytrain is brilliant It is always clean You rarely have to wait more than 5 minutes for a train It is swift The signs around the stations are easy to understand There are even maps to point you to the exit you should use Security guards help travellers with bags pass through the gates as well I did not see an elevator at any station though So I don't think that it is wheelchair accessible at all which is disappointing  If you are planning several trips on the BTS in a day get a day pass for only 150 baht and it will save you having to change notes for coins constantly It takes a couple of journeys before you get the hang of the system for buying a oneway ticket First find which station you are going to on the map next to the ticket machine There will be a price for each station Then go to the information desk to exchange your notes for the necessary amount of coins At the ticket machine you select the amount that you wish to pay (the stations and how much they cost are right next to it) then put your coins in A ticket will be dispensed Use it to walk through the gates but hold onto it as you will need it when you exit The BTS skytrain can seem daunting at first It can be crowded and the purchasing a ticket can be confusing However once you get used to it it is a wonderful way to get around Bangkok and it sure beats being stuck in a traffic jam

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Easy to use and very cheap Get a map and make sure you know where and in which direction you need to go We were travelling with a 3yo and 7yo and managed  fine

title: Great!
review: Easy to use  The machines were easy to operate and great signage Used them frequently  Made many stops and major shopping centers and areas were easily connected  I didn't have to ask anyone how to use them )

title: Bangkok's MRT Transit
review: The Bangkok MRT is another awesome way to go around the city allowing one to discover the city more )

title: It's my daily commute
review: I take this train every workday It's great Operating speed is faster than BTS The only downside is that it's a bit crowded during rush hour especially in the afternoon going into town with lots of tourists coming in from the airport with big bags You sometimes have to push and shove your way out because there are so many nincompoops who won't step off the train to let you out I love trains and hate humans The Airport Link will be even better when it gets connected with the BTS Yellow Line in another year or 2

title: What a mess!
review: Still has paper signs all over the stations how many years after it was finished No cover from rain at the link between Makkasan station and Petchburi MRT so if it's raining you get drenched and near run over crossing a major road I think Tarzan and his apes designed this mass transit system

title: Very clean and efficient
review: Used the BTS various time during our stay in Bangkok and found it very easy to use The train is very clean and air conditioned and covers a range of areas

title: brisk walk
review: only about a 10 minute walk altho with luggage make sure u get a cabbe careful with $$ thomake sure u agree on price b4 or have the driver turn on meter because they will all try to cheat you

title: Convenient
review: Bangkok traffic is not much different from Jakarta I took taxi to Siam Paragon which was 25km away and spent 45 min in the taxi Only then I decided to try the Skytrain from the Stadium to Siam to avoid the traffic issue Surprisingly the Skytrain is very convenient and clean I don't mind to commute with skytrain again but I was confused on the signage or perhaps I should learn to read Thai

title: The only way to travel in Bangkok!!!
review: Sky train covers all the main areas in Bangkok and is reasonably priced and easy to use Very clean and safe but can be very busy most of the time and standing in the train is the norm especially on popular routes Fully airconditioned in the trains Protect your valuables as the trains are really crowded Found this time there is no quiet time always bust no matter what time of day you travel but much quicker than using the roads

title: I love it
review: It is so convenient and fast from Airport to city center but when you exit the way down and walk to any of the hotels is not suitcase friendly but is it OK if you have a dragon

title: Wonderful option when taxi lines are crazy
review: The taxi line seemed miles long so we went in search of another option and next time we will not even attempt the taxi line The Airport link was extremely easy and the English option on the machines made it simple  We had asked at the tourism desk for instructions as to which station was closest to our hotel   There are luggage racks on the express train so it cuts down on luggage taking up space on the busy train   We took the train back as well

title: Travelled  to Phrom Pom
review: Its a good option to travel by Metro as Bangkok is always have huge traffic But still I did not find it better than my New Delhi Metro

title: Super busy, but efficient way to get around
review: Be prepared for crowds And come with coins as the machines do not take bills Great coffeesnack shops at the BTS stations

title: Great System
review: Took the sky train several times great system basically the London Underground in the sky Gets busy at times very clean and can get you around Bangkok quickly Got to say though Tuk Tuls are more fun

title: Easy to use and gets you everywhere
review: Skytrain covers most of the parts of Bangkok real easy to use Compared to Amsterdam it's really cheap )

title: fastest and cosiest way to travel in Bangkok
review: best cheapest and fastest way to travel in bangkok instructions are everywhere and onground staff is helpful in giving directions they speak english well enough to give directions

title: Comfortable and cheap
review: BTS sky train is very cheap and comfortable way of traveling in Bangkok Specially if you are living in sukhmvit area The fares are very affordable and the travel experience is great But mostly crowded and bit more comfortable if they use English language on the maps

title: Efficient way to get to the airport but...
review: Overall the airport link is a quick and efficient way to get to the airport My only real issue is where you get on the train Stations are limited and not particularly luggage friendly Often you may have to get a taxi to the intown station which kind of defeats the purpose But once on quick and easy

title: Responsibility of a traveler
review: Well sometimes people make a review because it is too good to be missed or sometimes it is so bad that it is so bad that you would wish the other people don't repeat your mistake and this is a review of the later OK I visit Bangkok so often that some part of the city I probably can walk blindfolded (plus a stick)  but  be realistic taxi or limo in Bangkok is not expensive and do yourself a favor The Airport link is a bad joke even for people like me that always travel light and for those travel with large checked luggage please avoid it

title: Very convenient and cost effective
review: Only wish they had city checkin counters at the stations and stowing space for large bags  Gets one to several convenient stations connecting with other public transport and beating the traffic

title: skytrain rules
review: best way to move around in bangkok try to book a hotel next to a skytrain station  traffic is chaotic and heavy

title: Not expensive & best
review: Our Journey to Bangkok and Shopping was very much dependent on Skytrain It was so well connected to places we want to visit We had got the map of skytrain from the ticket counter too

title: Great trip to do with a couple of cautions.
review: This is a great trip to do…a floating market and a train that passes over a food and produce market with millimetres to spare amazing   A couple of things to be aware of though  Firstly this is not a morning trip as advertised but more like a day Not a problem if you have the time to spare but not if you have a flight to catch A couple of guys on the trip missed their flight as they thought it would be just the morning  It takes well over an hour each way before you see anything  Secondly I was picked up from my hotel in the morning which was great However I was not aware or possibly didn’t understand the itinerary properly that the trip ends at a shopping mall which was a long way from my hotel A taxi ride at my own expense was not appreciated after a long trip back through heavy Bangkok traffic

title: Hot, busy & uncomfortable.
review: But don't hold that against it We caught the train back from Nam Tuk  the last station on the railway back to kanchaburi It's a 3hr trip on wooden benches with no aircon & was packed BUT the scenery was nice We only really wanted to see & travel over the viaduct so it was worth it just for that

title: So convenient
review: Really easy to use and clean Covers most of city and stops all at main visitors attractions also interlinked with metro

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: Not quite as ontime as trains in Japan but almost Qiute cheap as well

title: Immerse yourself in Thai Culture
review: A mustsee tour when you visit Bangkok The Maeklong Railway Market and Damnoen Floating Market tours will really show you a lot about Thai culture This tour also included mini tours of River City a temple and the sea salt farm Definitely worth it

title: Crowded but gets you from A to B easily
review: As expected in a highly populated area the BTS is usually busy so expect to stand for most of your trips The BTS makes it easy to travel around Bangkok  Foreign traveler tips  Remember to keep coins to purchase tickets if not some stations have counters where you can purchase tickets or they exchange your notes for coins to use in the ticket machines  When selecting where to go on the ticket machine you will see a map next to the machine and your destination will have a number next to it and you press the corresponding number on the ticket machine The number also represents the price of the ticket Eg  zone 15 = 15 Baht zone 42 = 42 Baht  When trying to figure out which platform to go to find your destination on the map and look at the station at the end of the line this will be the direction and platform you need to follow (eg Mo Chit Bearing)

title: I must say Thanks!!!!
review: Thanks to Airport link service It just made my trip to Bangkok esay you can get trains that link airport to the main city from suvarnabhumi airport just take around 20 min to reach downtown Bangok

title: Very easy & cheap
review: Cheaper quicker and cooler than tuktuks in most cases

title: Get Aroung BKK Easily
review: The main station is called STADIUM STATION  This is situated next to and adjoining MBK shopping centre The trains are very regular and plentifulThey are clean and well maintained and you get a very good view of the city from this vantage point Travelling on the Skytrain makes getting around much faster and easier as you avoid all that Bangkok trafficA good idea to use if on the routes to where u want to go

title: Clean, easy and safe.
review: The quickest and easiest way to get around Bangkok is using BTS Skytrain The entrances are well marked and all announcements on the trains are in English and Thai  You can purchase tickets from vending machines or from an attendant at a ticket window if you prefer  The BTS travels to most of the major districts in Bangkok and also connects to the subway (MRT) and a direct line to Suvarnabhumi Airport It is much faster and cheaper than taking a taxi through Bangkok's normal traffic gridlock  The most notable feature of the entire system is the cleanliness which is amazing when you consider the number of people using the system daily The only drawback if there is one is that the system stops completely after 1100 pm

title: The best for traffic in bangkok
review: If you dont like the roush hour in Bangkok take the skytrain It may be full also in roush hour but youre faster than by car Very safe and clean

title: Great Experience
review: We used 12GoAsia to book train tickets from Bangkok to Buriram and back for the MotoGP 2018 It was easy to book online and collect the tickets a day before we left I got a refund of 140Baht which was a pleasant surprise Also for each ticket 12GOASIA gives 1 bottle of water  much needed   The train rides both day and night exceeded our expectations The night berths are comfortable with clean bedding pillows and a curtain for privacy provided

title: The only way to travel in Bangkok
review: the "sky train" is an exceptionally convenient way to get away from the traffic and travel to pretty much any place in BKK take your time to get a travel map from the ticket office and study it I have a Rabbit card which you top up then just travel any where you want by just placing the credit card sized ticket on the turnstile it's much more convenient than queuing up and then struggling for change Even if you just use the sky train to get out of the busy areas in BKK then jump a Taxi it's the only way to travel in central Bangkok

title: A real pleasure to commute, with Food stalls at stations
review: The Skytrain is probably the best thing in Bangkok to commute similar to tube in many countries Clean and safe Trains are small and have good frequency in Peak hours The stations are well integrated into Bangkok particularly at Siam where it opens up directly into the Siam Paragon The skytrain also makes it easy to get to Sathorn pier (Exit Gate no2  as far as I remember) to catch a ferry ride on Chalong river Plus the stations also have great food options to catch a drink or snack in between your ride

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: This is a cheap and fast way to get around parts of inner Bangkok Each trip cost a dollar or less Tickets are available from machines but the attendants will change notes to coins if required The trains are clean and cool and we never waited longer than 5 minutes for one going in the right direction It's an easy way to get to Chatachuk weekend markets  a fab place to visit

title: Convenient
review: It is a very convenient choice of transportation in Bangkok especially if you are travelling alone But if you have company especially more than 2 then it is cheaper to get a taxi if there's no traffic

title: A easiest mode of public transport
review: It is the best mode to get around Bangkok if you want to avoid traffic jam It connect the airport express and MRT Although it not so convenient to transfer between MRT but it better than caught in the traffic jam It cost between 2542 Baht depending on far you going It is also not convenient for people with large items and walking problem

title: Why fight the Bangkok traffic when you can travel by train?
review: this is absolutely the best way to get from the airport to Central Bangkok It is fast efficient and cheap I have done the trip all the way to National Stadium with an 18 kg backpack and another bag and had no problems Heading back out to the airport you are almos guaranteed a seat

title: cool change for bangkok heat!!!
review: on a domsestic flight going back to bangkoktaking the airport rail link was a great decisionso easy and coolbest way to get to the city

title: quite fast to get the bangkok city center
review: quite fast to get the bangkok city center but not so convenient to change the station to BTS station

title: A great day out
review: A great day out our guide was very knowledgeable and knew the best stops to get the best view of the train market and also lots of facts about both markets Please be aware though that these are now very touristy markets still a great day out

title: Nice and useful
review: It's cheap and easy to use and a nice air con break from the bangkok heat Can get very busy though even out of rush hour

title: Even better than Singapore MRT!!
review: Clean aircon is cooling even when there is alot of crowds train moves smoothly Speedy and affordable

title: great way to beat traffic from airport if your hotel is near a Station
review: Review actually covers Airport rail link  but it was easy for me as i was solo with only bag  never tried carting large  bags on this but sure is possible  beats sitting in Horrible traffic

title: Good . But rates are higher.
review: Good connectivity Rates are higher No integrated payment system Connect to Chao Phaya river express boats at Saphan Taksin station

title: Fantastic! Fast! Full-packed!
review: Really easy to get around (works similarly to the London Underground) and is perfect for beating the traffic (which is awful) You can use your baht coins to buy your ticket at a machine you just select the ticket price based on what station you're visiting (the machine will have a sign to tell you the cost of visiting each station from where you are) Also it's really cheap But it's busy no matter what time of the day

title: NICE CLEAN SERVICE
review: Excellent fast and prompt train service in which very clean and nice too This service provides people to travel within the Air Port from terminal to terminal without much tiredness

title: one of a kind market
review: nice local market that really sell local grocery stuff like fish  vegetables  and other local delicacies time and time there will be train passing by to the mongklong station a photo worthy place was here while we drove to hua hin

title: Skytrain right in the centre
review: Easy access during my stay at SLEEEP Bkk Silomjust infront of the amazing capsule hotelu have 4 exit direct to the hotel i was staying Silom Mall Complex patpong n night bazaar Every time if i come to Bangkok I will stay in this areaand perfect accessibility even to go to the riverside Good service of BTS here always punctual

title: A continuation of our exploration above Bangkok.
review: A continuation of our exploration above Bangkok This attraction lost a star because of the length of the walk between the 2 linking platforms      Cheap & cheerful 45 Baht one way from the start of the link Praya Thai to the Airport I was impressed by the safety on the platforms Automatic barriers impeding access to the rail Opening when the train doors were aligned  The platform staff attentive & making sure that the elderly & infirm got seats As the Skytrain very crowded

title: Easy on the ways
review: The MRT is very important for you go around to Bangkok and have many distination too The station are convenient and comfortable when you wanna go All staff is very nice and helpful when guest have a problem For me MRT is very nice and have many ways for your connec to change to sky train So i very like it 🚊🚆🚅🚄🚈🚃🚋

title: Cheapest and quickest way to the CBD - city of Bangkok
review: I would recommend the Rail Link over taxis if arriving in the day It beats the traffic and takes you into the city From the end of the line you can catch a taxi to your hotel It is easy to buy a ticket so make sure you check it out It s also a good way to connect with the hustle and bustle of Bangkok )

title: Fast and convenient
review: Take the skytrain is a breeze from the airport It can get a little crowded at certain station The skytrain can take a while to arrive so be patience

title: great if you are young, fit and un-encumbered with luggage, pushchair, etc
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok  it is quick and clean It has just one great big disadvantage  It you are elderly disabled carrying luggage or a pushchair then make sure you are good for at least 100 steps up and down at almost any of their stations Some stations have an escalator  up only with a slightly better than even chance it is working  However that only gets you to the ticket office  It is another 50 steps up to the platform   There are no down escalators so it is always at least 100 steps down  Great if your knees are less than perfect  Awkward if you have a pushchair or a case Very few stations have elevators For a relatively modern system the poor access is a scandel

title: Very convenient, cheap and simple
review: The Bangkok SkyTrain was surprisingly easy to use You get where you need to go  it is well connected to interesting areas throughout town it's cheap and effective and it gives you a good view Used in combination with the river boat transport system it is the best way to get around when sightseeing shopping and so on  Apart from the fact that it is an excellent means of transportation it is also quite impressive on its own and it is very easy to use

title: Airport to 100 yards from the hotel.
review: Clean quiet cheap and beautifully organised If every destination were like this travelling would be heaven 40 minute trip for 1 dollar

title: Fun way to travel
review: I could have booked a flight to Chiang Mai from Bangkok or take the overnight train but the day train is really nice and relaxing to do All those villages and rice fields passing by Cabin was just fine with airco in train service was above expectation with food and drinks No big deal but better than I expected It's long about 11 hours but I arrived relaxed and got some reading done ) Price is about 650B at the moment of writing Higher than the rates in the LP

title: Very convenient
review: Took this for the 1st time during current trip  Made getting tofrom the airport a breeze and you avoid hours of traffic

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Is clean air conditioned and cheap Being above the street gives you a great view of the city  Don't miss this way to get around the city

title: Easy to use
review: A great way to travel and avoud the busy traffic Easy to navigate clean airconditioned Great for travelling to and from the airport to the weekend market or jumping between central Siam Asok National Stadium Highly recommended way of travelling around Bangkok

title: Great way to get around + excellent aircon system.
review: We soon found the skytrain a fast clean cool economical way to get about Bangkok Sometimes a bit crowded but out of rush hour plenty of seats Nice views compared with street level too

title: Far less stressful than getting a cab to and from the airport
review: Only opened a few years the airport rail link offers convenience and relative comfort travelling high above the often gridlocked streets on Bangkok Originally there were two services express and city lines but now there is only the city line which takes around 25mins from the first stop to the airport or vice versa Very cheap it connects to the sky train or MRT subway systems at several stations but for the sake of security you may have to open your luggage transferring between two which is a hassle If the weather is bad or you’re worried about timing then it’s far safer to take this train than a taxi to and from the airport Staff are helpful and speak enough English to understand basic questions

title: Cheap easy transportation
review: The bts is a really great way to get around bangkok Especially on those busy Friday's when the traffic is unbearable Only downfall is that is doesn't run 247

title: Excellent way to see this sprawling city.
review: Cheap and great aircon  The downside is how packed it can get  You can barely move with arms going everywhere as we hurtle forward trying to steady ourselves  Perhaps more services should be running on certain days

title: Like a hop
review: It's quick and convenience but the express' schedule is not that easy It's is every 30 min between 6am til midnight That means earlymorningdeparture passengers and latenightarrival passengers can not access the service Last time I have to run to the train from arrival area with 20+ kg dragging luggage and 7+ kg carryon to catch the last train

title: Fun and unique experience!
review: Definitely a unique experience Not sure it's a MUST but really cool to see how the countryside looks and the type of markets still exist and are utilized by many It's a bit of a drive there and back and of course lots of typical tourist traps and shops however if you just accept it which you should you can make a fun experience

title: Bangkok's BTS
review: The BTS is very efficient convenient and clean The convenience is even more if any tourist are staying along the Sukhumvit belt The line services Sukhumvit very well stopping at key shopping centres along the way You can even take the train to catch the boat to Iconsiam Shopping Centre Try to avoid peak hours though as it can get packed However the Thais are very disciplined and form very neat lines to wait for the train

title: Must see to believe
review: Incredible absolutely amazing  One of the most unique experiences of my life An entirely different way of life This is a must see tour

title: Great service to save you from expensive Taxi
review: Its totally hassle free You have to take ticket from vending machine There are no security checking like india which saves a lot of time and the speed and connectivity is good it connects to MRT and Airport rail Link also and mainly runs along the main area of Sukhumvit A must take ride

title: Easy to use to get from Survanabhumi Airport to city
review: Trains departs from basement area at Survanabhumi Airport and travels to Phaya Thai station where you can transfer to other lines As train starts at the airport it is easy to get seating but there is no dedicated area for luggage so not recommended for anyone with more that 1 suitcase Travelled mid morning on a Saturday and trai never got crowded

title: A good solution for escaping the street's heat
review: New modern urban line easily organized for tourists it's easy to make your way buying tickets getting in despite the lots of people Air conditioned so you almost don't want to get off it and head back to the suffocating heat under

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: It doesn't cover too much of Bangkok unfortunately But it leads you to big shopping malls and some of the city's many sights A little bit crammed in thw wagons but good AC

title: Simple and easy!
review: Bangkok has one of the easiest subway system I'm always confused and lost when I try to ride subways in foreign countries While visiting Bangkok I followed my friend around who is a local there and he taught me how to ride the BTS while traveling alone It's so simple You either go one way or the other You can use the kiosk to buy tickets and it's cheap compared to other countries The BTS is air conditioned so it will keep you cool until you get off ) I would definitely recommend using the BTS rather than wasting time while sitting in Bangkok traffic

title: Fast and reliable
review: Along with bts the best way to move around city of Bangkok Lines are expanding and more stations are being added to entire network Very crowded during morning and afternoon rush hours

title: Way better than a NYC subway
review: The train system itself was very easy to figure out We only speak English and are not city people by any means so even thinking about taking the train was a big deal for us The signs all had English subscript and the ticket machines had an English option The tellers in the booth spoke decent English as well It was very easy to figure out where you are and what train to take to get to where you want The price is way cheaper than what you would pay for taxi and is the faster option as well People were very respectful on the train I saw the young give up their seats several times for mothers with children or older people It was a million times cleaner than a NYC subway It was air conditioned as well

title: The best transportation
review: Bangkok the city of traffic you will not find a better way to travel in Bangkok then to travel by the BTS The price is good and it's very clean

title: Crowded
review: Excellent service if you know where you need to get off It is always crowded during rush hour But it is good to see that longer trains are being added to the system

title: So comfortable
review: In the heat of bustling Bangkok this is a great way to travel if the limited number pf lines suits your destination It is clean the commuters are very orderly and the air con is very effective and very welcome Various passes are available to suit your needs or just but a single ticket and enjoy the experience The only fault is that effectively there are only 3 lines (north south and east) and they only cover a limited choice of destinations but if they work for you then I would recommend the Skytrain as a means of transport

title: Very convenient to reach the airport and avoid traffic.
review: Decided to use this means of transportation to reach the airport and avoid heavy traffic at that time of the day It took me exactly one hour from Chongnonsi station to the airport with connection at BTS Siam station Convenient and cost effective

title: Very easy and convenient
review: Excellent service the best way to get around bangkok Better to get the rabbit card (prepaid transportation card)  if you are planning to stay a few days so that you can avoid the long queues to buy a ticket each time

title: A great alternative to the busy traffic
review: Very easy to use All the signs are in english and the fares are quite reasonable  It certainly beats sitting in Bangkok traffic not moving

title: Easiest Way to Go to Airport & Downtown Bangkok
review: The easiest and cheapest way to get to Downtown Bangkok and Airport For just 35 baht to Makassan you can get to the Airport Compare that to 500 Baht via Taxi and Traffic

title: Another wise choice than taxi
review: Similar to BTS it's wiser to choose MRT than taxi if you want to avoid the terrible traffic jam while travelling in the city

title: Great way to the city, avoiding the heavy traffic on ground
review: We traveled via the ARL from Suvarnabhumi Airport to our hotel  This is super convenient if your hotel is located near any BTS Metro or ARL stations as the ARL stations have interchange stations linking to the BTS and Metro lines  This was a good choice cheap and fast  We didn't have to waste time sitting in a taxi  Took us about 50 mins from the airport to our hotel instead of approx 90 mins by taxi (according to our hotel's advice)    ARL THB40 per pax and Taxi approx THB450550    Conclusion Taking the ALR is both efficient in time and cost Whoots

title: Cheap, easy and clean
review: Once you figure out how to use the skytrain you will never walk a few blocks again  It is super cheapthe cheapest trip is 15 Baht

title: Cheap, fast and safe way to move around the city
review: The BTS is the obvious choice for moving around town Best of all Contrary to the experience with most Western cities this train is clean fast and SAFE  Itineraries are well laid out on notice boards and a voice reminds you in Thai and English were you stop and what the next stop is going to be Practically foolproof Going by taxi will take you much much longer if you do not carry much luggage the BTS is your best option In this tropical heat the train powerful Air Conditioning is also a refreshing addition

title: Hassle Free
review: Just a few minutes walk within the airport you find the ARL reached Pratunam at a quick pace and the announcements are very clear so you can get ready when your desired stop is nearing Would recommend all travelers to use the Airport Rail Link

title: Great airport transit!
review: With this direct train link from Suvurnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai station navigating Bangkok from the airport is made easy You don't have to hail a cab and pay inflated fare The trip to the airport to Phaya Thai station is faster than getting a cab as well It will just take more or less 2030 minutes and it only costs 48 baht

title: Daily travel
review: I use the MRT daily to go from my home suburb to to nearest BTS station  The service is fast efficient and carriages clean  Trains usually arrive within 6 mins  The MRT is often packed with office workers between 730 and 10 am daily and in the evening from about 530 pm till around 8 pm  At those times one is squashed like a sardine

title: Easy way to get to central Bangkok
review: The Airport Rail Link is very easy to access at the airport  The kiosks do a good job of explaining the use  It is a very inexpensive way to get to city center

title: Good
review: Most stations are next to shopping malls evening time is so crowded Good prices between stations but Long station price is same as the taxi

title: Limited coverage but more spacious and cheaper
review: The difference between BTS and MRT is that MRT runs underground And there is one line It has 18 stations and stretches for 20 km in a horseshoe shape from Hua Lamphong in the South (near Chinatown) to Bang Sue in the north Trains arrive every 57 minutes and connect to the BTS Skytrain at Sukhumvit and Silom stations So that mean you can't get lost taking the MRT just alight and hop over the opposite line you took the wrong line

title: Fast and save moneytake it
review: It located at the basement of the airport If you want a fast and cheap transport take it but you must know wether your hotel near any station

title: Great connectivity and efficient
review: I stayed in Bangkok for four days as a tourist and made sure that I traveled only through the BTS Skytrain and the Underground Metro The BTS is cheap and efficient Just choose where you want to go insert coins collect your ticket and go It can get crowded almost all the time but it is worth it

title: BTS Trip in Bangkok
review: BTS is metro and it can be recommended as one of the best and safe metropolitan in the world Comfortable very clean with air con and very well safe by a security service present at all time

title: The best connection to city center
review: Fast clean cheap not overcrowded connection to Phaya Thai where you can take a taxi hop on a bus or BTS For those who prefer public transport the most recommended choice

title: easy ride
review: very easy just like the subways in HKG and Shengzen and better than London simple to navigate with English

title: Great
review: Fast service and very cheap only $1 to centre of Bangkok Took approx 15 minutes Will be using it again Not issues with bags

title: Just fabulous
review: Yet another example of great public transport in an Asian city Clean trains and platforms awesome punctuality smiling service at the stations (if you need help that is) fantastic frequencythe works Try staying near one of the BTS stations and don't take cabs or tuk tuks

title: Easier than it looks!
review: It's easier than it looks Even for someone traveling alone perfect to get around as the traffic is soooo bad here

title: Market tour
review: Victor was a fantastic guide and really cared about the group having a good time  The driver was smooth and made the ride comfortable  Highly recommend this tour The lunch recommendation was amazing

title: Better take taxi if you are in a group
review: I would say the price is not cheaper than taking taxi if you are more than 1 person better take taxi For example I and my friend took BTS from chinatown to siam the total cost about 90 baht for 2 people If I take taxi it only costs about 80+ baht Just a recommendation if you are a solo traveler it is a best choice of transportation in bangkok but not for those who travel with more than 1 person

title: Really good!
review: This sky train is up there with the best in SEA It's very fast clean and convenient The only criticism would be the signage in the stations they only add more confusion to an already chaotic crowd

title: Easy & cool
review: May is simply too hot n humid month to be in Bangkok even though their BTS system is well air conditioned Temperatures compares to the oilutside is much different got to be aware of sudden cooling n rising on your body  Other than that BTS is quite convenient to get around

title: First transport
review: As you know bangkok is busy city  Not easy to go here to there because of traffics   Sky train is best transport system and first to travel  Like it a lot

title: Traffic
review: Very good to change places in Bangkok  Much better than taxis or Tuk Tuk with the big traffic and the smog   I recommend to take BTS  Amazingly clean and quite between thousand of people   Many other cities who have metro should learn the behaviour of Thais travelling on public transportation  They are the best  They are clean  quite and nice people

title: People mover
review: BTS is very good at moving large crowds Always able to find a station It's one of the best sources for zipping around Bangkok

title: Thai train Bkk to Yala
review: I boarded at Surat Thani (to Hat Yai) already 90 minutes late train broke down at Khuan Niang (40km from Hat Yai) Staff told us to leave train no help was offered or alternate transport provided I will never again use Thai Rail only the commuter link from Hat Yai to Pedang Besar going to Malaysia

title: Convenient but always too many people
review: Their BTS service connected to main shopping and attraction areas was perfect for tourists You need coins for ticket purchase and always lot of people at the counters Perhaps they have weekly pass you can check out at the their website   At any time the trains are full So be patience and be ready to squeeze inside the train during peak hours   Most of the exits are connected to main shopping mall so that's makes it very convenient for walking during sunnyrainy day

title: A great, inexpensive way to explore Bangkok
review: The BTS is always clean efficient cheap on time & easy to navigate Even during peak hours although it is very crowded it still seems to run smoothly The staff are helpful & the ticketing machines are plentiful The trains are air conditioned which is essential in Bangkok I have been offered a seat several times which is something I have not experienced at home The queues for the incoming train are orderly & the upcoming station is announced clearly & in plenty of time to organise exiting the train The majority of hotels seem to be located within reasonable distance from a station The one day pass is great value  if out for a day of shopping It can be used up until midnight in case you still have enough energy to go out again for dinner or a show

title: Excellent
review: save time and money get the airport rail link just 45 baht and 40 minutes where a taxi can cost you 10 times that and more plus traffic is horrendous  especially in the evening rush hour

title: A direct link to the airport.
review: From Phaya Thai which is very close to Victory the rail link takes around 3040 mins It costs around 45baht to reach the airport from there Train comes at regular intervals

title: Covers a long distance for only 45 Baht
review: Very cheap to get to and from the airport  I wish they thought of people carrying luggage when they interchange to other lines  Beware of lots of steps

title: Fast transport,  but avoid rush hours
review: It's fast and frequent  somewhat expensive for Bangkok (~30b) Avoid rush hour 17h to 19h and 21h It's airconditioned

title: Fast, inexpensive and safe
review: We took the airport express train to Phaya Thai where we caught the BTS to our hotel  The 2 trains are separate and you have to pay separately as well  It was fast clean safe and inexpensive  Much better than sitting in traffic  I believe it cost us about $5 per person vs $35$40 for a cab

title: Escape the Bangkok jam with this train
review: The notorious Bangkok traffic jam can be very annoying if you are on a tight schedule and need to get to the airport fast I take the train to the airport during my business trips to circumvent the jam in the city

title: Best way to get into BKK Central and beat the traffic!
review: For all visitors to BKK don't bother about getting a taxi tofrom the airport (unless your hotel is providing transfers for free)  just hop on the airport rail link for a quick stress free and easy ride into town watch the scenery of bangkok city life go by as you ride the elevated tracks through BKK suburbs and then into the city centre

title: Sky train
review: Fast  clean & easy to use  Stations are numbered so easy to work out where you are going  Buying tickets from machines very straight forward  Can be busy at peak times but trains ate air conditioned so it's not a problem

title: Reliable and Convenient
review: Bangkok MRT is very convenient clean and reliable I am always using the MRT every time I visit Bangkok

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: What an affordable airconditioned way to get around the city  Sadly the route is still quite limited but we were able to visit many sights and shopping malls on the Skytrain   We were so relieved that all signage is also in English so it really is easy to use

title: Great transport in Bangkok
review: To travel around BKK city the BTS Skytrains are comfortable fastcheap and has Air Conditioning BTS gets you to most places a tourist would need to go to but avoid the peak hours where it is very crowded BTS is better than taking taxi

title: Clean and convenient
review: The BTS Skytrains are a convenient way to travel around Bangkok downtown as most attractions within Bangkok are walkable to a BTS station It would be better if the airport rail and MRT could use the same payment system so one would not need to keep buying tokenstickets when changing modes of transport

title: Super fast and convenient!
review: Loved this method of travel Definitely my favorite because it's super cheap and fast It is also very clean Highly recommend using it Be careful of the stations that allow you to switch between lines (from Sukhumvit line to Silom line) it can be very confusing The staff are super helpful though so don't be afraid to ask if you can't figure it out

title: The Best Half-day Tour ever! ❤️
review: It was an amazing experience We enjoyed a lot and had so much fun The tour is quite fast paced but a very informative one We learned a lot about Thailand's cultural landscape The tour guide Ms Kiwi has been generous enough to share her knowledge and tips when talking to the locals Ms Kiwi is  very friendly and with good skills also  in taking travel photos 😁 She did a very good job I admire Thai people's politeness and how they value paying respect Floating market Railway market and a padldleboat experience Totally worth it for a halfday tour This tour is a musttry ❤️👌

title: Be Aware!
review: Fast efficient and easy service to the airport  but be aware  the airport link is only running every 40 minutes at the moment  so make sure you are leaving in plenty of time to get to the airport (especially if you are departing)  The seats are comfortable there's plenty of room for you and your suitcases  Great way to beat the traffic

title: Skip the taxi
review: Spent 70thb from airport to my hotel destination On way from my hotel back to airport this shuttle was not yet operating as it was 330am so I had to take a taxi for 440thb

title: Excellent for train fans
review: Much of the WWII built railway is still in use with an olderstyle diesel train running several times a day Towards the northernmost existing part of the railway (the end towards Myanmar  Burma was pulled up) is some lovely scenery and the train will have plenty of locals travelling There are also some interesting cuttings and trestle bridges (including a very long curved one along the edge of the river) to be seen At this point the train moves very slowly due to the roughness of the track and the steep curves Most tourists just take it between 2 stops to cross the bridge as they're on limited time It's possible to take  the 'tourist' version of the train the whole way from Bangkok to Kanchanaburi and back the weekends

title: No more traffic jam
review: If you want to avoid the famous Bangkok jam and have a better control of your time the Airport Rail Link is the answer for you  It takes only 30 mins from Makkasan station to the airport  From Makkasan you can go to Sukhumvit station which is next to it and from there it is only 1 stop from Asok BTS station Very convenient and reasonable priced Saved a lot of time

title: Above It All
review: Bangkok traffic frightens meboth in quantity of drivers and the quality of their recklessness  Now you have a choice to the airport spend $250 and spend one hour on the Skytrain or spend $20 and take your chances  Airport to Patthai to Asoke or Nana and you are now in the middle of Bangkok  Its that simple

title: CROWDED - But this is Bangkok
review: It is very busy  When your slide your card in to be admitted do not throw it away you need it to exit Did I say it can get crowded  It is a lot of young professionals

title: Easy and Awesome
review: 35 baht from the airport to the city  Best way to get out of the airport without being rippedoff by the cabbies

title: Good, efficient and fast
review: The Airport Rail Link is the most convenient cheap and fastest way to travel from the airport to the city centre  The trip takes under 30 minutes and the trains run frequently

title: Great experience
review: it was an amazing experience our guide Mr T told us about the thai culture and the local costumes and did everything so we can enjoy  the visit to the train market and floating market

title: Skytrain fast and clear
review: We all travel on the Skytrain as a family was so easy to ride fast and clean Had no problems getting around by the train People on the platforms were helpful to guide us where to get on and off

title: Fast and reliable
review: It is very easy to use right from BBK You get a token which you must use to open gates in and out Trains are modern fast and with AC You can transfer to the Metro line if you need to get to Silom or Hua Lampong thus avoiding the city traffic

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok.
review: Very convenient route and popular use in Bangkok escape Bangkok traffic jam and save your time Great way for toutist

title: A really convenient way to get to the airport
review: A cheap fast and reliable way to get tofrom the airport Also you can observe the change of the city from the center to the suburbs

title: A great way of transportation
review: When visiting Bangkok and you are up to other means of easy and quick transportation across the city the sky train is an excellent choice It is cheap and it will get you nearly anywhere you want to go Hop on on one end of the city and get out on the other and finish your trip with a tuktuk

title: very easy to use - never full and if you are near to it - just use it - best and most economic way to airport
review: I used it from Asok  it was empty and most eco to airport  very clean and fast  brings you directly to the terminals

title: Empty
review: At 1000 am I was the sole occupant of the airport express 100 THB from Suv airport to Makkasan terminal Carried my luggage with me Very comfortable train with separate luggage racks At Makassan the huge station was almost deserted A couple of thai youths followed me Came to the bottom level and asked for a cab No cabs around One cab asked for THB 150 to go to nearby Pratunam When I insisted on meter he drove away Next cab after 5 min also flat price then went by meter cost THB 60 only

title: Good experience
review: Very good lady tour guide (Sara)  She will ensuring things to be place and provide refreshment for everyone as well   We are well taken care by the tour guide

title: Great Public Transportation System
review: The BTS is the perfect way to move around in Bangkok because is clean fast and people is respectful and friendly It does get crowded at some moments of the day but is pretty similar to what you will have in some other cities

title: Recommended
review: Easily interchangeable with BTSMRT Lines Trains were running uninterrupted and very ideal mode of reaching townairport

title: Effectiv
review: To travel with the skytrain is a very good way to move in Bangkock No traffic jam fast in time and the newer wagons are airconditioned

title: fast comfort
review: It's very convenient if you can get where you're going from the station which is quite near the Monument of Victory The speed is well worth it if you plan in advance for your airport transit

title: Clean and easy to navigate
review: Amazingly clean airconditioned plenty of seats and very easy to navigate once you figure out whether you're heading north south east or west

title: Fast, cheap and accessible
review: The Skytrain is great it takes you all over Bangkok in no time I don't remember ever waiting more than 5 minutes for a train in either direction I would recommend taking the train to all of your destinations it's a fast easy and cheap way to get around Bangkok

title: Excellent way of getting Around
review: The BTS Skytrain is the best Y of getting around Bangkok it is cheap fast and connects most places you want to get to

title: Catch a sky train
review: Don't even hesitate The skytrains are easy and very convenient It's a relatively small network but if you can change up your trip from the road to a sky train then don't hesitate You can get to major markets and shopping centres  They are airconditioned and clean A must

title: An experience in Bangkok
review: We used the BTS from the MBK shopping centre and it costs about 60 baht for 2 people for a single journey back to the Taksin Bridge were we got the boat back to the hotel  The BTS is popular with lots of people it is cheap clean and very good value for money The journey did not take long and there is a voice over the intercom which tells you what station you are approaching  Try the BTS if you in Bangkok

title: Kind of Mid.
review: The Tour guide was generally polite and genial Arguably the best part of the trip is the Railway market and as many others have stated the stay here is far too short In our case it was a scant 25 minutes it’s a shame because although it is a bit touristy the market does actually seem to be authentic  The floating market on the other hand (where we spent approximately 15hrs) is literally just a tourist stall sitting on a dirty canal The same hawkers selling the same generic tourist goods that you can find anywhere in Bangkok Also do yourself a favour they’ll take you to a restaurant at the floating market  advised to exercise caution Me and some of group watched staff clean dishesdishrags in the river  The journey to and from the locations also was quite cramped (11 adults in one minivan)  Conclusion Take it or Leave it

title: MRT in Bangkok
review: Efficient on time and a super way to get around the city It runs like clockwork and is clean and safe along with the skytrain a rally fast way to get around and so cheap too

title: Fastest way to travel in the heart of Bangkok
review: Pros Fast Reliable Easiest way to get around Bangkok Cons Not cover all the areas of Bangkok Could be very busy during rush hours

title: A very simple system
review: This is a mode of transport that while in Bangkok you should really use it a day pass is recommended I think we paid under 500BHT for 3 tickets Very cheap and easy to use

title: Only English!
review: Very confusing train but once you get the hang of it it isn't too bad Not many English people use it so you do stick out a bit but the ticket office is very helpful

title: very efficient way to get around bangkok
review: the skytrain is an obvious way to get around bkk especially if you are going to places that are served by the skytrain simple to use and reasonably priced

title: A great way to travel
review: The Skytrain network in Bangkok is such a great way to get around as the traffic network is usually in gridlock and can be very frustrating  The Skytrain offers a cheap clean safe and very efficient option to get you to many of Bangkok's attractions

title: Not in the rush hour...!!
review: Brilliant way of getting around Bangkok clean cheap and air conditioned it offers an affordable way of travelling around the sights of Bangkok It doesn't take you to all the main tourist attractions but will get you pretty close

title: Clean, fast and scenic!
review: This is definitely your best bet to get to and from t he airport We took a taxi the first time and would not recommend that Do keep in mind that there's no bathroom on this thing

title: Good and Quick
review: The station was literally 5 minutes away from my hotel and it was a very clean and quick way of travelling Cheap as well

title: One of the best Sky train in Asean country.
review: The Thailand government improving their mass transportation time by time I always took BTS to visiting the tourist attraction during visiting Bangkok Time by time BTS connecting stations the BTS has growth to more tourist attraction and shopping mall You can easily go to such Asiatique Chatuchak weekend market chinatown Bangkok night life shopping mall and many palaces with Bangkok BTS skytrain and safer than took taxi or tuk tuk If about cheap or not BTS compare with Taxi or Tuk Tuk is depending to how many persons you are And to whom who arriving and departing fmto Suvarnabhumi airport can take BTS and MRT interchange at Phayathai station But  specially Don Mueang airport looks the BTS rail still on progress perhaps connecting in 12 years a head

title: Easy and fast
review: Easy way to go around in Bangkok and avoid the jams Cheap and affordable Might be a bit crowded during peak hours

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: The Bangkok central district traffic is appalling and the only way to get around it is to use the skytrains The trains are clean instructions and signs are also in English and what's more the trains are air conditioned

title: Sky train east and cheap to use!
review: Easy to use Helpful staff when you don't know what you are doing or where you are going Gets you were you want to go without the traffic hassle

title: Awesome day trip
review: Awesome trip and Alex was a great guide Little bit of a bus ride to and from but worth it Definitely for tourists but an experience you should have The price was good for what you get

title: A good way to get around
review: Bangkok subway system doesn't share tickets or travel cards with BTS or airport rail normally 1 station transport is 16thb

title: Reliable and fast
review: Cheap and efficient form of transportation You get to beat the crazy traffic and reach your destinations quite quickly It does get a little crowded during peak hours but the frequency of the trains are good and the public are considerate and queue up outside the doors

title: Very convenient!!!
review: Its fast on time main thing is you dont have to sit in the Bangkok Traffic The price is a little expensive if you take the direct train but if you take the indirect one which have around 4 to 5 stops in between barely takes 45 minutes and its very cheap

title: different all together
review: Boarding in sky train in Bangkok is a different experience all together Starting from Ticketing system to stations and its connections is just too good

title: Cheap and Convenient Mode of Transport
review: It's fuss free cheap and convenient to take the airport rail link  The train in comfortable and offers a smooth and traffic free ride to the city

title: Cheep, fun and safe way to get around the city.
review: Cheep fun and safe way to get around the city try to avoid early mornings and early evenings this train get packed however it's still fun and very safe Thai people are very circuitous

title: excellent way to get around Bangkok
review: Best way to avoid the horrible traffic if they go near where you need to go We had a hotel right next to Surasok stop so it was perfect for many of our trips

title: Much better than a Taxi
review: Bangkok traffic is terrible Peak hour lasts 23 & 34 hours and is bad enough to make me want to leave   The Skytrain is the solution  Trains are constant clean air conditioned and fast  Once we figured out how it works (and it’s not hard) getting around Bangkok became much easier   The skytrain links with the normal trains as well as the River Ferry  My only criticism would be that I found it hard to find a decent route map online Once we got a hard copy from the station then all was well An example Our Hotel to Christmas lunch by Taxi took an hour and 15min On our return we took a Ferry to the station the the Skytrain and then walked 5 mins  Total trip was 35mins

title: On time, convenient, clean and cheap.
review: I travelled on the first train at 604am from Phaya Thai on a Sunday and was very pleased how easy it was Phaya Thai is the first station on the line and it took 30 mins exactly to get there The train left on time was super clean and only cost 45Bht

title: Easy to get around Bangkok
review: The rail system is relatively new in Bangkok (10 years I believe)  Cheap easy to navigate  You might consider this mode of transport  to get from the Airport to the City as it took us 2 hours by cab (traffic was horrendous)

title: Easy and quick
review: Not too much to say here really the process is quick and easy The rail is actually a sky rail so you get to your destination quickly and you also get to view some of Bangkok that you wouldn't see from down below   Safe for all

title: Great value, clean, fast and efficient
review: I found this service fabulous and recommend it as a great way to get to and from the airport into central Bangkok Very good

title: Easy to use
review: Cheap clean and easy to use A local man was extremely helpful and walked us to our destination Map easy to read

title: Efficient service
review: We bought a day ticket but realised afterwards that the this doesn't cover MTS The trains are all air conditioned (very welcome) but usually crowed as they don't run as frequently as what we are used to at home but still a good service and value for money

title: Nice tour
review: The tour was nice Our tour guide was nice and gives us information of the location as the bus drives pass it The floating market was cool to see Overall the tour was nice but definitely not something that needs to be done again It’s more of a one time thing

title: Cheap getting around
review: Great way to get around in Bangkok but can get very very crowded

title: Super easy
review: We used the BTS throughout our entire stay in Bangkok affordable and easy  Takes you to all major sites and shopping sites At first you do have to get use to the directions but the peopel at the ticket stands could usually help you find your way

title: Super convenient way to travel
review: AC trains that run quickly and often easy machines to purchase tickets in (coins only) friendly people around that help you if needed

title: A great way to get around and cheap
review: Once you have mastered the ticket and pricing  this is a quick and easy way to get around the areas in Bangkok that it services

title: Comfortable ride from airport to Novotel
review: Took the airport link and it was about half hour ride to Novotel (5 min walk from station) for 40 bhat The train is clean  they actually do security check and clean the train once it arrives into the station Comfortable ride though you need to be careful if you are carrying big bags as the trains do get a bit crowded There are Space to store your luggage so that they don’t get into the way

title: Efficient but very crowded!
review: We live in Bangkok and use this most days as it is a great way to get around the city particularly if you get a Rabbit Pass which avoids having to queue at ticket office or machine lines The trains are crowded at all times and very crowded during rush hours which leads us to believe that the should increase the number of trains as it can be very uncomfortable As mentioned in an earlier post Siam Station can be exceptionally crowded meaning a lot of times you will not get on the first train and have to wait for another

title: Good
review: Trains andnskywalks are really the best commuinities for countries like thailand Its just make the whole travelling experience much efficient Good job

title: Efficient way to get to the airport

title: Clean, fast and a very good way to get around in the city :)
review: The Bangkok Skytrain is different from the MRT which only goes underground and the Skytrain only goes above ground unlike in cities like Singapore and Vancouver where the two are just one and the train goes some part underground and some part above ground  Here the MRT is MRT and the Skytrain is Skytrain although you can switch from one to the other at two sets of stations one is Silom MRTSala Daeng Skytrain and the other is Sukhumvit MRTAsok Skytrain and so at these two locations when you switch from MRT to Skytrain you go out the MRT station then pretty much immediately above and the vice versa is by going out of the Skytrain station then pretty much immediately below  Also be sure that you know the "end station" in the direction that you're going whether you're on the MRT or on the Skytrain because that's how you know if you're going in the right direction  For example if you're going from Sala Daeng to Saphan Taksin by Skytrain (the Silom line) be sure to go in the direction of Bang Wa and if it's the other way around be sure to go in the direction of National Stadium  So the "end stations" for the Silom Line (Skytrain) are National Stadium and Bang Wa and those for the Sukhumvit Line (Skytrain) are Mo Chit and Bearing those for the MRT are Bang Sue and Hua Lamphong (also the main train station which is right above the MRT)  Another thing to know for the Skytrain as different from the MRT is you could only buy the ticket yourself at the machine (their service counters will only help you with change and if you have questions) whereas in the MRT you could buy the ticket from the service counters

title: Highly recommended.
review: Our Half Day Railway Market and Floating Market Tour was a great experience The hotel pickup was on time and was a welcome change from having to book a taxi or Grab and then dealing with traffic delays Our guide was animated informative and interested in finding out about everyone on board the mini bus en route to our first stop the Railway Market After a short tour through the market we experienced the packup of vendors' awnings and then waited for the arrival of the train Following that it was a short trip via the bus to the Floating Market which was nothing like we'd seen before Navigating on long boats through the canal's markets trying to avoid colliding with others was hectic but fun Thankfully someone experienced was steering We then had free time to have lunch and wander through the local adjacent markets before heading back into Bangkok Our drop off point was at the MBK Shopping Centre which has some great bargains and is also a good transport hub

title: Best way to travel
review: Have had lots of challenges with taxi getting one during peak hours one that would use the meter or know where your hotel is despite giving them the business card  They have tourist card with unlimited distance for a certain amount of trips and time frame single trip or just get the rabbit card and top it up as needed (80bht fee for the card) The card can also be used at some food court supermarket etc   BTS is the way to get around Take the train from the airport to Phaya Thai Station and switch to BTS if your hotel is near a BTS station Mo Chit BTS station is just 5 minutes walk from Chatuchak Weekend Market Siam BTS is where most shopping are and MBK is walkable from that station too  Gets crowded during peak hours but as tourist you can just plan your travel around that   Faster than getting stuck in traffic as your don't want to waste your vacation time in a taxi and safer for a solo female

title: Great Way to travel and beat the heat and traffic jams
review: It reminded us of Delhi Metro  the same design and look The only difference was that people were more disciplined even during peak rush hours and the pushing and pulling was missing The people were courteous and gave personal space Great way to travel and avoid Bangkok Heat and traffic The commute gets very fast  Our first travel required us to change from Subway (MRT) to Sky train and then interchange the lines at Siam Central Seeing us with small kids many advised us to take Taxi but we wanted the experience And it turned out to be real great There are ample signs the staff is very helpful and informative and guides properly There are info displays and signs everywhere One ride and even the children had got hang of how to get ticketstokens the travel routes the interchangesGood way to travel during evening rush hours

title: Inexpensive way to beat the lod thip (traffic jams)

title: A Must See

title: Quick Ride with Good Views
review: The Airport Rail Link is an express train which runs from the Suvarnabhumi (BKK) Airport (about 15 miles away from downtown) to centercity Bangkok and connects travelers to other transit options including the MRT (subwaymetro) BTS Skytrain and the BRT (Bus Rapid Transit) The ARL is an elevated line which allows riders a pleasant view along the way Most of all the train is very efficient with only eight stops getting from one end of the line to the other is quicker than one might imagine Trains typically arrive every 1518 minutes

title: Travel above the taxis!
review: It's well airconditioned clean and timely  What a way to travel

title: Fast, reliable and cheap
review: My title says it all It is fast (under 30 minutes to the city) reliable and cheap (only ~ US$ 3 per person) Don't bother taking a taxi (unless you insist) to go to the city from the airport you know how bad road traffic can be in Bangkok sometimes Not to mention the English standard of Bangkok taxi drivers are not very good at all

title: Over congested and warm
