review: So after a couple of weeks travelling with taxis and tuk tuks spending loads of money we discovered this Super efficient saved us time and a way cheaperfaster option to move in this city

title: Nice experience in Bangkok Markets
review: Good half day in the market  The guide was very nice but it was sometimes hard to hear what he was saying in the car due to the low volume of the mic And perhaps we felt a bit rushed especially for the train market (if you wanted to buy something you had to be quick otherwise you loose your group) But in general it was a very good day

title: Great way to get into the city
review: Definitely the way to go to beat out the traffic jams when traveling to and fro from the city and the airport

title: Great connection
review: I think it’s a really useful service it connects the main airport Suvarnabhumi International Airport (Bangkok) to the city in just 2025 min The service starts around 5 am finishing around 10 pm The trains we got were always in time  The last stop is Phaya Thai close to Siam Square It’s a great service

title: Fast , clean and comfortable option
review: used the BTS option few times during the recent visit to Bangkok A very effecient public transport system it is clean and comfortable A day pass costed 140THBs but the disappointing thing is that you cannot use the 1 day pass for MRT

title: Good idea, poor management
review: The actual train travel is not bad gets you downtown fast The overall experience from ticket purchase to station transport connections feels poorly planned and implemented For so many foreigners using this train you would think they have more English speakers available to help

title: convenient conncection
review: travel is easy in bangkok taxi is abundant the sky strain is close by the little bicycle van is fun to ride though kind of expensive

title: Interesting transport system
review: The Bangkok BTS (Bangkok mass Transit System) or Skytrain is a very fast low cost method of commuting around Bangkok it's clean efficient and covers two main routes across the capital The Sukhumvit line runs from the north (Mo Chit) through the centre (Siam) and onwards east to Bearing and the Silom line runs from the west (National Stadium) only one stop though through the centre (Siam) and onwards South and then over the Chao prayor river heading west to Bang Wa The whole system is currently under going extensions expanding the network further west and east You need to be able bodied and possess only light luggage however as a major design oversight is a lack of lifts or down escalators at most stations This oversight is being rectified by a current program of retrofitting lift systems at all stations Unfortunately the lifts will only carry you from the platform level to the concourse level (or vice versa) you will still have to carry your luggage and yourself down 3 flights of stairs to reach ground level at most stations It is a little disappointing that given the cost of retrofitting lift systems they didn't seem to consider decent access for disabled people or people with luggage

title: Economical but a little inconvenient
review: We have a condo near Makhasan Station and occasionally take the train to or from Suvarnhabumi airport when we travelAlmost everyone takes the City Line which is less than half the cost of express that onlt takes you to a couple stations I believe Why they even run the express is a mystery to me Hours of the train are approximately 6am to midnite so depends on when you arrive or depart as to whether train is option Depending on direction you are traveling from Makhasan taxis are either easy or a big hassle For instance our condo is just over 1000 meters from the station but to get to it taxis cannot turn right on Asok so have to take a long expensive ride through traffic Usually if we are coming from the airport we just take a metered airport taxi Going to the airport for us it's a better option

title: awesome way to get around town
review: you can get to downtown BKK from the airport using the skytrain it's easy to navigate and most of the instructions are in English they have day passes where you can use the skytrain all day I just wish they have something like 3 or 5 day passes

title: Perfect & Quick
review: When arriving at Suvarnabhumi International Airport this is by far the quickest and safest way to get to the centre of Bangkok It is clean safe and hassle free Just follow the signs from the arrival hall and you will easily reach the basement floor from where the Phaya Thai train link departs  arrives It cost only THB45 per person and the duration is approximately 30 minutes Of course also easy and quick if you have to travel from the city to the airport Very tourist friendly and  highly recommended

title: Beat the Bangkok Traffic
review: I lived and worked in Bangkok for a couple of years Getting from here to there is an art which depends on what transportation is available and the time of day Just like most cities morning and afternoon traffic is the worse Taking a taxi at 1200 PM is a good choice and taking the same taxi at 600 PM is insane    The BTS is part of the art of getting around Bangkok The originally two lines go NorthSouth and East West with a connection in Central Bangkok at Siam Station The Thais learned it is very difficult to make a subway system in Bangkok and the BTS System is being expanded extensively into the outer areas of the city    I recommend purchasing a toll card instead of waiting in line to buy the tokens There is a 100 THB deposit and a 100THB minimum to put on the card If you are in BKK for more than a day then get ahead on the card and then turn it in for a balance refund when you leave Be sure to look into how the subway bus taxis (car and motorcycle) and even canal boats can get you around Bangkok more efficiently

title: Convienent
review: Fast and easy way to get from the airport to Bangkok Great for first timers like myself Easy to purchase a ticket at the airport

title: Amazing!
review: Sarah is the best She made the experience unforgettable I would highly recommend this experience to anyone

title: Shopping Trip to BKK
review: Really impressed with the BTS metro Cheap fast & clean So much easier to move around without getting caught in BKK famous traffic Only thing is you need to have coins ready Fear not there's also a counter to help commuters to change coins and the staff are really helpful

title: The way to travel when in Bangkok
review: The BTS in Bangkok is the beat way to get around  Coupled with the underground rail it is both cheap and quick Is is easy to use and tickets for a person on holiday can use at a discounted price are available

title: Super Simple!
review: I can't speak Thai at all but I was able to enjoy the skytrain easily The ticket kiosks is in Thai or English and I knew where I wanted to go and purchased the ticket The hardest part was knowing with side to board the train so I studied the map on the wall before I went up the stairs

title: No cheaper way

title: BTS
review: In this month here weather is too hot and rays of the Sun is very strong like firing to us Even traffic is can't compare so best option is BTS

review: Bangkok has an excellent Skytrain called the BTS It's easy to use and the fastest way to get around and affordable It does however not cover select areas of Bangkok Most notably Kho San Road which is popular with the backpackers But it's a great way to get around

title: Fast way to travel to city
review: Airport Rail Link is an option for travelling to the city from Suvarnabhumi Airport It has been a few year since they offer only city line services (ie the express line has already been cancelled)  A tip for someone travelling during rush hours The Airport Rail Link will be very crowed (not recommend for someone travelling with big luggage)

title: Nice A/C!
review: Great way of getting around  Efficient clean great AC Much better cheaper and faster that cabs Easy

title: Convenient
review: Once you get to know how the system works is very inexpensive and convenient   First you have to know where you want to go Like other subway and metro systems you choose the name of the last station on that run  You need the exact change to buy your tickets  and there is a special counter called ticket office that will give you the change for the machines to buy the tickets  The number beside the station you want to go to is the price of your ticket Deposit your change  So if you want to go to Sala Daeng and 37 is beside the name then deposit 37 bahts   You must use your ticket to enter the system and it is required to get out of the system   General directional instructions are not always evident so you do have to search around   The places in Bangkok that you cannot reach by BTS can be reached by the river boats for 15 bahts per trip  Took a day to get comfortable with the entire system and from then on it was a breeze

title: Bangkok BTS - Limo on rails
review: Very convenient stops in the right places clean and cool Schedule is always on time I t connects with the MRT or Metro Rail which connects with the Airport System

title: An easy and affordable way to get around the city
review: Quick efficient way to get around Bangkok Many shopping malls are right off the many exits Does get quiete busy after lunchtime until late evening Tickets are cheap can get a day lass for 140baht

title: Reliable quality service!
review: Clean reliable fast and cheap   In fact forget using a Taxi or tok tok as the train will get there first at a fraction of the cost I have to say the service was unparalleled in every way Just like the London Underground putting you right in the heart of each location on time Loved it

title: Good way to get around
review: Good way to get around especially during rush hour although coverage limited  Need to have coins to use machines otherwise queue with ticket agents  Below portions of the system are elevated walk ways which are great to get above the traffic

title: Modern and easy to use.
review: Metal detectors and cursory bag inspection on entry a bit of a surprise but nice to know they care Fares seem cheap and you can buy a token for the trip or get something like London's Oyster Card  There are plenty of straps and poles if you don't get a seat at busy times The trains are quite frequent and were not crowded mid morning when I travelled to Hua Lamphong

title: Great way to get around!
review: Excellent public transport offering and it really is inexpensive All the staff at the stations were very helpful

title: Great System
review: Great train if your there a lot I would recommend getting a rabbit card easy to use and to recharge You can get anywhere from mbk to the river with ease

title: Easy Transport..!

title: Great way to get around the city

title: BTS

title: Well connected
review: Clean( interiors)   Clear( on announcements )  crowded (peak hours ) easy for any foreigner to travel

title: Good Transit System
review: A majority of our traveling was done on the MRT and BTS systems Both are extremely to navigate and very affordable There is an English option and you simply pick what station you need to go to and the fare is calculated  In hindsight I should have gotten the fare card instead during my stay  The line ups to the vending machine can range from non existent to 12 hour depending on the station You get a token where you swipe to enter the gates and upon existing you insert the token So don't lose your token

title: Excellent....at the moment!
review: Skytrain (or BTS as everyone refers to i) is the the cleanest cheapest and safest way to travel in Bangkok  albeit the network is limited but growing  In fact it is a victim of its success as "rush hour" now extends through much of the day  The trains are very frequent but still crowded  They should add a carriage to each train (the platforms are long enough and marked for extra carriages)  However still BTS should be your preferred means of transport in Bangkok

title: Excellent way to travel

title: Sky Train
review: We had a free tuk tuk from our hotel to the sky train for our first experience on this We were with a guide so she bought our tickets we were amazed at how clean the train and platforms were This is because nobody is allowed to eat or drink on them It did not feel at all intimidating in fact a very pleasant and reasonably charged way to travel

title: The best mode of transport in Bangkok

title: Getting BTS Sky train tickets
review: The BTS Sky train is a really convenient transportation mode It not only links up the major nodes of the city and also the popular shopping centers However it will be perfect if the counter in the station will sell tickets in particular for tourists not familiar with the tickets selling system  When we had our first ride by the train we were in a hurry and did not know how to get tickets from the ticket machine though it was easy to operate after the first try  So we showed our destination to the counter staff and prepare to buy tickets Unexpectedly she just told us the cost of the ticket and gave us back the exchange of coins implying that we needed to get the tickets from machine We were a bit astonished at that moment

review: Airport Rail Link (0600midnight) that connects downtown Bangkok with Suvarnabhumi International Airport is a smart alternative to the airport’s express buses or taxis  it is better because  you safe time and avoid traffic jam  and money   howere it is not work 24 HrsThe Airport Rail Link connects you to the MRT underground at Makkasan City Interchange Station (MRT Petchaburi Station) and the BTS Skytrain at Phayathai Station Please note the baggage checkin at Makkasan Station is no longer available From Bangkok International Airport (Suvarnabhumi) the entrance to the Airport Rail Link service is on the First Floor The ticket is 45 Baht it is  bad idea if you have heavy luggage

title: Beat the traffic jams with the BTS

title: A good way to get around
review: These trains get very busy bit like London Underground but a lot more reasonable 140 Thai Bart’s for a one day travel card very good value and run about every 5 minutes

title: Sara the smart one
review: The weather is hot Nonetheless sara serves us well with her tips and guidelines Enough time to take toilet too

title: On time transport with great site seeing
review: Had to go from Ayutthaya to the Cambodian border and wondered about 900 Bath each for private bus starting at 630 am and arriving at 6 pm State railway offered much better times with starting at 830 am 3 hour break at Bangkok and arriving 6 pm for only 60 Bath each Sure travelling 3rd class is a bit warmer than cold AC but the fresh wind from lots of open windows and great views at green landscapes was unexpected and worth it Train is much better than bus to explore the country

title: Easiest way into Town
review: Catch it in the lower part of the airport and it will take you direct to Phiyra Thai BTS station where you can easily get anywhere you need to go in Bangkok on the BTS or connect to MRT  If there are more than 3 in your group it will be cheaper to take a taxi but that can take up to 2 hours with traffic if your luggage is light take the Air Rail link

title: Much like you'd expect
review: fast easy way to get tofro BKK airport and downtown Different company that either MRT (subway) or BTS (skytrain) so no overlap with cards from either company

title: What a pleasure !!
review: It's funny to write a review about a train But we really want to share the way we feel  Once you figured out the way it works we didn't stop using the sky train  Got from one place to the other fast with no traffic jams and over charged Tuk Tuk rates We felt VERY safe and very "local"  Very clean and well maintained  At every station we could get good information in English  On the busy days we did lots of trips we bought daily tkts Saved some money Under the train rail we also used the walking path (in the same route) That saved us lots of time instead of walking on the busy pavement with all the food and souvenir sellers  The aircon on the train is too cold I'm always cold Took a light cardigan with me )

title: Easy fast and an experience
review: We were out off using the sky train at first but don't be afraid to ask for help we just presented a map to the ticket lady and she told us how much to put in the machine and when button to press  very easy to use so much faster across the city than by car and an experience to see everyone rushing too and from work

title: You better take this
review: You better take this or the subway otherwise you will be stuck in the cab and waste your precious time in Bangkok   Even on the "light" traffic day It ISN'T light Just use subway or skyline to get to the closest station to your activities then take a cab I really mean it

title: Very good way of transportation!
review: This is the best to move around Bangkok Each way is 31 baht like 1 usd and if you buy the full day is 140 baht and you can go  up and down as many times as you want It is easy to figure out and very clean Stations are always well located Just make sure you keep your back pack in the front be aware of pick pockets

title: The only way to move around Bangkok
review: Get yourself a rabbit skytrain pass if you plan on being in Bangkok for a few days or just buy a day pass for moving around The traffic is notoriously terrible at all times of the day and the skytrain is very easy to navigate

title: An easy way to get to airport
review: Traffic is terrible in Bangkok If it takes 45 minutes or 2 hour by taxi  is unpredictable Train is always at schedule In less than 20 minutes you are at Phaya Thai Here you may changed to BTS (Skytrain) which has stations all over the city And its cheap 45 baht compared to 4500 baht for at taxi

title: Nothing to do just transport
review: Airport rail link is busy as it goes during rush hours morning and evening for local to commute btw home and office Then travelers should be aware of these periods if you come with huge luggage It is no issue when catch a train from original (airport) but if you would like to get off somewhere along the line it would not be easy because of packed train If you get off at terminal station phayathai no issue By the way it is better choice than commute on the road because of unpredictable traffic Enjoy your stay and welcome to Bangkok the longest capital name in the world (try with google)

title: Great quick way to get round some parts of Bangkok - but take coins!
review: The Skytrain is a fantastic way to get around Bangkok though study the map as the two lines do not cover everywhere (Wat Phra Kaew and Wat Pho being two good examples) It's efficient clean and actually a bit more modern than a lot of the London Underground It's also super cheap  most rides were the equivalent of 30p  50p We didn't look into getting passes and just bought tickets as we went but do be prepared for the ticket machines  they only take coins so hold onto change you get for this purpose and sometimes the queues for the machines can hold you back 5 minutes There are manned windows too but bear in mind that when you go up with a note to pay for tickets they will often just give you change and ask you to then go use the machines which can mean queuing twice Much better to just hold onto coins throughout your day Also note that each station has a security check point once you are through the barrier  you need to remove any hats or sunglasses and if you have any bags you will need to let the security check the contents This is a quick process that is always polite and takes no longer than a few seconds

title: The best and fastest way to move around in Bangkok
review: Using Sky train it was very easy to move around and cheap A bit cold the air conditioning was very strong )

title: convenient
review: We used the airport rail link when we visited Bangkok by 2011 Very convenient from airport to city There are staffs you can ask if you are not sure which station your hotel is located but with their limited English

title: A best experience trip

title: User friendly - w/AC!

title: Quick and safe
review: Take a map to decide your direction before going Get coins to pay at the machine Usually less than 40 baths Very fast to go anywhere

title: Brilliant way to get around Bangkik
review: The rail link in Bangkok is one of the best I have been on The trains are clean and run on time The maps are clear and the cost is low compared to catching cabs etc I find the traffic chaotic in Bangkok however the trains are a much easier option

title: The Sky-train at my feet
review: The Sky train (and the subway) is a great boon in Bangkok   More than the price of cab travel it is the traffic at any time of the day that kills you To beat that Sky train is the  answer   The stations in Bangkok are very well organized with their signages   The ticket getting is mostly through self help kiosks If you are carrying 10 5 and 1 THB denominations (the only 3 coins accepted by the machine) in plenty you can beat the double queue that often lines up during the peak period to first get enough coins and then to stand in another line to get the tickets   A few stations have the benefit of subway and skytrain Asok (for skytrain and Sukhumvit for subway train) and Mochit (for skytrain and Chatachak market for subway train) are 2 such stations This is perhaps one reason why the Sukhumvit 15 to 22 area is popular for staying where you have Asok and Sukhumvit   You can sometimes have an issue if you are not familiar with how to handle the 'paper ticket' for getting into and out of the main departurearrival area When you are entering you have to put the ticket facing in the direction the arrow points in order for it to be accepted It comes out on top The moment you take it out the gate opens and you must rush through else it will close Similarly at the departure station put it into the slot facing in the direction of the arrow This time don't wait for the card to come out because now you have arrived at the destination The gate will open the moment the card is received So rush through   There are a few stations like Siam where there is a train interchange to travel on a different Skytrain In such a case the 2 train directions are typically on 2 different levels So ask where you have to go People are very helpful in guiding you   In the train you can sometimes have lack of clarity beforehand as to which side's gate will open Whilst they announce the side before one arrives sometimes due to crowds you need to know beforehand and start making your way the moment you leave the preceding station and before the announcement is made In that case please ask and do not assume   In one case we ended up buying a lower denomination ticket by mistake The ticket was not accepted at the arrival point However there was no penalty We were simply asked to pay the balance and move on   Oh and one more thing If you are carrying some baggage they happily allow you to pass through the manned security gate Simply walk there hand over your ticket to the security guy He will open the gate to pass you through take your ticket himself and pass it through the slots come out the regular way and hand the ticket back to you (if you are departing) or simply let you go (if you are arriving)   At some of the major stations there are a number of exits Please ask Information which exit to take Language is a barrier as most people don't understand or communicate in English so asking 'Information' is often the best bet   Enjoy your ride

title: Best Transportation

title: A cheap and speedy alternative to taxis
review: Naturally I missed my connection in Beijing so I was unable to take advantage of the limosine I'd hired for my arrival at Suvarnabhumi Airport and was left with a few options  I could use a taxi hire another car or take the Airport Rail Link  As I'm loathe to throw my money twice down the same pit and the taxis are notoriously dishonest I chose the Airport Rail Link and was glad I did  Cheap speedy clean and reliable  I got to my hotel much faster than if I'd gone by car  The signage for the rail is easy to follow within the airport and the ticket machines are easier to use than I had anticipated  I arrived at a busy time but found the Airport Rail Link to be pleasantly uncrowded and the trip to the city took in some nice views that I would have missed by car  I was pleased enough and comfortable enough that I used it again on my departure  Quite satisfied

review: I consider BTS SkyTrain Bangkok  is one of the best one if compared to other advance ones like in Singapore and Japan after I use it for years and years  1 It is very clean very rare i see there is paper plastics food remains etc 2 AC is always cool enough (well adjust during summer afternoon evening etc) 3 Available in 510 mins 4 Mostly the driver is experience and applying smooth break etc 5 The train style is still uptodate (not old model) 6 It is well maintained (no peel off paint no broken ads covers etc) 7 Seats for elder people mommy with kids pregnant women are functioned well where Thai culture still keep the tradition going on and applied 8 Very save (history) and they keep improving the station fence gradually This is the only point Faster better 9 The ads is always well positioned (means they evaluate the design etc) 10 Guards are always doing their job for guide the safety for everybody 11 Station cleanliness is always there i saw everyday somebody clean the floor and all fences parts 12 Most of staff in BTS is very polite patient helpful and friendly (ticketing security etc)   I love this facility and admire on how the management keep the service very stable and sustain very respective culture Bravo and Wish The Best  Regards

title: BTS
review: Bangkok's BTS sky train is the fastest way to travel in Bangkok If your destination is not near the BTS take BTS to the nearest stop along the BTS routes then take a taxi this is the fastest way to get to any destination You can hasten the boarding process by buying a "rabbit" card at the counter instead of only purchasing a one way fare at the machine or at the window You merely pass the card over the electronic window at the turnstile If in doubt how often you will travel buy a card for 200 baht

title: In Bangkok the train is your friend.
review: In my four day trip in Bangkok I found it that taxis get jammed up in the downtown area which the BTS also covers By US standards I think the BTS is a good quality train system it's punctual and easy to use It is not quite up to Tokyo standards but I don't think anywhere in the world is  I think if you are new to Bangkok the most straightforward way to get around is to take the train to the closest station to your destination and then walk or taxi from there That makes the BTS the best form of transport in Bangkok in my book

title: First class travel

title: Good to try

title: Very convenient and user friendly for non-Thai readers/speakers
review: Great way to get around Bangkok  Trains were always air conditioned and clean  Stations were also clean and staff spoke English so buy your subway fare cards at the ticket window

title: Best Public Transportation System
review: I went to bangkok in last monthAs usual in foreign country taxi and tuk tuk are expensive for travellers we use public transportation in bangkokMainly BTS and bus BTS stations are covered all over bangkok cityYou can walk to nearest station from your hotelThe ladder is easy to climb up to the station from the road All the road signs are very clear to read throughVery easy to buy the ticketThe ticket machine offer for english and thai language But one important thing here is you need to keep the ticket with you until you reach your destinationIf not you need to pay again to walk out from the barrier The air conditioned train is very fast to reach the stationsI think it took five minutes to reach from each station to next oneThe tv in the sky train always tell the current station name and next stopSo it's very convenient for the foreigners If you are a traveller with tight schedule to go to the places better taking sky trainBut if you want to feel the secenery and environment of bangkok I would like to recommend to take bus Thanks for reading

review: We loved this way of travel lots of new stations so you can get about easier The undergroiund is clean and air conditioned a real treat to get away from the heat Spotless and beautiful Cheap and easy to use

title: Bangkok's Best Transpo
review: With the traffic situation in Bangkok BTS really was so helpful to us during our 3week stay there Though most people use BTS you won't have problems as their system is so organized and all lines are linked and you don't need to walk long to catch a different line   The AC is so cold and the trains are so clean We never had problems travelling since they operate from 6AM12AM

title: Clean and prompt!
review: After falling for the SkyTrain we were hesitant to use the underground  But we were happily surprised by the neatness and ease of use  Sure there are crowds from time to time but all is very orderly  As new BKK residents we like the different areas that this subway goes and plan to use it frequently

title: Better by BTS
review: If you need to get around Bangkok this is far the best option Yes rush hour is busy but for the tourist it's fast non expensive and yes air conditioning To save time and trying to find your correct fare I recommend a Rabbit card Get these from the station as only takes a minute but will save you time and frustration working the ticket machines and queuing

title: Easy way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: We traveled from Rachaprarop station (second from the end of the line at town end) to Suvarnabhumi Airport There apparently is an express train with fewer stops but I was unable to find it Even with the regular commuter run the trip time was about 30 minutes The train platform rises several stories above ground level and escalators rise to the top level without problem though handling more than one piece of luggage plus having small children in tow could be a problem There is a very small elevator but it was "locked out" for some reason and token purchase (THB40) must be made on a middle level with the escalators needed for access to the train level Allinall the rail link is preferable to surface travel

title: Good efficient way to get around

title: Mr Philip Phillips
review: I've traveled many times to Thailand and BTS skytrain and I use it all time  clean and efficient Very quick and good service  The price of the fare very good

title: An excellent way to get around Bangkok
review: Bangkok traffic is infamous so if you want to get around easily use a combination of the two train systems (MRT & BTS) and the ferries  We were staying close to a BTS Station "Krung Thon Buri" so ended up using the BTS skytrain quite a bit during our most recent trip to Bangkok The BTS Skytrain covers most of the city so will either get you to or close to where you want to go  Add to that the fact that the trains run so frequently that you don't need to worry about timetables and they are just the perfect way to get around  The BTS also offers airconditioned carriages and a view of the city as you travel around  We didn't worry about getting a daily travel card as we found purchasing individual tickets easy enough You purchase individual tickets from a vending machine and if you don't have the necessary coins you can get change from one of the manned ticket windows  We found the Station Staff friendly and helpful On one occasion we dropped a ticket on the track whilst trying to board the train We got off the train and informed the security guard on the platform who checked that we had in fact dropped a ticket on the tracks He then radioed the ticket office to inform them of the situation and directed us downstairs to get a replacement ticket Everything was done with a minimum of fuss and we had a replacement ticket in time to catch the next train

title: The best way to get around for both local and foreigners.
review: BTS Skytrain is really the best way to get around for both local and foreigners in Bangkok    It is cheap fast and easy to use

title: Skytrain
review: I thought it was only the name but it is literally sky train BTS not only safe our time but when it's not crowded you can see Bangkok view from above there Especially at night it was beautiful The train is clean and modern but my suggestion is don't go at rush hour If you bring your kids between 34 years old heshe will not feel comfortable with it But if you go with your friends then it's fine

title: Reasonable time and fare
review: You can't beat the Bangkok Airport Rail Link with equivalent of A$2 on air conditioning train travel for over 30 kms to the heart of Bangkok less than 30 minutes  Hassle free if you travel with one big suitcase and a cabin bag  Shame that the express schedules which would take only 15 minutes were ceased to offer

title: Value for money

title: Good connectvity

title: Easy go everywhere

title: The only way to go!

title: Fantastic

review: Great and cheap way to get around Bangkok Easy to get tickets andvery inexpensive You can even go out to the airport

title: Affordable Way to get to the city
review: Affordable way to get into the city if you don't have lots of baggage with you the airport link connects BTS in Phaya Thai and then you just have to walk 5 mins to reach the BTS but there are lots of signs to guide you Highest fare would be 42 THB from the Airport to Phaya Thai

title: A great way to reach your destination faster
review: Skytrain is always a great way to commute and in Bangkok recently there are traffic in the rush hours Almost every time I use skytrain and reached my destination on time I enjoyed the ticket collecting process and it was so easy to find the stations I wanted to go Most of the time I found its crowded but still a much better option specially for travelers

title: Not an attraction, just an overfull transport system
review: An efficient transport system but not an attraction and doesn't warrant being so high up the ratings on Trip Advisor  Insanely busy and jampacked most of the time Doesn't compare to the fantastic Hong Kong metro

title: Slow way
review: It's not so fast They may have better way May be good for ones who would like to see Bangkok first

title: Great Value
review: Very clean and excellent position We had 3 nights here and it was in a great area with bars and restaurants all within a few mins walk If you didn't want to walk the hotel offers a tuktuk service that runs to Terminal 21 shopping centre and the sky train Easy quick check in and the rooms have everything you would need including hair dryer iron and travel plugs I would recommend this hotel for its price cleanliness and position as its only 35 mins to the airport and a two minute walk to the sky train

title: bangkok sky train
review: excellent way of travelling around BangkokVery cleanefficientaffordableBeats sitting in traffic jams

title: Easy connectivity
review: Bangkok is well connected with Sky trainConnecting to all major part of city makes it easy for tourist to have hassle free roaming  Our hotel was quite near to BTS station so we opted this to go to Pat pong market

title: Amazing transpotation
review: Loved it ) plus really organised not super crowded and super fast and great connections to everywhere

title: Amazingly Easy
review: We got off our plane and were newbies to Bangkok  It was approximately 10pm at night We walked outside to the cab rank and my goodness the cue it was so long  My husband and i just looked at each other and decided to take the train  At first i was slightly apprehensive as we didn't have a clue of the vicinity of the hotel from the train station and we didn't have 3G so we couldn't check on our phone however any apprehension that i had quickly was gone because once we got to the the train station it was so very easy to navigate  We got to our hotel with ease and for 40 baht each as opposed to a 600 plus Baht trip via taxi so win win for us It is such an excellent transport system and so clean it would be great if Melbourne Airport had one

title: Excellent, fast, efficient!
review: The best view of bangkok you get from this train For 40 baht it takes you to the airport And the soldiers are there to salute the train at every station

title: Easy mode of transport
review: Easy to travel with the airport rail link Its very cheap too Eg from airport to ratchaprarop cost only THB 40

title: The better way to move in Bangkok
review: In Bangkok have always big traffic but if u want move faster to visit the most beautiful things in Bangkok u need use BTS if u make the rabbit card is better

title: BTS is very cool.
review: Very clean very quick  very nice BTS is very cool I went to Siam station from the river station and it was only 34 bhat for a quick 12 min ride to Siam Easiest way to move around in Bangkok AC is very good

title: Airport transfer
review: We used the skytrain to get from the airport to the hotel for 150 baht Minimum taxi fare was 500 There was a 15 minute walk from the station but how else to soak up a city's atmosphere

title: Use of skytrain
review: Quick air conditioned and regular Easy to get around the city If need taxi to go onwards they are cheap too

title: convenient and affordable
review: it's convenient clean fast reliable and affordable in fact cheap you dont really have to worry even if you have big luggages

title: CHONG Nonsi to Saladaeng
review: I stayed in Ascott n usually I travel to Silom complex as I m more familiar with the shops there   Nonetheless  BTS sky train is cheap as compared to Singapore MRT of course  N most of all  Thai people queue  Very polite n orderly with no pushing   Nice people

title: The best way to get around.
review: The sky train is fast clean efficient and an excellent way to get around

title: Beat public transport option in Bangkok
review: Convenient and efficient public transport basically you can go anywhere by BTS within Bangkok Depends on where you go if you are using for long trips over THB30each get a ticket for 15 times @THB450 is good for value

title: The easiest way to travel
review: Avoid the roads and traffic this is the best way to get to shopping and selected sites

title: The Fastest Mode of Transport in Bangkok
review: Frequent Fastest way to get tofrom city center to Suvarnabhoomi International Airport It takes less than 30 minutes this way Do not think of going by Taxi or Bus as it may take hours due to the always traffic jam in roads of Bangkok

title: Accessible and on time
review: One of the things that travelers wants is a very reliable fast transportation that will bring them to their destination and hotels

title: Super fun and efficient
review: We caught the sky train from our hotel to have dessert  Station was close to our hotel  Train was very clean and efficient  The signage to where we want to go was excellent

title: Is this an airport link? really ?
review: No direct link to phayathai from the airport The train stops everywhere and is quickly crowded Station have no escalators  Either you take the small lift and wait a while or go for the stairs which is very uncomfortable when you have luggages

title: Very efficient
review: The best way to reach the city center from the airport It can be crowded at some times but it is clean and fast

title: Clean and organized
review: Best form of transport to move around especially when we said near Siam paragon where the traffic is exceptionally bad during peak hours   Unlike Singapore commuters who push their way into the train in Bangkok people are so orderly and queue to go into the train This makes the rides less chaotic when there are many commuters   It'd cheap too For 2 stops we only pay 22 baht per person

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Great service easy to use & trains are very clean Return tickets andor a day pass would be good for tourists

title: Need Improvement
review: I am Thai and I want to be straight with our guest The connection with BTS and MRT is not so good  No escalator at Phayathai Station  The train neither run on early morning nor late night  Delay is quite common   Type of train 1 Express Train  Pro Stop only at Phayathai Makkason and Airport  Cons Do not come often  2 City Line  Pro Come rather often 15 minutes is considered 'often' for this train   Cons Train stop at all stations It take longer time tofrom airport It could be crowded even on weekend   Good News 1 They are working on connection with MRT  2 They are adding escalator at Phayathai Station

title: Not easy to figure out
review: We road this once  We did not have change so we saw others getting change thinking they were getting tickets  THey just gave us change  The hard part was we knew where we wanted to end up but NOWHERE did it tell you which area it was in Just numbers  The lady who gave us change just told us 23  Luckily someone who knew english told us we had to put the change in and push 23  WE chose to WALK back instead of using the train

title: Great means of transportation
review: The Skytrain connects almost every nook and cormer of bangkok quick cheap and reliable One can use it for tourist places as well as airports

title: Nice
review: Clean and adorable with ac You can get 1 ride ticket or  1 day ticket It doesn’t cover the city so some time you need to use bus or the subway

title: Great way to get around Bangkok.
review: Easy transport system the maximum you pay per trip is 52baht If you do more than 3 trips in a day get a day card for 150baht the Skytrain also links into the airport express at Phaya Thai

title: Great
review: Fast efficient and clean  Very easy way to get around Bangkok and access the river ferries   Miss the traffic but try not to travel at rush hour

title: 카드가 아닌 토큰
review: bts는 카드 인데 mrt는 동그란 토큰이 티켓이에요 bts와 이용방법 똑같습니다 택시보다 mrt 추천해요 길막히면 택시는 너무 오래걸려요 딸랏롯파이야시장2 mrt역에 있습니다  you can use easily mrt the same as bts I pefer mrt to taxi because of traffic jam Ratchada Rot Fai Night Market is located in Thailand cultural centre mrt station

title: Good for long distance commuting and avoid traffic within bangkok
review: had travelled both the silom and sukhumvit line during my stay in bangkok stations maintained well Take day pass only if you will travel a lot in a day and check the individual prices between stations and calculate your itinerary accordingly sometimes it might not be worth to take day pass if your trip is just very short BTS is a good option to avoid traffic in bangkok but if you are a family with 34 members then taxi is also a cheaper option

title: Not what we expected
review: We only went on the sky train to MKM shopping mall which was about three stops Buying a ticket wasn't very clear Neither were the signs We are used to public transport and expected it to be a wow experience but it was more like the London Underground above ground I think if we had used it more we may have got more out if it

title: Okay
review: Fast in comparison to a car yes Cheap in comparison to thee taxi cheater yes The only problem are the signs at the final station how to get to the train and where to buy the tix We had to wait in four different lines at four different tix office's and only at the last we got our tix

title: Decidedly a great way to travel
review: This train is fast clean and affordable You can't go wrong on this train The stops even come in English so you know where you are Why not try it It's very affordable

title: One of the quickest and most convenient way to get around Bangkok!
review: BTS Skytrain MRT Subway and the Chao Praya express boats are pretty much all you need to get around fast plus the occasional Tuk Tuk to take you from a station to a pier or from whereever you are to the nearest station of one of the abovementioned Never get stuck in traffic jams  it's possible in Bangkok

title: most efficient
review: such a nice system fast timely clean and easy to use was so nice to see signs for NO eating NO drinking No sleeping No selling just a superb clean and safe service in a city of 10 million people oh and Air Conditioning

title: BTS SKY TRAIN
review: clean efficient never known to not be running for any reason  Arrows on the platform show where to queue to wait for the train  When arriving  into the station Arrows to alight the train  Most people follow the rules and wait til passengers get off before getting on Making it very pleasant It's Quiet on the train apart from tv adverts being shown  Most important of all   Air conditioning making for a pleasant journey

title: Fantastic cheap travel
review: We utilised the daily BTS tickets that can be purchased at each station Use them until midnight on all BTS lines and travel around Bangkok easily

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: In Bangkok where traffic jams and touristsforeigners who were scammed in taxis are common  BTS is definitely the best way to travel For foreigners like me BTS is cheap a reliable way to get around town and a much more convenient alternative to taxis even during the rush hour  Even if you have to travel to a place where BTS is inaccessible travel as far as possible with BTS or MRT then take taxi or even Grab or just walk

title: Awesome
review: Perfect travelling in the huge city Lot of traffic jam downtown bangkok so a perfect  way to avoid that

title: Quick and easy way back and forth to Suvarnabhumi
review: The Airport Link is an excellent way if you like to go by yourself and not take a taxi The end station in Bangkok is close and Connected to the BTS system for easy transfer other places in town

title: Great, efficient system
review: Well laid out and easy for an English speaking foreigner to decipher The fares are a simple calculation based on the stops The stations are read out in Thai and English and the BTS map is printed on each ticket Very user friendly

title: Efficient & Comfortable
review: Indeed it is the most time efficient and comfortable way to travel around in Bangkok   I noticed the frequency is approx every 3 mins interval    Travelling is easy when you plan your hotel of stay near the skytrain station

title: very good alternate to avoid traffic jam
review: during rush hour and almost all over the day the Skytrain is the best alternate to avoid the traffic jam It is fast airconditioned and very clean Handling is very easy

title: Good and efficient transportation
review: Skytrain is an easy way to go through the city especially in rush hour It is cheap quick and normally comfortable Often many stairs to climb even if there most of the times is possible to use escalators etc

title: stunningly clean and efficient
review: just what we should have  well run well used  but always polite staff are very helpful if you are lost and people that use this system all seem the same  dont no what they would all do if you took there mobile phones off them

title: Air conditioned, fast and efficient
review: Great experience to see the city from the window while traveling to your destination The trains are air conditioned and the lines to enter are very organised

title: Very effective
review: Effective fast clean and reasonably priced Has four exits escalators are not everywhere no elevators for disabled and baby strollers

title: This is the only way to travel!
review: Avoid anything on land it is sooo slow because of Bangkok`s infamous traffic The Skytrain can zip you to Chatachuk weekend market and into Sukhamvit for nightlife and shopping down to the Eastern Bus Station if you are going to Pattaya or Ko Samet but best of all for travellers in the station by the Chao Praya River where you jump on a river ferry to get to Khao Sahn Road or just enjoy the bustling river environment I take this trip even when I don`t have to go anywhere

title: Efficient
review: Don't bother with a taxi unless you've got a crazy load of luggage This is so much more efficient and worry free as you don't have to deal with the Bangkok traffic

title: Good Connection
review: I took the Airport Rail Link Ratchaprop to Phaya Thai Station and change connecting station  to various places I  want  to go Terminal 21 Shopping  Center Siam Center  for MBK change to National Stadium  Alot of walking though  the distance to the station are long Be prepared to wak but you save alot because taxis and tuk tuk charges  very high fee 55

title: The best transportation
review: BTS is the best transportation to avoid traffic It is very comfortable and on schedule It is pricy but it is the best way to beat the traffic in Bangkok

title: boon if you wish to time your trip to the airport
review: bangkok traffic is extremely uncertain and planning you trip to the airport (suvarnabhmi) is a game of chance  the airport rail link cuts out the guessing the trains depart at very regular intervals and the travel time is under 30 minutes from the phaya thai to the airport stationthe fare is bahts 45 and there are many ticket vending machines specific amount is change is not essential as the machines return the change with your ticketsthe ticket is a plastic tockem which you tap on the machine to access the train platform and drop in the slot at the terminal machines  those are the benefits  it would become an excellent facility if 1 seemless ticketing can be arranged in conjuction with the BTS and the MRT ( buying your tickets for the latter trains is an additional process) 2 make the phaya thai BTS station more user friendly with provision of elevators or escalators so that baggage can be handled more conveniently elderly are severely handicapped under the existing conditions as you have to carry all you bags down the steps leading to the rail link station  this is an excellent begining for the airport transportation an extension to Hua Lum Phong ( the main railway station)  could also be considered

title: Sometimes convenient
review: The thought of a rail link from the airport to city center is a good one  Traveling with bags as most people arriving at the airport this system is difficult to use  Too many stairs and the small elevators are hard to locate or out of order  Most times you will still need a taxi to get you to your hotel  You can save a small amount of money but public [metered] taxis are available  on the ground floor of the airport

title: Crowded but its really is the best go to
review: this BTS is like New york subway but very crowded peak times u will be very close to each other but its way better than using taxi do yourself a favor and learn this easy system

title: Top way to navigate Bangkok
review: Use Skytrain extensively when in Bangkokgreat and cost effective way to get around and see the city

title: Only Way To Travel To & From Airport
review: Excellent value (much cheaper) and faster than screwing around with taxi's  It connects with other rail systems so you can go just about anywhere (or at least get close) in the city from the airport

title: Safe and Clean BTS
review: Convenient commute from CBD Bangkok to tourist attractions and outskirts of Bangkok Easily connected to underground MRT  Safe clean convenient way to commute with attentive staff and several pass to choose from  I love BTS Sky train ^_^

title: Super efficient
review: The best way to get around Bangkok is the BST  It has 2 lines   One line connect the northern part of the city with the south eastern part and the other line connects the central part of the city with the south western part    the bst connects various other modes of transport like the MRT and the ferry  service at various stations   The service is excellent  with the frequency being every 34 mins  Trains are not very crowded as a result of the frequency  announcements are made in both Thai and English  though in keeping with the tradition  the tone is quite soft  so  one has to listen carefully to correctly identify the upcoming stations  Alternatively  maps of the  BST  which illuminates the station which is about to arrive  is there in every corner of the train   Easily one of the finest modes of public transport in BKK and def matches the London Underground

title: Very Easy to Get Around
review: Used the BTS to get around Bangkok Recommend getting the day pass to allow you to jump on and off as many times as you want Very convenient

title: Really simple to use
review: Download the Bangkok metro map on your phone and you can easily plan your route from the airport using the link and then straight on to the tube & around the city for a fraction of the cost of taxi  tuk tuks

title: Amazing train ride, recommended!
review: I took the night train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai It's cheap saves you money because you don't need a ho(s)tel and you don't lose any time because you wake up in Chiang Mai The train offers some great views and is the perfect opportunity to meet some fellow travellers You can order food and breakfast for in the morning on board Be sure to take this train

title: Great way to get around
review: This was a great way to get around the city It services a lot of the more popular areas on the city and it fast and well priced

title: Riding the skytrain
review: During our stay in Bangkok we were right by a station and had no problems getting on and off  The crowds were not bad at all  Only once were we not able to find a seat  Very clean and comfortable  A great way to get around

title: Take this if you don't want to get stuck in traffic
review: Rail link is awesome thinking of transportation between airport and city The price is just 45 TBH till the end Phaya Thai station The connectivity with other trains in the city is so seamless that you will get to your point faster than taxi

title: Easy and quick
review: A great and simple way of getting from the airport into town Links to the Metro and BTS stations Train is fairly cheap and is easy to use Everything is in Thai and English Train can become very crowded

title: Doesn't operate after midnight
review: Tried to take the rail when my flight arrived at 1am The train was down I had to take a taxi instead

title: Best transportation in Bangkok
review: The BTS System is very efficient and clean We purchased a day pass and travelled around the city of Bangkok for a very cheap price

title: Convenient
review: A great way to get around the city Cheap and easy to use Can get busy when it's rush hour Combined with the sky train it gets you to most area's or within walking distance

title: Convenient Travel
review: An easy way to get around and avoid tuktuk drivers who ALWAYS overcharge or taxis that don't feel like going where you want to go Skytrain is reliable and if traveling light you can get from the airport to nearly anywhere in Bangkok for just a couple dollars

title: Clean Skytrain
review: Skytrain in Bangkok is very impressive  Clean efficient and well maintained  Maps are all over to help travelers get into the right trains  Sufficient number of self service machines are installed as well  Exits were properly marked clearly that leads to the right exits  Very handicap friendly too since elevators are installed for travelers having loads to carry or for pregnant and senior citizens  Best way to travel to get rid of traffic on land

title: Review
review: So wounderfull help you to reach on time we went with our friends  it save your timings alot bangkok has so many tripissues

title: Expensive and Limited
review: By local standards the BTS is very expensive There are very few lines the trains have few carriages and far and few between therefore they are usually packed I think the basic design is at fault the trains are very heavy because they use a landbased train chassis and the elevated sections probably couldn't handle heavier trains Still those wanting to go up and down Sukhumvit Road may want to use the BTS to avoid the horrendous traffic jams below

title: Easy to use
review: This is by far the best choice to get around Bangkok If you are in Bangkok for a BITEC trade show get a hotel near this train and you can be at the show in minutes and back each day The cars are air conditioned clean safe and regular

title: Amazing and efficient train!
review: Amazing and efficient train that is always mostly on time and takes you to your destination quickly sparing you from the crazy bangkok traffic Super clean and super easy to use compared to trains in europe Also there is a skybridge attached to the sky train which is just super convenient to walk around on Highly recommend both sky train and sky bridge

title: Cheap and good to the city
review: Hate taking a cab when you travel light and needs to go to the city hotel Hate to be in a traffic jam Airport rail link is the best option Airport to my hotel in silom including transfer is only 45mins  It's Clean fast and easy

title: Clean, air conditioned and modern.
review: The only negative factor is that the lines do not meet up or intersect There are shuttle busses set up but it is damned odd and a little incoveinient

title: Fast cheap and accurate
review: Every time I come to Bangkok I use the skytrain when possible It is cheap and most important fast so you arrives to your destination in reasonable time Since the center of Bangkok is always very crowded (heavy traffic) going with TukTuk or taxi might take 510 times slower than the skytrain It's sometimes frustrating to take a taxi for 1 mile distance but arrive there after 1 hour this is Bangkok

title: Simple to use but OFC give yourself time to go on the train, buy the tickets, get food...
review: Thailand Railways was great I see several reviews saying that the sleeper trains are dirty This is probably because they did not realize (or didn't search beforehand) that all the trains aren't the same If there are several trains going from Hat Yai to Bangkok only 1 or 2 of them are the new trains the rest are old trains which might be old and a bit dirty (never tried them as I can just take the new ones) I suggest going to the train station early as you have to buy the ticket (hopefully it won't be sold out) get to your platform and buy drinks and food to eat on the train Enjoy

title: fatser and easier
review: This was a great chance for us see Bkk in cheapest way and fasteat Worth for value and time We could see many grear attractions from skytrain and if u travel as budget get this train from airport to city center

title: Very Efficient, Modern and CLEAN Subway System
review: My only complaint about this system is the fact that if I want to bring a suitcase it has to be thoroughly inspected  BTS doesn't require it  Otherwise no complaints with how this system is operated and maintained  San Francisco could take some lessons here

title: Smooth Experience when transiting from DMK to BKK,  Bangkok
review: I had to find Door number 6 after immigration There was a transport desk near the door which verified my next ticket and they stamped on my hand The driver later checked for the stamp and allowed me in The ride was smooth and the travel time was 1 hour 10 mins I left DMK at 1100 am

title: Efficient commuting
review: The BTS Skytrain is probably the most efficient way to visit the different malls as well as the best way to explore diverse parts of the city It is safe and hassle free and the station names are announced in advance for convenience Its best to take a multiple day pass because there are long serpentine queues outside the ticket booths Train frequency is pretty good and safe to travel at night The trains are quite packed during the morning and evening rush hours so try and work around them

title: Clean, modern, and works well.
review: Comparing the BTS with others around the world is difficult as it leaves others in the shade it is immaculate modern and is the most efficient way to travel around Bangkok The cost is very modest

title: Don't be shy to use
review: It can be a bit daunting when first arriving in a city like Bangkok to use the SkytrainTipsget a map from from hoteldecide where you are going and get a plan with the help of hotel staffKnow the names of the end of the trackthis will make choosing the right platform much easier Choose to go outside of the rush hour for first tripEverything is much calmer you can get adviceand the whole experience is less stressful do it once or twice and you will have cracked it and it will open up parts of Bkk that you would have never found

title: Well organised but little opportunity to spend at the markets we visited
review: A well organised tour with an English speaking guide Unfortunately due the trip being a long half day there was very little opportunity to buy at either markets I would rather have got back an hour later with half an hour at each market This must also be disappointing for the market traders who see lots of wealthy tourists just passing through and getting in the way of local shoppers If tour companies like yours don’t encourage putting money into the local economy then there may be no viable markets for us to visit in the future

title: Efficeient, but not cheap for groups
review: The BTS is efficient however for a large group if there is not traffic a cab may be just as good or a better choice  Please also note that the train shuts down at midnight

title: Clean, cool, fast, unique to Bangkok... :)
review: The only think I mind on the BTS is the stairs to get up to it which make sure you get nice and sweaty to the track But once you get on the train the freshness is a godsend and you are to your destination in no time On certain routes it beats taxi by miles as it's cheaper  especially if you are alone  cooler and certainly faster

title: It was a great experience.
review: Our Tour Guide Sarah is a great one I've learned a lot about Thailand as well as about our tour This activity is for keeps

title: Quick reliable transport
review: I always use BTS in Bangkok  Best quickest and cheapest way to get around line gradually expanding keeping people out of traffic below    Stored value card very handy   Recommend choosing hotel within few minutes walk of a BTS station  Dedicated line now going out to Airport and links up with main line

title: A DEFINITE MUST DO
review: This full day excursion will lead you deep into history with its chilling facts The railway trip is a memorable oneHIGHLY RECOMMENDED

title: BTS, Fast and Amazing service
review: I have used the BTS sky train when I was in Bangkok Its really good You can find lot of foreigners as well travelling and using this service Map can be taken from station also available on every ticket you get from Ticket Vending Machine

title: Ease of use
review: It's so easy to get anywhere in Bangkok on the BTS  Just look on the map  pick your destination  look at the number of your destination and that is the line or station you put into the ticket machine

title: Best Way travel within the area
review: The fasts and greatest way of public transport and cut off the traffic problem too but unfortunately is not expanded all over Bangkok so depending on your desire area other public transportation like bus taxi or boat is available

title: Easy access to Airport
review: Half the price of taxi fare quick and easy for travel between centre of Bangkok and the Airport Used the train around 9am  not very busy no problem with baggage

title: Brilliant service
review: Wonderful service  easy to use  Cleancool comfortable  Regular service  The steps are quite steep  am sure there is a liftCheap

title: Fastest way to travel to/from Suvarnabhumi
review: Just like Bangkok's BTS trains the airport rail link is a blessing A30minute journey tofrom Bangkok city centre can take up to 23 hours in a taxi due to the horrible traffic

title: nothing to say
review: new fast cheap clean perfect to arrive in down town bangkok in 20 mn connections with BTS or MRT nothing to say just use it

title: Hot sweaty the ticket lady will help you
review: It is hot and sweaty in Bangkok and rubbing against humanity makes you want to sweat more Once you get the knack of it you can buy your own tickets at the machine

title: Easiest access with reasonable fare
review: It is easy to ride and reach the city without any hassle or trap in the traffic jam I like to use this everytime when i am in bangkok be it to the city or return to airport )

title: Cheap, Easy and Airconditioned!
review: Wow the bts puts Metros in the US to shame It was easy to navigate air conditioned and super clean This is a great was to get around the city for less

title: Cheap Airport Rail Link (CITY LINE) to Bangkok
review: The Chaepest way from the Airport is to take the Airport Rail link (City Line) to Phaya Thai Station Cost is about 120 bath Here is a row of seats on each side of the Train so you have plent of Room for your Suitcase It takes about 30 minutes to Phaya Thai Station Here You can change and go on the BTS Train to where you want to go or go to the bottom and take a Taxi to Your Destination

title: Easy access to city
review: it is convenience to take Airport rail to city fast and cheap fare First time visit Bangkok was 20 years ago and now see Thailand has been changed a lot

title: Quick & Simple
review: The skytrain is a good cheap way of getting to and from the shopping centres Some ticket machines only take coins but the station has a window where a employee can change your notes into coins The carriages are airconditioned We had no problems

title: Well-connected routes
review: The train goes to most tourist attractions in Bangkok Get the prepaid Rabbit cards if you travel a lot It'll definitely save you time Train is clean and comfy Love it

title: Convinient way to reach Bangkok City
review: It starts from B2 level of Suvarnabhumi Airport A oneside journey to Phaya Thai costs 45 Baht only From there you get connectivity to rest of the city via BTS In comparative terms taxi to Phaya Thai would cost you 350400 Baht

title: Amazing
review: The sky train in Bangkok is amazing its clean and tidy at any time of the day  Wifi is great as is the aircon  in fact I wear glasses and after only a couple of stations upon exiting the train my glasses steamed up Be prepared for the train to be busy tho almost all the time Stations are easy to get to as the voice announcements are in both thai and in English And each station has information areas including a map of the line

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Clean punctual very frequent service  inexpensive avoids the traffic We always use it when in BangkokWhat's not to like  Except perhaps that you can't always get a seat but then it's always a quick journey

title: Only for Backpackers
review: Make sure you can carry your luggage up or down long flights of stairs  There is no escalator from the street level Otherwise the service is a great way to avoid the typical bangkok taxi driver faux friendliness

title: SO EASY
review: Highly recommend using the metro to get to BKK We flew out of BKK and were struggling to find an inexpensive option to get to the airport Traffic in Bangkok is terrible it is a big city afterall and we weren't trying to spend $30 to get to the airport (it was the end of our trip so we had run through most of our money) We decided to give this a try and I'm so glad we did  We walked to our closest metro stop which was less than 10 mins away We put in our destination at an automated kiosk at the bottom of the station You don't need exact change We were given two tokens one for my boyfriend and I We were a little confused going up but one of the guards helped me go through We waited about 10 minutes for our train which was running like 2 or 3 minutes late We had 7 stops to get to the airport It was air conditioned and not very crowded though we just found a spot to stand in the corner We were dropped right off at the airport   Seriously this is the way to get tofrom the airport It's cheap easy and by far the fastest method of transportation This metro definitely beats the on in Washington DC on cleanliness and timeliness so if you're from the States you will be pleasantly surprised

title: Like the MRT it is the best way to travel Bangkok to City
review: Excellent value and easy to use  but not if you have lots of luggage to take with you Use the the airport link (of MRT) to get into the city and then taxi from there  much quicker and a little cheaper

title: Straight to the Airport
review: Its the cheapest way to the Airportaround £400 each

title: Impressive
review: Next to the bridge Buy a ticket for 100 Bath (one way) and join the train ride to the hellfire pass We took the train from 1140 am and arrived at 1230 pm after 1 hour you can take the train back also 100 Bath and arrive back round 1430

title: Clean and Cheap
review: Figured out the subway and train system and took it all the time for my 4 day trip in Bangkok  They offer a tourist card for 100 BHT for unlimited 24 hour use  Wish they had a multiday pass for tourists  Impressed with how clean the system was and the use of technology ie touch screen vending machines in corridors etc  This is definitely not a third world country

title: Cheap, fast and comfortable.
review: Traveling with the BTS Skytrain is always a good option especially when there is a rush hour in Bangkok Sometimes a taxi driver will even refuse to take the ride because he will know that the roads a hopeless jammed for the tour you ask for Just take the BTS Skytrain if it gets you in the right direction

title: Intro to mass transit in Bangkok
review: Good way to get around assuming you are going to where the Skytrain services Buying tickets at the ticket booth was effortless and easy The trains that we took were busy but we had no issues boarding and standing

title: Fast and accessible
review: Got us to our destination quick Even if I'm visiting Thailand for the first time didn't get lost and didn't get us worrying for airport transfers

title: Fast way to city
review: Really good way from airport to city or otherway aroundmuch cheeper and faster than those greedy bangkok taxidrivers Good links to MTR and BTS

title: Quick Train to City
review: I took this train to Phaya Thai station The fare is 45 baht from airport and saved me a few hundred baht on uber ride going to Phaya Thai station to my hotel  You can buy the token at the selfserve machines and 'tap' the token at the gates to enter the platform  The train is a bit small so it does not transport a large number of people

title: do not accept bicycle
review: it can be convinient but if you are two or 3  it is cheapper to take a taxi They do not accept bicycle inside the train so impossible to use it to go in the exellent bicycle track in suvanabhumi ((

title: A very convenient link
review: Very easy to  get to the train by following the directions inside the airport We had to walk for a while but eventually took us to the train station All was very smooth infact they have made it so hassle free that you don't even need to pick up your luggage even once between the luggage belt and the train Truly impressive Takes you right into the heart of the city and is cheap indeed

title: Good but can be better
review: As an airport rail link the least the management can do is to add luggage space inside the train By doing this travellers luggage does not block seat and aisle for people to pass or stand

title: The way to get about
review: After suffering bangkoks traffic in airport transfers and a tour you realise this is the way to get about if you have a station close to your hotel and or destination Staff can speak English and it's pretty inexpensive

title: Amazing!
review: Great option to move around Bangkok and very cheap as well Very reliable and felt safe by catching a train

title: excellent way to travel to airport
review: you can save a lot pof traffic time if you are going to the airport by using airport link express The ticket is very cheap and it takes just iunder 30 minutes to travel to the airport

title: Loved the guide, the boat ride, the car ride - everything!
review: I thought the markets were just too far away from Bangkok for me to see This tour then was amazing train ride boat tour airconditioned van funloving always smiling guide (he qnswered all the bizarre questions I had) small group and a fullday tour (how much more can you do in a day after shortly to four anyway) It was wonderful and for this prize on top

title: convenient access to town area
review: With frequency of 15mins it is a good and cheap option to get into town esp With Bangkok's traffic conditions it means 0 jam situation

title: Convenient Transportation
review: The MRT system is very good and new It goes around the city I used it a lot while I was in Bangkok It would be a lot more difficult for me to travel without this MRT However be prepared for the crowd on the weekend or rush hour

title: Fast, reliable and cheap, Skytrain in Bangkok
review: Probably the easiest and cheapest way to travel around Bangkok Very fast very clean and very reliable I wish they had things like this in Germany

title: great accessibility
review: most stations are located area popular places in bangkok great connectivity to MRT and Airport Rail

title: Easy transport link to thr city
review: Take this Airport link It's cheap convenient air conditioned and by far the easiest way to get to the heart of the city You join the MRT transport at the end

title: Easiest way around the city.
review: The BTS is the best and cheapest way to get around the city I used the BTS nearly every day during my many trips to Bangkok A bonus is that it is air conditioned so even at peak times you are not too hot on the train

title: Great way of travel
review: This is an easy and accessible way of quick travel in this mega city no hassle easy to buy tickets clean and safe better than sitting stuck in a taxi in the hectic traffic

title: Fastest way to travel
review: MRT in Bangkok is the fastest way to travel Many of the major attraction are well connected with the MRT   Ticket vending machines help you purchase tickets Day passes are also available Crowded during office hours but a nice experience

title: Efficient!
review: What a great way to get around a busy hot and humid city It was a  welcome relief to step into the air conditioned train compartment

title: A very good way to move around Bangkok
review: We found the Skytrain very nice to use but down rate it slightly due to large crowds during rush hours and challenges with ticketing You do get nice views of the city as you move around on it kind of like a minitour The cars are airconditioned and there are several stairescalators to ascend to or descend from each station Over Sukhumvit there are even extended elevated walkways in places to avoid having to mix into sidewalk traffic or cross streets

title: Good way to get around
review: As a tourist it was a bit confusing knowing how to buy tickets and how it works  It would be better if the passes were integrated with the Metro system Overall service was quick and it was a good way to get around the city  or at least to the old part of the city (and then you are on your own)

title: Clean and efficient
review: The Bts system is incredibly efficient you never wait more than a few minutes for a train Onboard they are clean and refreshingly cold We travel everywhere by Bts avoiding long traffic delays Buy a prepaid card if you are using it a lot saves time queuing to buy a ticket Very busy though so chances of getting a seat are rare

title: Other Cities Take Note..!
review: Definitely the Best way to travel whilst in Bangkok so efficient clean and air conditioned throughout  Avoids sitting in taxis in Bangkok traffic most destinations are around 4050Baht and you get a decent view around Bangkok in a cool train   Do try to avoid rush hour though as you get more closely acquainted with fellow passengers than you might like  Make sure you have the right change and if you do plan to use it throughout the day think about the day pass definitely worth it

title: Quick and easy
review: Great value at around £1 for a ticket you get to travel in clean easy to use and frequent trains above the streets of Bangkok

title: bangkok visits
review: convenient quick reliable public transportation for traffic jam packed Bangkok roads  But unfortunately not convenient for physically challenged Should have planned better

title: Bts
review: Very efficient skytrain serving Bangkok The only negative is queuing for the tickets  very long queues on a weekend

title: Convenient and beat the traffic during rush hour
review: The BTS services is excellent you know exactly the next station arriving as they announce the station in English as well The only thing that it is usually very packed and buying the tickets must require you to have coins and the machine do not accept notes But don't fret station masters there are rather helpful and you can change coins with them  Better than taking taxi and getting stuck in the traffic as Bangkok is famous for the traffic jam

title: Simple, easy and cost effective
review: I was a bit nervous about using the Rail Link and connecting to the train but it was actually really simple Signs everywhere and you can ask the staff if you're a bit lost It works out so much cheaper than a taxi if you're travelling alone

title: Awesome and Fascinating - a real Thai experience
review: Efficient and simple Best way to exit Suvarnabhumi airport especially as you don't want to face traffic after a long flight

title: clean and efficient
review: I catch the Bangkok BTS Skytrain regularily when I am in  Bangkok Usually I stay in accommodation near Asok Nana or Ploen Chit BTS stations I usually go to MBK Chidtlom Central Dept store or Siam to go to Paragon for shopping The BTS runs around every 3 minutes and is spotlessly clean and efficient Costs vary from where you want to go but for 1 or 2 people is great value for shorter distances More than 2 people probably a taxi in non peak times is better value

title: Super speedy!
review: This is the first time I took the airport rail and I am impressed It barely took me 30 minutes to reach my destination which is the second last stop of the line I would definitely use the rail again when I visit BKK next year

title: Easy travel
review: Can't beat this form of transport in Bangkok Quickclean and cool

title: Fly over the traffic
review: When i first visited Bangkok in 89 they were building the skytrain and moving about the city was a nightmare (unless you traveled on the river) Now its a breeze its cheap clean safe and easy to navigate

title: Clean, safe, fast...
review: Highly recommended even for the first express trip to BKK from airport Just follow airport signage to the airportraillink [ARL] to city Get the free official airport map from the tourist desk at airport it's real helpful Express ARL trains run about every 15 minutes Approx 1720 minutes express to city [Makkasan station] which is most convenient if you are staying in the Sukhumvit area nearby Then hop on taxi to hotel No more 45  50 minute stressful rides in taxi to city in traffic jams heat and no more 900  1200Thb fares to hotel from Suvarnabhumi airport ARL suitable for families too Safe Clean Fast Cheap [about 35Thb pp one way express]

title: Best and safest way to/from the airport
review: By far the cheapest safest and most reliable way to get to and from BKK airport Use it to get to the BTS skytrain or into town and take a short taxi ride but with traffic unpredictable this is the BEST

title: A great example of public transport at it's very best.
