review: Only used this after a long cab ride in mad traffic and would highly recommend for anyone travelling to Bangkok It's cheap air conditioned and a very easy way to get around the city We used it only in a small radius of our hotel in the main shopping precinct but it's a fantastic safe way to get to the markets

title: It's good way to go around Bangkok
review: Bangkok traffic is very very bad Sometimes foreigner get lucky coming when shool is off ( March April may  and October )  So maybe don't encounter these but for local staying here  Traffic is the biggest problem  We can usually go in 20 min on Sunday but weekday can be 1 and half   This train system solve this problem a bit although they don't cover whole Bangkok so getting to station is also other problem But easy to use and safe

title: Brilliant
review: The sky train runs on time has plenty of seats is cheap safe and easy to use even if your not familiar with it as we weren't And unlike the UK transport system you don't get thrown around its actually a comfortable ride

title: Alway crowded but always there
review: The skytrain is very crowded all the time  I have never seen it with open seats unless you are at the beginning of the track  but at the same time  this skytrain make it so so convenient to move around in Bangkok Like it

title: Air conditioned  transport
review: What a delightful rail system with full air conditioning It was efficient and well used by the locals so some times it got very busy Cheap to use about 75p per trip London transport could take note that it was fast and clean

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: Excellent way to travel  It was so clean and a great way to get a way from the heat for a while  Great easy way to travel in Bangkok

title: Superb time exploring bangkok on BTS
review: I travelled with two older teenagers from the UK so I don't speak Thai however didn't have any problems with the language Most people spoke English  We travelled to Mo Chit to the huge weekend market and several trips to patpong Siam and central pier Very cheap and avoids the huge traffic jams in bangkok

title: Quick and easy to use
review: The Airport train is definitely a great way to get to BKK City centre without the traffic It was easy to use and quick The only thing is that I don't understand why they suspended the direct nonstop service from Airport to Phaya Thai The train was crowded since it had many stops and many locals as well as tourists used them

title: Poor Schedule
review: You cannot know what time the train will come they are broken quite often If you want to go to airport by this way please plan your schedule at least 2 hours Frankly don't use this transportation

title: Gets very busy.
review: A great way to explore Bangkok the Sky train is a quick and easy way to get round Being careful when to use Certain times it gets very busy hot and can feel a bit daunting It’s quick station to station but be aware the stops can be very quick you need to be by the door when ready to get off

title: Zooming over the city
review: Best way to get around Bangkok Connects the major business dictricts shopping areas and even the Chao Praya river Paying for tickets can be a pain since the system accepts only coins and especially during peak hour one has to stand in long queues for this purpose Better option would be to go for the Rabbit stored value cards which can be refilled as needed and can even be used to buy burgers in McDonalds

title: Cheap and frequent
review: there is at least one train every 5 minutes the personnel is helpful kind and always smiling and the journeys are always smooth and pleasant

title: Fly above the traffic
review: The best way to get around this trafficclogged city  Economical clean and convenient  It is easy to navigate and a great way to peoplewatch

title: Safe, clean & most efficient way to get around
review: Most beneficial to stay within walking distance of any BTS Skytrain station  Even if you stay towards the ends of the lines (Sukhumvit or Siam) the ride is quick & efficient to get you to the center of Bangkok  Siam station is the central transfer station to change between the 2 lines     If you rely on taxi or tuktuk you risk being stuck in traffic (which seems to be all hours of the day) or getting overcharged  Most people using the Skytrain are tourists and locals (going tofrom work or shopping)  It gets really crowded in the morning (~89am) and in the evenings (~56pm)  Locals are very polite do not push or crowd talk loudly on their cell and offer seats to the elderlymothers with babies  Unfortunately it is visitors from certain countries who are rude on Skytrain when it gets crowded Also no eatingdrinking on Skytrain  Like most subway systems you look at the end point station names to indicate which direction (platform) on the line you are going  There are maps (on the walls & ones to take w you) in English @ each station & onboard the train  Since stations are very large when exiting the station there are signs that tell you which Exit Number to take to get to your destination (usually indicated by a major landmark such as a hotel shopping mall government building or park)    Recommend buying  a refillable Rabbit card to avoid the long lines @ the singleride Tix kiosks  A minimum of 100Baht is required to refill each time  If you have some leftover Baht on your Rabbit card you can use it up by going to McDonald's for a drinksnack

title: Very easy
review: We did have a guide with us but the system seemed very similar to London's underground and I'm sure we would have been fine without a guide  At the first station you could buy the tickets in the machine and received change  At another station the machine needed the correct money there was someone in a booth where you could get change for notes

title: Fast & easiest way to get to the city!
review: It's the fastest and cheapest way to get to the city No jams nothing They used to have one that operates straight to phaya thai but I'm not too sure why it stopped But nonetheless clean & efficient )

title: saves lot of time and money
review: Each time I visit Bangkok I take this train from the airport This is very convenient and in about 30 minutes you will be in Bangkok

title: Excellent Transit system
review: The BTS links most of the main attractions in Bangkok and has contact less cards (get these instead of the machine dispensed one way tickets to avoid the hassle) available at their transit offices located at the gantries of every station  Staff have a good command of the english language and are more than capable of serving you  Trains are well air conditioned but keep in mind that during peak periods can be quite packed Stations themselves are not air conditioned though so keep that in mind

title: One of the easiest and best ways to get around Bangkok
review: There are a few key transport systems in Bangkok the BTS (Skytrain) MTS (subway) River taxi canal taxi car taxi bike taxi and bus  In terms of ease speed and comfort BTS is the way to go Fares are based on distance but won't cost more than about £1 per journey The trains are airconditioned immaculate inside (food and drink apart from water is banned on the system) and run smoothly and frequently There are only two lines so you cannot get everywhere but most of the key sights you might want to see as a tourist are accessible

title: Very clean and comfortable, but rush hours are very full
review: During the rush hours it is very wise to use BTS  Because the traffic jam in Bangkok are awful I use BTW a lot in MBK area  The connection are quite good  I even took BTS Airport Link many time to get to Bankna area  For 1 Person is good and cheap  But if there are many of you BTS Prices are more expensive than a Taxi  Well depending on the traffic you can decide which public transport you would take But have fun in Bankgkok

title: It link to most of the shopping center
review: Most of the local nation unable to communicate in English You may asked the train station staff they are able to tell the location you want to find

title: Great service hard to figure out our destination
review: It was a challenge to figure out which direction and how to pay But the trains are superI loved the way everyone lines up and waits for everyone to disembark before they get on

title: Comfortable and "cool"
review: In a nutshell BTS will take you to most bangkok attractions and neighborhoods and if it doesn't you can still use the subway Trains are modern and have AC which is why my title said "cool" and after a very hot day walking around bangkok riding the BTS is a blessing even if it is for 15 minutes Fares depend on distance and it 's most avisable to carry lots of coins (but you can get change and advice at the infochange booths at every station) At rush hour trains are packed but they run pretty often you can always wait for the next trainand you can buy all kinds of stuff from the little stores at avery station from protein bars to shoes ans socks

title: Easy to use and reasonable price
review: I used the skytrain while staying in Bangkok Using the facility was easy considering the language barrier It is also very reasonable for cost Our trip between our destination cost less than 20p in English money

title: Easy to reach Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Cheap and fast for transportation between BKK airport and city The price around 3545 bath per person and it was comfortable Recommended for travelers with light luggages

title: Fast and easy
review: Taking the red and blue lines is basically the same  just a price difference so if you're not in a huge rush just take the cheaper route It drops you right at the airport so it's a super convenient way to leaveenter the city

title: Convenient
review: Though it can get quite crowded its really convenientalso the overhead walkways are covered so they prevent you from getting wet (and is better than walking on crowded roads) and lead directly into most malls

title: amazing
review: I am able to visit the place I want to go thanks to MRT Organise and always on time Safe to travel

title: best option
review: Skytrain is the best option a tourist can have in order to beat the traffic and save money as well as time

title: Seems well connected
review: In traffic filled Bangkok this is one of the best ways to get around The very efficient service connects most of the city center and then covered walking to the shops

title: Perfect to go to the city or back to airport
review: It's cheap and convenient I recommend this transport when you arrive or when you go back Try to find seat faster as the airport train can stop to all station between airport and the final station

title: Easy alternative to get from the airport to the city
review: Pro  Not depending on traffic  2 lines  normal and express (which only stops at certain stations)  no hassle with taxi drivers (fare smelly car loud radio etc) etc  Con  Timing unreliable (on certain days express trains have no commuted at all etc)  Hence on way TO THE AIRPORT  only use if enough time at hand  Getting from station to your final destination can be a bit cumbersome on a hot day with lots of luggage (getting MRT from Makkasan is easy)  Bottom line I use the airport link anytime I can just for the peace of mind However getting TO THE AIRPORT I still rely on taxis quite frequently

title: Very easy to navigate
review: Skytrain is easy to use and staff at stations are friendly and helpful It is also great value for money to get around the city

title: Quick, efficient and cost effective.
review: I've used this service more times than I can remember and find it very convenient and cheap When first opened it was awkward as access was difficult and transfer between BTS and MRT difficult especially with luggage While still not perfect this is now much improved If you intend to use do a little study beforehand and work out the best stop for your city destination  and most convenient transfer station I am almost always solo and this is much better than a taxi If in a group you may prefer a prebooked shuttle or taxi

title: The most efficient way to airport or to city
review: Nothing compares to the well managed airport rail link Bangkok cheap always with traffic controllers around to manage the crowd movement clean efficiently interconnected between airport and city centre

title: BTS
review: This is one of the most reliable commuter systems I have ever usedClean and always on timeAnd incredible value for money

title: Convinient
review: When arriving to Bangkok via the Airport this is by far the easiest way to get to the city Cheap and fast It connects with the skytrain and the metro

title: Stops running at midnight..
review: Found this out when my plane from Shanghai was lateit is very clean and punctual but when you have a big luggagedon't know if you want to be hauling it around either up and down escalators or stairs and long walks

title: Good cheap way of getting around.
review: Obviously you can't get to all the tourist spots but clean and best of all wonderful air con😃  A Cheap alternative if it's where you want to go  A little tip everyone thinks Tuk Tuk's are the best way to get around there not Use the metered taxis ok not as much fun but with a meter you don't get ripped off

title: Forget taxi
review: This is an excellent service It is extremely fast very efficient and affordable The only time i would consider useing taxis is if you have heavy or a lot of luggage

title: Inexpensive way to get into the city
review: This train is clean fast and depending on time you ride crowded We arrived in Bangkok on a Saturday afternoon and riding this was a snap The next two times we rode it to and from the airport it was crowded and we had to stand with our bags Still it is way more economical than a cab and much faster as you don't get stuck in traffic

title: Very good for quick transport purpose
review: I have used BTS train during my stay in Bangkok It was really worth using the train as it used to take very less time as compared to taxi So I preferred to use it and recommend others to use the same

title: BTS - most convenient way to travel
review: The BTS is really easy to use and covers most of the popular areas of the city I combine the BTS with the river boats which covers other places not accessible by BTS I bought a pass I think the deposit is 100 BHT and the card cost another 100 BHT Most trips are 25 to 30 BHT Be careful not to bend the card I had the card in my back pocket so it was slightly bent When I tried to return it for my deposit they refused to accept the card The card was still usable as I had been using it all the while although slight bent I also like the BTS as it doesn't have to contend with traffic jams Peak hours can be very crowded though but I always managed to squeeze in

title: Elevated Train good for Touring around Bangkok!
review: The BTS is a good cheap and efficient transportation to see some tourist spots around Bangkok The schedule is reliable and buying a card ticket is simple and the ticket teller will assist you and even change your paper money to coins so that you can conveniently use the vendo machine Cons is the lack of elevator in some station

title: Great
review: Great wat to move all over the city securely  Like the ease of movement around the city Dislike at certain times it can be very packed

title: Awesome
review: Awesome system of travel in this busy city As our first time in Bangkok I was worried it would be to confusing but it was easy to understand and a great way to beat traffic

title: Super easy and cheap way to get around Bangkok!
review: The BTS Skytrain is easy to navigate and super fast It is by far the easiest and cheapest method of transport We were struck by how clean it was too AU$3 got us to to other side of the city and back It stops at all major department stores and even took us to Chatachuk markets Easy Peazy

title: Cheap Way to Get Around
review: Cheap and relatively quick way to get around town Signs and instructions are in English and Thai Worth staying at a hotel close by a station

title: Value for money
review: You can get to most of the big shopping centres via the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok Use the skytrain to go to your hotel from the airport as well

title: very clean and accessible
review: the airport rail link is very accessible it can be found on the basement of airport there are two kinds of train the express and regular train but I prefer to use the regular train it's almost the same and cheaper

title: Efficient
review: Usually packed with office workers but runs efficiently and is an inexpensive way of getting around

title: Cheap, Fast and Convenient
review: The best transportation options to reach downtown city Fast on time and very cheap Less than 100 baht per person from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Phaya Thai (the last station) It takes only 30 minutes Running from 600 am till 12 midnight

title: Convenient Transportation to Central Bangkok
review: Tried boarding the airport rail link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Makkasan Station during my arrival in Bangkok I can say that it is the best option if you are avoiding the rigorous Bangkok traffic jams It is cheap too When you ride the airport rail link just be prepared to have someone bringing large suitcases onboard the journey It is also the fastest mode of transportation to or from Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: Great way to get around
review: Cheap and efficient way to get around the city over long distances Use with the MRT to get all over the city

title: Cheap Efficient Way Around Central Bangkok
review: I love the BTS Its so convenient with stop at major attractions and very tourist friendly If you are going to visitshop numerous places then get the day pass for 140 baht Just try to avoid the morning peak hour rush

title: Fast & Easy
review: Avoid the bangkok rush hour traffic and use Skytrain Very convenient Just exchange your bank notes to coins and use the machine to purchase ticket Make sure you have a map of Skytrain handy in case of traveling Trains have English announcement as well

title: Very convenient and fast to reach the city
review: it is clean cheap and very very convenient to take it to the hotel Took taxi previously and not only is the fare high it took a longer time than using this Airport Link Highly recommended

title: frequent, efficient and very clean
review: A very good service and reasonably priced (as is the MRT) you can travel less expensively on buses if you know the route number and want a bit of local colour  or just to save money because you aren't in a rush But often the BTS is most efficient and the system is going to expand greatly over the next few years Obviously at rushhour and early evenings on Friday and Saturday it can be very packed especially around popular nightlife stations such as Sala Daeng or Siam but the next train will be along in just a few minutes Please note that there is an orderly queuing system for boarding each carriage

title: Another must do in Bangkok.
review: These are the best 2 experiences of Bangkok An absolute must The train is not a little one for tourists but a huge one and it comes right through the market Great experience

title: clean and convenient
review: trains were efficient and provided access to some major tourist spots in Bangkok Other passengers were polite even during rush hour staff were patient enough to answer queries and trains were clean I guess the only inconvenience would be the need to buy separate train tickets depending on the train line

title: Great way to get to the city.
review: This is a great alternative to a taxi to get into BKK if you want to land near the skytrain (BTS)  or underground (MRT)

title: Not perfect, but so much safer than travelling by taxi.
review: I've been using the airport rail link since it opened  Before I travelled by taxi but now I always use the rail link  I travel fromto PhayathaiAirport and have not used any of the intermediate stations  At 45 Baht it is a bargain neatly avoids the very real dangers of Bangkok taxi drivers and connects with the Bangkok Mass Transit Systems (Phayathai is also a Skytrain station)    It runs every 1020 minutes and takes something around 30 minutes There is ample room on the train for baggage   There is also an "express" which costs a little more and runs on the same track but seems to run less frequently  If you are in a rush then check which train leaves first  no point in paying extra for the "express" and then waiting half an hour before it departs No trolleys for baggage  drag it or carry it Lots of stairs  Escalators are up only There is ONE elevator at Phayathai but as with many such things in Bangkok it's too small & too slow and as far as I recall does not operate from street level (only between the intermediate level and the upper level) and so is more of a symbol than a practical facility The timetable is herehttpbangkokairporttraincomtimetableroutehtml but treat it as a rough guide only and don't depend on the last train to get you to the airport Be aware my last visit was Sep 2013 & the ticket machines could not take the latest Baht 20 notes I've rated this 4 out of 5  I'd have given 5 if there had been better disabled access and better facilities for travelling with baggage

title: Convenience and cheap
review: Without a doubt this is the best way to travel throughout Bangkok  even the locals advise against using the taxis due to traffic jams and scams All those malls you want to go to are just a step away from each station Just makes sure you have enough coins or notes on hand otherwise go to the counter for exchanging larger notes into smaller notescoins AC is within the train It can be a little busy at rush hour but compared to Hong Kong it's nothing Of course the alternative is the underground where AC is throughout the entire station regardless if you're going to be stepping outside it doesn't really matter

title: Better than a Taxi
review: I was travelling through Thailand on a budget and wanted to spend most of my money on food I would 100% recommend the skytrain it is so easy to use You go to the platform and get your notes changed into coins from the money exchange manned by the loveliest ladies Just hand it over and they do the rest Then you go to a little ticket machine on the wall You look at the map above of the train line and depending on where you go you might need to change trains There are two lines with Siam being the change point If you know where you want to go and you don't need to change trains press the stops number (it will be next to the name) The machine will then tell you how much Baht to put it Once you put in the change the ticket will pop out Put it in the gate Security will check your bag for explosives etc Once this is done you have to walk to the platform You want to look at the map find your stop and follow it to the end of the line It will be Mo Chit or Bering if you are on the Sukhumvit line and other stops on the other line Depending on the final stop will determine which platform you should walk onto Then all done you hop on the train and get off at your stop Follow the exit signs then all done So much cheaper than a taxi and it's how the locals travel

title: Easy transportation
review: Can be crowded at times (mornings and evenings) but easy to use  You can buy a pass and skip the ticket machines

title: I love the Skytrain!!!
review: OK it's usually crowded but it's incredibly reliable great people watching and icy cold on usually hot and steamy days Much better and cheaper than taxis that get stuck in traffic And a day pass is only 140 baht ($450 usd)

title: Excellent
review: Greatest public transport system I have come across on my travels  Easy to use easy to access   Save the coins

title: Highly recommended! 5 stars ✨
review: Tom was an unbelievable guide very friendly informative and knowledgable on our tour The whole tour was well planned from checking in right to our central drop off The tour themselves were expertly organised and the driver was top class We were even given a drink and snacks during our tour Thanks for having us We highly recommend this tour

title: Lovely train ride over the wooden bridge
review: Go for the first class section with a light snack and reserved seats We choose the short option for the train ride from Kanchanaburi which lastet about 1 hour the wooden bridge included Otherwise there is not much to see

title: very convenient
review: Very nice and convenient service Easy and cheap to come to the city from BKK airport even with a lot of luggage At least one should definitely come to Makkasan with airport city line (cheaper than express line and not worth paying the extra high price for express line if you are not in real hurry) and there is very efficient and transparent taxi service to any where in the city This way you also save the 50baht airport toll fees which you need to pay if you take a taxi from the airport itself  But consider taking a taxi all the way to the airport while taking the return flight from Bangkok This way you do not need to pay airport toll and it's not worth  to get off at Makkasan and take airport link to Bkk specially at night when you are tired after your trip in bangkok The difference in price is not much so just enjoy your taxi ride all the way to BKK

title: fast and reliable
review: great and fast and clean train which connects you pretty much everywhere you need for tourists and malls

title: Clean, easy and convenient
review: It is definitely another alternative to get around Bangkok besides using the taxi As long you know how to read the map to know where to stop you can use it anytime at your own convenience

title: Sky trains Bangkok, cool and comfortable
review: The sky train is an ideal choice to travel when in Bangkok It is cheap efficient and punctual but always crowded and so you prepare to stand and stare at the crowd and the outside scenery It also connects the Aero link and make your journey memorable Better you get a day ticket which is cheap and convenient if you want to visit many places I would say it is the best way of getting to places in Bangkok

title: Cheap, clean, and efficient mode of transport
review: The BTS is a clean and efficient way to get around Bangkok  The fees are not too expensive and the staff are very nice and helpful  Bangkok is notorious for its traffic and this is an easy way to beat it  The air conditioning also gives you some relief from the heat  The BTS system does cover a decent amount of Bangkok but there are parts of the city where another form of transport is needed

title: Stay connected
review: A very good initiative by bangkok making almost all the places accessible by BTS  It is a network of overhead metros by which one can travel anywhere within minutes and avoiding the traffic Day week monthly passes are also available There are many lines of BTS like the red blue green

title: Easy to use, quick, fast and saves time and money
review: Skytrain is very easy and simple to understand and this (in combination with the ferry service) is the cheapest and most hassle free way to travel across Bangkok   For those Indians who have travelled on Delhi Metro you would not find any issues in dealing with the skytrain   We used the Skytrain for the first time when we arrived from Hua Hin via minibus on to Victory Monument We had some trouble in finding an escalatorlift however in a few minutes we are confortable with the system   When you arrive at the BTS station you can look around for the ticketing booths Not all ticketing booths may accept notes so you may need to get change  at the ticket counters It is easy  all you need to do is to show a 50 B note and ask "coin"  and you get the 10 B in coins (and if needed 5 B coins)  The ticketing machine will have a map either on a computer screen or on a printed map next to it and the map will tell you how much you need to pay from the current station to a destination station So if you are in Saphan Takshin and need to go to Victory monument you can see in the map with Victory monument written as "35" So drop in the 10 coins and 5s coins and you get your ticket Go to the turnstile drop in your card and the card pops out in a fraction of a second and your gates open  The train you need to catch will depend on the direction you wish to go So be familiar with the final destinations of the two major lines There are enough directions and instructions in English and if you have any queries the counter guys seem very helpful  More details please read at httpwwwbtscothcustomerenmainaspx )   The trains can be  a bit crowded at office rush hour times however we travelled in the skytrains and the airport link rail carrying two aircabin size luggage and we had no issues at all Thai commuters were very friendly and gave us enough space to stand and sit The AC work very well  Siam is an important junction  as that connects the two operating lines Siam Paragon and other huge malls are just a 5 minute walk from Siam station  The skytrain does not connect to the Wat Pho and Grand palace however you can take the ferry station from Saphan Taksin and take the ferry to Wat Pho (Tha Tian )   Enjoy Bangkok with skytrain

title: EASY & AFFORDABLE
review: Really easy to use Its quick i think its the best way to travel from the airport Really felt comfortable Its clean And a good experience

title: easy to use
review: we used the BTS for out time in Bangkok super fast and easy to use you can purchase a ticket that lasts 24hrs so can travel anywhere on the BTS so very good value it does get very busy at some time but if you miss one only a couple of minutes wait and another one comes along a must for all Bangkok travellers

title: Good Idea
review: The concept of a public transportation link to a city's major airport is good but this one falls a bit short   First of all you have to get to the transfer station at Phaya Thai BTS Station  At nonrush hours with light luggage this is not too difficult but between 730AM  930AM or 4PM  7PM it can be nasty  The other issue is train hours  It is not a 24 hour service so you need to match your arrivaldeparture times with train operating hours  Personally I only use this when I go to the airport to meet arriving or departing friends   Taxi service is ubiquitous and cheap in Bangkok  A taxi fee of $12 US will get you anywhere and usually it is less  Rush hour is a pain whether sitting in a taxi or fighting to board BTS    One note of caution  do not expect your taxi driver to understand much or any English  Have your destination written down preferably in Thai

title: best and quickest way to get to and from airport.
review: quick and convinient air conditioned  maybe a bit too cold even No bargaining and paying too much on taxis and the most improtant  no trafic jams

title: Great half day tour.
review: Tum was our tour guide and she was excellent at what she does The tour itself is about half a day from the morning so we still had plenty of time to do something else afterwards We went to temples visited salt farm the train market and last but not the least the floating market The tour also included a short boat ride at the floating market It was fun food was decent For the price this tour is a must go if you're here for only a few days

title: Efficient, cheap and quick way to get around
review: Really clean ordered queues cheap it has to be the best way to get around Bangkok The trains are clean and air conditioned Great experience

title: Easy, fast, convenient
review: Find your way through the city with the BTS it's cheap fast clean and really convenient Traffic in Bangkok will make you lose hours in the taxituktuk goes until midnight safe to take Big up

title: Fast, easy, cheap
review: Best way to travel in Bangkok Fast easy cool and cheap They are building more lines and stations so in the future it will be nice to go to downtown by MRT Looking forward to that

title: A subway is a subway is a subway
review: Not much to comment on except take this if yo can avoid taxis  It is a more efficient way to get around

title: Why is the skytrain the number one attraction in BKK?!
review: fast cheap air conditioned a little crowded and a little confusing at first

title: Easier than a taxi
review: And much cheaper Recommend getting on the line at the beginning of the line in Bangkok to ensure a seat Trip was smoothbetter than the taxi ride into the city

title: fast mode of transportation
review: airport rail link always my choice for going from suvarnabhumi airport to bangkok city center (phaya thai station) for 45 THB  fast  safe  comfortable with scenic view of bangkok always love it

title: Getting. Crowded
review: Crowded day and night Aso not that cheap Taxis can still be better option I also prefer the underground to BTS

title: Pretty decent and reliable
review: Pretty decent and reliable Sometimes the only way to keep moving and avoid the traffic on the roads You can buy a local "Rabbit" card to use these services here It's quick and easy and does the job   Clear and helpful signs are available throughout the train stations so you can't go wrong   Note  The rabbit card is different from the M subway train they are run by different companies so you need to buy a new card if you are switching train networks for your journey

title: Clean and efficient
review: Great value and clean experience It’s easy to navigate the ticket offices speak good English and it’s an easy way to travel and see the city

title: Look for elevators if hauling luggage or travel with stroller
review: Every time I visit Bangkok BTS gradually extend its services to more stations  The accessibility for the needs are not really met  Elevators are hard to find  You have to really search for them  Since it’s high rised track escalators are designed ton one side and stairs are located on the further side of the sidewalk  In between the escalator and the stairs there must be around 50 meters apart

title: Clean, modern fast cheap
review: Very good system providing excellent connections throughout the city and to other transports Seemed very safe though I didn't use it at night

title: great system
review: best way to get around Bangkok air conditioned so also allows a refreshing break from the heat  Very good design signs are posted and easy to navigate Because the stations are above the street you can exit on either side of the street which makes it safe and convent

title: great service into city
review: i loved this I was able to get from soi 4 nana road all the way to airport in 45 mins with one change

title: Crowded
review: VERY Overcrowded Difficult to get on and off Once you are on good system that avoids the clogged roads

title: It Was Efficient.
review: The Skytrain was clean and it helped me commute to several places in Bangkok The intervals between stations were okay but I felt that the interchange station was a bit of a distance A great tip If you're planning to come to Bangkok I'd recommend staying around Siam or a few stops away from Siam This will save you a lot of time travelling from one place to another I didn't take that into consideration while planning for my trip to Bangkok I ended up staying 11 stations away  from the interchange station and I lost so much time while travelling Well of course it also depends on where you would be travelling to If you're only going to travel around the place that you stay in I guess this tip doesn't apply to you

title: Accessible and efficient
review: The train is easy to locate in the airport and connects with the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok which is great Very affordable at just 45 baht to ride airport to the last stop

title: U Have to go
review: Fast  Clean No crowd  Easy to go everywhere More than expected  But if u are a family 4 or more taxi is cheaper but traffic jam

title: Good
review: If you want to get around Bangkok then the train system is the best way the BTS and the MRT two differently owned train systems are so much better than the Sukhumvit car park If you're here awhile get an electronic card for the BTS as it's much quicker and easier in peak hours than fumbling getting a ticket not too expensive initial cost

title: Easy to get around
review: Very easy and affordable to get around  Trains can be very crowded during busy hours  Once the farther bts stops are up and running they will need to run trains more frequently

title: My First Time But Not My Last
review: I have been to Bangkok many times and always taken a taxi from the airport Due to the time I arrived which was rush hour I thought I would give the train a go The best decision I made I could clearly see the freeway traffic heading towards the city and it was heaving with cars I had to swap over to the BTS to get to where I wanted to go I think my trip was about 40 minutes which I have no doubt would have been 3 hours in a taxi Plus I didn't have to deal with the suicidal driving some of the taxi drivers subject you too Plus it was far cheaper than the taxi

title: Much, much cheaper than taking a taxi
review: Since the Airport Rail Link opened I always take it to get fromto the airport to SiamSukhumvitAsok where I tend to choose to stay  It's about 1 hour to get from the airport to Asok The same as taking a taxi But the ARL costs ~80 baht taking the ARL + BTS or MRT combined compared to ~400 baht (as of this writing) by taxi

title: Get a rabbit Card
review: If you're in Bangkok for more than a few days get a Rabbit card only 50THB refundable then top up to get cheaper travel and no waiting in endless queues to get tickets just stroll past the tourists on to the train like a local

title: The best transport option for downtown Bangkok
review: Up above the buzz and throng of the crowded streets below the Sky Rail is the cheapest and most timely option to get across downtown Bangkok Air conditioned and regular schedules

title: Convenient way to travel in Bangkok.
review: I found that this was a fast cheap and convenient way to travel in the city getting around the shopping centres  Once you have figured out the ticket system it gets very easy to get around

title: fast inexpensive link from suvarnabhumi to bts network
review: fast inexpensive cheap direct from airport to bts network better than any taxi There is security at each station who check the train for packages that have been left behind Great experience

title: The best way to go to airport.
review: Forget taxis If you have the right spirit use airport rail link to teach airport Inexpensive time saving and convenient it is linked to BTS Station in the basement of swarnbhoomi airport Bangkok it is very easy to go to arrival or departure terminals

title: Connectivity
review: The sky train is a very convenient mode of transport It is well maintained and clean It connect to various parts of Thailand in a short time Also the frequency of the train is fast that you don't waste time waiting Taking a day pass helps you through the day and is value for money

title: Great experience
review: We used it once Easy access to the stations and easy to purchase the tickets  All day ticket is 150 bhat The map is a bit confusing but after studying it for few minutes you can find where you want to go and what train platform to use People are helpful so if you not sure ask

title: An experience
review: We made the classic tourist mistake of watching good spirited travel vlogs that claimed rail travel to be fun We should have checked the reviews beforehand  We took the sleeper train 84 from Trang to Bangkok in a first class sleeper First class is relative I think it might have meant that it is the first passenger carriage in the train While we did not expect a five star experience we certainly did not expect a small room so grimy and dirty that a 50 baht back to basics beach bungalow in Koh Nowhere would look like a Hilton club room compared to this abomination I have stayed in some wonky hostels while younger but this was extremely disturbingly dirty To actually access our cabin wr had to wake up the attendant who was sleeping on our bed  The bathroom as other reviewers have told is equally dirty as the room Don't use it unless in dire need and bring something chemical to wash your hands Doubles as a shower you should not shower there  The train creaks and wobbles through the night and the driver had an obsession of honkin the horn on every intersection Our carriage was the first one so the horn was quite loud It's hard to sleep if you're a light sleeper  Another thing is the cockroaches swarming in the cabin I have travelled with the leeches of Bornean rainforest and other nasty critters that habit the tropics but sleeping in a grimy small closet with tens of cockroaches skittering around the walls and floors is a nope from me The infestation seems to be quite serious as some of the the roaches were big enough to have calculus homework from college   The food service is a scam as indicated by other reviewers Costs alot of baht and is basically processed food served on a plastic tray When the bill came it had magically inflated with 200 baht because reasons Staff pretends not to speak english and charge for stuff that is included in the menus I was just too tired to argue at this point after a sleepless night that I just paid Judging by reviews some people have been scammed more  So in the end we just jumped off at Bang Sue Junction took a grab to Don Mueang and flew to Chiang Mai as we were supposed to take another sleeper train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai the same evening Flying costs pretty much the same and the Air Asia economy seat is more comfortable than the dungeon we spent our night in

title: Easy to use!
review: Clean airconditioned and easy to use this transport system is world class Gets busy during peak times but this is to be expected Good way to check out shopping malls and move around the city

title: Easy
review: The sky train is the best way to get round Bangkok quick and easy  always buy an extended ticket to last your visit as it can be a pain queuing at the station for tickets

title: Excellent!
review: It was an amazing trip We had such a good guide  Recommend to take a pick up point from your hotel where you will be staying All in all  perfect half day trip

title: Efficient, timely and cheap
review: Peak hours it's a little cramped but this is a great means of travel from the main Suvarnabhumi airport to the city You buy a token at the train station at the airport at either a machine or booth and swipe it as you pass through the gates Trains come every 15 minutes you get on the train there are bench seats along the walls and luggage racks at each door When you get off you deposit your token at the gates when you exit the station I went to Siam so I had to swap to another train system (BTS skytrain) on another level at the end station Phaya Thai You have to buy another ticket (as it's a different train system) but it's easy to swap to the BTS which goes all over the city overhead There is a network map available to help navigate the systems but they are well set up for western use with English type maps and stations are clearly marked (if not hard to pronouce)  I have uploaded s map but just google for one There are maps in the British underground format  Just watch peak hour on the BTS especially in the evening as trains get a little crowded (standing room only) which is harder than usual but not impossible with luggage The locals are very polite and helpful if your are also Fastest transport in peak periods avoiding the congested roads less than one hour airport to hotel at Siam Just use a map to know where you are going 😜

title: Market Day
review: The railway market (which is actually much larger than what you normally see in the photosvideos) was amazing Noom and our driver were also great

title: Easy way to connect city line BTS
review: From Airport station to downtown is very easy route MRT is connected at Makkasan station and BTS is connected at Phayathai station

title: Not accessible for disable people...
review: The BTS skytrain is quite good be we could not reach the trains with escalators not lifts because there were not  We travelled with a person Who can not climb up stairs and he had to call a taxi Otherwise the BTS itself is quite good

title: Very efficient, effective, clean, and convenient.
review: The BTS system in Bangkok is an extremely well engineered operation Determining which ticket to buy and how to do so getting on the right train etc are all very well planned an executed Using the train to go anywhere in Bangkok takes a fraction of the time that a taxi would take on the clogged city streets

title: Amazing view and food
review: Trip and tour guide was pretty amazing  Sara was awesome she is very knowledgeable and funny Im going to tell my friends about this trip with Sara

title: Fast, clean, cool and cheap
review: The BTS Skytrain is what I fondly refer to as the "Third" level of public transportation in Bangkok The first level is the ultra modern subway system The second level is on the street by Tuktuks and taxis The views of the city from the Skytrain are great

title: Cheapest mode of transport in Bangkok!
review: My one and only mode of transportation in Bangkok Cheap and hassle free Opens till midnight which is more than enough for you to go around the city You can also not worry about the traffic jams on the roads which is a bummer if you are rushing to the airport FYI BTS line and their airport line are 2 different entities which you need to buy separate train tickets One day passes are on the BTS lines

title: Airport Link Bangkok
review: This is a great way to get into the city if you are a solo traveler However if there are 3 or 4 it is more cost effective to use a taxi Many Thais use this as their daily transport and there are not always seats available The last time there were four tourists with their bags occupying 8 seats and they would not budge It is not 'handicapped' friendly

title: Best way to commute but messy to get tickets
review: It's great that BKK has a sky train and metro system However it's a hassle to get tickets as one has to get separate tickets for each one system The ques are very long they do go fast enough though At least for tourist it seems to be the case Their might be an all In one card that can be used for locals Their is a 3 day card for the metro Or can get a permanent card for the Sky train (lasts for 5 years and costs 180bt only 80 refundable) if you not willing to invest in this then have to get per trip tickets and that's when it gets messy with the coins and the amounts and machines not taking bill notes only coins   Other than this it's a great way to explore BKK Likely the best and fastest way as traffic is very heavy and congested most of the time especially rush hour and weekends Both systems are clean and regular only a few mins waiting Trains are cooled and stations also have air conditioning Eating and drinking is not permitted and loud talking both p2p and on the phone are frowned upon Queuing to enter the train is the custom in Thailand and other SE Asian cities like Singapore or Hong Kong  It is very congested also during rush hour and weekends so it's not uncommon to wait for the next train to get in   Personally is my favorite way to travel in BKK for fastness and efficiency

title: Simply Excellent
review: Whenever in Bangkok this is pretty much the only form of transport I’m using It’s fast cheap and you never wait more than 5 minuets My 9 year old loves it too and we even took rides for fun

title: Convenient but PACKED
review: Clean usually on time but not enough cars During rush hour you will be squeezed Don't bother trying to bring large bags or a bike

title: Clean and safe
review: Felt very safe using this service Gives a totally unique and beautiful perspective of this slightly manic city Good value and easy to work out routes etc Plenty of security checking bags at entry points

title: safe fast way to travel about bangkok
review: BTS is safe fast and easy to use one of the best ways to travel around Bangkok you can also use the BTS from the new international airport and in two years both airports will be accessible from the BTS

title: good but crowded
review: nice but very much crowded but its on of the vest way to travel in busiest city like Bangkok and the best part is it on time

title: Too slow an airport city link
review: This is the first time I took the bangkok airport city line (the blue line) to the city centre  I must say this is the slowest train that I have ever travelled on  It was even slower than the scenery train which purposedly travel slowly to help you enjoy the scenery   The Bangkok airport city line however was all in all undisarable  Of course there is another line the red line running to the city centre  As I was in a rush and without knowing the timeconsuming characteristics of the blue line  I board on the blue line and was totally disappointed

title: Dont use the taxi from BKK, use the Airport Rail Link
review: It can be a real hassle getting from BKK airport into the city by taxi that is until you make your way down to the basement and take a 40 minute airconditioned ride into the heart of Bangkok Its comfortable & the last stop at Phya Thia you will find within a short walking distance many good motel to stay at as well as the BTS train systems that will take you even further Siam is the centre if the shopping district

title: Very convenient public transportation in Bangkok
review: If you want to save your travel expense in Bangkok BTS Skytrain is a choice to choose Save the time trains are clean and convenient  English language announcement is available on the train  It is connected to almost all part of the city

title: Good way to avoid traffic delays between BKK and city center
review: Nice clean predictable and quick way to get tofrom airport at a cost of 40 baht Metered taxis are not expensive (around 350400 bahts or 10 USD to Sukhumvit area)  and are more convenient if your city destination is not close to the train andor BTS stops

title: Very good
review: best form of transport in Bangkok as it takes hours in a taxi due to volume of traffic  they do tend to get very packed

title: Much better than a taxi
review: Its a much better way to get too and from the airport if you are staying in or near the city center and its definitely much cheaper and stress free

title: Best way to get to town from airport
review: This is the first time for us to use the airport rail It took us less than 30 mins and 45 Baht each to get from the airport to Phaya Thai the last stop where our hotel is located Excellent

title: A good experience but mind your expectations. Think moving hostel.
review: We couldn't get much information or a booking on line Fortunately we managed to book tickets the day before from the station Maybe the protests made business quiet but we had no trouble just went up to a desk booked and paid No touts or agents or commissions Based on what others have said maybe we got lucky  We left our bags at the station during the day and collected before train Don't leave this to the last minute as queues can be large and retrieval slow We were shown to our seats by the cabin attendant and given menus Then another guy came to take our dinner orders We wanted to eat in the buffet so can't comment on this serviceWe were surprised when the attendent told us that beds would be prepared at 7pm So early we thought it was a mistake but true to his word he made up beds and some settled in Note as a couple it's better to book a top and bottom Otherwise you may loose your seats for someones bed  Food was ok nothing special It's only a kitchen in a train As we ate the music was being turned up so I guess it turns into more of a party bar carriage I think this was about 8 We didn't hang about to confirm and by the time we returned our seats were beds  Our carriage was cool but not cold Maybe we got lucky with this also Our 2nd class was mostly full of tourists but fortunately we had no antisocial behaviour  Bottom bunks are more specious At 6ft1 I was ok with a slight diagonal lie My wife took the top and apart from the bright light slept ok With the noise and jostling I didn't sleep too well to be honest Toilets were split On one side a squat the other a western sit They did get dirty by the end of the trip There are basic sinks and soap We had breakfast in Chiang Mai so can't comment on this I don't recall it being especially late We wanted the later train for more morning views but it was full The earlier train was ok though and you get to see a bit of the countryside  Essentially you're on a train (noisy moving and to a certain degree at the mercy of the aircon and your many fellow passengers) As others have said take earplugs an eye mask and warm clothes and enjoy the novelty It also saves money over flying though I was glad to take the plane back to Bangkok Check out Seat61com It helped us a lot

title: The only sensible way to travel between the airport and central Bangkok
review: Cheap fast and efficient  Don't bother with expensive taxis between the airport and city  This takes you downtown in about 30 minutes  The current terminus Phaia Thai is not overly large but is a little bit confusing as it is on different levels and has an interchange  Trying to exit can be disorientating  There are liftsescalators down to street level

title: Amazing
review: Travelling at speed at 5 floors above the ground Easy to buy tickets and best way to travel without delay

title: lift
review: There is no lift It will be user friendly to have escalator rather than just stairs The frequency of the train should increase as the train is very crowded

title: Clean and Cheap
review: Best way to get around Thailand  I highly recommend spending some time to figure out and then it will save you time and money from taking a taxi or Tuk Tuk on the conjested Bangkok roads

title: Perfect transportation
review: Good to go to the international airport not using taxis Cheaper friendly and better than taxis Fast and eficient really recomend

title: Easy to use and very handy
review: I found the BTS Skytrain a breeze to use and loved it I think it would be great if it was open until later though

title: Super comfortable and on time
review: Super comfortable and on time It is the best way to beat the traffic in Bangkok We stayed in Bangkok for 6 days and used it everyday Don't bother buying the day ticket  the trip to trip tickets are just fine

title: A great and modern way to travel around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a great independent way to explore the heart of Bangkok  The trains are fully air conditioned so you remain cool throughout the journey  even during the rush hours when they can get quite full  The system is easy to follow containing only a couple of lines  very easy to work out for a tourist compared to other systems such as the New York subway or London Underground  Journeys are very cheap and vary depending on the number of stops  Conveniently many of the stops are at the various shopping centres in the city  Also convenient are the modes of payment  cash for single journeys or the recommended way of using a cashless travel card Rabbit card to make your journey quicker similar to London's Oyster card  A Rabbit card can be obtained from a cashier's booth at any station for 50 Bhat (approximately £1) and initial topup of 100 Bhat  I've used the BTS on both my previous visits to Bangkok and have enjoyed it  It's clean quick and safe

title: Hot and sweaty but well worth going
review: We have been to Cha am 14 times and never miss the market here you can find the shoes someone left behind to LED light for the garden they sell everything And you can eat anything from bugs to pancakes I haven't tried the bugs but the pancakes are good it's always very hot and busy so you might not want to stay to long but there are lots of great bargains to be had This is well worth a visit

title: Beat those Taxis
review: This is the best way to get to the airport if you are near a skytrain  It is cheap quick and you beat the taxis that want to rip you off

title: Great Transport System
review: The BTS Skytrain is a great transport system I've used metros subways and other mass transit train systems on four continents The BTS is on par with the best of them It is convenient and clean

title: Easy and CHEAP!
review: After many years of visiting Thailand and Bangkok finally decided to try the MRT on this trip  What a good and fun experience  Actually ended up using it on 4 different location since it was easy cheap and much quicker than a taxi  I can honestly say it was much easier than I had imagined  My trip from downtown to the Huai Kwang district was only 40 minutes and 120 baht compared to a taxi a night before for 90 minutes and 250 baht  We used it on numerous evening to get around downtown BKK and it was fun and easy each time

title: Clean, safe and easy!
review: Really a great way to get around the city The maps are easy to follow the platforms and trains are clean

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Travel by the skytrain is very simple pleasant and is very reliable to get from one place and the next Cost is very reasonable I felt very safe travelling on the skytrain

title: Try out
review: We deliberately planned our day excursion to use the BST train for a few stops  \\\\\\\\\\\\\\obviously heavily used but curiously placed  Access would be difficult and expensive for average folks  The minimum wage is 300 baht per day but a few stops one way on the BST cost us 37 baht so out of the price of an average worker  Very utilitarian and heavily used  The cars themselves are great with very good air conditioning  The instructions over the loudspeaker helped but to be honest the platform signs were still a bit confusing  We do like to check out subway and mass transit wherever we go

title: Great way to travel
review: Skytrain was a good value safe and excellent way to get around Bangkok  We used the MRT and Skytrain often depending on where we needed to go

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Get a smart card and load it up  Swipe card when entering and exiting gates Trains are fast air conditioned and arrive quickly  Can get pretty crowded especially during rush hour  Don't recommend dragging your luggage onboard although there is a connection to the airport

title: Best transportation from Suvarnabhumi
review: It was super fast transportation from Suvarnabhumi airport to the city It didn't packed like BTS (or maybe because I took a night trip) it was comfortable to travel with Even when I took a baggage

title: Great way to see Bangkok
review: Brilliant way to get around the city It's about 130 baht for a day pass Definitely worth using this as it's nice to hop in & out of air con trains to get to A to B before exploring this wonderful city

title: Great
review: Skytrain is great way to get around the center of the city and to see some sights from an elevated view

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: Due to heavy tragic best way to get around is either us g BTS or long tail boats if by the Chap Praya river Nice and smooth and a world away from NYC metro and first class at its best if compare with Paris metro

title: Could be good
review: Took the new train ( no9) to Chiang Mai Clean and comfortable EXCEPT the lights stay on all night in second class sleeper which made sleep hard I can not understand why a railway service would spend so much on excellent sleeper trains but not have lighting installed that can be dimmed or alternatively use night lighting like on planes

title: Clean and efficient - well priced (considered a local luxury)
review: The sky train is a great way to get around town although it is not well connected to monuments such as The Grand Palace

title: Amazing experience ",)
review: It's perfectly designed & wellorganised I loved it & I see it as an opportunity to realize how friendly Thai people are & to know about their culture as well A Must Do )

title: Easy and reliable
review: For foreigners it is cheap though I think for locals it is a bit too expensive  3080 bahts per journey There is no connection amongst the different lines the payments need to be made in cash no bulk ticketing etc The metro cars are big enough spaces for many people it can take you quickly to the airport of the heart of the city The aircondition works on very low temperature so I was cold sometimes

review: Very affordable and convenient mode of transport around Bangkok   The air conditioning was ideal in such hot weather and was wonderful   Very easy to get around Bangkok and the shopping malls    Nice and spacious mode of transport

title: A Great Way to Get Around
review: Our motel was 2 mins from Hwai Khwang underground station This is such an efficient way to get around Bangkok It is easy to use  collect all your change for cheap travel tokens but ticket machines change notes too There is also the option of a ticket counter but the machines have an English screen option and are easy If you are not in a hurry and travel between 10am and 3pmish you will have short wait times In the peak time morning and evenings be prepared for longer queues and being packed like a sardine The good thing is that at peak times the trains run every couple of minutes This is all part of the adventure of Bangkok  give it a go The best rail destination is Chatuchack Flower Market

title: BTS Sky train
review: My first time on the BTS after coming to Thailand since Sept 1988 We only went 5 stops and back and I think it was 30b each each way Quick a little crowded one way but it was 430pm so the rush hour and back got a seat as was nearly empty A good way of getting around Bangkok
